13433112.content:
Quiet. Soothing. Great. These are the three perfect words to describe this day as you walk around Lake Valor, of the Sinnoh region. Not a single noise can be heard here, except maybe the wind. You inhale deeply, the silence of the place bringing peace into your mind. This must be the perfect day...


... At least, until now.


Upon hearing a nearby plant rustling, you turn your head to see a Floatzel leaping out of the bushes, glaring at you. Then, without warning, it opens its mouth, shooting you with water.

You are hit in your stomach and are sent backwards as the Floatzel attacks you once more, this time with its fangs. It bites your arm. You scream in pain as it's fangs sink into your arm. Gritting your teeth, you punch the Floatzel in the muzzle with your free arm, managing to pull off, a bite mark on your arm.

The Floatzel glares angrily at you. Why is it even doing this? You think as it charges again. It tackles you. Both of you end up falling into the lake behind. Bad thing. The Floatzel starts attacking repeatedly. You try surface, but the weasel simply won't let you.

You are about to lose consciousness.
‘I... I don't wanna die...’ you think, desperately trying to fight back. And that's when something weird happens.


‘Have you got... the will to survive?’


You hear a voice in your head. What was that?
‘I'm going to drown... I don't want to die...’ you think again, the Floatzel not giving any sign of wanting to let you go. The voice is heard again.


‘Very well. I shall aid you in this battle...’ it speaks. The last thing you notice before blacking out is a bright light coming from downwards. Then, you let darkness take you as you black out...


You wake up hours later. Your first though is
‘Am I... Am I dead?’ you move from your laying position and bring a hand to your forehead.

"Feeling better?" a soft, feminine voice suddenly asks. Your eyes slowly open. You take a look around, trying to spot whoever talked.

The first thing you notice is that you're in a cave. And slowly, your gaze falls on a golden creature, with a blue, star-shaped head; A red gem on its forehead and two tails lazily floating behind the creature, gems on them as well; Golden eyes are fixed on you. And, most of all, it's huge. At least 140 ft tall. You recognize it as the legendary pokemon Azelf. And a shiny one, too.
"Hey, are you feeling better?" the same, feminine voice you heard before, this time, you notice, is coming from Azelf, speaks again, making you assume it's a female.

"Y-Yes..." you reply to her question.
"What happened?" you then ask. The pokemon gets closer to you. She picks you in her golden paw and brings you to eye level.
"You were about to drown," she speaks calmly " But I felt it. Your will to live. So I decided to help you. That Floatzel fled and I brought you here. I healed your wounds." you instinctively look at your arm, the one that Floatzel caught in its maw. The bite mark disappeared.

"Thank you..." you thank her. Azelf smiles.
"Don't worry." her free paw comes to pat your head.
"I'm sorry but... Where are we?" you ask her.
"We're in my cave, at the bottom of Lake Valor." she replies.
"You mean... under the lake?!" she nods.
"Then... Could you bring me back up, so I can go home?" you ask.

At this point, she looks at you weirdly.
"I've got something to tell you. I think we'll have to stay together... Master..." she says.
"Come again?"
"I have to stay with you. Your willpower was enough to wake me from my sleep, and I can see my master in you." she explains. The declaration takes you off guard. You stay silent.

"So? Do you accept me as your pokemon?" she asks you. You consider this. Azelf kindly saved you, why would you deny her request? So, you slowly nod. The willpower being smiles.
"Well then. Welcome... home..." she says, closing your body in a hug.
"Wait, home? Aren't we going to my house?" you ask.
"Well... I doubt your house would... contain me, would it?" Azelf replies, stifling a giggle. You can't really fight her logic, so you simply nod, willingly accepting to live with her.

"Good," she says, starting to giggle.
"Cute little master." she giggles, making you blush.

You both stay silent for a while, just staring at each other. You suddenly break the silence.
"So... what now?" Azelf cocks her head, seeming to be thinking.
"Well...

"They were literally begging me," you gasp and enter a flabbergasted state, "What, are they sacred or something? Am I going to get cursed? Wait, are you just jealous?"

"Let me rephrase that," Lucario states bemused and moves a bit closer, "You fucked the legendaries, and now they are going to fuck us. Tell me, did any of your actions actually 'cure' their heat?"

"Yeah!" you abruptly shout out in order to defend yourself, though remembering Mesprit had already had you twice already, "I mean, sort of? Temporarily?"

"All you did was whet their appetite, and it always comes back stronger!" Lucario continues with a hint of desperation, "Why do you think none of us ever tried anything? The last time they just kept asking for more and more, finally turning crazed with lust and going on a rampage across Lake Acuity!"

You couldn't believe it, yet at the same time something about all this seemed vaguely familiar. The Vaporeon walks around you, stands in your line of sight and looks at you with large puppy-dog eyes.

"Why do you think those three sisters are so enchanted by humans?" Lucario growls, "Because since they can't understand the local inhabitants, they're the only ones who don't fuck off when we tell them to!"

"Hey now, it's not my fault!" you shout back, "Try blaming those perverted Sneasel who keep crawling into Uxie's vagina, not me!"

The Lucario stops for a moment and looks towards Vaporeon for consultation. They exchange a few confused words in a language that sounds remarkably like they were just repeating their own names.

"Apparently Uxie's not the problem," he admits after a moment, "Nobody can seem to remember her ever going on a rampage."

The color drains from your face as you hear what sounds like noises of relief from the crowd around you. Apparently nobody knows about Uxie's powers. Or perhaps they did know, once. How many times had Uxie gone on a rampage, only for it all to be...

"No, this is all crazy!" you blurt out as nothing about this makes any sense to you, "I've spent several hours with them already, they're the sweetest trio you'll ever meet! They would never do something like that!"

"Ursa, diu," a Teddiursa suddenly speaks up from the crowd.

"They don't mean to, they can't control themselves during this season," Lucario translates as a Noctowl begins to hoot.

"Apparently it was always like this? But now they're really big, so things get very dangerous," Lucario continues slowly.

"Vaa-reon," the Vaporeon in front of you pleads, and you can tell that she's genuinely scared now.

"They're scared," Lucario unnecessarily translates, "And they don't want to break the trio's hearts by telling them about the things they did during that rampage."

"OK, fine," you mutter dejectedly and stand up, "Why am I even arguing? I didn't want to get caught up in any of this. I was just trying to help."

"Good," Lucario says with a nod before pointing back at the cave where they had picked up the human, "Now go back there, tell them this was all a mistake and we'll escort you to the nearest human settlement. Vapid here says she'll see to any sex you might miss out o-"

The blue jackal is cut off as the Vaporeon jumps up and slaps him across the face with her large double-pronged tail. You're taken aback.

"Leaving!?" you repeat in shock, "Right now?!"

"Ow... Yeah, for your own sake," Lucario mumbles while rubbing his cheek, "I can smell that you were with at least one of them not long ago at all. You don't know the state of mind those legendaries will be in once they wake up."

"State of mind?!" you repeat once more as the crowd of Pokémon begin to disperse, "Wait, what do you mean?!"

"You said they were begging you for help?" Lucario grumbles as he turns around to leave, "Well, the next time, you won't get a say in the matter. And after that..."

He whispers something to the Vaporeon who whispers something back. Lucario suddenly seizes up and starts blushing like crazy.

"I'm not translating that," he says uncomfortably while waving his hand back, "Just... Don't get eaten."

You freeze up. EATEN? Sure, they said something about eating small fish Pokémon, but...

Vaporeon starts arguing louder as Lucario pulls his ears down to the side of his head.

"I don't care how that Snover died! The human gets it without me spelling it out!" Lucario said loudly while shaking his head, resulting in the Vaporeon once more tail-slapping him across his muzzle.

"OW! FINE!" Lucario yells out exasperated before turning towards you, "Your broken corpse will make a nice dildo. Have fun!"

All the Pokémon disappear and leave you with two choices...
134331211111212121121211212122.title: Dangerous love

choices: You actually managed to wake one of her sisters!
1343312111112121211212112121221.content:
You sit there on the cold snow for an imprecise amount of time. You can't believe it. Those three, sweet pokemon... true, they're incredibly big, but aside from that they aren't scary at all!

Your mind travels back at the last words the Lucario said before disappearing. About what they would do with your corpse. Holy shit is it an horrible image to think of.

But they wouldn't do that, not to you.

Right?

As your mind starts to doubt everything they've said you all day long, you get up. Whichever is the truth, you have to do something.

You can feel your brain screaming you to start running without looking back. It's screaming you to never come back in this place, to forget the three sisters and their lake.

But you decide against it. You don't know where to go, and you might possibly get lost in a blizzard again. And no Uxie to save you then, since she is still asleep inside of the cave.

Another question forms in your mind: did she really wipe away the memories of what she did from those pokemon's minds? Or she really didn't go on a rampage?

Lost in your thoughts, you unknowingly start to make your way back to the cave where the three guardians are currently sleeping. You want answers, and you want them now.

You stop as you get to the entrance of the cave. You can't believe this place is big enough to hold all the three sisters at once.

Suddenly, you feel observed. You turn around, noticing several pairs of eyes staring down at you from the nearby trees.

Many pokemon are staring down at you with either scared or disapproving looks. A scared looking Hoothoot. A glaring Scyther. A worried Murkrow.

"I need to do this." you whisper at them. Then, without saying anything else, you step inside the cave.

You walk deeper inside, despite your brain yelling you to turn around right there and leave right there and then.

Soon, the three huge bodies of the sisters come into view. Mesprit sleeping in the middle, her arms still resting on her chest where you were sleeping yourself earlier, before your unexpected meeting.

Azelf and Uxie are fast asleep too, positioned beside Mesprit. Now that you think of it, how did those pokemon remove your body from Mesprit's grasp?

You just stand there dumbfounded, not knowing what to do. One big part of you wants to just run as far as you can. The other wants to start yelling to wake the three up and demand for answers.

Knowing that neither of the two options are valid, you decide instead to wake one of the three and - calmly - ask for answers, as you aren't quite sure of how confronting all three of them straightaway would end.

But which one of the three should you wake up?

Mesprit, maybe? You've been pretty... close to her.

But, what if she uses her powers and makes you unwilling to leave anymore? Heck, she could make you eager to have a third round in an instant. You shake your head. Mesprit is out of question.

Uxie? She turned out to be very shy, maybe you can convince her to answer to your questions?

Again, you shake your head. She could just open her eyes and force you to look into them, making your forget the reason of your awakening.

That only leaves the third choice.

Azelf.

True, you know pretty little about her, but for the little amount of time she's been around, she was nice to you.

You distinctly remember her words, ‘Maybe you can help me with my own problems later on.’ you sigh. That's just another point against the three of them.

However, you decide, maybe Azelf is the best choice.

Unsure of how to wake a 200ft pokemon, you walk up to her face.

You start poking one of her blue cheeks.
"Azelf. Wake up. Azelf..." you whisper. All you accomplish is a slight moan escaping her mouth.

You notice shifting position, moving her arms upwards and burying her face in them in her sleep.
"Well, isn't that useful?" you remark sarcastically.

Out of good ideas, you walk upwards, where the red gem on her forehead rests. You start rubbing it. For a gem, it feels actually weird. For starters, it's warm. And it feels kinda... fleshy.

"Azelf, come on wake up." you call her louder. Another moan comes out of her lips, though this one was louder. This gem must be a sensible spot, you decide.

"Azelf." you call out for the third time. This time, you notice the giantess removing her arms from her face and drowsily spots you near her forehead.

You take a step back as she talks.
"Oh... you," she says, pausing to yawn.
"Any good reason to wake me up in the middle of the night? Or it's something you do usually?" she asks.

You ignore her last question.
"Azelf, may I ask you something?" you ask. You see those two golden eyes of hers sparkling with curiosity as she gives a nod. You feign a smile. To cover the fear you're feeling right now.

You choose your words carefully.
"Does... does the word 'rampage' suggest you anything?" you ask.

This gets her to raise her head.
"What do you mean?" she asks, seemingly taken back by the question.
"I mean... it was only a doubt I had... did you or your sisters ever... lost control? Maybe in this particular period?" you ask.

You notice that she's now wide awake, her attention now fully on you.
"What kind of question is that?" she asks.

"Only something I was wondering about." you lie.
"Really? I don't think anyone would wake up in the middle of the night because of a simple doubt." she flatly replies.

You drop your smile.
"Azelf, I've heard something interesting about you three." you state.

She looks at you with amusement. You continue.
"Yeah, about something you do during this particular season."
"And that would be...?" she asks.

"You lose control. Go on a rampage around here. They're terrified, Azelf," you say bluntly, admitting everything you have been told. You notice her listening with eyes and mouth wide open.
"And they gave me a pretty accurate idea of what you would do with my dead body." you recall.

"‘They’ who?" the titaness asks you.
"Friends..." you reply.

A moment full of tension follows.
"I don't know what to tell you... this is absurd. We would never do anything like that! Especially not around the Lakes!" she exclaims, keeping her voice low.
"Really? Because that's what I heard, Azelf." you see the giantess staring at you intently.

And then, she smirks.
"Well, I have no clue. Maybe 'they' are right. Or maybe not. But you know what? I'm wide awake now," you notice her smirk growing wider.
"And I've got a certain 'itch' that needs to be scratched." she says.

You need no more answers.

Without any warning, you sprint away, towards the exit of the cave.

But, as you approach it, you abruptly stop. You didn't mean to. What happened?

You hear Azelf talking again.
"Whoever filled your head with that stuff, ignore them. We would never do things like that." she says.

You're pretty sure she's lying. You try to tell her, but you find that you can't even open your mouth.

Soon, you find a large paw closing itself around you. The giantess brings you up to her smiling face.
"Sorry about your will. Had to prevent you from running somehow. You'll have it back now." she says like it is no big deal.

Will?! Is this her power, taking other's will away?!

You discover that you can talk again.
"Come on Azelf, don't do this! I thought you were nice!" you say.

Her smile widens.
"Glad that you have such opinion of me." she says.
"Come on, I mean you no harm. Now, let's find a private place, shall we?" she asks, giggling.

You're in cage. You're trapped in the giantess' grasp. And you're too far away from the floor, even if you manage to break free, you'll only meet a worse fate than this one.

Your only hope is to scream for help. Sure, your new 'friends' might not be able to help you, but you could at least try to wake Uxie or Mesprit. Sure, you fear them no less than Azelf now, but they're your only hope.

Mesprit did act jealous earlier after all. Maybe she will do so again! Everything depends on what you'll do now. You know there's only one thing you can do.

And, as you start regretting not running away in the first place, you do it.

You manage to let out one single scream:
"Help!" you find Azelf's free paw pressing on your mouth.
"Be quiet. Wouldn't want to wake my sisters, would we?" she says.

Held in place by her fist, silenced by her paw, you can do nothing but watch what will happen next...
1343312111112121211212112121221.title: Nighttime confrontation.

choices: There's no choice! Let her have you!
Lucario and Vaporeon put their plan into action!
13433121111121212112121121212211.content:
Unable to move or talk, you can't do anything but watch with terror as the giantess carries you towards the entrance of the cave.

She stops briefly, glancing backwards to see if Mesprit or Uxie woke up. Luckily (for her) they didn't.
"Good." you hear her whisper as she floats out of the big cave.

Cold air hits you as you are carried outside. You look at the trees around, only to discover that all pokemon are gone. Where could they be gone to? And why now that you need them?

Your questions remain unanswered as Azelf floats towards the thick, snowy forest, the tall trees doing a good job in hiding her form from eyesight.

Every once in awhile, she stops, maybe searching for the right place, and talks to you, telling you things like:
"I'm sure you know how it works. I mean, you already did it a few times, right?"

"Don't worry, I'll try to make it as quick as possible."

"Be gentle with me, alright?" your fear grows each time you hear her talking.

She's acting like this all is a simple game. She doesn't seem to think that you could get seriously injured! That you could lose your own life! Again, images of three using you even after your demise cross your mind.

You go pale as death itself, and try to shake off these thoughts. This is quickly becoming too much for you to handle. You just hope that you'll find a chance to escape soon.

After what seems forever, but was, in reality, twenty minutes, the giantess finally stops.

"Well, that seems like a nice place, " she points to a small cave, which is well hidden by several bushes and trees. How did she even spot it?

Azelf quietly makes her way towards it. With a bit of difficulty, she manages to slip completely inside. It's spacious enough for her to sit upright, the tip of her star shaped head gently touching the ceiling.
"Yup. Nice, warm, and secluded. Maybe a bit cramped, but I'm sure it'll do it." Azelf talks again as she glances around.

And then, her gaze shifts on you.
"So, ready?" she asks, spreading her legs in front of you.

You almost have an heart attack as her vagina comes into view. And, suddenly, you can smell that familiar scent of heat.

Rather than stepping forward like the titaness expected, you actually back away.
"Come on. I won't harm you, I promise! Just help me already!" she exclaims, annoyed.

You don't move of an inch. Suddenly, an idea springs up in Azelf's mind.
"Listen. Let's make a deal," she says.


Unknown to both of you and Azelf, you were being watched by two familiar pokemon... well, familiar to you. A Lucario and a Vaporeon.

They kept an eye out for you when they saw you returning to the cave and, when they noticed you coming out carried by the blue giantess, they decided to follow her. And now, the two are having a quite animated discussion in their own language.

"See? What did I tell you? We warned him! And what is the first thing he does? He goes wake one of them up to have sex!" Lucario growls, frustrated.
"What if he didn't agree with it? What if she's forcing him? I saw his face, he was scared!" Vaporeon retorts.
"Yeah, right. A human male giving up on the chance to have sex? Humans are stupid, remember that!" Lucario talks again.

"Maybe. But he looked terrified after what we told him." Vaporeon says, before continuing:
"So, what do we do now? Do we just let it happen?" she asks.
"What else would you want to do?" Lucario growls with a hint of resignation.
"We could try and rescue the human..." the quadruped water type suggests.

Lucario looks down at her with a shocked expression.
"What are you, crazy!? Me and you, against that legendary mountain that has the power to deprive you of willpower?" he shouts.
"Maybe it could work. I distract her, you grab the human and then we flee." Vaporeon reasons. Lucario's paw slams against his forehead.
"Do really think it would work? How would you distract her?" he asks. If it wasn't for this site situation, he'd be laughing at the suggestion.
"Wouldn't you be distracted if a blizzard hit you in the eyes?" the water asks with a hint of irony.

"Yeah, like it could work! She'll just mistake you for a pesky bug and she'll crush you fla-" for the third time tonight, Vaporeon leaps up and smacks him across the face with her tail.
"Are we doing it?" she asks. Lucario gives a defeated sigh as he rubs his cheek.
"If we die for that human, I will remember it." he says.


You look up at the giantess with curiosity. A deal? What is she talking about? The only thing you want right now is to run as far and fast as you can!
"What deal?" you ask.

Azelf smiles.
"Glad that I got your attention. Now, if you - heh - play with me for a bit, I'm going to tell you what really happened during that... 'rampage', as you call it," she says.

You don't agree with the terms of the deal.
"What about this? I help you, and then you let me go?" you ask. Azelf tilts her head and looks at you weirdly, as if she is amused by your question.
"Even if I wanted to let you go afterwards, I couldn't do it. My sisters would make me pay as soon as they wake up and find out you're missing." she says you.

You stand your ground.
"What if I refuse?" you ask stubbornly. Azelf's smile disappears.
"Do you like your own free will? Let's just say this,
I can take that and still have you," she says.

You pale at the perspective. She was talking to use you as a... as a living sex toy!
"Come on, I'm tired of waiting!... I'll try to make it enjoyable for you as well, alright? Just... let's just do it! I'm offering to do it without having to do anything nasty!" she literally shouts.

Still white as a sheet, with your heart galloping within your chest, you give a deep sigh. There is no way out of this. If you refuse, she'll simply take your will and use you for her own pleasure. Might as well do it when you can still move, you decide.

And so, reluctant, defeated and humiliated, you start walking towards the giantess...
13433121111121212112121121212211.title: Azelf carries you away undisturbed...

choices: The night goes on smoothly and the morning you are ready to flee.
The sisters manage to find you!
134331211111212121121211212122112.content:
"Come on, let's do it, and we can go straight back to the cave and return to sleep." Azelf encourages you as you make your way towards her, deliberately taking as much time as you can to do so, hoping some kind of miracle would occur. The scent of her heat grows stronger as she nervously, but eagerly, waits for you to reach her.

And her smile comes back as she sees you walking in between her legs, slowly reaching her womanhood, which is already wet with anticipation.
"I understand you're scared. But it'll be swift, I promise." she says sympathetically.

Her words have the only effect to make you feel worse. They just made you imagine your own body, deprived of life, laying on the hard, cold floor of the cave, completely drenched in white, sticky liquid while Azelf stares at the pitiful sight, unable to feel anything but lust...

You shake that image off your mind and sourly surrender to reality. No one with some common sense would ever try anything against Azelf. No one is going to save you.

At least, that's what you think.


On the outside, Lucario and Vaporeon discuss about their plan.
"Alright, let's repeat it one more time. You go in there, get her attention and attack - aiming to her eyes." Lucario explains. Vaporeon nods.
"Then you come in as well, you grab the human, and then we flee. And we'll have just a few minutes to find a proper place to hide." she finishes.

Lucario nods at her.
"Good luck, Vapid. You'll need it." he says. Vaporeon gives him a smile, before taking a deep breath and heading to the cave where the human and the giantess currently are...


"Oh! K-Keep g-going!" Azelf stammers loudly, letting out a moan in the meantime.

Not quite knowing how to start, you commenced by rubbing her crotch, although you aren't willing to get inside of Azelf. The idea, which was kind of arousing earlier, now totally scares you.

But you stop as you hear a loud cry.
"Vaap!" you turn your head. And so does the giantess.

Your heart skips a beat as you notice as blue, quadruped pokemon with a a big, fin-like tail walking inside the cave. The Vaporeon from before!

Azelf is the first to talk.
"W-What are you doing in here?" she asks nervously, blushing wildly.
"Vap! Oreon!" Vaporeon cries in response.
"You're seeking a shelter for the night? Well, I'm sorry for you, but this cave is... occupied." Azelf replies, briefly eyeing you.

"Vaa."
"What do you mean, ‘That's not a problem’?" Azelf asks, momentarily forgetting about you.

Vaporeon doesn't reply. Instead, the atmosphere in the cave suddenly gets freezing cold as Vaporeon shots blizzard.

Right at the giantess' eyes, which get covered by a thin layer of ice. The titaness brings her paws to her eyes.

"Why you little...!"
"Lucario, now!" as Vaporeon lets out this cry, you notice a familiar black and blue pokemon running inside, towards you.

Lucario grabs you by your arm and pulls you away from the screaming legendary.
"Let's go human!" he shouts. He doesn't have to tell you twice as you start running towards the entrance of the cave, followed closely by Vaporeon.

In a moment, you three are out in the cold again, running towards no destination you can think of. Decisively, NOT towards the other cave, the one where the other two sisters are sleeping. Or, at least, you hope they are sleeping. Otherwise, they might hear Azelf screaming and go check what happened.

But you soon find that it isn't necessary.
"Get back here!" roars the familiar voice of the guardian of Lake Valor. And she doesn't seem to be too far. Instead, she seems to be enraged. Shit...

You turn your head, finding the blue mountain coming out from behind trees, flying straight towards you and your companions, shouting horrible words.

True, she is obviously faster, but you have the advantage of being smaller than her and, with the darkness around you, she has some problems in spotting you three.

"This way!" you hear Lucario shouting. You and your two companions keep running into the thick woods, zigzagging into different directions every two seconds.

And your very soul seems to sigh in relief as you finally notice that the giantess isn't on your tracks anymore.

You, Lucario and Vaporeon hide in a large bush.
"That was close," you pant, sitting down.
"I cannot thank you enough, you two."
"Vaa." Vaporeon replies.
"You're welcome." Lucario growls.

Only when you fully regain the ability to talk properly, you dare to ask:
"So? What do we do now? We stay hidden until dawn?" you ask.
"No. You and Vapid stay hidden until dawn, I'll go check on Azelf in the meantime. I'll see what she will do. I'll be back soon." Lucario replies.

And, despite the protests of Vaporeon, he gets up and dashes away, soon disappearing into vegetation and darkness.

Lucario comes back half an hour later, looking scared.
"She woke up her sisters! Now they're on our tracks!" he breathes heavily, trying to catch his breath, suggesting that he had be doing a lot of running.

"What?" you ask, now fearing the worst.
"Azelf returned to the cave, and woke her sisters up. She told them everything of how ‘I lost the human!’. Mesprit looked angry, she said something like ‘The closest thing to a mate I've ever had is now probably freezing! And it's your fault!’. Uxie seemed worried, though angry as well." Lucario pants while you listen with your jaw almost touching the ground.

Is it true? Mesprit and Uxie are really worried for you? Or are they only worried because they're probably not getting anymore pleasure?

"What... what did they do?" you ask.
"They rushed out of the cave, and they spread in three different directions. They're searching for you." Lucario adds unnecessarily.
"Surely enough, they're not searching for you. Or maybe Azelf is. Maybe she wants revenge on both of you," you say, looking both at him and at Vaporeon, who shivers at the thought.

"But the point is another. We're risking here. I say, let's wait until dawn comes. I'll run away then. Maybe you two can escort me, or not. You two can choose." you say.

Lucario nods slowly.
"Haven't I had enough troubles already?" he asks sarcastically. But Vaporeon climbs on your lap.
"On!" she cries.
"What do you mean with ‘I'll come with you’?" Lucario asks her.
"Vap! Vap!" she says.
"Do as you want! But... don't get caught." Lucario says.

You look at Vaporeon.
"You will accompany me?" you ask. She nods. Why does she seem to like you so much?

"Thank you, then." you say, smiling gratefully.
"Now, let's be quiet. Otherwise, one of the three might hear us. We'll just have to wait until dawn comes." you whisper, getting nods from the two pokemon.



Some time passes, although you can't tell how much. You don't get any sleep at all, your drowsiness faded the moment when you were awakened by Lucario the first time. You envy Vaporeon, who is quietly napping on your lap, while Lucario looks very tired, but keeps peeking out of the bush in order to see if Azelf, Mesprit or Uxie get too close to your hiding place.

You just keep quiet, occasionally petting Vaporeon. You just hope your plan will work.

If it does, you'll be safe and, hopefully, far from the three sisters and their lake. Otherwise... you don't want to think about what would happen if they find you before dawn...
134331211111212121121211212122112.title: Rescued... but safe?

choices: ... The three sisters are staring down at you...
... Uxie is staring down at you. Looks like her sisters aren't here...
1343312111112121211212112121221121.content:
You struggle to keep your eyes open. The thought of sleeping is very tempting, and all you want getting some sleep. But you know that isn't possible. You have to stay focused, ready to leave whenever dawn rises.

Luckily, it doesn't take long for the sun to rise over the horizon, its first, warm rays enlightening the lower skies. Your vision blurry from drowsiness, you almost don't notice Lucario peeking out of the bush once again.

Then, he looks back at you with a serious expression.
"Human. It's time for you to leave." he says, proceeding to gently shake the Vaporeon on your lap.

The quadruped water type slowly opens her eyes and gives a yawn, followed by a curious cry.
"It's time to leave, Vapid." Lucario grumbles.

Vaporeon looks at him for a second, then she looks at you, quickly remembering the situation.
"Vap." she cries, leaping off your lap and looking at you with an expectant expression that screams ‘It's now or never!’.

You slowly walk out of the bush, followed by the water type.
"Vaporeon?" you ask, earning a curious look.
"Before we leave, I need one last thing." you say.

--

You patiently wait for the small water type to return. And you smile brightly as you notice her dragging something with her mouth.

Your bag.

Sure, it currently lacks food - stole by those damned Sneasel - but the money you brought along is probably still there, so, you figure out, you might just have a decent breakfast once you are wherever Vaporeon will be taking you.

You quietly get a hold of it, gently petting Vaporeon on her head.
"Let's go then." you say, looking at Lucario, who gives a nod.

Vaporeon nods as well, starting to walk forward, followed by you. You glance backwards one more time, again looking at Lucario. He seems to be thinking. Maybe about something to say.
"Good luck human. And good luck to you, Vapid." he says, using a soft voice for the first time since you met him.

You smile as her darts away, soon disappearing into the forest.
"Vaap!" cries Vaporeon, who seems eager to leave.
"Coming." you say, hurrying to follow her.

--

After a while of walking, you notice the forest finally ending as you get out. You decide that this must be where the path to Lake Acuity begins.

And, for one last time, you turn around, getting Vaporeon to stop to throw you a curious glance.
"Azelf, Mesprit, Uxie. I may be leaving now. It's really hard, but I must do it. But keep this in mind," you speak to yourself as there is nobody but Vaporeon listening to you.
"I'll leave my heart here. And someday, when this heat season will be over, I'll come and get it back!" you exclaim.

When you turn around again, you find Vaporeon smiling at you. That speech of yours must have had an effect on her.

She stares at you for a few moments, before turning around and starting to walk again. You swear you can hear her giggle.

--

The daylight is beginning to fade when the lights of what seems a city come into view.
"We made it, Vaporeon!" you exclaim, relieved that you are finally safe.
"Vaap!" she cries, showing off a big smile as you both start running to what you remember is Snowpoint City. Sure, you came here before getting lost into that blizzard Uxie rescued you from.

--

Finally, you get back to the small house you rented here before you met the three guardians. You used part of your money to buy a meal worth that name for yourself. You also bought some pokemon food for Vaporeon, who quietly waits for you to open the front door of the house.

Only when you manage to gulp down some nice, warm soup you notice that sun is no longer there, fully replaced by the moon.

You also take notice that Vaporeon is done eating her own meal.
"So, ehm... maybe you want to... go back to the lake?" you casually ask her. Vaporeon rises her head, and looks at you, tilting her head in a curious manner.
"Yeah, I mean, Lucario is probably worried... don't you want to go back home?" you ask again.

Much to your surprise, Vaporeon shakes her head. Her answer is clear, ‘no’.
"You don't?" again, she shakes her head, and stares at you.
"... You want to stay with me?" you ask. Surprising you again, Vaporeon nods.
"Well... alright, I guess..." you mutter, getting her to smile.

She suddenly leaps in your arms, nuzzling your chest. You laugh at her naive behavior.

Finally, you walk towards the bedroom. It is a comfortable house, you notice. You hadn't the chance to take a better look at it. But all you desire now is a warm, soft bed.

And your wish is soon granted as you get to finally collapse on your bed, Vaporeon leaping beside you. Although it's not even remotely as warm and soft as Mesprit's fur, it is enough to spend a quiet night.

You slide under the sheets, Vaporeon following you.
"Good night, then." you say, closing your eyes.
"Vaa." is your reply.

Memories of yesterday, when you met the three giantesses, come to you. It shattered your heart to leave them, but you also really wanted to remain alive. But you made a promise. And you know it, you're going to keep it. These are your past thoughts before the darkness comes. And you eagerly embrace it, greeting a night of nice, long sleeping.

--

Two months passed since you met the three giantesses. Two months since you left them. Two months since Vaporeon chose to stay with you instead of going back. You have been living in Snowpoint City since the day you came back. You had enough money with you to afford whatever you needed.

Anyone else would have just forgotten the three sisters and would have moved on at this point. But not you. You made a promise, that you were going to back to lake Acuity once their heat was over. And by now, you're sure it is.

And today is the day.

Once you finally got dressed, you grab your jacket. The same jacket Uxie provided you that day. Memories coming back to your mind, you absentmindedly put it on and grab your bag.

Vaporeon walks next to you. When she learned what you want to do, she seemed a little scared, but she was quickly reassured when you told her that the sisters' heat is most probably over.

"Ready?" you ask once you're fully ready to go. The water type nods. You give a smile as she walks forward.

You lock the door behind you as you follow her out of the city and towards lake Acuity.

--

Only when sun is fully settled, you finally arrive to lake shore, the crystalline water reflecting the pale moonlight.

You can't contain yourself anymore.
"Azelf! Mesprit! Uxie! It's me! I'm back!" you shout out, imagining three giantesses instantly responding to your cry with a happy, warm ‘Welcome back!’.

Sadly, nobody answers to your call. You look at the island in the middle of the lake. The same island that leads to an underwater cave where Uxie resides. Or at least, where she should reside...
"Is there anyone? Uxie?" you call again, louder this time, quickly remembering that she is the actual guardian of this place.

Again, you get no answer.

You give a couple more cries, just to get the same response: absolute silence.

Just when you decide to give and turn around, giving Vaporeon, who had been staring at the lake with amusement, a silent ‘Let's go’, you notice a gigantic shadow sliding over you, covering you completely.

Vaporeon flees, and hides behind some plants. You told her to do so earlier. If Azelf is here and recognizes her, you're not sure of how she would react.

However, your heart filled with hope, you turn around, eager to find out who the shadow belongs to.

And the first thing you notice is...
1343312111112121211212112121221121.title: A new beginning, but not the end

choices: You wake up later. Azelf and Mesprit are here!
13433121111121212112121121212211212.content:
You gaze upwards, finding a huge, yellow headed pokemon staring down at you with disbelief.

You smile brightly.
"Uxie!" you call out. But the giantess doesn't reply, her mouth opening wide.

She stares down at you for a good five minutes, before she breaks the silence.
"Y-You?!" she literally shouts. She doesn't give you any time to reply, though. She brings her paws to her head, shaking it slowly.
"This... T-This can't be... I must be dreaming... this is a dream..." she mutters, before looking at you again, staring right into your soul through her closed eyes.
"And yet, it is not. Maybe it's a hallucination... just my mind tricking me..." she whispers again.

You drop your smile, but stay silent, not finding anything to say. The giantess continues.
"B-But... even if it is... who cares?" she smiles brightly at this last question.
"Little one!" she then shouts, marking the end of her monologue by extending her paws towards you.

Before she can get a hold of you, though, you swiftly run forward and leap onto her already approaching paws, which she brings up to her chest, closing your whole being in a loving hug. You return it, hugging back as long as your arms can reach.

"You're back! You're finally back! I... I m-missed you so much!" stammers the giantess, tears now freely running down her cheeks, suggesting that she was trying to hold them back.

"Y-You must be freezing here! Let me get you inside the cave!" she then says, not releasing you from her hug.

Then, in a flash of yellow light, you find yourself in the cave where Uxie resides, Acuity Cavern.

The giantess uses a paw to wipe tears away.
"You can't even imagine how worried I was! Not to mention... not to mention Azelf and Mesprit!" Uxie continues, using her paws to bring you upwards.

She then pushes you into her cheek, starting to nuzzle you.
"Azelf was really sorry. She thought that she was the cause of your escape. But Mesprit - we thought she was going to cry all the liquids she has in her!" the yellow headed giantess exclaims.

Your smile drops at the last remark. Uxie continues:
"But now, tell me, where were you for the past two months? And most of all, why did you run from us? From me?" she then asks, concerned.
"I was forced to, Uxie. Pokemon around here... they told me that you get crazy with lust when you're in heat. That you... that you may have hurt me! They told me you and your sisters went on a rampage around here!" you say. Uxie's mouth opens wide once again.

"But, before leaving, I made a promise. I promised that I would have returned. And I kept that promise." you proudly state, smiling at your last remark.
"And since that day, I've been living in Snowpoint City, a place not too far from here. I decided to stay there because I... I didn't want to get too far from you. I knew I was going to return here." you pause and take a deep breath, taking also notice that the giantess is looking at you with great interest.

"It was really hard to leave you, Azelf and Mesprit. But I had to. I didn't want to risk my own life. Don't misunderstand me, I would have gladly helped you again, but it was very dangerous. So dangerous, that I... that I had no other choice." you tell her the truth.

Uxie seems confused.
"I don't know what to tell you... I'm speechless. Getting crazy with lust, I don't remember ever doing that. Neither I remember going on a rampage. Especially not around my Lake!" she exclaims.

She then goes silent, seemingly thinking.
"But you know what? Let's forget all of this," she says.
"The heat season is over anyway," she places her paws on her mouth, seeming to be pondering something again.

You remain silent as she finally speaks again:
"You know, maybe I should call my sisters. They were really worried when you... 'disappeared' that night..." she says with a hint of sadness.

You nod. You have to admit, you really want to see Azelf and Mesprit again as well. Especially Mesprit. You really missed her and Uxie. You spent just one day with them, but you got incredibly close to the two of them.

Uxie talks again, this time with a smile:
"But, let's wait for a bit. I'll call them later," she looks at you, smiling again.
"For now, why don't you tell me what have you been doing during these two months?" she asks you. You smile.

--

"Well, you had a peaceful life, it appears," Uxie says after you finish telling her your story. You didn't mention Vaporeon though.
"Yes. It's been a pretty quiet-" you pause to let a yawn come out of your mouth.

Uxie smiles.
"Are you tired?" she asks.
"Yeah. It took all day to come back here." you reply.
"All day? Well then, I guess you should rest now." she says, unexpectedly pushing you to her chest, embracing you.

You blush.
"Uxie... don't you think that it's a bit... early for this?" you ask. You literally just met her again.

But Uxie simply giggles.
"Don't be silly. Our relationship didn't change one bit. To me, you're still that tiny human I saved from a blizzard. That tiny human that helped me around Lake Acuity. That noticed those pokemon slipping up inside me," she replies with a nostalgic voice.
"That tiny human that still has all my gratitude for his help with my problem." she says, planting a small kiss on your head.

You blush even more, but say nothing, touched by her words.
"Now, get some sleep. In the meantime, I'll... you'll see." she says.
"Oh, and..." she nears her head to yours.
"Don't you ever leave me again." she whispers.

You give her a tired smile, before leaning forward, laying your head against her fur, its softness and the warmth it carries, along with the sounds coming from within the giantess, are enough to send you straight to dreamland in a matter of minutes.

Upon noticing you asleep, Uxie's smile grows.
"This brings me back. ‘Hello there, young human’" she recalls the moment you woke up in her paws that day.

The yellow headed pixie then calls upon her psychic powers to establish a psychic link with Azelf and Mesprit.
‘Girls? Are you awake?" she telepathically asks.
‘I am." Azelf replies from her own home at Lake Valor.
‘Me too. What is it, Uxie?" Mesprit asks from Lake Verity. Uxie notices her pink headed sister replying with a broken voice.

Right.

Mesprit didn't handle the human's leaving very well. She left shortly after him. Uxie herself and Azelf didn't hear her for days.

Uxie pauses for a moment, letting a couple of tears pour down her cheeks. Your sudden reappearing was a great surprise for her.
‘Uxie? Are you still there?" Azelf's voice brings her back to reality.

Smiling, the yellow headed pixie resumes, telling just two simple sentences:

‘Girls, I've got a guest with me. You'll never guess who.’.
13433121111121212112121121212211212.title: Tears of joy

choices: Help Uxie around the lake first.
Decline, and go search for Vaporeon instead.
134331211111212121121211212122112121.content:
"So? You talked about a guest, Uxie. Who is it?" this voice fully wakes you up.

You slowly return to reality as you rub your eyes and absentmindedly start to stretch.
"Awake already, little one?" a sweet voice calls for you.

You open your eyes, finding yourself staring at a wall of blue fur. Memories of the past few hours come to you.
"Uxie?" you reply to the call.

The titaness opens her paws a little bit. She leans forward, pecking your head.
"I was going to wake you up later, but I guess that won't be necessary. Just in time, dear human. Mesprit and Azelf are here." she whispers with a smile.

That said, Uxie opens up her paws, releasing you from her hug while presenting you to two other giantess, one with a pink head, the other with a cyan one, both sitting on the floor of the cave. Apparently, both were looking at their sister. But, the moment she revealed you, their gazes fixed on you.

Azelf and Mesprit stare at you with curiosity. But then, their curiosity changes into disbelief as they notice that their sister is indeed holding onto a human.

Both giantesses stare at you with their eyes wide open for a while. You stare right back at them, smiling.
"A human...? I don't get it, Uxie... Is he the guest you told us about?" Azelf asks, confused. She seems to not have recognized you.

But Mesprit surely did, you judge as you hear her exclaim one single word:
"C-Cutie!" Mesprit exclaims.

Before Azelf can process who you are, her sister floats forward at breakneck speed, paws pointing to you, ready to snatch you from Uxie.

But the yellow headed pixie gracefully spins around, avoiding her sister, that ends up grasping the void.
"Careful, Mesprit!" Uxie exclaims before turning her attention on you again.

That spin of hers left you completely nauseated and somewhat dizzy.
"Hehehe, whoops," giggles the giantess, gently lowering her paws, letting you on the ground. A mix of incoherent syllables is the only reply she gets.

Before your sense of orientation can come back, though, you discover two large, blue paws wrapping around you and scooping you up.

The two paws manipulate you so that you can see that they actually belong to Azelf.
"I-Is that... you're really here, aren't you? I'm not dreaming or something, right?" she asks, seemingly confused.
"No, Azelf. I really came back." you assure.

The blue giantess stares at you for a couple more seconds, before enclosing you in a soft, yet firm hug.
"I-It's really you... I'm so sorry for what I've done that night... I don't know what happened to me..." she apologizes. Looking upwards, you discover something shining under her closed eyelids. Something like two forming tears.

"Azelf, I didn't run away because of you. It wasn't your fault, trust me." you say. The giantess opens her eyes.
"It wasn't?" she asks. You shake your head. Azelf smiles.

And then, you notice her moving you upwards. Towards her lips.
"May I?" she asks. She doesn't wait for an answer, though, as she presses her lips on your forehead, producing a loud smooching sound.
"I'm so happy that you returned. We all missed you!" she says cheerfully after pulling off. She then proceeds to gently place you down.

You smile. Now an atmosphere of pure happiness reigns inside the cave.

However, a certain pink headed pokemon is starting to get annoyed.
"Believe me, I more than anyone know that this is extremely heartwarming. But aren't you missing something? Or someone?" Mesprit asks, placing her paws on her hips.

You shiver slightly as you hear her voice. You're not sure of how she would take it if you told her that you actually forgot that she was present in the cavern.
"Mesprit..." you can't say anything else.

Two slender, huge hands wrap solidly around your body, and snatch you up. Only to shove you into a furry surface of some sorts afterwards. It doesn't take long for you to understand that Mesprit is hugging you against her chest.

"Y-You can't... you can't possibly know..." the giantess abruptly interrupts herself to stare at you, trying to find a way to express herself. But you speak for her:
"I missed you." you say.

The moment these words come out of your mouth, your whole being is roughly brought up and assaulted by a pair of large, pink lips. Mesprit kisses you.

You feel like you're on fire. Each and every inch of you burns as the giantess loudly smooches you.

Only after a good minute, she finally pulls leaving a dazed you laying on her cupped paws.
"Don't you ever try to run from us again! I... we were so worried! I thought... I thought I wasn't going to see you ever again..." Mesprit suffocates the last remark so that only you can hear her.

You suddenly feel very sorry. Right, Mesprit likes to play with other's emotions.
"I'm sorry. But I had no other choice." you reply bluntly.
"Why? Were we scaring you? Did we do something wrong?... Did I do something wrong?" the giantess asks.

You shake your head.
"None of these reasons," you glance at Azelf and Uxie. Already knowing your story, Uxie simply smiles at you and nods her head, silently telling you to tell Azelf and Mesprit the reasons of your escape.
"Might as well sit down. It's a long story." you say.

--

"That's... that's just..."
"Absurd!"

In the past hour, you have been explaining the real reasons that made you leave two months ago. Azelf and Mesprit carefully listened to every word that came out of your mouth, while Uxie sat apart, already knowing what you had to say.

"So, are you saying that we actually lose control during the heat season? That we... hurt others?" Azelf asks. You nod.
"But, our heat ended a while ago, and we don't remember hurting anyone. I mean... we didn't hurt you back then... right?" Mesprit asks, concerned.
"You didn't hurt me," you reassure.

"You know what? The heat season is over. I don't think It'll do any of us good if we worry about it now. I say, let's just forget it for now. And when the next season comes... we'll see... because, you're going to stay... right?" Mesprit asks you. You notice Uxie floating closer to the three of you.

You smile.
"As long as you three want me to be here-" you don't get to finish. Two large paws, belonging to Uxie, get a hold of you and bring you upwards.
"Of course we want. You're welcome here, little one," Uxie says. You smile gratefully.

Mesprit snatches you from Uxie.
"Hey, now that I think about it, it's actually been a lot of time since we last played together... why don't we make up for lost time?" she asks you, winking.

The sentence startles you.
"Hey, I thought the heat season was over!" you exclaim.
"It is," Mesprit says.
"Much to our relief." both Azelf and Uxie add.

Mesprit rolls her eyes, before gazing at you again.
"Who says we can't have some fun anyway? Not necessarily sex, you know," she states.
"We could also play with emotions again~" she sings.

You instinctively look at Uxie, who smiles at you.
"Sorry to ruin your plans, Mesprit. But I've still got a few chores to do around here, maybe you can help me again?" Uxie asks, gently snatching you from her sister.
"Uh, sure. I'll help!" you say.

It is just perfect. Not only Uxie just saved you... again... but she also gave you the perfect excuse to go and search for Vaporeon.

Last time you saw her, she disappeared into the forest when you met Uxie again. You wonder what she's been doing for the whole time.

Mesprit huffs loudly.
"Fine." she mutters dejectedly, crossing her legs and resting her tails on her lap.

You look at Azelf, who simply smiles and gives a shrug.
"Let's go then," you hear Uxie's voice.

The next moment, you find yourself outside of the cavern and into the warm sunlight.
"How much time did I sleep?" you causally ask.
"About five hours." she replies, hovering above the lake and gently letting you down on its shore.

"Say, are you ready to start?" Uxie asks you.

You hesitate. Can you tell her your intentions? You decide against it. And then again, it's been a long time since you actually spent time with the giantess. Do you really have to go and search for Vaporeon straightaway?

But another part of you is somewhat worried about the quadruped water type.

"Anyone in there?" Uxie's voice brings you back to reality.
"Mh?"
"I said, let's get started. Is everything alright? You seem a bit off..." she says.
"I'm alright." you reply.

Uxie smiles.
"Then, why don't we start?" she asks you.

You take a few moments to take a decision, wether to help Uxie or go search for Vaporeon.

You give a deep sigh as you make your choice...
134331211111212121121211212122112121.title: The reconciliation

choices: let Mesprit have some quality time with you
1343312111112121211212112121221121211.content:
Thinking that you need a chance to catch up, you decide to agree with Uxie's request, even if it means that you'll have to work.

Upon hearing your affermative answer, the pixie lets a bright smile spread across her face.
"Wonderful! Now, wait for a moment," she says, placing a paw over her forehead.

Just as she does so, she happens to spread her legs. Just a little bit, but enough for you to spot her sex.

Blushing furiously, you suddenly think about something. Before you can express yourself, though, a pair of pruning shears materialises in your hands.
"There we go. Now-" you interrupt before she can continue.

"Wait, Uxie. I just thought about something." you say.
"What is it?" she asks.

You blush again.
"Well... remember what happened last time we did this?" you ask her.

It's now her turn to blush.
"I didn't want to think about that anymore." she replies with her embarrassment.
"But, what if it happens again?" you ask.

The yellow headed pixie smiles.
"And that's why you're sticking close to me this time. What do you say? Will you be my little guardian for today?" she talks with a hint of affection. You find her paw approaching you, lightly petting your head.

"Uh, sure." you awkwardly reply. Uxie stifles a giggle.
"Well, then. Let's get to work. Now, like last time, I'll unfreeze the area and you cut the dead leaves." she instructs.

You take a look around, and notice that the nearby vegetation is completely covered in snow.
"Alright." you say.

The blue and yellow titaness nods, before leaning down. And, exactly like the last time, she starts breathing on a few snow-covered bushes. The snow immediately melts away because of the sudden warmth, revealing verdant and brown leaves.

You start to cut the dead leaves like you were instructed. Soon, a small pile forms at your feet. You then notice Uxie moving to the next set of plants.

The whole thing goes on for a while, with Uxie unfreezing the vegetation and you cutting off the dead leaves. With little help from the giantess, you also manage to 'aid' the trees around the lake.

--

It takes both of you a not-so-little amount of time to unfreeze the whole area around Lake Acuity. The thing took at least two hours but, now, all the vegetation returned to its original green color, while a large amount of decayed leaves is scattered on the snow-covered grass.

"Once again, we did a pretty great job, dear human." Uxie says.
"Yep." you reply.

You then find her paw reaching out for you. Once Uxie gets a hold of you, she lifts you upwards.
"Sadly, I've got nothing to reward you with," she says.
"Uxie, there's really no need to-"
"Hush. Just accept this," she interrupts, leaning forward, pressing her lips on your forehead.

The titaness pulls off after a minute.
"Thank you." she whispers. You smile.

"My, what a good job you two," both you and Uxie turn around to see Mesprit and Azelf staring at you.
"Oh, I wish I had someone to help me around my lake as well." Azelf remarks, giving you a big wink.

You blush furiously. For how long have they been there?

Did they see...?!

Apparently, Uxie shares your embarrassment, as you find her blushing as well.
"Weren't you two waiting inside?" she asks her sisters.
"It was getting pretty boring in there," Mesprit replies.
"So we decided to check on you two. It seems you're doing fine." Azelf explains with a causal shrug.

Uxie shakes her head, before turning to you.
"Let's continue, alright?" she asks you. You nod.
"Alright then. Start digging up a hole while I gather the leaves." she says, gently placing you down on the snowy floor around the lake.

"Hey, how about we help too?" Azelf suddenly speaks up. Then, without waiting for an answer, she continues:
"I'll help you with the hole, human," she says, floating closer to you.

Uxie looks at her, then at Mesprit, who shrugs.
"Then I'll help you, sister." she says.

So, aided by the blue giantess, you start digging a hole. Obviously, her huge paws are much more efficient than your comparatively tiny hands.

In the meantime, Mesprit and Uxie use their psychic to gather all the leaves, that start to float towards them, forming a large pile in midair.

Once the hole is dug up, they carefully move the dead leaves towards it, dropping them into it. At this point, Azelf covers the hole with snow.

"Are we done?" Mesprit asks.
"For the moment, yes." Uxie replies. The three sisters proceed to sit down next to you.

--

Some time passes before Uxie talks to you again:
"Little one? Would you like helping me again?" she asks with a smile.

Before you can open up your mouth, Mesprit speaks up.
"Come on, Uxie, give the guy a break. After all," you discover the giantess' tails wrapping around your waist, lifting you off ground and onto the open palms of her waiting paws.
"I want a chance to catch up as well." she says, mostly to you.
1343312111112121211212112121221121211.title: Help Uxie around the lake first.

choices: Don't fight it - let Mesprit have you...
Try to talk your way out of this!
13433121111121212112121121212211212112.content:
"I don't mind, but the choice isn't up to me," Uxie replies to Mesprit's statement.

Mesprit giggles.
"You're right," she says, turning her attention on you.
"What do you say, my little human? Want to have some quality time together, me and you?" she asks.

You decide to agree with the giantess' request. You want to spend time with her as well.
"Alright... why not?" you reply.

Mesprit closes her golden eyes, and smiles brightly.
"Great!" she says, slowly getting up.
"Mind if I spend some alone time with this little human?" she then addresses her sisters.
"Not at all." Uxie and Azelf reply simultaneously.

Mesprit smiles even more, and slowly carries you off into the forest. The same forest where you discovered about her powers for the first time. The same forest where she had her outburst. The same forest where she declared her devotion towards you.

The same forest where she had you for the first time.

"Say, Mesprit, are you going to play with my emotions again?" you recall the memories of her games while she hovers through the woods.
"Maybe. Or maybe not~" she sings, clearly excited about the idea of spending time with you.

"Hey, you don't want to cause me fear again... do you?" you ask.

Finally, the pink blue giantess finds a clearing. She stops to sit down.
"Nope," she replies to your question.
"I don't like playing with the same emotions twice. " she states.
"No, today we're going to play with something more... sensual," the last remark makes you shiver.
"Why don't I like the sound of that?" you ask.

Mesprit smiles sympathetically, while leaning back against the trunk of a tree roughly her size, holding you in front of her gigantic face.
"Oh, trust me, you'll like it later." she says.

You suddenly feel weird. Mesprit's smile widens.
"Hey, are you feeling alright? You look... weird," she says.
"I feel... dazed... as if..." you try to find the right words.
"...As if you like what you see?" Mesprit asks.

"...yes..." you reply in a whisper. Mesprit giggles.
"Can you feel it?" she asks you.
"Feel it?" you parrot back, confused.

Mesprit pulls you closer to her face.
"The love. Can you feel the love?" she asks with a soft voice.

You don't know how to reply.

Love?

Sure, you enjoy her company a lot, but can you really call this 'love'?
"Yes." you risk, replying to her question.

The pink and blue giantess giggles, and moves you closer to her lips, placing a soft kiss on your face.
"Then I'll assume that you like this as well?" she asks.

You nod. Why are you enjoying this?

Again, Mesprit giggles, and again, she places another gentle kiss on your face. Then, she slowly pushes you into her cheek, proceeding to nuzzle you.
"See? That's what love does. It shows the truth.
Reveals the most hidden secrets." she speaks while nuzzling you.

The giantess then pulls off, and closes you in a hug. You don't even try to fight back.
"Tell me, are you feeling happy?" she asks.
"Yes..." you whisper, with an almost dreamy voice.

This all seems like a wonderful dream, one you wouldn't want to wake up from. For some reason, you feel... happy. Like you don't need nothing more than Mesprit's presence.

The titaness continues:
"But love... can be painful. Very, very painful," she says.

Suddenly, you find yourself descending to the ground along with Mesprit's paws. She gently lets you down, and pushes you away with one of her tails.

Suddenly, you feel very sad. Like your heart was just torn apart.

You don't like this game anymore.
"Mesprit! Stop it! It... it hurts!" you cry out. The giantess blinks innocently.
"Stop doing what?" she asks, choking back a laugh.

Before you can reply, you find yourself floating off ground. You're brought onto Mesprit's paws.
"It still hurts?" she asks, hugging you against her chest.

All your internal pains cease in a instant.
"Actually... no." you reply, making Mesprit giggle.
"See what I meant? Love makes you feel all warm and fuzzy, but it also makes you feel the greatest pain ever." she says, placing another kiss on your head.

Slowly, the dreamy atmosphere around fades, replaced by hard reality. You notice Mesprit snickering.
"Hehehe, did you enjoy our little game? Did you like the warm embrace of love?" she asks, while giggling hysterically.
"I sure liked it better than the first game," you reply.
"Oh, really... human?" suddenly, Mesprit gazes at you sternly, her fist closes around you and you start to feel scared.

You're released shortly after as the giantess drops her stern look and resumes laughing, while your fear suddenly disappears. You sigh.
"And that's exactly why I like being around you and your sisters. You three sure are nice... except for that heat problem." you state.
"You know, me and my sisters hatched from the same egg." she says.

You look up at her, incredulous.
"... Is that even possible?" you ask.
"Apparently. And that's why we're so close. I mean,
we all got powers. We share a connection. And we... " Mesprit stops in mid sentence to look at you.
"And we have the same human as a mate..." she remarks.

You don't like where this is going.
"I'd like to say that Azelf didn't have me." you quickly say.
"I know, cutie," she replies.
"Now, about our game, how about we take it a little... further?" she asks.
"Further?" you ask. You pretty much know what she's up to. But maybe you're wrong. You hope you're wrong.

"Well, I taught you about love... so, what do you say if we do some practice?" the question confirms your theory.

She is really asking you to have sex. Again.

If you could, you would be surely running back to her sisters now. But Mesprit is holding you several feet above the ground. There's no running here...

But, again, the giantess isn't crazed in heat anymore, maybe you can talk your way out of this situation?

You notice the giantess moving you downwards unnervingly slowly.

You know that soon you'll have no more choice. If Mesprit wants you to do it, she can easily make you. Surrendering to her desires sounds easy...

But, on the other hand, you can surely try to reason with her. After all, she isn't the lust-crazed beast she was back then, right?

A thousand thoughts occupy your mind as you try to take a decision, but you must hurry - time is running out!
13433121111121212112121121212211212112.title: A love-ly playtime

choices: You don't want to leave them. Stay with the three sisters.
You don't want to take the risk. Ask them to let you go.
1343312111112121211212112121221122.content:
Hours go on silently as you patiently wait for the sun's first lights to show up, enlightening the sky.

Vaporeon is still asleep on your lap, snoring softly, while Lucario seems to be having a hard time in keeping his eyelids up.
"You can rest too. I can check if those three are nearby, you know." you mutter. But he shakes his head.
"If they somehow find us, we'll have to run. I can't risk." he replies.

You nod in understanding and go silent again, waiting for the sun the appear over the horizon.

Sadly, it never does.
"Little one? If you are around, come out, please!" a very familiar voice breaks the silence.

You go pale, and look at Lucario, who peeks out of the bush.
"Mesprit," he mutters, scared.

You lose no time and gently rise Vaporeon from your lap.
"Run." you instruct as you hand her to Lucario.
"But-"
"She can feel my emotions! She'll find us anyway!" you suffocate your voice in order to not be heard by Mesprit.
"She won't hurt me. Now go!" you say.

Lucario nods. Without losing anymore time, he secures Vaporeon in his grasp and exits the bush, soon disappearing into plants and darkness.

"Little one? I can sense your fear. I won't hurt you,
promise." Mesprit calls.

Taking a deep breath, you step out of the bush as well, though in the opposite direction Lucario went.

As soon as you stand up again, you find yourself staring at a mountain of blue fur. Looking upwards, you find, as expected, two golden eyes, belonging to a pink face, looking straight down at you.
"Little one!" Mesprit exclaims, lowering her paws to get a hold of your body
"Oh, when Azelf told me you were gone... I thought-" she says, bringing you upwards. However, you interrupt her.
"Mesprit. We need to talk." you say, deciding that running from your problems won't help you solving them.


So, here we are. What did have to tell us?" Uxie asks.

In the past ten minutes, Mesprit telepathically called her sisters, telling them she found you. Then, she returned to the cave.

Between hugs and sentences of how much worried they were, you gave a short explanation of what happened. There was no point in denying about Vaporeon since Azelf saw her, but you didn't mention Lucario.

And now, you're currently sitting in front of the three giantesses. Three pairs of identical tails are laying around the cave, while two pairs of golden eyes are fixed on you. Though Uxie's eyes are lidded, you can tell that she has her attention on you as well.

"Azelf told us that you talked about a few things that none of us seems to remember," Mesprit says. You look at Azelf inquisitively.
"But she made me a certain deal," you remark.

The blue giantess lowers her head.
"I was lying. I have no clue about what you said, I just wanted... I just wanted you, alright?" she admits, blushing.

You roll your eyes.
"Say, does the word 'rampage' tell you something?" you repeat the same question you asked Azelf earlier. And, just like her, Mesprit and Uxie look confused.
"No." Uxie replies after a moment of silence.
"Why? Should it?" Mesprit asks.

You nod slowly.
"Earlier, I woke up. Or rather, I was woken up." you say.
"By?" Uxie asks.
"For now, I'll keep that for me," you reply, not wanting to out the local pokemon in danger.
"Anyway, I was told something about you three." you say, trying to use a calm tone.

Azelf already knows your story, so she stays silent. But her sisters can't hide their curiosity.
"What were you told?" Mesprit asks.
"I learned that you three... in this particular period, not always..." you say, suddenly reluctant to go on.
"What?" Uxie inquires.
"Well, you... how can I say this?"
"We apparently lose control," Azelf speaks for you.

Her sisters stare at her. Then, they look at you, mouths wide open. You nod timidly.
"That's right. You can't control your urges. You get crazy with lust. They're scared, girls. So scared. You go on a rampage, do things that you would normally regret. But you seem to forget all of that," you say, the mouth of the trio opening more and more as you speak.

"And speaking of forgetting, Uxie, they don't remember you ever doing that for a certain reason, I believe." you reply, looking at the yellow headed pixie.
"This can't... this can't be! I never open my eyes for a reason!" she exclaims.
"Apparently, not during this season. And, if I got it right, other... friends died. Died, girls. They didn't want to break your hearts by telling you, but they wanted it to stop!" you reply bluntly. For a moment, you imagine the silhouettes of Lucario and Vaporeon.

A new concern comes to you. Are they alright?

"This... this can't be. We can't... we couldn't have..." Mesprit says, holding her head in her paws, like trying to wake up from a nightmare.
"You didn't tell me these things, little one. I can't believe this. Uxie would never... we would never have done something like that." Azelf states.

Uxie stays silent, seemingly thinking.
"W-Wait. I remember something," she then days, earning curious looks coming from you and her sisters.
"I don't exactly remember when, but a few pokemon died around here. When I asked how to other pokemon, they told me nothing and left..." Uxie states, visibly incredulous.

"So..."
"It all was true..." Azelf and Mesprit say. You nod.
"That's why I ran. They told me to do so, otherwise you would have lost control and you may have hurt me," you say.

The three giantesses exchange sorrowful looks, before looking back down at you.

"We're sorry!" they exclaim at unison. Mesprit's paws rush down to grab you.

You find yourself crushed in her grasp, while her sisters hug her - and you as well, only making it harder for you to breath. You notice tears pouring down their cheeks.

"H-How could we... how could I... what guardian am I, letting this all happen?!" Uxie shouts.
"What have we done? That's horrible!" Mesprit cries.
"We're supposed to protect other pokemon, not harm them!" Azelf screams. By now, anyone would have understood who your 'friends' are.

The whole thing goes on for almost an hour. Just when you're about to pass out from the lack of oxygen, the three release you.
"We are... we are truly sorry for all of this..." Uxie sniffles.
"If you still... want to leave, we'll let you go. We can't blame you..." Azelf says, wiping tears away.
"But if you still... but if you still want to stay with us,
we promise you..." the three once again look at each other.

"We promise we are never going to hurt you." they say at once.

Complete silence falls into the cave, as they stare down at you, eyes still wet from the tears that had been pouring from them not even a few minutes ago.

You can't do anything but regard the pitiful sight of the three sorrowful sisters. Now you know why those pokemon didn't want to reveal the truth like you did...

Nonetheless, they offered you a choice. If to leave - and you're tempted to do so - or if to stay with them, with the promise you're not going to be hurt.

Whatever choice you take, it will have its consequences. If you leave, you're sure that you're going to miss them. But, if you stay, they might just lose control and try to use you again...

After a long and hard reflexion - it was hard, because the three sisters were staring at you for the whole time - you finally decide yourself...
1343312111112121211212112121221122.title: Confronting the Lake Trio

choices: Yet another talk with Lucario and Vaporeon...
Mesprit suddenly wakes up, noticing you three leaving!
13433121111121212112121121212211221.content:
Admittedly, a big part of you wants to just tell the sisters to put you down, let you grab your bag and leave, no strings attached.

But the other part, a weaker, yet still very audible voice in your mind tells that you don't want that, it tells you to trust the three legendaries. It tells you that their tears were of sincere regret. And leaving would mean that the three are going to be not just sad. They would be heartbroken.

And you don't want that.

You glance up, noticing them staring down at you intently, eagerly waiting for your answer.

Which they soon get.

"If you... if you really will try to not lose control anymore..." you start.
"We won't," Mesprit, who is still holding you in front of herself and her sisters, speaks up.
"I don't want anymore problems around my lake. We'll try to keep ourselves under control, right Azelf?" Uxie asks.
"Absolutely." Azelf replies, nodding her head.

You continue:
"Then, if you really won't hurt me... I don't want to leave you girls." you admit. It felt like a boulder was lifted from your soul.

Mesprit and Uxie smile brightly. But Azelf looks perplexed.
"Glad to be hearing so, but..." she says. Her sisters look at her. And so do you.
"... But we still have our... problems. Do you... do you still want to... fix us?" she timidly asks.

You smile a little.
"As long as my willpower, emotions and memories stay where they are. But... let's keep that under control, alright?" you reply.

You get no response but three big smiles.

And the next second, you are assaulted by three pairs of large lips; blue, pink and yellow is all you can see; their touch on you is all you can feel; the smooching they produce is all you can hear.

The only other thing you can feel is the burning sensation growing each time their lips make contact with your face.


Only after a good amount of time they finally pull off, leaving a dizzy you almost unable to stand on your legs.

Mesprit gently places you down.
"That's just sweet of you." she says, smiling brightly.

"You know, since we took care of this little problem,
why don't we go back to sleep? It's still pretty early you know. I could use a few more hours of rest." Uxie says, reaching her original spot and laying down, sending small shockwaves through the floor.

"You're right, sister. Of course, I wouldn't have woken you if it wasn't for a good reason." Azelf states as she lays down as well, soon followed by Mesprit.

Unsure of what to do, you start laying down as well.
"You may be cute, but you're stubborn. You're not sleeping on the ground." you hear Mesprit saying.

And second later, you're pulled towards her by a strong psychic grasp. You try to resist it with all your mental strength, but you only manage to slow down a little.

Nonetheless, you end up getting closed in a tight hug.
"Hey Azelf, This little one has some willpower in him. He almost resisted!" Mesprit chimes. You can hear the Uxie and Azelf giggling from beside Mesprit.

You then feel a pair of lips pressing on your forehead, before the three relax, soon falling asleep again.

You have to admit: you're not sure if this was the best choice. But you didn't want to leave the trio. Especially not after they started crying, sorrowful about their actions. You sigh. This relationship with them might be hard, but maybe you'll survive until the season is over. They did promise to not harm you, after all.

Right?

You close your eyes, wanting to rest after the events of the night.

Just a little...

"Wake up, human." it feels like very little time passed since you feel asleep.

With your vision blurry, you drowsily gaze at whoever woke you up. You discover that Mesprit rolled on her side in her sleep, but she's still holding you tightly.

Of course, your brain registers this a secondary information, because you quickly take notice of two familiar pokemon staring upwards from down below.

With a bit of an effort, you free your arms from Mesprit's hug, and you rub your eyes, before opening them.
"Vaporeon? Lucario?" you call out.

Apparently, you guessed right.
"We need to talk. Again." comes Lucario's grumbly voice.
"Vaa. On." cries the sweeter one belonging to Vaporeon.

You sigh, not quite wanting to leave the warm embrace of Mesprit again. But, regarding what you learned earlier, you decide that you might as well listen to them. It might be something worth your well-desired sleep.

So, you slowly and silently free yourself from Mesprit's paws and slide down her body, landing right in front of the two waiting pokemon.

Lucario slowly looks upwards, maybe checking if Mesprit woke up, before his gaze returns on you.
"We heard everything, you know," he whispers.
"You don't want to leave anymore." you mutter some incomprehensible words in response, annoyed by the fact that the two have been watching your reconciliation with the three.
Especially the moment when they started kissing you.

You notice Vaporeon staring up at you with an indecipherable expression. Something between fear and irritation. Sadness as well, maybe? You understand the first two emotions, but why would she be sad?

"They promised me that they'll try to control themselves." you reply.
"But I don't think we should talk about this. Not here," you say, pointing to the entrance of the cave.

Both pokemon look at each other, exchanging nods, before starting to walk towards the exit, you following close.

You take one step outside of the cave, noticing that your previous wish was granted: dawn finally came, weakly enlightening the sky.

You abruptly stop walking, reluctant to leave. If by any chance one of the three wakes up and notices you're no longer in there with them? What would happen then? Would they believe that you lied to them and ran away?

Would they believe that you betrayed them?

Your train of thought is interrupted by yourself being pulled forward.

You notice Lucario and Vaporeon pulling both your jacket and your pants, one with his paws, the other with her mouth.
"Let's go human!" Lucario grumbles, letting go of you as he noticed your comeback to reality.

You nod as you hurry to follow the two in direction of the forest...
13433121111121212112121121212211221.title: Reconciled with the guardians of the lakes

choices: "Alright! Fine! Do as you wish!" he shouts, starting to walk away
"Last warning. Leave, or you'll be forced to!" he shouts menacingly
134331211111212121121211212122112211.content:
