Silently, you follow the two pokemon, who are walking in front of you, leading the way to the now quiet forest, which was being crossed by three giant, agitated sisters not even two hours ago.

"Let's hurry. I don't want those three to find that I'm missing again." you whisper to Lucario.

The blue, bipedal pokemon looks back at you briefly. He doesn't reply, but his crimson eyes stare right into yours with stern.

Then, he turns around again, and resumes walking.

None of you talks for the rest of the trip, until you stop in front of the entrance of a small cave, in which point Lucario says two simple words.
"Get inside." he points to the inside of the cavern.

Still without saying a word of protest, you walk inside, Lucario and Vaporeon soon following. Weirdly, Vaporeon hasn't even made a noise since you reconciled with the three sisters.

You can't help but wonder what's up with her.

You walk in the middle of the cave and look straight at Lucario, digging your hands in the your pockets.
"Well? What is so important to cost me my sleep?" you ask defiantly.

Lucario stares at you, that stern look not leaving his face.
"You know it, human." he says after a few moments of silence.

Obviously, you know what he is talking about.
"Lucario," you start.
"I confronted Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie. If you were watching the scene, you most probably saw them crying. They were sorry, Lucario. Sorry about what they did. That's why I'm not going to leave." Lucario snorts.
"Let me guess, you believed, and still believe, that their tears were of sincere sadness and regret?" he asks you.

"Should I believe otherwise?" you ask.
"You should. Even if they were lucid for a moment, they're still in heat. They might go crazy at any moment, do you realize this?" the blue jackal asks, exasperated by the events of the night.
"They promised they won't hurt me... or anyone else." you retort.

Lucario grins sinisterly.
"Right. You just listen to whatever comes out of their mouths, don't you? You really think they won't become crazed with lust again? That they won't go on a rampage, ending innocent lives, yours included?" he asks, now assuming a serious expression.

"... that's a chance..." you admit.
"Va-poreon." Vaporeon suddenly cries. You look at Lucario.
"Vapid is still willing to escort you to safety while you still can," he translates.

You start to get annoyed.
"Didn't you hear me? I'm not leaving." you state firmly.
"I trust those three sisters, alright?" Lucario looks at Vaporeon.

Both exchange incomprehensible cries.
"You trust them? Really? Or maybe, since they... did it with you, you think you can get more?" Lucario then asks.

You flush red. How could these two think about something like that right now?
"What - no! I didn't even want to do it in the first place!" you try to defend yourself.

Both pokemon exchange more unknown words.
"And a plead and a few tears were enough to convince you?" Lucario then asks sarcastically.

That question of his means two things. One, he's using the sister's earlier actions against you; two... they've been spying on you after Vaporeon left!

"That's none of your business." you reply bluntly.

Lucario starts walking around you slowly, seeming to be thinking. About what to say next.
"Look, you don't understand. You need to leave. Not just for your own sake, but for ours as well." he says, trying to sound calm, but having little success in hiding the exasperation in his grumbly voice. He must be trying to reason with you.

You look at Vaporeon, who nods her head, agreeing with the words of Lucario.

But you stand your ground.
"Lucario, it is you that don't understand," you say, trying to use a calm voice as well.
"I have no intention of leaving. I trust them. You didn't want to shatter their hearts by telling them the truth, I don't want to shatter their hearts by leaving." Lucario's paw slams against his forehead as he cries his name frustratedly.

Vaporeon repeats her name twice, her gaze locked on Lucario.
"I know this is serious. This human is stubborn, I can't do anything about it. Go ahead, try to convince him." he replies as if you weren't there.

Vaporeon walks towards you and stands on her hind legs, her forepaws leaning against your legs.
"Vaa-on," she cries.

You look at Lucario, obviously not understanding, but the bipedal pokemon turns his heads away. Sighing, you look back at the water type.

She cries her name twice, and points first to herself, then to you, before pointing to the entrance of the cave.

Then, she briefly pulls back. Her tail supports her body as she closes her forepaws together, as if begging you.
"Uhh..." you reply like a Slowpoke who just noticed that its tail was bitten by a Shellder.

Vaporeon repeats her moves a couple more time before you finally understand the meaning of her words.
"... you're saying that we should just go, right now?" you ask.

The quadruped water type nods, returning on all fours, her tail springing back up. It's now your turn to face palm.
"Look, I can't - and I don't want - to leave. I grew attached to those three sisters. And I believe they did as well," your explain.

At this point, Lucario decides to talk again.
"They didn't! They're just crazed with lust! Will you ever understand that?" he shouts, no longer containing himself.
"And who are you to say that?" you ask with a frosty voice, staring daggers at him.

He lets a out a loud growl after hearing your words.
"Look," he says, taking a step forward.
"You." he takes another.
"Need." he stops inches from you.
"To leave." he finishes, threateningly leaning forward, his muzzle now close to your face.

You pull yourself back.
"And if I don't want to?" you stubbornly ask.

He looks at Vaporeon, and says something in poke-speech. Vaporeon suddenly seems alarmed, and cries her name while frenetically shaking her head.

Lucario shouts his name louder. The water type shakes her head, and backs away looking afraid.

Lucario looks back at you, now looking stressed. You suddenly understand why Vaporeon looks scared.

His crimson eyes locks on your form as he opens his mouth to speak again...
134331211111212121121211212122112211.title: A heated argument

choices: Uxie needs help with her Lake
1343312111112121211212112121221122111.content:
"Alright, fine! I don't care anymore!" Lucario shouts loudly, his voice echoing around inside the cavern.
"Do whatever you wish! Go back to those sisters, stay with them! But don't you blame me when they'll start using you as a plaything!" with this last remark, Lucario turns his back to you and hurries to the exit of the cave, soon disappearing outside, leaving a scared Vaporeon and a dumbfounded you behind, both staring at the point where the blue jackal was not even a minute ago.

Eventually, Vaporeon looks at you with that pleading expression of hers. She seems to be saying: 'Please, listen to us'.

Slowly, you lower yourself to pick her up. She lets you.
"I can't leave. I'm sorry, trust me, but I simply can't." you start petting her lightly.
"Vap..." she cries softly, assuming a resigned expression.

You gently let her back down.
"I must be leaving now. If those three find that I'm missing again, they'll think I betrayed them. I need to get back to the cave." you mumble.
"On!" the water type exclaims, using her paw to point first to you, then to herself, and in the end to the exit.
"You... want to escort me?" you ask.

Surprisingly, she nods. You figure it makes sense. After Lucario's outburst, it is highly probable that someone from the crowd of pokemon from earlier heard you out there. Maybe Vaporeon wants to help you avoid unwanted surprises.

So, slowly, you follow her to the cold outside world.

--

Vaporeon leads you through the forest. It was dawning when you left the cave for the second time; now, the sun rose some more. Most of the pokemon that occupied the trees and the bushes - probably keeping an eye out for you - are gone, while others, you notice, are just starting to stretch under the warm rays of the sun. All while a certain trio is still is still in the land of dreams, still inside the cave you're being led to.

You can't help but think again about Lucario's words, but you quickly shake the thought off. Those three sisters swore that they will never hurt you. And you firmly believe that they wouldn't do something like that.

Not the playful, loving Mesprit.

Not the shy, sweet Uxie.

Not the nice, (mostly) gentle Azelf.

Completely lost in your thoughts, you soon get to the cave completely unharmed. Returning to reality with Vaporeon's cry, you look down at her, noticing that she's staring right back at you.
"Thanks," you mutter, leaning forward to pet her head. The quadruped water type barks happily.
"So, er... see you later." you say.

Vaporeon looks at you, somewhat dejectedly, before nodding her head, starting to trot off. Soon, she is concealed from your sight by the thick vegetation.

You give a deep sigh. Which is followed by a loud yawn.

Right.

You didn't get too much sleep tonight. You really can't wait to shut your eyes close for a few hours at least.

Letting out another couple of yawns, you enter the cave, soon finding the trio giantesses still sleeping there on the floor, three pairs of tails are laying around.

Quietly, you walk over Mesprit. Much to your luck, one of her arms is laying on the floor, while the other is still on her chest, right where you were earlier.

Sighing, you start climbing up her arm, managing to get to her ample chest only after twenty minutes. Tired out, you lay down on the furry surface.

Mesprit seems to feel you in her sleep, as she starts to moves her arms, then she closes both paws around you, embracing your whole being.

You blush, but you really can't deny that, as much as it is embarrassing, this is one comfy way to sleep.

You close your eyes, and try to empty your mind from all the not-so-good adventures of tonight. And it seems to work, as you soon start to feel drowsy.

And, in just a few minutes, darkness claims you, and you follow it without complaining.

--

"Wake up, cutie!" a loud, cheerful voice drags you back to reality from dreamland.

Not quite willing to leave the embrace of sleep yet, you bury your head as deep as you can into your pillow.
"Aw, isn't this just cute?" a second, but as well cheerful voice chimes, tugging you back to your senses again.

Bothered, your brain forces your eyelids to part as you take your first look around, discovering yourself staring at a wall of blue fur.

Memories of yesterday come to you as you feel something gently poking your head a few times.

Sighing softly, you gaze up, discovering, as expected, two pairs of golden eyes, while a third pair is hidden by two yellow eyelids. You notice Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie with smiles on their faces. Although Azelf's seems... unconvinced for some reason. Plus, you also take notice that Mesprit is the one currently holding you.

"Hello." you mumble. Uxie is the first to talk:
"About the time you woke up, dear. Good morning." she says politely.
"Some sleepyhead you are!" Mesprit chimes, giggling.

You smile a little, and turn your head to Azelf. Her gaze locks with yours. A faint, red shade covers her cheeks as she quickly looks away, while starting to float towards the cave entrance.

Her sisters don't seem to notice her weird behavior, though, as they follow her outside and into the warm sunlight. You notice that the sun fully rose up in the skies, enlightening Acuity Lake and the area surrounding it.

Mesprit gently lets you down on the grass.
"Magnificent day, isn't it?" Uxie states, stretching.
"Hey, little one, would you like to help me around here again?" she then asks you, smiling.

You don't reply as, again, you notice Azelf acting weird, floating apart, keeping her back to you and her sisters.

Determined to find out what's wrong with her, you make your way towards the blue giantess, earning a curious look from Mesprit, and a concerned one from Uxie.

"Azelf?" you call as you reach her.
"Hm?" she looks down at you.
"Oh... ehm... you..." she mutters shyly, bringing her paw down in front of you.

You hop on as she brings it, and you along, back up to her face.
"Azelf, can we talk in private for a moment?" you ask.

The titaness looks at you curiously, before...

‘Sure thing.’ you flinch as her voice suddenly sounds in your head.

You quickly recover yourself.
‘Alright, what's up with you? You're acting weird.’ you cut short.
‘Me? I'm fine.’ she replies.
‘Do not lie. I only want to help you,’ you say.

She sighs.
‘I can't... not after last night... you would never...’ she stops in mid sentence.

Your mind puts two and two together.
"Azelf... your heat..." you say. She gives a sad, heart-melting smile and nods her head.

You mentally slap yourself. How? How could you forget about it after all the events of this night?!

You're about to reply, but Uxie suddenly hovers closer to her blue headed sister.
"Are you alright, you two?" she asks.
"Yes." both you and Azelf reply at once.

Uxie offers a small sigh of relief, then a smile.
"Then, would you like to help me again, human? I actually enjoyed having some company during this kind of things," she says. All while Mesprit, you notice, watches the scene with an intrigued expression.

You pay her no attention, and look first to Azelf, then to Uxie. If the yellow headed pixie just asked you to help her again, why refuse? After all, you enjoyed, and enjoy, her company as well.

But another, smaller part of you also wants to help Azelf out. In a way or another, you're going to spend more time with one sister than with the other.

The only difference is that Azelf has another conception of 'help' right now. You remember her words ‘You would never...’.
Accept? Agree? Does she think you were offended last night?

You look at both sisters, discovering Azelf's cheeks red once again, and Uxie with an expectant expression. They clearly want you to say something.

After what seems an infinite amount of time, with a deep sigh, you make your decision...
1343312111112121211212112121221122111.title: Back with the Three

1343312111112121211212112121221122112.content:
Your gaze locks with Lucario's. He stares at you for a whole minute, negative feelings flowing between the two of you like electricity.

But then, he gives an exasperated sigh.
"You don't understand. You refuse to face the reality. Those three legendaries are a threat. They can't control themselves. Say, what do you think will happen once you're... out of use?" he asks, his grumbly voice filled with ice.

You don't respond, not even wanting to think about such occurrence.

Lucario tells you anyway:
"They'll just throw your dead body somewhere and they'll come get us!" he grumbles.

You shudder.
‘T-Those three are really a threat after all...?’ you ask yourself. An internal conflict goes on inside you for a few minutes, before you shake your head while shouting out loud:
"No, they're not!" Lucario and Vaporeon flinch.

You turn to the two of them.
"I will repeat myself, they're the sweetest creatures ever. Didn't you see them crying earlier? I honestly regret telling them what they did," you admit.
"Yeah, we saw them crying. And you fell for it. You humans are-"
"You're wrong!" you interrupt.
"They're not a threat. They're not! And for Arceus' sake, I will NOT leave!" you shout.

The bipedal pokemon remains silent. You continue.
"All you're doing is blabbering about how dangerous Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie are, and how stupid we humans are. But will you know what? I may be stupid, but those three sisters aren't dangerous! And, if you don't comprehend the sincerity of their tears, well, the only idiot here is you!" you shout.

That said, you look at him. You wish you hadn't. His fists are closed as well as his eyes, while his sharp teeth are gritted. A dark aura seems to surround him. And you need no Uxie or Mesprit to realize that he's getting angry.

"Is that so?" he asks, his voice even colder than before. You notice Vaporeon backing away, even more scared.

The jackal's eyes open up again as he stares daggers into you. You, however, remain still.
"Last warning human," he grumbles.
"Leave, or you'll be forced to!" he literally roars.

At this point, Vaporeon runs in between you and Lucario, starting to bark at him.
"There is no other choice! This human... must leave...!" Lucario exclaims.
"You don't need to force him! The choice is up to him!" Vaporeon barks.
"No, it isn't! We can't risk!" Lucario howls in poke-speech.

You watch as the argument goes on between the two pokemon. Every once in awhile, they would turn to you, Lucario staring at you coldly, while Vaporeon throws quick, pleading looks.

"We can't force him to leave! Those three would hunt us down!" Vaporeon barks, starting to get pissed.
"And what do you think we should do? This human is stubborn! He just won't understand!" Lucario snaps back at her.
"But... maybe he's right. Maybe the legendaries were truly sorry." Vaporeon tries to reason with him.

You see the jackal giving a deep sigh, growing more and more angry the more the argument continues. Even though you're not understanding a word, you definitively understood what the two are arguing about.
"We both know they weren't! It was only lust!" Lucario growls.

"Urgh, the human was right. Why can't you simply accept this possibility? Give them a chance!" Vaporeon barks.
"Shut up!" her ears twitch with irritation at the last two words, pronounced in an imperative tone.
"Lucario, I don't want to beat sense into you, but I will if you keep this up," Vaporeon says, wagging her tail for good measure.

In response, the blue and black jackal closes his forepaws together, a blue sphere of energy forming in between them. Growling, Vaporeon opens her mouth, frosty air taking the shape of an azure ball.

You watch the scene with disbelief. They don't mean to start a fight right then and there, do they?!
"Uhm, guys, le-let's calm down..." you stammer.

They completely ignore you, too busy staring daggers at each other.
"Come on, weren't you friends?" you try, attempting to convince them to stop.

In response to your words, Lucario throws the aura sphere at Vaporeon, who releases her blizzard attack in the meantime.

Both attacks collide, creating a literal wall of smoke.

And Lucario sees his chance.

Swiftly, he runs up to Vaporeon, and places a paw on her head.
"I'm sorry." he mumbles, before releasing a force palm attack. The effect is instantaneous.

Vaporeon falls flat on the ground, unconscious.

Lucario stares at her for a couple seconds, before turning to you.
"This is... all your fault. None of this would've happened if you just agreed to leave." he growls at you.
"My fault? You're the one trying to force me to leave! You're the one that started the fight! How is this my fault?" since he's acting hosting towards you, you decide that you might as well stop being nice with words.

"It is! Now," he crafts yet another aura sphere.
"Are you going to leave by yourself? Or do I need to knock you out and drag you away?" he asks sternly.

You take a step back, startled. You know about Lucario that they're formidable fighters. It wouldn't be a wise choice to try and fight him yourself. But, obviously, you're still unwilling to leave.

Your best option seems running back to the cave, back to the three sisters. Lucario wouldn't dare to mess with you around them, would he?

But, on the other hand, you don't want to worry them. And, especially, you don't want Uxie misunderstand the residents of her lake.

You could also try to fight Lucario yourself. But something tells you that it wouldn't end too good...

The jackal keeps staring at you with that cold stare, and with his aura sphere still floating in between his paws. Whatever he will do now depends on what you decide to do.

And knowing that leaving isn't an option - at least, it no longer is - you're pretty sure that he will throw that sphere at you as soon as you run off or you try to attack.

You take a few minutes to decide yourself, but, in the end, you make your decision...
1343312111112121211212112121221122112.title: Looming threat

choices: Mesprit and Uxie wake up as well
Azelf needs to talk to you. In private...
13433121111121212112121121212211221122.content:
The tension growing between you and Lucario, you hastily opt for the safest choice and run like hell.

As you predicted, Lucario throws the ball of concentrated energy right at you.

You leap out of the way, the aura sphere exploding a few steps behind you. And, wasting no more time, you hurry to the cave exit and into the forest, which is enlightened by the sun's first rays, leaving back an unconscious Vaporeon and an angered Lucario, who, realizing what your plans are, emits a loud roar and quickly chases after you.

"Get back here human!" you hear him growl. Another explosion roars next to you, suggesting that another aura sphere just missed you.

Adrenaline pumping in your veins along with blood, you start running even faster. The jackal, however, keeps up and follows you, his mind continuosly reminding him of his purpose: you mustn't reach the legendaries.

At one point, you slow down. You didn't mean to, but your own body is now reacting to your sudden run; first, you start panting. Then, sweat starts pouring down your face. And, in the end, you start slowing down.

You quickly glance backwards. Lucario doesn't seem to be feeling your tiredness and, although visibly labored by his chase, he's still behind you. And he's catching up...

And then, it happens.

You stumble and fall down. Before you can even conceive of getting up, the pokemon is on you.

Your head is forced down by one of his knees, while your arms are held still by his paws. It's like he's a cop who just managed to catch a common thief.
"Now," he grumbles.
"You will be leaving, wether you want it or not." he removes his hind leg from your head and, placing back on the ground, he starts dragging you.

Out of remaining energy, you let him. It's over. He'll just drag you out of Lake Acuity and to the nearest city before leaving.

And then, when you're about to fully give up, a thought crosses your mind.

Them.

Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie. Their faces briefly flash in your mind. They have tears in their eyes.

A newfound strength, you start to struggle. Surprised by your sudden activity, Lucario softens his grip, and you break free.

Then, as he tries to get a hold of you again, you grab him by the spike on his chest and you push him into a tree.

Without giving him time to recover, you start running again. In a matter of moments, you hear him growl as he, once again, starts to chase you...

--

Fortunately, you manage to catch a glimpse of a familiar cave. And your heart beats faster as you notice the silhouette of a blue giant pokemon. Or, more specifically, a giantess. With a cyan, star shaped head, golden eyes and a red gem on her forehead.

Azelf is standing - or rather floating - out of the cave. Apparently, she just woke up and maybe, not wanting to wake her sisters as well, she made her way out of the cavern.

"Azelf!" you cry out.

The pokemon giantess drowsily eyes you, having heard your voice.

But her drowsy stare shifts into a frown as she spots the blue jackal chasing you.

In a moment, both her tails dart forward, separating you from your chaser.

Without giving him time to realize the situation, Azelf leans forward as she sternly apostrophes him:
"Hey! No messing around!" she exclaims to a now scared looking Lucario.
"And especially, no messing with this human! Or-" he dashes backwards, soon concealed by the vegetation.

Azelf stares at the spot where he was for one more second, before turning to you with a smile.
"Good morning, you." she says.

--

"Thank you, Azelf," you thank her as she nuzzles you.
"After what I did last night? Don't even say that. I'm still ashamed of my actions. I still owe you." she says with a small smile.
"After this, you're totally forgiven," you say.
"Sweet talker." she replies with a giggle.

Then, her smile is replaced by a serious expression.
"Now, any reason of why...?" she asks with concern.
"Don't mind it. I... just let it slide." you say.

Respecting your wishes, she nods her head.
"I imagine that my sister don't have to know about this?" she asks with a smile.

You smile right back.
13433121111121212112121121212211221122.title: The chase

choices: Trust them, return to sleep. Maybe they were honest after all.
The risk is too great! Break free and run away while they sleep!
13433121111121212112121121212212.content:
You just watch with horror as Azelf floats towards the entrance of the cave, you held in a solid grasp.

But, just like you, the giantess abruptly stops. Not because someone took her will away like she did with you. But because a voice suddenly echoes inside the cave.
"Urgh... what's the yelling about?" the voice, that you recognize as Mesprit's, talks.

Azelf turns around, noticing her sister rubbing her left eye with a paw. But the other, open eye fixes straight on you.

Mesprit's gaze travels down on her chest, as she makes completely sure you aren't there.

She removes her paw from her eye, opens it up and glares daggers at Azelf.
"Azelf. Give. Him. Back." she holds out a paw to empathize her words.

Even though the situation, you can't help but smile. As you hoped, Mesprit is once again acting jealous.

But the blue giantess grasps you more tightly.
"Come on, Mesprit. Can't I have some fun as well? You more than anyone else should know how I'm feeling!" she whines.

Mesprit shakes her head.
"That doesn't allow you to steal the little one from me while I sleep!" she exclaims.
"I didn't 'steal' him! He woke me up!" Azelf retorts.

Mesprit shots her an inquisitive gaze. Azelf continues.
"Yeah, and he told me a few interesting things. Right?" she asks, now looking down at you.

Mesprit's gaze also fixes on you.
"What... what did he talk about, sister?" Mesprit asks.
"Try asking him yourself." is her reply.

Much to your relief, she sets you down on the rocky floor of the cave.
"What 'interesting things' is she talking about, little one? Why did you slip away from me?" Mesprit asks you with a somewhat annoyed voice.

You hesitate. Can you really confront both of them?
"Come on, you. You can tell me if something is wrong." she says, giving a sympathetic smile.

You sigh deeply.
"Mesprit... I didn't leave you. I was awakened by... someone... they told me something about you three. That you lose control during the heat season. That you go on a rampage because of it," much like Azelf, Mesprit's mouth shuts open.

"They told me that..." you voluntarily stop, not wanting to think about the three of them using your corpse for such purposes.

"That's... ridiculous! Who did tell you all this li-" you frustratedly interrupt her.
"Don't you lie to me, Mesprit! Azelf here just proved me that it was the truth!" you shout.
"Me? I did nothing!" she exclaims indignantly.
"You just tried having me as well! Without my consent!" you retort, quickly remembering Lucario's words, 'The next time, you won't get a say in the matter.’ you realize that, again, he was being truthful...

You shift your attention back on Mesprit, who is now visibly surprised.
"Tell me the truth, Mesprit. Please!" you plead.

The giantess sighs.
"Alright, we may have crossed the line a little bit sometimes. But-" you interrupt again.
"A little bit? A Snover died, Mesprit! Died! It ceased existing!" you yell, anger mixing to fear. Emotions that Mesprit seems to detect as she looks even more surprised.

Azelf stares at the scene with an ashamed look.

"This is no game. I could seriously lose my own life here..." you say, calming down a bit.

You look at both giantesses, who are staring at you in complete silence, clearly not finding anything to say. So, you choose to continue.
"Mesprit, you said you really liked me, right?" the pink headed titaness nods down at you.
"Then, if you really do, just let me go. I don't want to risk and-" she rises her paw, interrupting you.

"I don't think that's possible. Not anymore." she says slowly.
"What?" you ask. You look back at Azelf, who is eyeing her sister with a surprised expression.

"I... we can't let you go. I... I... oh, what the..." you suddenly are lifted up by a strong psychic force.

You're brought up in the giantess' paws, and pushed into her lips right after.

You can feel your fave burning as you get what she was trying to say, ‘I love you’.

The titaness pulls off.
"Uxie feels the same way I do, I can feel it." she says, closing you in a hug.
"You aren't like the others. We really care about you.
We sincerely love you. Trust me, trust us. We're not going to hurt you..." she speaks very softly.

You try to talk, but no sound comes out of your mouth as another thousands of doubts starts raging in your mind, like the blizzard Uxie rescued you from.

Is she laying again? She seems to be pretty lucid right now... but maybe she's just saying it to convince you to stay.

You look at Azelf, trying to find some kind of confirm. She looks right back at you.
"Trust us. We aren't going to let you get hurt. We won't let you die." she says, floating closer.

Then, seeing as you don't say anything, Mesprit talks again:
"Come on. Let's forget all of this. Let's... let's just return to sleep, alright? Let's sleep on it." she says, looking straight down at you with that sickeningly cute smile of hers.

And you catch yourself reluctantly nodding. Why?

The two giantesses smile. Mesprit lays down again, keeping you still in her solid hug. Azelf takes her original place beside her sister. You can't believe Uxie didn't actually wake up from all the shouting you and the two have been doing.

"Sleep tight, little one," Mesprit says, pecking your head.
"Sweet dreams." Azelf adds. In the darkness, you can feel a second pair of lips smooching your left cheek. You sigh.

Shortly after, the two are asleep again. Good.

You can finally think now.

You don't know how to feel. The two seemed sincere when they said they wouldn't hurt you, but you know to not trust the appearances.

They were maybe simply trying to trick you into staying. And they admitted that they really went on a rampage. That only raises your fear of them.

But... what if they were being truthful? If they were, have your really got the courage to shatter their hearts by running away?

Your body is now acting as a battlefield for two factions: your mind, that tells you to not trust them, to slip your way out of Mesprit's arms and run while they are asleep, and your heart, that tells that you might as well trust them after all.

The 'battle' inside of you goes on for a while, and you can't really take a decision. You're really tempted to give up and get sleeping, but you know you can't. Not before having taken a decision.

It feels like hours when your internal conflict finally dies down. And you finally make your choice...
13433121111121212112121121212212.title: The truth revealed

choices: Uxie notices you leaving and stops you
You manage to slip away before she sees you
1343312111112121211212112121222.content:
You stand there, dumbfounded, for a while. You don't know what to think. Did Lucario speak the truth? Did Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie really go on a rampage? Or did they not? The whole story of them going on a rampage seems just unbelievable... and yet, those pokemon, their scared or angry expressions, Lucario's words... For some reason, you are tempted to believe it.

But on the other hand, your mind refuses to believe it. Those three sisters, they've been the nicest creatures you ever met so far. And plus, Mesprit and Uxie wanted you to 'fix' them.

But that's where the apparently problem is. According to Lucario's words, once those three wake up, they won't ask for an opinion. They'll just use and abuse you.

Again, you try to deny it. But the more you think about it, the more your mind tells you that their problems will become your last problems.

And you come to the point when you realize that just standing there won't solve this dire situation you've gotten into.

So, absentmindedly, you move a step. Then another. And another, until you start walking aimlessly through the woods.

You need to think.

--

You keep walking, only three questions currently occupying your mind.

Leave or not leave?

Risk or not risk?

Trust those three or not?

You feel dazed, scared, sad; you really don't want to leave the trio, but you also really want to live. Lost in your mind, you suddenly notice that you've arrived to the lake shore, the limpid water reflecting the moonlight. In other circumstances, this would have been a magnificent sight. But in this situation, you can't care less about it.

For a second, you ponder about the chance of getting discovered by one of the three sisters. But you quickly shake the thought off. The cave where they are - and where you were earlier - isn't too near the Lake. And then again, you're not doing anything bad.

You stare at your own reflection into the Lake, still overthinking about your situation. By now, your thoughts are reduced to just two words: 'Stay' and 'Leave'. You keep mentally repeating these two words for a while, trying to make the best choice.

And, although you do really like Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie... in the end, your reason ends your internal conflict.

You decide to leave.

For your own sake, and for the sake of the Lake's inhabitants.

So, sticking to your decision, you turn your back to the waters of Lake Acuity and start walking away, into the depths of the forest, planning to get out of it and get to the nearest town by morning.

But you abruptly halt as you remember about something.

Your bag is still inside the cavern where the sleeping sisters are... at least, you hope they're asleep.

Anyway, you need your bag. True, your food was stolen by certain mischievous dark-ice types you don't want to think about. But it is also true that you have money in there.

And, as much as you want to leave, you know that you must sneak inside, grab your bag and leave. It actually sounds pretty easy. But you know far too well that things never are too easy. If by any chance one of the sisters wakes up, your chances of leaving are done.

"So? Made up your mind?" a voice suddenly asks, startling you.

You hastily turn back. Only to spot a familiar duo staring at you in darkness. A quadruped, blue pokemon with a fin-like tail and a bipedal, blue and black jackal with red eyes.

The Lucario from earlier and the Vaporeon you saw twice already.

You lower your head, and take a deep breath before answering:
"Yes. I'm going to leave," you say.
"Vaa!" the Vaporeon cries with a small smile, seemingly grateful. Grateful, maybe, for your choice.

You, however, continue:
"But, I need my bag first. I cannot leave without that." you state.
"A bag? Why would you risk your life for a bag? You do know, right, that if the legendaries wake up..." you unceremoniously interrupt him.
"I know. But I need that bag. There's something important inside." you explain.

Lucario nods his head.
"Alright. Go get it, but be quick. Me and Vapid will bring to the nearest... city, as you call it." he says. You nod in understanding, and start walking in direction of the cavern where the dreaded trio is.

--

You shudder as you take your first step inside of the cave. The snoring of the three sisters can be heard in distance.

Slowly, you venture deeper inside until you finally come to a halt. In front of you are the gigantic silhouettes of Uxie, Azelf and Mesprit, laying beside each other, all three of them fast asleep, their tails occasionally shifting position as they sleep.

And, laying in the deepest and darkest corner of the cave, the object of your desires: your bag.

You tiptoe towards it, holding your breath, afraid that even the slightest noise would awaken one of the three - or worse, all three.

Slowly, you walk over your bag, gently lift it up and put it on. Then, silently, you tiptoe backwards, back in front of the three sisters.

Only then you stop for a moment, a couple tears forming in your eyes. You never were exactly the best with good-byes.
"Goodbye, girls. Goodbye." you whisper, shedding your tears and walking to the exit.

Unfortunately, as you walk away, one of the gigantic, identical tails happens to move right in front of you. And, noticing it on the very last second, you end up stumbling, and as a consequence, falling face down on the wide surface of the tail.

You get back up and, not caring whose this tail is, you hurry towards the exit, unaware of two things.

One, the tail your tripped over belongs to Uxie; two, when you fell on it, the yellow headed pixie actually felt it and woke up.

Slowly, the giantess turns her head in your direction. True, she never opens her eyes. But, thanks to her psychic powers, she can make out the position of things and living beings just as perfectly as if she had them open.

But, tired as she is, she doesn't exactly focus too much on you, halfway from the outside world.

The only question now is, does the giantess see you? Or do you manage to slip away in time?
1343312111112121211212112121222.title: A hard, painful decision

choices: Tell Uxie about her heat problem
13433121111121212112121121212221.content:
"Little one?"

You freeze up as Uxie's voice echoes in the darkness of the cave. The titaness speaks again:
"Where are you going? In the middle of the night?" she asks, yawning.

You hesitate to answer. How can you tell her you're leaving?

"Um, just going for a walk. I kinda..." you don't find any excuse that might cover you.
"Going for a walk? In the middle of the night? And why do you have your bag then?" she inquires.
"Uhh..." you hear a muffled noise that interpret as a stifled sigh.
"Come here, please," Uxie says, now wide awake.

Reluctantly, you as told and walk over her gigantic, yellow face. Even if her eyes are closed as always, you can feel all the weight of her gaze, which seems to scan your very soul.
"Good. Now, what were you actually doing?" the titaness asks again.
"Me?... Uh, nothing?" you try.
"Please, do not lie to me. I only care for your well being, so I need you to answer truthfully," she says with a concerned tone, before asking again:
"What were you doing?" you ponder answering, but you decide against it and remain silent.

Silence falls between the two of you, interrupted just by the regular snoring of Azelf and Mesprit. Until you notice Uxie moving as she slowly gets up, looming over your comparatively tiny body.

She then moves a paw in front of you.
"I guess that me and you need to talk." she states. You swallow, and reluctantly climb onto her paw, which she brings upwards as she silently hovers out of the cave.

--

"There. Now we can talk without bothering anyone," Uxie speaks as she sits down in front of Lake Acuity, while holding you in front of her face.
"Now, please, answer to my question. What were you exactly doing?" she speaks with a soft voice, as if preparing herself for the worst.

Again, you hesitate.

And Uxie decides to try with a different approach.

You find her retracting her paws, and you along, to her chest, pulling you in an embrace.

You remain silent, taken aback by the sudden display of affection. Uxie smiles as she speaks.
"Listen, it's perfectly fine if you don't want to talk. But if something is tormenting you, I beg you to tell me. I just want to help you." she says with a sickeningly sweet voice.

Her availability for you only makes you feel worse. She's asking you about your problems, without possibly knowing the she is the problem.

She and her sisters.

But have you got the heart to tell her that? No, you haven't. Just like the inhabitants of the Lake.

Your train of thought is interrupted by the sound of Uxie's voice:
"Come on... whatever you need to say, just tell me.
I promise it'll remain between us. I won't tell anybody." she says, not releasing you from her hug.

"Uxie, I-I... I simply can't. Please..." you plead. But the pixie doesn't let it go.
"Yes you can. Just tell me what's up with you. You'll feel better if you talk about it. Look, there's no one but me and you. Nobody else will know what you'll say. And I promise that I won't be upset. So, please, speak up." she demands, not dropping that somewhat reassuring smile of hers.

You give a deep sigh, before opening your mouth to speak. But no sound comes out of it.
"Come on." Uxie encourages you.

You sigh again.
"Uxie... I wasn't actually... I wasn't going for a walk," you admit. She smiles.
"I think I figured that out," she places a paw over her mouth as she giggles. You flush red.
"Anyway... I was..." you stop, trying to say it.
"You were...?"

You force the words out of yourself:
"... I was going... I was leaving..." you say, imagining her reaction.

Which almost matches your thought.

The yellow headed giantess drops her smile, and frowns.
"Leaving?" she parrots back, seemingly confused.

‘Why would the human want to leave?’ is the only thought she can formulate.

You nod timidly.
"B-But... why?" Uxie stammers, breaking her hug and bringing you in front of her face once again.

You ponder an answer, but you don't come up with any, aside from 'You're too dangerous'.

"Come on, now I need to know. Please, go on," she says, suddenly saddened. And you can't really blame her as you were pretty saddened by your decision as well.

"B-Because... Y-You..." you stammer, but stop in mid sentence.
"What? Did we do something wrong?... Did I do something wrong?" she inquires.
"What - no! No no no, not at all. You and your sisters have been the sweetest living beings I ever met. Just..." again, you interrupt yourself.
"‘Just’ what?" the titaness asks, before shyly adding:
"Was I... unsatisfying?" she asks, her face going from yellow to bright red the instant those words leave her mouth.

You blush as well.
"No, Uxie, it isn't about that... it's just..." you say, earning curious look from the giantess.

You take a deep breath, trying to decide if to tell her what happened earlier - and most probably shatter her heart - or not say anything.

Ultimately, you take your decision...
13433121111121212112121121212221.title: Confronting Uxie

134331211111212121121211212122212.content:
"I-It's just... I c-can't..." you say, deciding to not tell her about what she and her sisters apparently did during the heat season.

Uxie makes one last attempt to try and make you talk:
"Please... tell me..." she begs, a couple tears falling down her face from her closed eyes.

But you shake your head.
"I'm sorry... I can't tell you... I... simply can't say it. You would hate me." you say.
"I would never hate you. Why would I hate you anyway? J-Just tell me what happened!" she stammers.

You shake your head.
"I'm sorry, Uxie. Just believe in my reasons." you say firmly, fighting back tears.
"Now, please, just let me down and I'll be on my way." you add.

The giantess sniffles, and uses her free paw to wipe her tears away.
"Very well. I'll assume that you have no reason to leave then. And I'm sorry, but I c-cannot let you leave. I can't and I don't want to. Trust me, in other circumstances I would have let you go the moment you said it, but you are just too... precious for me to let you go." she says, trying to sound firm. But her shaky voice betrays her.

You however flinch at her words.
"Wait... what's that supposed to mean?" you ask, suddenly starting to fear.
"It means that I must insist, dear little one. Y-You have to stay," she stammers, obliviously not used to giving orders.

"Uxie... don't do anything you might regret. Trust me, I'm going to hate myself for doing it, but I need to," you say, trying to convince her to let you go.

Silence follows your statement.

Theme the giantess speaks again.
"Just a moment..." her eyelids part as she speaks, revealing two golden eyes, still damp with tears.

Remembering about her power to wipe away the memories of those who look into her eyes, you hurry to close your eyes, covering them with your hands for good measure.

"Uxie! You-" she interrupts you.
"Whatever reason you might have to leave, I don't know. But if you forget it, then we can b-be happy again," Uxie speaks up with a reassuringly sweet voice.
"Just look into my eyes, alright? I promise you'll be fine. You won't forget nothing but the past few hours," she tries to convince you

The past few hours... you would forget any dream you had. That and the pokemon meeting you participated to.

Obviously, you don't listen to her words, and keep your eyes sealed.

Uxie just smiles seeing your resistance.
"I won't lie, your stubbornness is kind of cute. But I need you to collaborate, dear," she says, gently removing your arms from your face, pinning them to your sides with a simple movement of her paw. The one holding you suddenly closes into a fist, keeping your arms pinned.

Now she only has to get through your eyelids, which you keep shut closed.

"This isn't right Uxie!" you exclaim, trying to reason with her.
"I know it isn't, dearie," she says, her now open eyes glowing blue, psychically opening up your eyelids.
"But this is for us. We need you. I need you." she says, lowering her head near her paw.

You're forced to look into her eyes.

You find her free paw finding its way to your head as she gently caresses you in the process. Meanwhile, you mentally struggle.

You mustn't forget.

You mustn't forget.

You mustn't forget.

...

You mustn't forget... what?

"W-What's happening?" you dizzily say. Uxie smiles, and closes her eyes back up.
"Uxie? What are we doing here... in the middle of the night?" you ask, looking at her.
"Nothing. You had a nightmare, I believe, so I brought you here. The air of the Lake is very clean, I thought it could have soothed you," Uxie lies, mentally scolding herself.

What she did wasn't right. But it was to keep the human from leaving, she had no other choice.

"Sorry for waking you up, my dear," she politely apologizes.
"Uhm... don't worry. Can... can we just go back to sleep? I'm kinda tired." you reply with a yawn.

Uxie's smile widens. Apparently, her human hasn't any memory left of whatever reason made him want to leave.
"Of course. Let's go back." she says, getting up, embracing you and starting to make her way back to the cave that is the shelter for the night for herself, her sisters and her little human.

So, she happily carries you off, completely unaware that she's being watched by two not familiar pokemon. At least, not familiar anymore.
"Damn. She somehow wiped his memories away," a frustrated Lucario cries, having seen and heard everything.
"Poor human. What do we do now?" a Vaporeon asks to her companion.
"I don't know. How are we going to explain ourselves again?" he asks.

"I don't know, but we need to find a solution. Can't we just go get him and - again - explain the situation? Possibly without having me slapping you?" Vaporeon remarks.
"I'd appreciate that. It still hurts, you know," Lucario growls, earning a giggle from the water type.
"Plus, Uxie knows about his previous intention to leave. She'll most probably keep a close eye on him now." he adds.

Both pokemon sigh, not knowing what to do...

--

"Sleep tight, dear. See you in the morning." Uxie leans forward, planting a peck on your forehead, while laying back beside Mesprit.
"See you later, Uxie," you reply.

The giantess hugs you to her chest again, and lays her head on the floor as she gets ready to sleep. You imitate her, and lay your head against her furry chest.

And, just a few minutes later, you're tugged back to sleep, while Uxie remains awake.

She can't help but wonder.

Wonder about why her little one wanted to leave her and her sisters. He said that they hadn't done anything wrong.

But then, why would he have wanted to leave?

Uxie shakes her head. She decides that she'll investigate your reasons later on. It's not the right moment and, right now, she'd like a few hours of rest.

So she relaxes back and tries to empty her mind from the events of the night, successfully falling asleep again...
134331211111212121121211212122212.title: The eyes of the giantess

1343312111112121211212112121222121.content:
You wake up, feeling like a Chesto Berry! Whatever problems that seemed to have bothered you in the past vanished as you were picked up and hugged by your favorite pink giantess.

"Mornin'DidYouSleepWellDoYouWannaPlay?!" Mesprit rambles in a hasty fashion. Clearly she had embraced the hyperactive, excited side of emotions this day.

"Mornin' to you too," you yawn and try to rid yourself of nausea as you shake around in her grasp. It wasn't very hard, you were feeling great for some reason!

"Oh yeah!" you exclaim excitedly as you pull yourself out of her grasp adn jump on top of her closed fists, looking at her with glittering eyes, "I'm ready for anything!"

You look at Mesprit's smiling face as she looks back at you. Her smile suddenly begins to wane.

"... What...?" she mouths breathlessly.

"Oh crap, what did I say?" you ask while crossing your arms before shaking your head, "No, I'm not taking it back, I'm feeling great and I'm ready for anything!"

"Y-Your eyes!" Mesprit stammers in horror as she holds you up to her own humongous oculars. You can see your own reflection in their golden topaz hue.

"They look fine to me," you mention as you parade around, examining yourself, "Looks a bit more yellow than I remember."

"... Wait, how can you see your own eyes?" Mesprit simply had to ask while trying to deal with many questions at once.

"I see my own reflection in your eyes! Get it? That's why everything looks yellow," you laugh as you look off to the side, noticing a yellow tint that wasn't there before, "Hmm, actually, everything DOES look yellow. That's good, right?"

Mesprit gazed upon you with shock, feeling her heart pounding and her head spinning. In desperation, she looked around. Uxie had already left.

"Mesprit?" you ask. The simple action of the giant turning her head and almost knocked you off your precarious perch and led you to carefully slide your way back into her grasp.

"I..." Mesprit started as she looked at you, her precious little human. That's right - HER precious little human. Not her sister's. And she knew that. It was all just a misunderstanding. It wouldn't be the first time she had jumped to conclusions.

"I'm... I'm sure it was nothing," she explains, but can't really shake the feeling of uncertainty. It was going to ruin her whole day if she didn't find out exactly what had happened.

"Is this another one of your games?" you continue trying to make sense out of the situation "Because I'm down for it!"

"Goood... Shut uuuup..." a load moaning eminated from deeper inside the cave. You saw an azure mountain tumble over to the side, almost causing a cave-in.

"SORRY!" you shout in a particularly loud fashion, causing the mountain to once more shift to her back and shoot you a frustrated gaze. Snickering to yourself, you look up at Mesprit to see if you had improved her mood to some degree. Alas, she wasn't looking at you anymore.

"... Sorry, I just... I need a minute," Mesprit says in a solemn voice as she moves over to Azelf and carefully puts you down on top of her belly, before turning around and flying out of the cave in a flash of lightning.

"Huh?" you exclaim in confusion.

"What?" Azelf says in the same surprised manner, causing her stomach to shake and making you tumble over.

"Oh, sorry," Azelf muttered before yawning, making the ground beneath you rise up, "What happened? What did I miss?"

"That's what I want to know!" you shout with confusion. Running after Mesprit made about as much sense as chasing down a planet, so you sat down with your arms and legs crossed on the soft ground and tried to think back.

When you thought to yourself really, really hard, your body seemed to remember something bad happening recently. But what? Everything had been great ever since you ran into these legendaries. Had you done something to Mesprit last night? Why couldn't you remember?

- - - - - - - - - - - -

Mesprit soared through the skies of Sinnoh, looking for her sister. Normally she would be easy to find, what with being a gaint and all, but they were all quite good at masking their presence and today she seemed to be eluding her. Was that a good sign or a bad sign? Mesprit felt an ache in her heart - When Uxie makes someone forget something, their eyes gleam yellow for a few hours afterwards. What had Uxie made her little human forget? What had Uxie made him do? No method on earth could return lost memories, so getting the answers from the source seemed like the only way to figure this out.

Dejected, she returned to Lake Acuity and sat down by the lakebed. Regular Pokémon fled at her sight, but she was used to it. Being a giant made her dangerous, no matter how kind her heart. It was the sacrifice they had given to be able to protect the three great lakes. Lake Verity was no different, the inhabitants were quite glad to have her protection, but less inclined to befriend her lest she rolled over in her sleep and smashed them into paste by accident.

The only one that had shown no fear was the human. Of course, he had been afraid at first, but when given the choice he had chosen to stay with her. Any other person would have fled by now in the dead of night. And now Uxie had erased his memories? What was gone? What was still there? And why?

Mesprit's eyes began to tear up. She called herself a guardian, but she hadn't even been able to protect the human from her own sister. Had Uxie had her way with the human and forced him to forget so she wouldn't find out? Or did the human proclaim his disdain for her, and Uxie and made him forget to maintain the illusion of true love?

A giant tear fell towards the lake. And it was swept up in midair by a Vaporeon, leaping out of the water and firing a water gun straight at it. Mesprit looked up in confusion as a voice rang out from underneath.

"86% of the inhabitants of Lake Acuity cannot survive in salt water," a Lucario said from the ground next where she was sitting, "And you almost just killed them all."

"One tear? I doubt it," Mesprit huffed with annoyance, before feeling bad at her haughty behavior, "Sorry anyway."

"I'm sorry too. Sorry over what happened," Lucario said with an exasperated sigh, "We should have warned you about your sister, but we figured you'd know her better than any of us."

"... What do you mean?" Mesprit asked with a sudden glare of both uncertainity and rage.

"What Uxie did to that poor human last night..." Lucario continued with a hidden smirk and a glint in his eyes.
1343312111112121211212112121222121.title: Impending sororicide

13433121111121212112121121212221211.content:
Mesprit mentally repeats the Lucario's words for a couple times, before finally replying:
"...I'm listening," she says, momentarily repressing the storm of emotions within her.

There'll be time to let them flow later, she decides.

The Lucario nods his head.
"Well... where do I begin?" he asks, rubbing his head.

After all, it's not every day one gets to talk with a giant. Or with a giantess, in this case.

"From where you please, since I don't know any of it," Mesprit huffs, taking notice of the Vaporeon leaping out of the water and sitting next to Lucario.

The two exchange a few words of which she can't really get the meaning. She does however get a few words, 'Should', tell' 'that?', followed by a few grumbles and cries.
"What? Tell me everything. And I do mean, EVERYTHING." she demands, lowering her head towards the duo.

The two look up to her.
"Alright." the Lucario says, mentally preparing to tell the tale.

"Last night, the human woke up and got out of the cave in which you, your sisters and him were sleeping." he proceeds to tell the events of last night.

Of course, with a few... modifications. If the gigantic legendary finds out he and the other pokemon made the human want to leave, the fault of the situation would fall on them all.

And how would they face the wrath of a gigantic, lovesick legendary?

Even worse, two, because most probably Uxie would join in too for making her erase the human's memories.

They cannot risk that.

"How do you know that?" Lucario rubs the back of his head.
"We kinda saw him, and we decided to keep an eye on him. You never know what humans might do around here," he explains.

Mesprit gives a slight nod, remembering what humans did to her and her sisters. Although she trusts that her human would never mess around Lake Acuity - or any of the three lakes, homes of three sisters.

"... Go on," she says.
"We saw him walking around the forest for no apparent reason. Maybe he just needed some air or something. He stopped before the lake, seeming saddened by something, though,"
"Saddened? But... why?" Mesprit inquires, confused.

Why would the human be saddened?

Maybe... Maybe it was true? Was her precious little one afraid of her? Was her heat problem too much for him to handle? Or was it because of that emotion game, followed by-

Lucario shrugs.
"We don't know. The human returned to the cave shortly after. Then, he came out again. This time, Uxie was with him. We saw her carrying him back to the Lake," Mesprit clenches her fists at this point, biting her lower lip.

Once she calms down enough to talk, she speaks up:
"... W-What did they do?! They didn't... make love, did they?!" she almost shouts, rage overwhelming curiosity.

Giantess and normal-sized pokemon blush at her question. The Vaporeon shakes her head and speaks up:
"No no, not at all, we saw them talking," she says.

Being a pokemon herself, Mesprit has no language barrier keeping her from understanding the water type's words.
"About what?" she asks, calming down a bit.
"We don't know. We didn't hear anything of what they said. Just..." Lucario hesitates.

"... ‘Just’...? Don't stop now, go on!"
"... We saw your sister hugging the human-" again, Mesprit clenches her fists.
"... They kept talking. Then, suddenly, Uxie seemed saddened by something, she was starting to cry," Lucario says.

Of course, he hides the reason of why her sister was crying, aka the human's previous intention to leave. The fault of this situation would fall on him, and Lucario himself pities him enough to not blame him for this.

After all, he had no idea about the legendaries' problems. The best thing is to keep the argument around Uxie, who, along with Azelf, is the only one that could handle Mesprit.

"Uxie seemed saddened? And what she did?" Mesprit asks.
"... She..." Lucario abruptly stops.

Vaporeon speaks up:
"... She wiped the human's memories away, then went back to the cave." she ends the tale.

Mesprit looks at the duo for a few moments, taking in all their words, before reacting.
"Cover your ears." she commands.

Right then, a loud scream echoes through the whole Lake Acuity, many pokemon fleeing upon hearing it.

Without even bothering to thank the two pokemon, Mesprit rockets upwards, questions forming in her mind, along with images of what she'd like to do to Uxie right now.

Why did she erase his memories?!

What did they talk about?!

Why both her and the human were sad?!

And where the heck is she?!

Mesprit hovers around in the woods around the Lake, not quite knowing what to do now.

One big part of her wants to just find Uxie and give her a piece of her very angry mind.

But the other wants to see the human, tell him the horrible thing her sister had done to him. And get Azelf's help finding Uxie while she's at it.

But after a while of thinking and rethinking, she takes her decision...
13433121111121212112121121212221211.title: Talking with the giantess

choices: Uxie decides to say nothing of it
134331211111212121121211212122212111.content:
Mesprit shakes her head. It isn't time to confront her little human just yet. She doesn't want to ruin his day as well as hers by telling him what her sister did to him.

But, still, the giantess is got a task to accomplish: find Uxie and demand answers from her.

So, the giantess once again hovers upwards and flies away in search of her yellow headed sibling.

--

Once again, Mesprit soars the skies of Sinnoh, although using some of her psychic to conceal her presence to other's eyes. Some psychic types could detect her presence with their powers, though they would have to focus really, really hard to match hers. She isn't a legendary for nothing, after all.

And having pokemon and humans freaking out upon seeing a giant pokemon flying through the sky - nearly obscuring the light of the sun itself - is the last thing she needs right now. She has other problems to think about right now. More important ones.

And the first of them all is, where the heck is Uxie?! Why is she eluding her?!

--

After a while of searching Uxie, Mesprit stops in the area near a well known mountain of Sinnoh, Mount Coronet, whose top became quite popular because humans believed that Dialga and Palkia could be found there. Obviously, that wasn't the truth, but people kept believing it.

And, as a result, not many people climb up the mountain anymore.

Mesprit sighs a sigh of frustration. Her quest had little success: Uxie's location is still a mystery to her. What if she wasn't even in the region anymore? Then where could she be hiding?

Mesprit lets out a cry of annoyance as she feels tears once again starting to form in her eyes. It's like her sister just disappeared from existence itself!

"Maybe... Maybe I should forget about it... Maybe it was no big deal... Maybe I should just go back..." Mesprit sniffles, starting to fly away from the area, intending to give up on her objective and return to Lake Acuity. Return to her little human, forget the whole situation and - maybe - save the rest of her day.

That before it struck her.

As she's about to float off, she suddenly feels something.

Concern.

Though not hers. The being of emotions can in fact feel others' feelings as well.

And right now, someone is feeling concerned.

Mesprit turns around. Who is concerned about what? And why? Did some human somehow notice her?

She looks around, not noticing any. She can instead feel more emotions following the first one.

Worry.

Frustration.

Fear.

Mesprit gets closer to the huge mountain that is Mount Coronet.

"... The top. These hard emotions... they're coming from the Spear Pillar..." she mutters.

Without even thinking, Mesprit starts hovering upwards, towards the top of the mountain. As big as she could be, her height is still no match for the majestic mountain. And it still takes her several minutes to fly to the top, even at blazing speed.

--

Eventually, the fairy-like pokemon reaches the top of the mountain, the Spear Pillar.

And she immediately takes notice of the silhouette of a titanic creature with a yellow head, a blue body and two identical tails.

She just found Uxie. And she currently has her back turned to Mesprit. In fact, she doesn't seem to have even noticed her yet.

Mesprit's heart leaps in her chest. She just floats there for a few moments, not quite knowing what to do now, if letting her rage flow or if quietly asking for answers to Uxie.

She shakes her head. She's no beast. So she decides to talk to Uxie first, discover her reasons.

"Ahem..." Uxie flinches, startled by the sudden sound of Mesprit's voice.

The yellow headed giantess turns around, noticing a not-so-happy Mesprit floating closer.
"Oh... hi Mesprit..." she says.
"Hi Uxie. Any reason to be hiding today?" Mesprit says bluntly, sounding more irritated than she meant to.

Uxie frowns.
"I'm not hiding." she replies.
"Oh yeah. That's exactly why you're all alone on the top of a mountain where nobody ever comes," Mesprit ironically states.

Uxie flushes.
"I needed to think, alright?" she says.
"About? Maybe about the reasons why you deleted the memories of a certain human of mine?" Mesprit glares at her.
"Okay, first, he's not yours. He's a free human, completely sound of mind and capable of choosing between right and wrong," Mesprit shoots her a cold stare.
"Second, I had one good reason." she says, brokenly, though not revealing about the human's previous intentions.

Uxie did in fact come up here to stay alone, investigate on your reasons for wanting to leave like she intended to last night, before sleep won her consciousness.

"I do have one good reason to hit you, Uxie." Mesprit says.
"I'd like to know what that poor little one did to you... first, you steal him, then you erase his-"
"I didn't 'steal' him! He was consentient! He just wanted to help... and he has, alright?!" Uxie shouts while her face goes from yellow to red.
"I already knew that, thank you. He helped me as well afterwards!" Mesprit retorts.

Uxie's mouth opens. A single tear falls down her face through her closed left eye.

Mesprit feels sadness adding to the storm of emotions raging within her sister. Regardless, she continues:
"So, now, PLEASE, why did you do such thing?" she asks, although with a gentler voice.

Uxie's eyes fix on the ground. The human had been with Mesprit as well? That's why he wanted to leave? Because he didn't want to shatter her heart by telling her?

"Uxie." Mesprit voice claims her back to reality. The yellow headed pixie rises her head to look at Mesprit.
"...Why? Why did you wipe his memories away? You'll be interested in the fact that someone saw you," Mesprit admits.

Uxie tilts her head, confused, but doesn't make any questions. She replies instead:
"Very well. Then, you'll be interested in the fact that 'your' little one wanted to leave for some reason." she reveals.

Mesprit's reaction isn't exactly one would call good.
"WHAT?!" she asks, once again shock and rage taking over her.

Another tear falls from Uxie's eyes.
134331211111212121121211212122212111.title: Sibling rivalry

choices: A talk with Lucario and Vaporeon...
134331211111212121121211212122212112.content:
With her head spinning, her heart aching and her eyes fighting back tears, Mesprit takes her decision.

Her little human should be informed about what Uxie did to him.

And she's going to do so.

So, still incredulous about the whole thing, the pink headed pokemon hovers deeper into the forest, in direction where her human and her sister Azelf currently are.

--

Upon getting to her destination, Mesprit focuses, and suddenly appears inside of the cavern in a flash of light.

Turning her head to take a look around she spots Azelf still there, the human looking thoughtful. It doesn't look they had done much moving around since she left.

In fact, the only difference is that the human is now laying on her sister's belly while she pats his own stomach with a paw.
"Don't worry, she's fine," she catches Azelf saying, suggesting the subject of the human's thoughts.

Upon noticing Mesprit coming back inside the cave, you spring back up and smile.
"Hey Mesprit! Where have you been? Why that long face?" you ask her, your smile fading the moment you notice the upset look on her face.

In response, the giantess hovers closer to her sister, and picks you from her belly, examining you up close.

That yellow gleam is still present in her human's eyes, confirming that everything she has just apprehended wasn't just a nightmare. Uxie did really delete his memories.

Once again, Mesprit felt the need to cry.

Did her little one really admit that he didn't love her back?

You stare up at the giantess, noticing her eyes growing damp, her lips shaking.

Azelf notices too.
"Mesprit? What happened...?" she asks, concerned about her sister's well being.

Mesprit's gaze shifts from you to her.
"Azelf..." is the only word she manages to say. Instead of replying, she just turns you around.

You watch as the blue giantess slowly sits up, and then gets up, bringing her face close to yours, to the point that you can feel her breath on your face.

You notice her golden eyes narrowing as she examines you, effectively taking notice of something odd.

The human's eyes are glowing yellow.

She stares at you confused for a few moments, before finally understanding the situation. She rises her head to look at the giantess holding you.
"Mesprit...!?" she exclaims, surprised.

Mesprit just nods in response.
"But... why...?"
"I don't know!" Mesprit shouts, irritated.

You still don't have a clue of what's happening, and you make it clear to the two sisters:
"Hey, what's going on?" you ask, trying to not sound too annoyed.

Which is pretty much pointless since Mesprit can feel emotions.

Their attention shifts back on you. Azelf is the first to talk:
"Human, we need you to answer to a few questions," she says.

"... Did I do something wrong...?" you inquire. What do this two know that you don't? Why are they looking like something bad happened to you? Aside from your concerns for Mesprit, you're sure you're completely fine.

"No no, don't worry. We just need to know... what do you remember about last night?" Mesprit asks you, looking unusually serious. Actually, both look really serious right now.
"I... I remember going to sleep with you, Mesprit..." you sincerely answer.

"Just that?" she asks back.
"Yes. I actually don't remember having any dream, but that's normal, right?" you say.
"Not in this case, dear." Azelf replies bluntly, looking as concerned as her sister.

You shoot her a curious gaze.

And your confusion rises when Mesprit suddenly closes you in a hug.

What is happening...?

--

You stare at the two legendaries, your mouth wide open. At first, you were curious about these two sisters' concerns.

Now, you regret knowing them... well, at least you're relieved that you hadn't done anything wrong to Mesprit last night.

The duo started explaining what that yellow tint in your eyes is, then why it is there, and in the end Mesprit told you things that your being simply refuses to believe.

"I c-can't believe it... Uxie..." you stammer incoherently.
"As much as unbelievable it may sound, trust us, it is all true," Mesprit says.

You look at her.
"H-How can you so be so sure, Mesprit?" you ask.
"For starters, your eyes are still glowing yellow. Second, other pokemon saw Uxie making you look into her eyes. Third, she's avoiding me." Mesprit explains.

You shake your head.

How could such a sweet pokemon like Uxie have done something like that?

While you try to find an answer to many questions, one in particular finds its way out of your mouth:
"B-But what did she make me forget?" you ask.
"That's the key of everything," Azelf mutters.
"And that's what we're trying to figure out. Now, try to think really, really hard. See if you remember anything, any apparently insignificant particular," Mesprit says you.

"Already tried that. I just remember something bad happening... but I don't know what..." you reply, rubbing your head. This situation had given you an headache.
"Well, something bad happened for sure," Mesprit says flatly.
"The only question is, why did it happen?" Azelf asks.
"And that's why we need to find Uxie. She's the only one who can give us answers right now." Mesprit adds.

"Okay. Problem. Where is she?" you ask. You then notice Azelf with her eyes closed.

She opens them after a couple of minutes.
"She cut off our psychic link," she mutters.
"What?" Azelf nods her head.

Mesprit inhales deeply.
"Let's go find her." she says.

--

Uxie is maintaining a low profile today. First, she cut off the link she shares with her sisters. Then, she made sure to keep herself concealed in the underwater cavern of Lake Acuity, the same underwater cavern that serves her as a home.

Being the one who created knowledge, along with her shyness, usually means one thing: a lot of time alone.

And right now, some time alone it's what she needs. It helps her to think.

And she's currently thinking about the events that occurred last night. She didn't want to confront the human and her sisters just yet.

She needs answers if she wants to give answers.

Erasing people's memories is something she hates doing, and now she wants to make she sure she had good reasons to wipe the human's ones away.

Otherwise, she's not going to forgive herself anytime soon. Neither are her sisters, who most probably already found out what she did.

"Okay," she thinks aloud.
"All of sudden, the human wishes to leave for no apparent reason. He seemed heartbroken, but said that we didn't do anything wrong to him... B-But, I can't think of any other reason that could have made him want to leave!" Uxie exclaims.

She has to admit, this situation is quite complicated even for her, the being of knowledge. She lacks enough information to figure out the whole thing.

Uxie ends up regretting taking the hasty decision to erase to human's memories. She could have simply insisted a bit more to get answers from him. Not that she didn't regret it earlier, though...

After thinking and rethinking about the whole situation, she comes to a conclusion:
"Me, Azelf and Mesprit must have done something.
Maybe not to him, or maybe indirectly, that scared him enough to make him want to leave. The only problem is: what could we have done?" she thinks.

In the end, Uxie decides that she needs some air.

She teleports out of her underwater cave and finds herself hovering above the surface of her Lake.

Quietly, she floats over the land, and sits down, dipping her tails into the water. She just needs to think.

Alo-

"That wasn't very nice of you." two voices ring from behind her.

She gives a deep sigh as she turns to face Azelf, Mesprit and the human, held by Mesprit.

The two giantesses hovers close to their sister.
"We need to talk, Uxie," Azelf states.

Instead of replying, Uxie moves her paw forward and snatches you from Mesprit.

Before the pink headed pokemon can express her anger, she gently lets you on the ground.
"Little one, go take a walk or something. I don't want you to hear this," she says.

You catch yourself nodding and starting to walk away. As you do, though, a single phrase stops you:
"I'm sorry," Uxie says.

You glance at her, and open your mouth to tell something, but a single look at Azelf and Mesprit tells you that you'd better shut up and get lost.

So, silently, you make your way through the forest, walking until you can't possibly see or hear the legendaries anymore.

Sighing, you lean against a tree, shaking your head as if trying to wake up from a nightmare.

But, the moment you lean back, two figures come out of the woods.

A bipedal, black and blue jackal and a quadruped blue pokemon with a long, fin-like tail.

A Lucario and a Vaporeon that you don't recall having seen before.

"Hello human," the Lucario talks in perfect human language.
You remain surprised for a few moments, in which the Lucario speaks again:
"You and us need to talk," he says.
134331211111212121121211212122212112.title: Revelations

1343312111112121211212112121222121121.content:
"Now Uxie-" Azelf starts, but Mesprit immediately cuts her off:
"The human. Why did you erase his memories?" Mesprit asks, glaring daggers at Uxie.

"Calm down, sister. It's already hard enough for me," Uxie mutters in response.
"Hard for you? You literally took the human's memories for no reason!" Azelf exclaims.

"Actually-"
"What did that poor little one do to you? Nothing! He's been nothing but a kind-hearted human who even... who even... h-he even helped you with the heat!" Mesprit exclaims indignantly.

Uxie flushes red.
"Yes! And I was grateful for it!" she retorts.
"Grateful? Good way to show that!" Mesprit says.
"Now, what did he do? He caused troubles around the Lake? He did something funny to you or us?... Or did you... do it again, Uxie? Which one of these?"

"None of those, Mesprit. None." Uxie truthfully replies.
"Then why?"

Uxie fixes her closed eyes on her sisters, pondering if she could open them and make the two giantesses forget about what happened.

If she had to, this was the right moment.

Uxie represses the idea. She would never do it, not to her sisters. She hates doing it anyway, and doing it to the human already broke her heart.

So, that leaves her with only one alternative...

"Azelf, Mesprit," she starts.
"The human... he wanted to leave..." Uxie whispers.

"What?" Azelf and Mesprit asks at one time.

"The human wanted to leave!" Uxie cries, bracing herself for her sisters' reaction. Especially for Mesprit's.

Mesprit stares at her sister, dumbfounded. Azelf disappears into the forest.

"WHAT?!"

--

"And now you know. All of it." Lucario ends his tale.

Your legs can't hold you anymore, you find. You ungracefully fall on your rear and grab your head in your hands, unable to believe what be just told you.

Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie...

"I can't believe this." you say
"You should," Lucario says, kneeling down.
"It's the truth."

You remove your head from your hands, making eye contact with the jackal.
"Who guarantees me that?" you ask, comprehensibly skeptical about what he told you.

Lucario grins slightly.
"Every single inhabitant of Lake Acuity, if you want. They... we, everyone of us will tell you the same thing." he states.

You look to Vaporeon, who didn't say anything while her friend spoke, be it because she can't communicate with you or because she didn't want to interrupt.

She fixes her blue eyes on you. Said eyes shift into a look of fear as she nods her head slowly.

You're tempted to lower your head and cry.

Was that all true? The three sisters you befriended, the three sisters you've been so close to... Mesprit and Uxie, who you've been with... carnally.

Those three are a danger...? And not only to you, but to every pokemon around here?

"I see you are reasoning," Lucario says, grabbing a hold of your hand as her steps back, helping you back on your feet.
"And that brings us to the point: you need to leave," he bluntly says.

You stare at him.
"Leaving?" you weakly parrot back.
"... Now?"

Lucario nods.
"Yes. Otherwise, you, us, and every pokemon of Lake Acuity will be in great danger." he replies.

Those words have the effect of making you take a decision.
"Alright. I'll leave." you say, your heart aching as you speak.

"But I need to get my bag from the cave first. I've got money in there and I-" Lucario doesn't let you finish as he lets out a growl, right in your face.

"It was your bag that doomed you last night!" Lucario growls at you. You glare at him.
"But I need that! I can't leave without it!" you snap back.

Your gaze casually shifts to the side, where Vaporeon is... where Vaporeon was.
"Uh?" Lucario says, confused as her notices his friend missing.
"Where did she-"

"Vaa!" a muffled cry echoes around. You gaze in its direction, noticing Vaporeon, dragging something with her mouth... your bag!

The water type lets it go as she stops before you, her tail wagging.

Giving a grateful smile, you put the bag on.
"Thank you," you say, before turning to Lucario.
"Alright, now I think we can-" a sudden noise catches your attention.

Rustling.

You turn around, taking notice of a few trees shaking.

Trees.

You turn back to the pokemon duo.
"Run." you instruct. Both stand like paralyzed for a moment, before turning around and running into the nearby bushes and disappearing within the forest.

Just then, the alarmed figure of Azelf comes out of the trees behind you.

--

The giantess stops as she spots you on the ground.
"Human! We need you, now! The situation got out of ha-"

"I refuse to believe this!" loud cry resounds.

Mesprit...?

Azelf face palms, before looking back at you.
"Come on, let's..." she stops in mid sentence as she notices something.

"Hey, you didn't have that before..." she points out, looking straight to your black bag. Your blood seems to freeze.
"I... I actually got it now..." you mention.

Azelf looks at you suspiciously.
"And for what purpose?" she asks.
