You swallow, trying to come up with something, anything that may save you.
"Ehm, since you three were arguing, I decided to go explore around here. However, I thought I could get lost, and I've, uh, got a compass in here..." you lie, mentally slapping yourself.

Even to you it sounded like a stupid excuse. Even if you got lost, one of the three sisters would have noticed and found you within five minutes.

Apparently, Azelf is reasoning on the same line of thinking as her frown remains on her face. That golden glare holds you down like a pile of steel was on you.
"Okay... what were you exactly doing again...?" she asks.

You open your mouth to reply, when you notice the giantess' eyes glowing blue. And the answer is forced out of your mouth:
"I was leaving!" you blurt out, before covering your mouth with both your hands.

You didn't mean to tell that, what just happened? It's like your mouth spoke on its own!

Azelf's own mouth shuts open.
"L-Leaving...?" she asks. It's what Uxie was saying!

She stares at you confused for a while, not quite sure of how to react.
"Looks like you, me and my sisters need to talk," she says in the end.

You find the blue mountain moving; her left arm extends as the giantess reaches out for you.

You stand tall for a moment, knowing that there's only one thing now to do now.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121.title: Two truths

choices: You reluctantly reveal what you know...
You insist that you can't tell and ask them to let you go
13433121111121212112121121212221211212.content:
‘Run!’

Your mind gives your legs this forceful command. Which, sadly, is never executed. You try to look down to see what the problem is, but you find that you can't move your head...

Panicking, you urgently realize that your body can't move at all!

But this problem is registered as secondary by your brain as the huge paw of Azelf grabs a hold of you and lifts you off the ground.
"I'm sorry for your willpower," Azelf says sorrowfully.
"But it's only a precaution. I couldn't risk you escaping. You'll have it back soon," she says, starting to hover back to where she came from.

You want to scream, but your mouth can't open, your tongue can't move and your vocal chords are silenced.

Willpower? Azelf just took your willpower away? Is that why you blurted out your intentions before?

The giantess made you talk, and now she's keeping you completely still, trapped in her titanic fist as she flies back where Mesprit and Uxie are.

--

It's only a matter of minutes before Azelf reaches the lake shore, where her two sisters are still yelling at each other.

"I refuse to believe this, Uxie!" Mesprit repeats.
"It's the truth! That's why I had to make him forget!" Uxie retorts.

Irritated, Mesprit casually gazes to the side. And she takes notice of Azelf, holding her little human in her paws.

Mesprit's frown fades, making room for a smile.
"Cutie! she exclaims, her voice going from venomous to honey-sweet in an instant.

"Uxie here says that you wanted to leave! But you didn't want that, did you?" she exclaims, reaching out for you.

However Azelf spins in place, avoiding her sister, and she places you down, her left tail gently keeping your will-less body from falling flat on the ground.

"Too bad," the pixie starts.
"That leaving was exactly what he was doing when I found him."

Mesprit and Uxie look at Azelf.
"What?" the exclaim in unison.
"B-But... I made him forget..." Uxie continues, incredulous.
"It isn't funny, Azelf!" Mesprit cries.

Azelf frowns as she looks to Mesprit.
"In fact, it isn't supposed to be. I'm serious! That's why I took his will!" she snaps back.

Mesprit's tails twitch.
"... You give that back now." she says. Azelf nods.

Her tail unwraps from your form as you find that you can move again. Regardless, you drop on your knees.

Only to be lifted back on your feet by a psychic grasp.
"Now, I think we deserve an explanation," Azelf says.
"I agree," Uxie says. You glance at her.
"Aw, I won't make you forget again." she reassures.
"But, now, give us an answer: why did you mean to leave? Again?"

You don't respond, and keep your mouth sealed.
"Look, If you want an advice, I suggest you talk," Azelf says, her voice sounding gentle, but firm.
"We know how to make you talk... I beg you, don't force us to make you talk." she says.

However, in this moment, Mesprit decides to speak up:
"Azelf, don't force him to talk; Uxie don't dig into his mind," Mesprit says, scooping you up in her paws and holding you in front of her face.

"I'm handling this."

You swallow as you notice Mesprit staring at you intently. You can literally see her emotions in her eyes: betrayal, confusion, sadness.

But all of that fades. The giantess fixes on you a calm stare as her mouth opens to let her speak:
"Human... why do you want to leave us... why do you want to leave me?" she asks, her calm voice matching her expression.

Your silence is enough of an answer, ‘I can't tell’.

"Please, tell us... We can talk about it afterwards..." Mesprit tries again. Still, you remain completely quiet and look backwards.

Azelf and Uxie are staring at the scene in complete silence, not wanting to interrupt. The sound of Mesprit inhaling deeply draws your attention as you shift your gaze back on her.

"You don't wish to leave us, do you?" Mesprit asks.
"...What makes you think that?" you ask.
"Dearie, I feel your emotions: you're heartbroken. Regretful," the giantess explains, maintaining the calm voice she's been using so far.

You remain silent.
"Now, we only want to know... why were you trying to leave?" Mesprit inquires again. Only to receive the same response as before: silence.

"I'm sorry for pressing on, but you need to answer me.
Do you wish us two to be alone to talk? I promise it'll remain a secret between me and you if you want." she says, earning two glares from her sisters.

She responds by glaring right back to them, before fixing a comprehensive gaze on you.
"Come on... you can tell me," she repeats.

"Mesprit... I c-can't..." you stammer.
"It's-"

"I don't want to lose you, human, Mesprit interrupts you.
"Now, if you tell why you suddenly want to leave, it'd be easier to reason about it, don't you think?" she says.

Her logic makes sense. However...

"I can't tell it." you stubbornly say.
"And I can't let you go," Mesprit bluntly replies.
"That means we're even."

You look up to the guardian.
"You mean... if I tell you, you'll let me go...?" you ask.

Sadly, Mesprit shakes her head.
"That, I'm afraid, it's impossible for obvious reasons." she says, giving a bit of a smile as she recalls that the person she's holding is the very one who stole her heart.

"Come on... whatever reason you have to leave, tell us... tell me... you do trust me, don't you? We won't be offended. And even if we will, we would never do anything to harm you," the last statement makes her glance at both Azelf and Uxie.
"Right?"

"Absolutely," Uxie says.
"Absolutely." Azelf repeats.

Satisfied, Mesprit glances back at you. You lower your head, trying to make a choice.
"Come on..." the giantess says.

Your head perks back up. You crane your neck to fully look into the giantess' golden eyes as you make your decision clear...
13433121111121212112121121212221211212.title: Forced confrontation

choices: Azelf leans in closer so that only she can hear what you're about to say
134331211111212121121211212122212112121.content:
"In that case..." you say as your face contorts into a sad expression, "... I really have no choice but to leave."

"But why?" Mesprit asks as your sorrow reverberates in her empathic senses.

"Because you won't let me!" you shout at the top of your lungs, staring the pink giantess straight in the eye, "They were right - It's too late!"

"... 'They'?" Mesprit repeats with confusion before giving off a sigh of relief.

"Finally, we're getting somewhere," Azelf says confidently as she moves up beside Mesprit, "OK, who said what?"

"EVERYONE!" you bellow with exasperation. This seemed to rattle up the legendaries for a moment, Azelf's confidence waning as Mesprit shivered from sensing your frustration. Uxie still had her eyes closed, but her mouth was hanging open.

"A-And... What exactly did they...?" Azelf starts, but is interrupted by a large yellow paw on her shoulder.

"Wait," Uxie suddenly chimes in from behind as you try to regain your breath, "Did someone tell you something? But you are the only human here, no?"

You swallow nervousley as the closed eyelids of the pixie seem to gaze down upon you. The notion that she could very easily open them and send you back to square one made you realize you had to pick your words very carefully.

"The... Pokémon of this lake," you explain at length with you heart pounding in your chest, "One of them could speak human, like you three. And he warned me about you."

Uxie rears back a little, looking back at her two sisters.

"Me?" Uxie asks meekly.

"Apparently he said that you could erase memories," you mutter before scratching the top of your head, "But I'm not sure, because you... Erased my memories."

"UXIE!" Mesprit suddenly shouts as she rose to her full height, which was quite impressive from your stature, "Have you been erasing memories of those around the lake!?"

"No!" Uxie responded as she felt a lump in her throat, "... Maybe once or twice? B-But only because it was really embarassing!"

"Are you serious!?" Azelf yells with indignation, eyes shot wide open, "Sis, you're supposed to be PROTECTING the inhabitants of this lake, not use your powers to take advantage of..."

Azelf suddenly quiets down and starts to blush. Mesprit suddenly perks up, sensing an unmistakable emotion from her blue sister.

"You too!?" Mesprit exclaims in surprise, making a hasty motion to shield you with her massive paw, "You've been... Abusing your powers to..."

"No no no! Of course not!" Azelf shouts while waving her hands back and forth, finally covering her blushing face in her paws, "How could you even think that!? No, it's just that everyone is so afraid, so sometimes it's nice to have someone to talk to, so if they don't feel like running we can chat for a while and get to know each other better..."

"Things just move on better if they don't remember," Uxie admits bluntly, lowering her head in shame, "Nobody wants anything to do with me after helping with my heat. And I... Help them along the way."

Uxie exhales heavily and begins to shake. Mesprit slowly floats away from her sister, towards where you have been standing flabbergasted all this time.

"I... I thought that's why the human wanted to leave!" Uxie screams with tears rolling down her cheek, "Because he helped me! And he couldn't stand to see me again! I ruined it for you, Mesprit, like I always do!"

"H-How could you!?" Mesprit replies as she too begins to cry, her sister's emotions overwhelming her, "D-Don't you understand!? I can't remove memories or s-steal willpower, all I can do is s-sense my partner's overwhelming fear at being inside of me!"

The two sisters slowly move away from each other, Azelf remaining in the middle and looking back and forth between them with a terrified expression.

"Wait..." you speak up.

"This human, he's the only one I've ever felt love from!" Mesprite continues her barrage, "And now you've scared him off because you raped him!"

"It's not like that..." you try to interject.

"I did no such thing!" Uxie snaps back instantly, "He agreed to it, you stupid, emotional bitch! And I took his memories for your sake!"

"You two!" Azelf tries to step in as things begin to flare up.

"Hey," you say, but your words are drowned out by Mesprit's rage.

"You took his mind against his will; That's mindrape!" Mesprit bellows as she moves closer to her sister who instinctively backed off, "I go to sleep for one night and you rape the love of my life, you worthless little-"

An explosion sounds throughout the area as Mesprit tries to grab a chokehold on Uxie, but is intercepted by Uxie's own hands. The two remain locked, Uxie's eyes opening into two tiny slits and her mouth forming into an angry snarl. The ground beneath your feet begins to tremble and you feel your skin prickle form the clash of the two titanesses.

"ENOUGH!" Azelf shouts as Uxie and Mesprit both suddenly go slack-jawed, letting go of each other and looking a little dazed. Azelf knew she would catch a million hells for stealing tehir willpower later, but figured it was preferable to her two sisters destroying the entire lake in a fit of rage.

"Finally!" you speak up, and at long last the three giantesses appear to notice, "Listen to what I'm saying - I wasn't trying to leave because of Uxie!"

"You..." Uxie mumbles, feeling her heart perk up yet not really having any ambitions to show it at the moment.

"I like you, Uxie," you clarify as the legendary's eyes begin to close into its regular serene state, "... I like all three of you."

"Cutie..." Mesprit whispers, feeling like she wanted to hug you but also feeling like she didn't really want to do anything at them moment, "Sis... Stop... It's humiliating..."

Azelf happily lets go of her two siblings, who both take a deep breath and feel a lot calmer than before.

"... Thank you," Mesprit says with a reluctant tone as she looks at Azelf, "But please. Just slap me the next time. Depriving a being of emotion of her willpowe-"

Suddenly Mesprit is embraced by Uxuie, who still has tears running down past her heavy eyelids. Mesprit is taken aback for a moment, but then returns the hug. You look up with relief at the two legendaries hugging in silence, like an astral body too large to fully comprehend. This was nice. A few minutes pass where nothing is said and all your problems seem to have washed away.

"So... Why did you want to leave, then?" Azelf asks you in a calm manner.

Uh-oh.

"Azelf..." you whisper while looking up at the giantess with a pleading expression. You really have no choice but to tell them now, but the other two are in a pretty fragile state of mind. Indeed, throughout all of this, Azelf appeared to be the most rational and calm of the legendaries. Maybe it would be OK for you to tell just her?
134331211111212121121211212122212112121.title: You reluctantly reveal what you know...

choices: It's too dangerous. You decide to leave...
You decide to stay. Maybe it won't be so bad...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Seeing the pleading look upon your face, Azelf briefly glances at her sisters, seeing if they are listening to the conversation.

Uxie and Mesprit are still hugging, tears running down their cheeks, and they don't look like they are going to stop anytime soon. That means that Azelf can freely talk to you for the moment.

Slowly, the giantess' gaze travels back on you.
"So?" Azelf asks you.
"Azelf..." you whisper, earning a curious look from the giantess.

You look around. After, Lucario proved that you've been spied on yesterday. Who says that he and Vaporeon aren't spying on you again, right now?

You sigh. There won't be a better time to tell what you learned. And, it's just Azelf after all...

Your head perks up. Your gaze locks with the golden one of Azelf, who is still waiting for you to speak. Slowly, you rise one hand, motioning for her to get closer.

Again, the giantess looks at her sisters, before bending down, until her titanic blue face is standing inches from your body.
"There. Now we can talk." she says in a whisper.

You open your mouth to speak, but no sound comes out of it. Your jaw closes back up as you meekly look at the giantess without speaking.

Azelf patiently waits for you to speak. However, noticing your muteness, the giantess smiles in a sweet manner.
"Don't be afraid to talk, human," she says, closing her eyes as her reassuring smile grows on her face.
"You're among friends here," her eyes open back up as she looks at her two still hugging sisters.
"Maybe even more." she remarks.

You flush red.
"I know, Azelf, I know," you say.
"It's just... I don't know how to start..."

"In any way you wish," Azelf replies. You don't respond, trying to find the right words to express what you know. To express what made you so afraid of the three legendary sisters.

However, you don't seem to find any good words.

Instead, Azelf seems to comprehend before you even speak:
"You mentioned the pokemon around this lake, right?" she recalls.
"You mentioned that they talked to you, that one of them could speak your language like we do. What did he tell you, aside from the fact that Uxie..." Azelf stops in mid sentence, clearly not wanting to depress her sister even more.

"They... they told me something. About you three." you start.

Azelf eyes you with curiosity, those huge, golden eyes of hers staring deep into your soul.
"...And? What did they tell you?" she asks.

Again, you remain silent. Can you tell her what Lucario told you earlier? That their heat makes her uncontrollable, dangerous, and possibly lethal for anybody around them?

"Look. I am not the guardian of this lake. Uxie is," Azelf says, noticing that you're still reluctant to talk.
"Even if you tell me what you know, I can't do anything about it. So, you can talk freely." she whispers.

You timidly nod your head.
"Alright." you reply, walking closer to her face. To ease your task, Azelf lays down, her arms crossing beneath her chin as they support her head.

One arm leaves the other as the giantess grabs you and sets you on her wrist.
"Go ahead." she says. You nod.

--

"I'm sorry, but I don't remember meeting you before," you spoke as the Lucario walked closer to you, the Vaporeon stopping beside him.

"Exactly. You don't remember us for a certain reason, I believe," he said. You looked at him suspiciously.
"You know...?" you asked.

The jackal nodded his head.
"Yes." he says.
"We saw what Uxie did to you," the Vaporeon spoke up. You looked at her, not quite understanding whatever she said.

"She said that we saw what Uxie did. And we know why," the Lucario told.

"You do?" you asked. The black and blue pokemon nodded.
"Yes," he told.
"You wanted to leave, human. And Uxie noticed you. She made you forget." he recalled.

You stood confused.
"I wanted to leave?" you asked.
"Why would I have wanted that?"

The Lucario smirked.
"Because, those sisters are dangerous!"


--

"We are dangerous?" Azelf interrupts your tale.
"But why? All we do is protect the three lakes, so... how are we dangerous?" she asks.

You hesitate. This is the moment of truth. Have you got the heart to tell it?

"Come on, don't stop now. You've come this far, tell all of it." Azelf says. You sigh, non-verbally expressing your regret.

"Your heat." you reveal.

The blue giantess gives a bit of a blush.
"Our heat? What about it?" she asks.

"Azelf, your heat makes you dangerous. Uncontrollable." you say. Azelf's eyes widen as you continue:
"Y-You are initially satisfied, but then you gradually want more and more. More and more, until you-" you abruptly stop, not sure you can tell it.

However, Azelf is too shocked to let it slide.
"... Until we...?" she parrots back.

You regretfully glance at her.
"You go on a rampage." you close your eyes, turning your head elsewhere.

There. You said it.

Azelf looks at you, eyes wide open, like her mouth.
"Tell me you are kidding." she says after a while.
"Trust me, I wish that. It's the truth Azelf. We both hate it, but..." you say, only to be silenced by a giant paw being pressed on your mouth.

"Please... don't go any further..." she says in a painful whisper, closing her eyes to prevent tears from falling. A futile attempt.

"I understand why you didn't want to tell it now. You little sweetie, you didn't want to make us sad, did you?" she asks.

You nod, though she can't see it.

The giantess opens her damp eyes and looks at her sisters, who are still hugging silently.

Then, Azelf's gaze travels back on you.
"Listen, I understand this. I understand why you wanted to leave," she says.
"But I think I'm talking for my sisters too: we don't want you to leave. We... we'd be hurt if you did..." she admits.

You try to fight tears.
"Azelf, trust me, leaving is the last thing I wish for. Since I met you and your sisters, things have been going wonderfully. But, your heat is a problem..." you say.

"We'll find a solution. There ought to be one. Just...
please, don't go..." she pleads.

You look at Uxie and Mesprit; the two sisters are just breaking their hug.

Mesprit turns to you, tears still running down her face. Quietly, the giantess hovers over Azelf and picks you from her, closing you in a hug.
"I still don't know what reason you had to leave," she says.
"But don't do it... for me... for us..." she pleads.

A quick glance at Uxie reveals that she too is staring at you, tears pouring from her closed eyelids. A silent acknowledgement, she agrees with her sisters: she doesn't want you to leave.

You stand there, squeezed in Mesprit's way-too-loving hug for a while as you try to decide.

A couple tears start rolling down your cheeks too as you make your definitive choice...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: The confession

choices: Try to talk them into letting you go alone...
You decide to remain. What's the point of leaving if they follow you?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"I'm sorry," you say, more tears rolling down your cheeks. You push your face into Mesprit's chest as you too start crying.

You sadness strikes the giantess' empathic abilities.
"Cutie..." she says, hugging you even more tightly. You grip Mesprit's chest as she senses your frustration again.

"D-Don't you understand?! I n-need to leave!" you stammer, trying to control your tears.
"Otherwise... I-I'll..." you abruptly stop, unable to finish your own sentence.

"What? J-Just tell us already..." Mesprit says as she gently starts to caress you.

You, however, pull yourself back.
"Pu-put me down." you tell her. Reluctantly - very reluctantly - Mesprit obeys and starts to lower herself, gently letting you down on the ground, before rising to her full height again.

"I... I don't want to this, girls," you say while looking at the three giantesses.
"I really like you - all three of you," you continue.
"You're the kindest, sweetest creatures I ever met..."

Now knowing what motivation made you want to leave, Azelf remains quiet, while her sisters open their mouths in surprise.
"But then, if you like us, why do you want to leave?" Uxie asks.

You look at her and sigh.
"I... I can't tell you, Uxie," you say, before looking at Azelf.

"Azelf..." you tell, making the blue giantess look at you with a sad expression.
"Azelf knows why I'm doing this," you reveal.

Immediately, both Uxie and Mesprit look over their sibling, who looks at you, trying to figure out what is going on in your head.

"The choice to tell you my motivation, or not, is up to her," you continue.
"And now-" you sob.
"All I ask you is... is to let me go..."

More tears start to tall from the eyes of all three sisters as they watch you starting to walk away. You already have your bag, all you need to do is leaving...

However, Mesprit wasn't going to let it happen so easily.

Soon, a blue and pink mountain moves in front of you, blocking your path. You rise your gaze, looking at Mesprit questioningly.

"If... If you leave..." she says as she sniffles.
"Then... I'm coming with you." she then says, trying to sound firm, although her shaky voice betrays her.

The statement makes you, Azelf and Uxie flinch.
"What?" Azelf asks.
"B-But..." you stammer.
"Y-You can't..." Uxie finishes.

Mesprit shakes her head.
"I... I know," she says, before looking at you.
"But I can no longer stay without you, human. I... I love you far too much." she sniffles while letting a couple more tears fall down her eyes.

You blush, but you can't shake off the feeling of guilt. Mesprit really loves you, and you're voluntarily leaving her and her sisters.

You know it's wrong, but...

"What about Lake Verity, Mesprit? Who'll protect it if you come with me?" you remark.
"Sis, that's true. You can't leave your lake!" Azelf chimes in. Mesprit shrugs.
"I... we'll find a solution. But I'm still coming with you!" she says, clearly irremovable on her decision.

That's when Uxie decides to speak up.
"If she comes with you, I'll come too," she says. Your mouth opens wide.
"Uxie... you too?" you ask as the titaness hovers closer.

She nods.
"You're the first one who ever offered to help me without hating me afterwards... I'd be stupid if I didn't come too..." she shyly says.

You take a few steps back. This situation has taken an unexpected twist.

And a horrible one too. What would people think if they saw you hanging around with two legendary pokemon who are 200 ft tall?!

"Girls... be reasonable. If someone saw us together, they'd freak out, don't you think?" you ask.
"Please! We know how to disappear from eyesight. You'd be the only one seeing us!" Mesprit retorts.

"But-" you are interrupted as you notice Azelf, who had been quiet for the whole time, taking place in between her two siblings, her gaze fixed on you.
"Human... If my sisters come with you, then..." she inhales deeply.
"I'll come too." she says.

Your heart totally freezes at this point.
"B-But... Azelf... I told you-"
"I know what you told me," the blue giantess slowly says, drawing the attention of her siblings.

Regardless, she continues.
"But if I don't come too, these two might end up trying to kill each other again..." she bluntly says while glaring at Mesprit and Uxie, who respond at unison:
"Shut up, Azelf!"

You silently watch as the three sisters start arguing.

You ignore them, and try to make a choice instead. Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie are determined to come with you.

But... what's the point of leaving then? You're leaving exactly because you need to get away from these three legendaries!

Might as well stay here to Lake Acuity if things go like this...

Another part of your brain tells you that you should try to talk your way out of this situation, convince the sisters to let you go on your own... despite Mesprit's declaration of devotion towards you.

Sure, you could easily try to talk to them and make them renounce on their intent to follow you.

However, stay or try to leave alone, the decision is up to you.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: An unexpected twist

choices: Azelf is convinced. Now to convince her sisters...
No such luck. Looks like they're coming with you...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Girls..." you mutter startled as the titanesses argue even louder. You fear that they might just end up fighting again. And that would mean that you may not make it out of this lake alive...

"C'mon... calm down..." you say, backing up a bit.

The argument grows louder and louder, until...

"THAT'S IT!" Mesprit shouts. Suddenly Azelf and Uxie's expression relax as the two move backwards, looking much calmer...

You quickly realize that Mesprit just stole her siblings' emotions. Sure, she played with yours before by altering them, but she never mentioned that she could steal them away.

"... All my anger is gone..." Azelf murmurs quietly.
"The rest too. Mesprit, you're a-" Uxie stops as she notices you walking up to her pink headed sister.

You place a hand on Mesprit's leg, looking up at her with a pleading expression. The giantess looks down at you, before lowering her head and sighing.

"Sorry... Sorry..." she mumbles. Uxie and Azelf suddenly perk up again, their emotions restored.
"Don't do that again..." Uxie says.

Azelf nods in agreement.
"Yeah. It's just weird to be without emotions. It's horrible, but you can't feel bad about it..." she says.

Mesprit perks up as she senses a hint of sadness, mixed with sheer relief. Instinctively, the titaness looks down at you.
"... You... You still want to leave, don't you...?" she asks.

Your relief fades, fully replaced by sadness.
"Yes... I... I need to..." you say.
"But why? Will you tell us at last?" Uxie asks, all the attention now focused on you again.

You shake your head.
"I won't..." you reply.
"Now... please... just let me go on my own path..." you beg.

At this point, Mesprit had enough of your sadness. She floats over you and bends. You fight the urge to cower as the giantess picks you in her paws and hugs you.

"Cutie, we've already told you," she says.
"You can leave this lake, or even this region if you wish, but we are coming along with you,"

You climb out of Mesprit's embrace, standing on top of her fists.
"Mesprit... It's not possible..."

"Oh sure it is," Uxie chimes in.
"It'll be fine..."

You try to catch a glimpse of the giantess from Mesprit's titanic body.
"Uxie... what'd be the point of leaving if you come along...?" you reason, hoping that she would too.

After all, she is the smartest of the trio...

However, the pixie shakes her head.
"Good point," she says.
"Thing is: you want to leave us; we don't want to leave you."

You swallow nervously.

Mesprit sighs.
"I don't know why you're doing this," she says, drawing your attention.
"It's causing you to suffer. I can feel it. And I hate it."

"Of course I'm suffering - I don't want to leave you!" you shout, exasperated.
"But I need to! Otherwise you'll-" you push your hands against your mouth, refraining yourself from blurting out the truth.

However, you've successfully drawn the giantesses' attention.

Azelf pales as her siblings look at you with curiosity.
"... ‘We'll’...?" Uxie repeats.

You don't reply and remain silent instead.
"Aw come on!" Mesprit exclaims.
"You've told Azelf - and you barely even know her!"

"Says you!" the blue pixie snaps back indignantly.

"... Why won't you tell me...?... Don't you trust me? Do you fear our reaction?" Mesprit asks in a much softer way.

"No, Mesprit, it's not that..." you reply.
"There's another reason... and I won't tell..." you gaze at the giantess pleadingly.
"Now... just let me go..." you beg, before an idea springs up in your mind.

"M-Maybe I'll come back someday!" you exclaim.
"Yes! I promise we'll be seeing again!"

Mesprit stares at you for a minute after your last remark, before she sighs.
"It is clear - you don't understand." she says.

Before you can question what she means, she suddenly gets a hold of you and moves you upwards. And then, your vision gets eclipsed by a giant pair of lips, which press against yours.

Your eyes widen, your arms go limp and your face burns as the giantess kisses you.

For a minute or even more, all you can see, hear, feel are the lips of the giantess against yours. Then, Mesprit finally pulls off, blushing vaguely, leaving a dazed you in her paws.
"You are part of my life now. I love you..." she bluntly admits. All of sudden, your sadness wanes, and you remember why you love this one giantess back.

Confused, you glance at Azelf and Uxie. You discover them staring at their sister with huge blushes upon their faces, mouths wide open.

"Please... if you really mean to leave, let us come with you..." Mesprit begs.

At this point, you can't really think of what else could you say to convince them to let you go... and you discover that you don't really care.

But then, you get one last idea.

If this doesn't work...

"A-Azelf..." you mumble, eyeing the blue mountain.
"M-Me?" she stutters, while moving closer to Mesprit.

"What... what would happen if... if that occurred... around other humans...?" you say, making one last feeble attempt.

Uxie and Mesprit look at you, trying to figure out what are you talking about, while Azelf looks up, seemingly deep in thought.

Perhaps... you finally managed to convince her?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: An argument with the legendaries

choices: Let the legendaries cheer, talk to the human later on
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Girls," you say, trying to make the giantesses reason. However, they totally ignore you as their argument goes on.

"Well... goodbye I guess..." you say as you take a step back. Your words have the extraordinary result to interrupt the argument.

Their gazes land upon you as they stare down at you in silence for several minutes, you staring right back at them.

"... Well?" Mesprit suddenly says, breaking the silence while also taking you by surprise.

Did she... did she just send you away...?

"What?" you ask, dreading the answer.
"What are you waiting for? Lead the way." the pink headed giantess says.

Somewhat relieved, you give out a sigh.
"Mesprit, I don't think you understand. I'm leaving. Alone." you bluntly say.

Mesprit blinks a few times.
"I think it is you that are misunderstanding, dearie," she says softly.

"We're coming along," Uxie clarifies, before blushing.
"I... I honestly don't want to leave you either..." she shyly adds.

"Me neither," Azelf chimes in.
"We like you just as you like us. Why do you think we're doing this?" she asks, making you blush.

Mesprit glares back at her blue sister, before looking back at you with a much softer expression.
"I already told you, human. I can't stay without you any longer. You're... you're part of my life now," she says while blushing heavily, her words sending you too into a state of pure embarrassment.

Not quite knowing how to reply to this declaration, you remain silent.
"Yeah. You are... special to me. I don't want you to leave me... so, if the only alternative is coming with you... so be it..." she says.

Desperate, you glance around, noticing Azelf and Uxie staring at the scene with serious looks. They're clearly determined to follow you wherever you go, no matter what.

How could you dissuade the-

"Azelf," you suddenly say, looking over the blue mountain, who perks up upon hearing her name.

Her golden gaze fixes on your comparatively small form with a curious stare.
"What do you think will happen," you start.
"... If that happens around other humans...?" you make your last, feeble attempt to convince them to let you go on your own.

Otherwise, you don't really know what else to say...

Azelf rises her head, seemingly deep in thought. You choke back a sigh of relief: she must be pondering all the possible, disastrous scenarios that their choice will lead to.

However...

"... ‘That’? Just what are you two talking about?" Uxie asks.
"Nothing..." Azelf promptly responds as she sighs, before loo back at you.

"... Human... you're right. It'd be a... a problem..." she admits, making your previous sigh of relief come out if your mouth.

"But wha-"

"But what other choice do we have? I'm sorry to say, but if you're still intentioned to leave, we're coming with you." she adds, ignoring the glare Mesprit shoots her.

You swallow nervously. That was your last chance...

"I'd like to know why you're feeling so nervous around us," Mesprit says, beginning to tear up again.
"So... is it true? Don't you love me anymore?" she asks, her earlier doubts surfacing again in her mind.

"What - no! I never said that!" you shout, instinctively taking a step forward.
"I already told: I like all three of you - check my emotions if you don't believe me!" you bellow, exasperated. The giantesses remain silent, taken aback by your outburst.

You bend, and your head lowers as you start breathing heavily.
"And how could I not like you?" you continue in a much calmer voice, before looking at Uxie.

"You saved me from freezing to death," you recall, making her blush. Your gaze travels to Mesprit.
"You declared your love towards me," your eyes move on Azelf.
"And you - you're literally one of the nicest living beings I met on this world!" you shout.

"The last thing is wish for is to leave you. But I... have to... please..." you pleadingly look at the three.

The giantesses stare at you for a good minute, before Uxie breaks the silence.
"You've chosen your words unwisely," she says. You perk up.

"Cutie, do you really think that after this small speech of yours we'll let you go, without coming along?" Mesprit chimes in, while gently bending to pick you up.

You can't believe it. What are they thinking? What would happen if people saw them?

...

What if their heat acts up while you're around other people? That'd be bad. Like REALLY bad.

You can't risk that. But the three legendaries seem really determined to follow you...

...

... So, that leaves only one alternative. You DO like them after all, no?

"Alright, you know what?" you say, tossing your bag aside onto Mesprit's hands.
"There's no point in leaving if you come along with me. So," you smile at the three, feeling like your soul was relieved of a huge weight.
"Might as well stay."

Time seems to stop as Mesprit, Uxie and Azelf stare at you for a good while, your statement sinking into their minds.

Then, a sonic explosion roars around Lake Acuity.

--

"WHAT the hell is he thinking?!" Lucario asks from his hiding spot.

He's been watching the human and the giantesses since Azelf brought him back. He saw the human explaining that he had to leave, he saw the violent argument between Uxie and Mesprit, he saw the human talking to Azelf.

It didn't take long for the jackal to figure out what he told her about.

But now, this?! The three legendaries wanted to leave along with him, and he decided to stay! Alright, the human had no other choice, but...

"He's committing suicide..." Lucario whispers to himself.
"What are you planning, human...?"

--

"I knew!" Mesprit shouts while smooching you over and over.
"My sweet little human, you would have never left me, right?" before Mesprit can further cheer, you are snatched by Uxie.

"Thank you..." she says, nearing her lips to your face as she pecks you. You blush.

"Stop stealing my love from me!" Mesprit snaps, irritated.
"Stop claiming him as yours!" Uxie retorts while turning to face her siblings, who growls at her.

You swallow.

Not again...

Before anything can happen, you are psychically snatched from Uxie. The giantess doesn't even notice.

Hovering at 200 ft, you begin to float over Azelf, the titaness closing you instead hug.
"I swear those two will never change," she sighs, before looking at you and smiling.

The giantess lowers her head, and presses her soft lips on your own head, making you blush.

--

Lucario keeps staring at the three cheering giantesses and the human.

‘What to do...?’

After many years, should he go out there and tell the three legendaries why the human should leave?

Or should he simply wait the proper moment, talk to the human again and possibly - hopefully - convince him to get lost?

A few minutes pass, the only sound that can be heard is the joyous cheering of the sisters.

In the end, Lucario takes his decision...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A hard, but happy decision

choices: Mesprit is too curious, and decides to investigate further...
Mesprit decides to let it slide. The day goes on like nothing happened...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Lucario growls lowly, irritated, as he decides to talk to the human later on. So, slowly, the blue jackal retreats back into the thickness of the forest, waiting for the moment the sun will set.

And whenever the human and the legendaries were gone to sleep, he would have had his occasion.

--

Azelf sighed in loud annoyance as she watched her sisters arguing yet again. Though this time the argument was a lot less vicious.

To distract herself, the blue giantess focuses her attention on you, who are still being held by Azelf herself. Mercifully, at a safe distance from the arguing Uxie and Mesprit.

"Hey," Azelf suddenly calls from above. You turn around and crane your neck to have a visual of the giantess' visage.
"Thank you..." she says.

"Uh... for what?" you question. A sad expression appears on the giantess' face as she lowers her head in her paws, to the point where you are standing face to face with her gigantic eyes, two huge golden mirrors that make you feel like a pesky bug compared to this giantess.

"... For... you know... for telling me..." she slowly admits. You take a step back on her paw as your expression drops too.

"I'm sorry, Azelf. I... didn't want to tell that... because I... and them too... didn't want to shatter your hearts..." you explain.

The blue giantess looks down glumly.
"Guess that was valid..." she sighs, still not quite able to believe that she and her sisters, the Guardians of the Lakes, whose purpose was to protect the three lakes... did the exact opposite and terrorized the inhabitants of the lakes by going on a rampage, fueled by lust.

That was a pretty bitter thought for a guardian...

A new thought joins the others in the giantess' mind. That was the reason why the human wanted to get away from Lake Acuity.

According to what he said, the pokemon around the lake told him about their problems. That meant, he needed a protector... they all needed a protector, in case that happened again.

And Azelf was more than just willing to fulfill such task.

The giantess rises her head up again as she looks at you on her paw. You've been staring at her in silence for the whole time, not quite knowing what to say to comfort the giantess.

On the other hand, Mesprit and Uxie are still arguing, and it doesn't seem like they're going to stop anytime soon.

Azelf opts to keep ignoring them. One wrong word, and she would be inevitably pulled into the argument with her two siblings.

That would be one good reason to leave for the human...

"Hey," the titanesses suddenly says while glancing back at you. You perk up.
"Listen, I... I know you still want to leave, don't you?" she says.

You assume a surprised expression, which then turns into a blush.

Actually, she was right. You've been hearing a voice in your mind that told you to wait for the night to fall, for the sisters to go to sleep. And then, you would have had to leave.

You tried to shake off the thought several times already, but the more you tried, the more it came back stronger.

"Uh..." you respond.
"K-Kind of...?" you risk answering.

Azelf closes her eyes and nods solemnly, before sighing deeply.
"Very well... don't," she bluntly says, before opening her eyes again and looking at you.
I know what happened now. I know what will happen..."

You nod.
"Go on,"

"Well... If that happens again... I'll protect you," she declares while giving a determined smile.

You however let out a sigh of exasperation.
"Azelf," you say.
"What if you too... what if you too go crazy with lust...?"

Azelf's smile shrinks.
"Well... I did make willpower, no? I've got more self-control than..." she makes a motion for her still fighting siblings.

And all of sudden, the giantess' smile drops into a frown as she decides she's had enough.
"Cut it out, will you?!" she screams, obtaining her sisters' attention.
"I swear, all you do is arguing!" Azelf exclaims, irritated.

Mesprit looks at her. She ponders answering, but quickly decides against it, not wanting to find herself deprived of willpower again.

Seriously, that sucks.

Apparently Uxie is reasoning on the same line of thinking as she exhales heavily.
"Sorry..." she mumbles.

Mesprit ignores her as she floats towards Azelf, and picks you from her.
"Hmph!" she exclaims indignantly as she hugs you.

You try to catch a glimpse of the blue mountain from Mesprit's grasp.

A truly impossible task, given how large the giantess is.

Luckily, she turns around to face her siblings. And you notice Azelf looking at you, her lips moving.

A non-verbal message. You sigh in frustration. You were never good at lip-reading.

Azelf uselessly tries to make you understand her message, until she grows tired.
‘Deal?’ her voice echoes in your head.

You appear startled for a moment, before looking at her and nodding. She smirks.

Mesprit looks back and forth between you and her sister, before finally asking:
"Just what are you two hiding?" she asks.

Azelf sighs.
"Nothing sis," she responds.
"Really nothing."

Mesprit nods, but can't really shake off the feeling that the human and Azelf are hiding something.

She looks at Uxie. Judging by her expression, she can easily make out one thing: Uxie is just as curious as Mesprit herself is.

Her human and her blue sister are hiding something for sure...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A possible solution

choices: One of the sisters is staring straight at you...
Someone else is in the cave, calling out for you...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Mesprit looks at you, then at Azelf, wanting to find out what you and her are hiding.

But then, she figures that she's not in the mood to fight with Azelf right now.

So, she simply assumes that it was nothing important.

The giantess sighs.
"Okay, fine," she declares, causing you to sign in relief. You then look over Azelf, discovering her smiling at you with a serene expression upon her face.

The giantess' lips move. Somehow, this time, you are able to make out what she's saying:

‘Deal’.

--

The rest of the day passes just as quickly as it started, and it went on like nothing happened. Eventually, the moon found its place in the sky while the sun had left it a while ago.

You are currently sitting in front of a small campfire - which required Uxie's permission, and it wasn't easy to obtain - while the giantesses sit aside, talking to each other.

You stare at the fire intently, trying to forget all the bad events today had brought.

First, Uxie erased your memories. Then, you were told the motivation of such thing. Then, Mesprit and Uxie almost killed each other...

"Human?" Mesprit's voice claims you back to reality.

You look away from the fire to glance up at the giantess. You notice her smiling down at you as she holds a arm out, a pile of berries being offered to you.
"Hungry?"

"... Not really," you reply as the giantess sets the berries down. Your stomach happens to growl in this exact moment, remembering you that you didn't eat anything the whole day long.

Mesprit giggles as she leans down, laying flat on the ground, her gigantic head resting against your body.
"Why are you so sad?" she asks cheerfully, although you detect a feeble hint of concern in her voice.

For a moment, you are tempted to just tell her what you were told.

You feel incredibly bad for not being honest to the giantess who openly declared her love towards you - and more than just once.

But you quickly shake your head to rid yourself from the temptation.

"It was because of earlier," you lie.
"Seeing you and Uxie fighting..." you convincingly shiver at the memory.

"Aw, that?" Mesprit asks as she begins nuzzling you.
"I know, it might have been scary for you, but it happens quite often between sisters,"

"Especially between us," Uxie suddenly chimes in as she moves a bit closer to both you and Mesprit.

The ground beneath you shakes as she sits in front of you with her legs crossed, her heavy eyelids seemingly fixing onto you.

"Tell me about it," Azelf says as she moves up beside you and sits down, all three sisters now encircling you.
"These two literally do nothing but argue with each other. Trust me, what happened this morning was nothing out of the ordinary," she remarks with a sigh.

Uxie huffs loudly while Mesprit glares daggers at Azelf, who starts to giggle in a calm manner.
"See?" she says while eyeing you.

You smile.

That's when a voice resounds within the confines of your mind.
‘Don't worry about that problem,’

You look up at Azelf, noticing her smiling reassuringly.
‘If it happens, I'll be there to protect you.’ she says.

You smile gratefully, slightly comforted by her words.

--

"I think we all should go to sleep," Uxie suddenly says after a while more of talking.
"Today's quite been rough..."

"There's no denying that," you respond as you begin to get up, emulated by the three giantesses.

You start heading to the cave, the three sisters silently following you.

Upon reaching your destination, you stop, letting the giantesses float inside, before stepping in yourself, completely unaware that you were being watched.

Hidden within the thick forest, Lucario noticed the human disappearing inside of the cavern with the legendaries. He decides to wait for a while, until them all were asleep.

Then, he'll have to slip inside, wake the human and talk to him.
The jackal sighs.

This was his last chance to convince the human to leave. And, if he refused, Lucario himself, the human and the whole fauna of Lake Acuity would be doomed.

--

Upon walking inside, you let Mesprit get a hold of you as she lifts you up and floats in a corner of the incredibly large cave.

The ground is shaken by many thuds as the three legendaries lay down, while you are brought up to Mesprit's chest and hugged tightly.

"Night!" the giantess exclaims, her voice echoing within the cavern.

She gets drowsy mutterings from her sisters, before she turns to you.
"Sleep tight, cutie," she says while leaning down as she kisses you.

You blush faintly.
"Ah... you too," you respond as Mesprit snuggles up to you.

Everything goes quiet.

A few minutes pass, and all you can hear now is the snoring of Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie, along with the sounds coming from Mesprit's body.

You relax as you try to forget this hell of a day. But you can't stop thinking about what would happen if the three legendaries really lose control because of their lust...

You shake your head, emptying it from the bad thoughts. Azelf promised she'll protect you... right? She said she has more self-control than Uxie and Mesprit...

You yawn and decide to sleep on it.

Your head leans against Mesprit's chest as you eventually fall asleep, joining the three legendaries in the world of dreams.

--

Your sleep is bothered by a sudden sound, ‘Human’. You ignore it as you move around in Mesprit's hug, trying to get comfortable.

"Human." the voice echoes again within the cave.

You desperately try to cling to your slumber, to remain in dreamland.

But your attempts are for naught: whatever dream you were having fades away, and you wake up.

You groan loudly in annoyance as you open your eyes, your eyelids feeling heavy, almost as if they were protesting against you for waking up.

Dazed with sleepiness, you yawn as you rise your head to glance around, trying to spot whatever bothered your slumber.

Your eyes eventually adjust to the darkness of the inside of the cavern, and you finally manage to spot the cause of your awakening...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A comforting chat

choices: "Alright, fine. Take my memories." you respond, deciding to give it a try
"No deal, Uxie." you respond, refusing to have your memories deleted
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
With your vision blurry from drowsiness, you free one of your arms from Mesprit's grasp and bring it up to your eyes as you start rubbing your eyes.

That's when your eyes manage to detect a color in darkness: yellow.

The indistinct figure begins to assume a shape too, and you soon manage to make out a massive yellow head with two closed eyelids, a red jewel above them.

"U-Uxie...?" you drowsily mutter, too tired to wonder the reason of why she's staring at you in the middle of the night.

The pixie rises her head a bit.
"Oh... you woke up..." she quietly says.

You finally start to regain a bit of lucidity.
"What's going on, Uxie?" you ask.

The giantess blushes a bit.
"Maybe it's not the case, but... I'd like to talk to you... If that's fine with you, of course," she timidly explains.

You yawn.
"Can it wait until tomorrow? When I'm lot less tired?" you ask. Uxie shakes her head.
"I'm afraid not. It's... urgent..." she says, gently extending a paw, removing Mesprit's own hands from you.

Sighing, you stand up on the massive field that is Mesprit and stare up at Uxie.
"Well... I'm awake now anyway, so... okay?" you respond.
"What do you want to talk about?"

In response, the pixie giantess points behind herself, to the exit of the cavern.
"Let us talk in private," she says, her paw moving to you and opening in front of you.

You wonder what she wants to tell you about.

You give a shrug as you step onto her hand, which moves away from Mesprit and brings you to Uxie's chest level. The giantess smiles gratefully, before turning around and starting to float outside, into the pale moonlight.

--

Lucario was just about to enter the cave to try and contact the human again.

He needed to talk to him, he needed to convince him to leave the lake.

For his sake. For the inhabitants' sake. For the sake of the lake itself.

Carefully, the jackal made his first step within the cave. However, he soon noticed someone coming his way.

Uxie!

As fast as he could, Lucario retreated back outside and dove in a bunch of bushes. Just then, Uxie came out of the cave, the moonlight enlightening her whole body, allowing Lucario to notice the giantess' tiny passenger.

"The human?" Lucario whispers, confused.

Just what was Uxie doing with the human in the middle of the night?

The last time this happened, she...

"No..." the jackal whispers with horror. If Uxie erased the human's memories again, he'd be back to square one.

Lucario urgently realizes that Uxie started moving again, in direction of Lake Acuity.

So, hastily, he starts moving into the bushes as he follows, the giantess completely unaware of him.

--

"Here," Uxie mutters as she stops near the water of Lake Acuity.

Gently, the pixie lowers her paw to ground level, letting you hop down.

As soon as the grass touches your feet, your gaze travels back up to the yellow headed giantess, who stares down at you with a small smile.

"So? What did you want to talk about?" you repeat your previous question as you move a bit closer to the blue and yellow mountain.

"Oh... you know... things..." she replies.
"Like?"

"Well, I must say, I am truly sorry about what you saw this morning. Me and Mesprit fighting..." she says, her smile dropping as she assumes an ashamed expression.
"It must have been frightening for you..."

You give a reassuring smile.
"Well... yes. But it all ended good, no?" you chime optimistically.

Uxie smiles.
"Yes. But-" she gives a sigh,
"There's still something." she says.

You give her a confused stare.

The ground beneath your feet quakes as Uxie sits down, her tails rising up to her shoulders and dropping onto them.
"The motivation of why you wanted to leave." she bluntly says.

You begin to tense up.
"I already told it, Uxie, I can't tell you. I-" a movement of the giantess' paw interrupts whatever you were about to say.

"Save it. If you don't want to talk, I'm not going to force you," she says, smiling reassuringly.
"But, you mentioned that you're not leaving anymore, am I right?" she asks.

You quietly nod your head.

Uxie's smile fades.
"And that's the point," she says, earning a confused stare from you.

What was that supposed to mean?

Seeing your confused expression, the giantess hurries to explain.
"You see, I thought that, whatever reason you might have had could still make you uncomfortable around me and my sisters," she slowly says.

You rub the back of your head, not sure of where this is going.

"So, I thought I could do you a favor." she says.
"Favor...?" you ask, all your attention now focused on the giantess.

She nods.
"Yes. Human, I'm going to give you a choice now. Keep in mind that I'm not going to force you to do anything if you don't want and-"

"Just say it, Uxie! Just say it!" you exclaim, interrupting the flow of words.

The giantess sighs deeply as she stares at you with a serious expression.

"Human, I... I can take your memories again... if you wish..."

--

"What...?" Lucario asks himself, dumbfounded.

What kind of offer was that?! The human couldn't possibly accept!

From his hiding spot, Lucario watches the human taking a few steps back, just as dumfounded as Lucario himself.

--

"Wha...?" you ask, not sure you heard good. Uxie nods.
"I can take your memories again. Just... y'know, I'm not forcing you if you don't want..." she shyly says.

"B-But..." you stutter, feeling all the air leaving your lungs.
"It isn't right..." you breath.

Uxie smiles as she readjusts her position.
"Of course it is. You'd only forget about today, trust me. You would also forget the fight me and Mesprit had. That would restore our normal relationship," she reasons.

You however shake your head.
"No no no!" you shout, unable to believe this is happening again.

Suddenly, a strong psychic force grips you as you are moved up into the giantess' open paws.
"Relax, will you? I'll repeat, I'm not forcing you," Uxie says.

You finally manage to calm down a bit.
"B-But... what if Mesprit and Azelf find out again... what if I end up hating you because I can't remember that I consented...?" you asks, dreading all the possible, disastrous scenarios that this might bring.

Uxie smiles reassuringly.
"I will simply tell the truth: you consented... if you accept, that is." she says.

After her statement, time seems to stand still.

You can't believe you're really considering the offer. Uxie's logic was valid.

If you forget, then it'd be easier for you to remain here. You'd forget about all the thoughts about leaving...

Then, your mind speaks up: this is just crazy. You can't be possibly considering it... but then, reality hits you.

You ARE considering it.

A few minutes of silence pass, and the nocturnal breeze blows past you as you look up at Uxie again.

"Take all the time you need to think about it. I understand this is difficult," she says with a smile.

You however already took a decision.

And you soon decide to make it clear to Uxie.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A weird offer

choices: You wake up the next morning
During the night, you are awakened again...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Alright, Uxie," you reluctantly say.
"I accept - you can erase my memories..."

Her logic made sense. If you can't remember that you wanted to leave, then you won't be thinking about leaving again.

Plus, even with their heat problem, Azelf promised she'll protect you from it, right?

And then, Lucario can always contact you again if things go wrong, no...?

Uxie looks surprised.
"... Are you sure...?" she asks softly. You nod.
"Okay... well then... come over here..." she says, extending her paw.

You take a step back as you think about something.

"Wait, Uxie," you say, interrupting her, earning a curious stare from the giantess.
"If I'm not mistaken, my eyes will glow for a bit..." you recall. Uxie nods.

"Mesprit will find out... That's unavoidable..." you ponder something.
"I'd like to do something... something to remind myself that I at least agreed to this..." you say, scratching your head, deep in thought.

Uxie nods her head in understanding.
"I understand. And I think it's a great idea. That might just avoid me another fight with Mesprit when she finds out about this..." she sighs in exasperation.

"Yeah... why does she even do that...? I mean... why didn't she believe that you didn't rape me?" you ask.

Uxie sighs again.
"Love is powerful. Really powerful. But so is jealousy," she tells.
"And my sister is stubborn."

You laugh a bit. Before an idea finds its way inside your mind.
"Uxie - I know!" you exclaim with excitement.

Her eyelids remain closed, but you assume she's looking at you.
"I know how to remember!" you clarify, starting to run in direction of the cavern, taking Uxie by surprise.
"H-Hey! Wait for me!" she exclaims as she hastily gets up, starting to float behind you.

Only once both you and her left, a pokemon comes out of the nearby bushes, looking shocked.

Lucario sits down, thinking about what he just saw.

The human accepted Uxie's offer...

"Stupid human..." he mutters to himself.

--

"Wait here!" you exclaim as you reach the cave, before making your way inside. As expected, Mesprit and Azelf are still asleep, a large amount of space left where Uxie once was.

You quietly walk over your bag, grabbing something from it, before heading for the outside again.

Uxie is patiently waiting for you. You smile, and hold out what you grabbed in a triumphant manner.

A pen.

"What's that...?" the giantess asks.

"It's a pen Uxie!" you exclaim, before eagerly explaining your plan,
"I'm going to leave a message to myself, somewhere I'll surely look at in the morning. And when I do, I'll-" Uxie suddenly perks up.
"... recognize your calligraphy, which would be perfect, because even if I forced you to write, it wouldn't be so accurate!" she concludes, a smile brightening her face up.
"I take pleasure seeing a human with such intellect." she compliments, causing you to blush.

"Thanks..." you mumble in response, before thinking.

Where could you leave your message...? Somewhere where you'll surely look at...

You place a hand on your forehead as you think. Only to instantly remove it as you gaze at it.

Your hand... Perfect!

"I got it!" you exclaim, stretching your hand. You place your pen on your palm as you start writing your message,

If you're reading this,
It means that Uxie erased your memories.
You consented.


"Perfect..." you mumble as you gaze up at the giantess, sliding your pen into your pocket.
"I'm done, Uxie," you say.

The pixie nods, gently picking you up, lifting you up to her face, in front of those gigantic eyelids of hers.
"Whenever you're ready," she gently says.

You look down, backing up a little.
"Does it... Does it hurt?" you ask. Uxie shakes her head.
"Not even a little. I've already done this to you once, and you were perfectly fine... right?" she asks, suddenly sounding concerned.

After all, she left the cave pretty early in the morning. She didn't quite know what effects her actions had on the human.

You nod your head.
"Yes... I felt fine... well, except for the fact I couldn't remember..." you respond. Uxie smiles again.

"Are you ready?" she asks in a gentle manner. You nervously nod as you look at those gigantic eyelids, waiting for them to part.

Slowly, Uxie's eyelids begin to shake a bit before they slowly part, revealing once again a pair of big, golden eyes. You instinctively gaze elsewhere as you bite your lower lip.

"Anything you want to say before... y'know..." she sheepishly says.
"I'll keep it a secret if you want to, and I'll tell you again if I think it's necessary,"

You look down. Should you finally reveal what reason made you want to leave in the first place...?

You decide against it.
"No." you respond, shaking your head for good measure.

Uxie nods as she smiles a little.
"Okay then. Relax, now, just look into my eyes, I'll do the rest." she instructs.

Your gaze remains fixed on her paws. You're starting to have second thoughts about this...

No. It's too late for rethinking, you decide. You've came this far, might as well do it.

You breath in deeply, before slowly gazing upwards, right into the eyes of the giantess. Uxie smiles reassuringly as she makes eye contact with you.

"Uxie... thanks..." you say with a serene expression as all the memories of the past day are wiped away from your mind, leaving you dazed.

Your eyes start glowing yellow.

"U-Uxie...?" you ask upon noticing the giantess holding you, her eyes closed as always.
"W-What are we doing here... in the middle of the night...?" you inquire.

The giantess looks surprised.
"O-Oh... you woke up... damn..." she says.
"... What are you doing...?" you ask.

Uxie giggles nervously.
"You see, you were having a nightmare. I thought the clean air of the lake could help, but, it did the opposite and woke you up..." she sheepishly explains.

You let her words sink in and nod, too tired to question Uxie. You yawn.

"You're still sleepy, aren't you?" the pixie asks,
grabbing your arm in her paw, making sure you don't see the message.

You nod.
"That's weird... I can't seem to remember what nightmare I was having..." you say.

Uxie shrugs.
"I'm sure it's better this way," she responds.
"Now, let's go back to sleep, what do you say?" she asks you, starting to float inside the cave.

Uxie moves over Mesprit, gently placing you down onto her chest, before laying beside her. Mesprit's paws find their way around you in less than a minute.

"Sleep tight, dear," Uxie chimes.
"Uh... thanks. You too." you respond.

You close your eyes and lay your head against Mesprit's chest, yawning drowsily.

And, soon enough, you drift off to sleep.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Forgotten problem

choices: Maybe it's a good time to reveal it, Azelf decides...
Azelf shakes her head, not wanting to tell it... yet...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Human sweetie~ wake uuup~"

Your eyes remain shut.

"Come on... there's a day of fun ahead of us~"
"... Just let me sleeeep..." you complain as you turn in your sleep, desperately clinging to whatever dream you're having.

"No deal~ wake up~"

Something started gently shaking you. You cry in annoyance as you try to keep on sleeping. But it's all for naught.

Your eyes open.

At first, all you manage to see is an indistinct mass of blue and pink. But then, your vision becomes less blurry, to the point you manage to see clearly one of the three legendary giantesses - your favourite.

Mesprit.

Upon seeing your open eyes, the giantess giggles merrily.
"Good morning, sweetie~" she says, pulling you in a hug.
"Slept well?"

You rub your eyes.
"Yes, actually," you respond, happily returning Mesprit's hug.

Slowly - very, very slowly - Mesprit breaks the hug, letting you stand on her cupped palms as she holds you in front of her face... her smile fades.

"...What?" she mutters as he notices your eyes. Gleaming yellow.

"A-Again?!" she exclaims, glaring.
"... What did I do?!" you exclaim.

Mesprit doesn't respond. She gently bends, and puts you down, before looking around.

Her eyes fix on Uxie, still sleeping in a corner of the cavern. Mesprit angrily moves over her, before rising her paws in the air and roughly slamming them onto Uxie's chest.

"OW!" the yellow headed pixie cries in pain, waking up instantly.
"What the hell do you want?!" she shouts, enraged.

In response, Mesprit points to you.
"You did that again - why?!" she asks, while Uxie gets up, looking at you.

"... He agreed." she responds. You stare at her confused.

Mesprit snarls.
"Should I believe that? You who-" the giantess' never gets to finish.

"I'm. Trying. To sleep." Azelf mutters annoyed, interrupting.

Uxie and Mesprit totally ignore her.

"... He agreed!" Uxie resumes.
"I did make an offer, and he accepted!"

"Offer?! What kind of offer was that?!" Mesprit shouts.

"Girls..." you timidly try to step in, obviously failing in doing so.

"You know what - you just raped him again, didn't you?!" your heart leaps in your chest as you hear this, before you realize you don't recall Uxie doing such thing...

Actually, you don't recall ANYTHING of the past day you discover...

"I..." you try to say, but are interrupted by the loud argument.

Which soon comes to an end when Azelf shuts her eyes open and abruptly gets up, glaring daggers at both her siblings.
"Arceus, you two, I swear - what is going on?!" she cries with annoyance.

Mesprit points to you.
"THAT is happening!" she shouts.

Azelf glances at you.
"He seems fine..." she comments. Mesprit huffs, before scooping you up and bringing you in front of her sister, whose eyes close into two tiny slits.

Only to open up again a second later.
"A-Again?!" the blue giantess exclaims, before fixing a stern gaze on Uxie.
"SERIOUSLY?!"

"He agreed!" Uxie repeats.

You had enough.
"Just what is going on?!" you shout at top of your lungs, finally managing to get some attention from Mesprit.

"Uxie erased your memories, sweetie..." she admits dejectedly, in a much calmer tone.

Your heart skips a beat.

"Yeah. And we'd love to know why..." Azelf continues, eyes fixed on Uxie.

"Did... did you do something wrong, dear?" Mesprit asks you, although she's certain about the answer.

"I-I don't know... I can't remember it..." you state quite predictably, holding your arms up.

"Wait... what's on your hand...?" Azelf asks, noticing something scribbled on your right palm.

"W-Wha...?" you ask, confused, as you glance at your palm.

You hastily read the message, feeling the air leaving your lungs.
"What..." you mutter breathlessly as re-read the message over and over.

"What's that...?" Mesprit asks concerned, your surprise detected by her.

"I-I..." you mutter.
"I... agreed to... to Uxie erasing my memories...?" you say.

To your surprise, Uxie starts nodding.
"Yes. It was your idea. To remember that you consented," she clarifies.

Mesprit frowns.
"Really?! Who assures you didn't force him to write that message?!" she asks, glaring at Uxie.

"Wait, Mesprit," you interrupt.
"This... This is my calligraphy... I don't think Uxie forced me... it's perfect..." you mumble, unable to believe this all is happening.

Mesprit looks at you.
"Cutie...? Are you sure?" she asks. You nod.

Uxie starts giggling bitterly, her feelings not escaping Mesprit.
"Such a clever little human - he predicted that. It was his idea, he knew he would have recognized his calligraphy, as he knew he would have looked at his hand," she compliments, gently patting your head.

"S-So... y-you really consented to it...?" Mesprit asks, gently picking you up, staring right at you.
"But... why...?" she asks, before recalling that you can't remember it.

Her gaze travels to Uxie.
"Why, Uxie? Why did he agree?... Why did you want to erase his memories in the first place?" Mesprit asks dejectedly.

Uxie sighs.
"... Because only this way he could be truly happy around us, after he... y'know..." she says. You look at her curiously, wondering what does she mean. Though, you decide to keep quiet.

Mesprit slowly nods her head in understanding.
"Cutie..." she says, but never gets to finish as Azelf suddenly floats forward, snatching you from her sister and pulling back, staring at you like you were crazy.

"Are you insane?!" she exclaims.
"You didn't have to forget what you told me!" Azelf exclaims while shaking you back and forth in her paws, almost as if trying to make you regain your lost memories by doing so.

"B-But... w-what did I tell you?" you ask, feeling nauseous as well as scared.

"Yeah, sis, what are you talking about? What did the human tell you? And for Arceus' sake, give him back!" Mesprit exclaims, snatching you back in her paws, squeezing you in a protective hug.

Azelf sighs as she calms down a little.
"The human. He told me something important... like REALLY important..." she reveals dejectedly after a moment of hesitation.

"And what's that...?" Uxie inquires. Azelf looks at her two siblings, then at you, pondering if she should reveal what you told her about, or if she should keep quiet about it.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A rough morning

choices: It's Mesprit, searching for you... looks like she overheard...
It's Vaporeon. She was just searching for you and Lucario to join in...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Your eyes fully adjust to the darkness of the quiet cavern as you spot a familiar figure standing by the entrance.

A bipedal jackal.

"L-Lucario...?" you drowsily call out as you yawn.

"Yes," he responds while walking closer to the sleeping Mesprit, who is still holding you in her embrace. Even though she's asleep, the giantess still has a good grip on you.

"What do you want?" you ask, annoyed by the lack of sleep. All you wished for was to sleep on the hellish day you had... and now, Lucario woke you up.

And for obvious reasons, you believe.

"Get down, human," the jackal whispers from below, careful to not disturb the sisters' sleep.
"You and I need to talk. Again." he adds in a somewhat annoyed voice.

You fix on him a tired gaze, before rolling on your side as you readjust, while closing your eyes again, opting to ignore him. Hopefully, Lucario will give up and will leave.

Sadly, you have no such luck.

"Human!" the fighting type indignantly hisses upon realizing that you're ignoring him.
"This is serious! Get down here!"

You huff, not even opening your eyes.
"Can't we talk later on?" you ask, determined to avoid confronting Lucario again.
"I'm tired. Come back tomorrow..." you add, before yawning.

You get no response.

Then, a flash of blue light enlightens the cave as an explosion resounds.

Your eyes shut wide open as you shift on your other side, noticing a few rocks falling from the partly destroyed ceiling of the cavern.

Uxie murmurs some words of annoyance in her sleep, before quieting down.

Your gaze travels down to Lucario, and you take notice that he has his paws cupped, a cloud of smoke emanating from them.

"Are you insane?!" you hiss as quietly as you can as you stare daggers at him. He shoots you an even colder stare as he firmly points to you, then to the ground.

The message is clear.

Wanting to avoid him waking the legendary sisters, you decide to do as he wishes. So, you slowly and carefully start to squirm and wiggle your way out of Mesprit's grasp.

Once you finally manage to break free, you stand on top of Mesprit's bosom and look at her, checking if she felt any of your movements.

The giantess' eyes remain sealed but, oddly enough, her arms begin to move as she sleeps.

It's like she felt the sudden lack of you. Mesprit is indeed asleep, but she needs you back in her slumber. Her arms move around as she tries to detect you anywhere on her body.

A moan escapes her mouth,
"Human... Don't leave... Please..." she mumbles, giving you a close idea of her dreams.

You smile, genuinely touched by the idea that you even occupy her dreams.

You kneel, and gently start to pet the giantess' chest.
"I'm not leaving, Mesprit," you reassure.
"Wouldn't dream of it," you add with a chuckle, although perfectly knowing she can't hear you due her being still asleep.

Regardless, your words seem to sink into the giantess as her arms begin to relax, clasping together to the point where you were laying before.

You give the giantess one last pat.
"See you later," you whisper, before standing back up and looking back at Lucario, who is staring up at Mesprit, his arms crossed in an impatient manner.

"Will you hurry up?" he remarks, causing you to huff.

Carefully, you slide down Mesprit's side and land in front of the jackal, making eye contact with him.

"... Let's go."

--

The nocturnal breeze blows past you as you make your first step out of the cavern.

You stretch as you yawn again, Lucario walking past you. You follow him.

You and the bipedal pokemon walk into the forest, and keep going for a while. Not a noise can be heard, except the cries of the nocturnal pokemon

"Hope we don't run into those perverted Sneasel," you suddenly break the silence, gaining a curious stare from Lucario.
"I'm here from a day, and they've already left a quite bad first impression," you recall.

Lucario sneers.
"You've already told something like that when we first met," he recalls, before his gaze returns serious.

"But, we're not here to talk about that." he says, suddenly stopping to look at you.

You halt as well.

"And what do you want to talk about?" you rhetorically ask, already knowing what reason led him to enter the cave, disturb your sleep and almost wake the three sisters up.

Lucario huffs as he detects the sarcasm in your tone.

"You changed your mind, human," he bluntly says.
"Why."

You shrug.
"They wanted to come along with me. I couldn't risk that..." you reply.

"... You know, right, that you could be leaving this exact moment, while they sleep?" Lucario asks.

"Yes," you respond.
"Thing is - I don't want to."

Lucario flinches.
"Come again?" he asks.

You nod your head.
"I've been thinking about it for the whole day..." you admit, before sighing a bit.
"The chance that they - the legendaries I mean - might get crazy scares me, alright... but, they like me... and I like them the other way around," you explain.

The black and blue pokemon sighs.
"And does it sound like a good motivation?" he asks, his arms crossing as he sets a stern gaze on you.

"... Yes...?" you risk replying, before shaking your head.
"Look... I've told Azelf about it," you admit, ready to receive harsh words. Which you deserved, since you broke the blue giantess' heart.

However, Lucario gives a simple response,
"I know," he says.

You glance at him questioningly, but decide to go on,
"Well... She told me that she's going to protect me if... if that happens," you explain, before putting a finger over your mouth.
"She also mentioned that she's got more self-control than her sisters do,"

Lucario flushes red.
"Well... that's true. She wasn't as destructive as her sisters were during that rampage..." he sheepishly admits.
"... Still-"

Lucario abruptly interrupts himself as a noise is heard.

"... What's that?" you ask as both you and the jackal look around to spot the source of the noise.

Your gaze lands upon a bush, which is shaking.

You lightly tap Lucario's shoulder, motioning for the bush. He eyes it with curiosity.

"Who's there?" you call out, not bothering to hide your nervousness.

Your call goes unanswered, and the bush keeps on shaking. Muffled sounds can be heard, and they're coming from this one bush.

"Show yourself!" Lucario growls from beside you, his gaze locked on the bush, which abruptly stops shaking.

You take a step back, watching a something - or rather someone - comes out...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A mysterious listener

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
You stay silent for a few moments, pondering on your decision.

Behind you, Mesprit keeps talking:
"Please... Don't leave me... I love you..." she whispers.

The words make your heart skip a beat and your blood freeze up in your veins.

She said it. The right words that successfully shattered your internal resistance.
"You know what?" you say.

For a moment, Mesprit's heart stops as she senses your resolution. Is her human still irremovable on the decision of leaving...?

You slowly wiggle out of her grasp and leap onto the back of her hands. The three giantesses stare at you intently, eager to see your next action.

Mesprit's heart resumes its beating as, and her mouth lets out a joyful exclamation as she sees you take off your bag, throwing it aside on her fist.

"I'm not going anywhere." you reply, turning around and hugging the wall of fur that is the giantess' chest.
"I'm here to stay."

A moment full of electricity follows your statement.

The emotions of the three sisters begin to pile up, only to explode at the same moment.

A sonic explosion roars through the whole Lake Acuity as the three legendaries let out three high-pitched cries of joy, causing your ears to ring for several minutes after.

However, you don't have time to pay it any mind. Roughly, Mesprit grabs a hold of you again as she brings you up. You have your idea of where you are heading.

You find you were right as the giantess hastily pushes you against her lips and starts pressing them into you repeatedly.
"Cutie! I knew! I knew you would have never left me!" Mesprit chimes, not quite realizing that you're running out of air, smothered by her lips.

Luckily, you are saved by Uxie, who suddenly snatches you from her sister's paws. Mesprit festive expression suddenly changed into a frown.
"Uxie-"
"I need hug him too, sis," she says with a smile, before turning to you.
"And you, what do you say? Will you forgive me for what I've done to you...?" she asks, the hope in her voice ringing in your ears.
"Uh, sure!" you reply.
"... As long as my memories stay where they are from now on." the pixie smiles.

True to her word, Uxie embraces you. The display of affection makes you laugh a bit as you hug back. All your problems seems to have vanished, replaced by the sheer happiness of the now reconciled sisters.
