"Well, now I want a hug too." Azelf suddenly chimes; roughly, you are picked by the pixie, who, ignoring Uxie's protests, hugs you too.

Like you did with the other two, you hug back. Then, you find the giantess leaning forward.

For some reason, you imagine that she wants to kiss you... instead, her lips stop inches from your left ear.
"Keep quiet about it," she whispers, causing you to look at her.
"It'll be our secret. I'll handle it." she says.

You smile at her.
"Deal." you reply. Azelf's eyes close again as she resumes hugging.

--

Unbeknownst to you and the legendary sisters, your earlier suppositions were right. For the whole time, you have been watched.

Initially, it was to check if the human told who spoke to him about the problem.

But then, the situation took a drastic change. The human changed his mind.

"What the hell is he thinking?!" Lucario growls as he watches you, hidden by the vegetation around the lake.
"He's committing suicide!"

"Not necessarily," Vaporeon remarks, sitting beside him.
" Should we talk to him again?" she says.

"Do you see any other choice? If that human stays here, the sisters will be 'helped'; if the sisters are helped, they become dangerous. And once the human is disposed of, they'll come and get us..." Lucario says, placing a paw on his forehead as he sighs exasperatedly.

"Lucario, I've been thinking," Vaporeon says.
"What if the legendaries won't kill him? I mean, Mesprit seems to truly love him..."

"I know," Lucario distractedly responds as he steps back.
"But they'll end up going crazy if he keeps 'helping'. Though Azelf still didn't have her fix." he points out.

A few minutes of silence pass.
"We'll talk to him again, make another attempt," Lucario mumbles as he starts to walk away.
"And if he's so willing to stay..." he glances behind himself one last time.
"So be it." he says, starting to walk away.

Vaporeon watches him leave, before shaking her head and walking in the opposite direction. Right towards the lake.

The water type notices the three legendaries still cheering about the human's decision.

However, his gaze suddenly travels on her, locking on her. Vaporeon stares back at him for a moment, before leaping into the water, disappearing from eyesight.

--

"What are you looking at?" Uxie asks upon noticing you staring at the Lake. However, looking herself, she finds nothing wrong.
"Uh? Nothing." you reply.

That was a lie.

You've seen the same Vaporeon you've apparently seen three times already.

You frown.

Where you being spied on again...? Should you expected something?

Uxie shrugs, before smiling.
"Hey, look. It's already midday," she says.

You, currently being hugged by Mesprit, look at the sky. Surely enough, the agitation, the meeting with Lucario and Vaporeon, the violent argument between Uxie and Mesprit and in the end the cheering for your decision to stay... all of these took away half of the day.

Only then, your stomach reminds you that you haven't been eating since you woke up this morning.
"Heh... I totally forgot to eat..." you say.

Azelf and Mesprit's stomachs choose this moment to act up too. Being pinned just above the belly of Mesprit, you experience what might be compared to an earthquake... or, several earthquakes...

Uxie chokes back a laugh.
"Let's get something to eat."

--

"You coming?" Mesprit asks you as she and her sisters hovers beneath the shade of a few trees.

After eating to fulfill your missed breakfast, the three opted to take a nap. It is nice to see them going along with eachother again.

"Uh, I'm not that tired," you respond.
"I'll take a walk or something, I guess."

"Suit yourself." Mesprit says with a shrug and a giggle.

--

Once the three are asleep, you lean back against a tree and wait from anything to happen. Apparently, things travel fast around this lake.

In fact, a figure suddenly emerges from said lake.

Vaporeon.

The water type carefully checks if the legendaries are asleep before walking up to you.

"Hi there." you say, giving her a light pat on the head. In response, Vaporeon nuzzles your hand, before looking at you.
"Vap." she says.
"Uhh..."

Vaporeon remembers how you misunderstood her intentions just yesterday, so she hurries to point to you, then to herself. Then, the water type walks in place before motioning to the forest.

"You want me to follow you?" you ask. The quadruped pokemon nods her head.
"You want to talk to me again?"

Again, she moves her head upside down, meaning that you're right.

Someone wants to 'chat' with you again...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A happy choice

choices: Suddenly, you hear the sisters' call... they're searching for you...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Alright, lead the way," you tell the quadruped water type.
"Time to settle this once and for all."

Vaporeon briefly glances at you, before nodding her head slightly as she begins to venture into the forest. You walk behind her.

You briefly look back at the sleeping legendaries: they're still soundly asleep, meaning that you'll have plenty of time to finally put an end to the idea of leaving.

Vaporeon silently walks in front of you, leading you to a mysterious location. You imagine that she's bringing you to Lucario.

"Let me guess, you didn't like the fact that I don't want to leave anymore, did you?" you suddenly break the silence. Vaporeon turns around, looking at you with those big blue eyes of hers. Her head makes a up-down movement.
"Well, I really couldn't help but stay. The legendaries were so sad..." you remark.

In response, Vaporeon looks at you weirdly, before turning her head back as she keeps walking, silence falling in between the two of you again.

--

After a while of walking, the small water type comes to a halt in a clearing.

You stop beside her, taking notice that there's no one but you and her.
"There is nobody..." you point out, confused.

Earlier today, Lucario told you about a pokemon meeting, in which you apparently had a part. Now, while not expecting such thing as another meeting, you at least expected the human-speaking pokemon, who didn't show up.

Your attention is drawn as Vaporeon rises her head, letting out a cry:
"Vaaaa!" she exclaims.

Before you can question about it, you notice the vegetation around you moving.
"W-What...?" you stutter as you notice a Glaceon coming out of a bush, a Buizel coming out from another, a few Starly and Staravia taking place on the branches of the trees around.

Soon enough, the whole clearing is filled with pokemon, who form a circle around you and Vaporeon, who sits down beside you, looking at the crowd of pokemon.

And then, your attention is caught by one last pokemon showing up: Lucario.

The moment he steps into the clearing, his crimson gaze finds its way to you.
"Hello, human. We meet yet again," he says with his signature growly voice.

"Yes." you respond as the gazes of all the pokemon land upon you. You glance around, looking at the variety of pokemon, trying to estimate how much there are. An impossibly hard task.

You also take notice of the expressions of these pokemon. Save for some who wore sympathetic looks, they didn't appear much friendly.

"This was the same situation of last night. You already know why you are here, don't you?" you shift your gaze on Lucario as he talks, while walking closer to you. You don't even think about it.
"My decision." you reply.

The jackal nods.
"Yes. You don't want to leave anymore; you were supposed to." he says, causing the crowd to start murmuring.

"As a matter of fact, I don't." you flatly reply, digging your hands in your pockets in subtle defiance.
"And why, may I ask?" Lucario says, though he already knew the answer.

You notice Vaporeon, who is been quiet so far, starting to bark something at Lucario.
"Yes, I know, those three love him," he says, causing you to blush.

"Gla! Gla!" the Glaceon from before suddenly speaks from the crowd.
"Didn't the idea of what those three could do to you convince you enough?" Lucario translates.

Recalling what he said earlier, you shiver. The idea of what the giantesses could do with your dead-

"I don't want to think about it, thank you," you state while trying to relegate the thought in the depths of your mind.
"Yes, it initially scared me. But then, I just realized that those three are more harmless than you all think."

Lucario huffs.
"Harmless? Rampaging is harmless? Because they've done it several times already," he states, before looking at the crowd.
"And that is another thing. We just discovered why no one can remember Uxie doing that: she apparently erased the memories of some of you," he speaks to the pokemon, getting several pokemon to let out cries of surprise.

"It was really embarrassing..." you recall what the pixie told earlier, earning the indignation of her sisters.
"That's no good reason," Lucario replies, exasperated.

"I'm not telling it is. I'm just telling that, perhaps, their heat is not so bad... I mean, they didn't lose control yet, right?" you say.
"Keep 'helping' them, see if it's bad or not," Lucario tells.
"But the point is: you still need to leave," this gets you to huff, annoyed.

"I don't know how many times I've heard that word today," you state.
"Look. I don't mean to, alright? I have my reasons to believe that they'll keep themselves under control," you recall Azelf's promise, ‘I'll handle it’. However, you can't tell that. You would reveal to these pokemon that you actually broke the giantess' heart.

You're not sure of how would these pokemon react.

You look around, noticing them staring at you intently with expressions of fear and annoyance. Though some were even of comprehension.

"Chu?" a Pichu suddenly speaks up. Lucario briefly looks at it.
"How can you tell?" he translates.

"I... have a... a feeling...?" you hesitate.

"Bui!" a Buizel says.
"That's not enough." Lucario says.

The jackal then crossed his arms.
"Look. Do you see how many pokemon are there here now?" he asks, annoyed.
"Yes?"
"Well, you do know that you're putting all our lives, yours included, in danger, right?" he asks again.

You casually look down as you notice Vaporeon staring up at you with a pleading expression.

You sigh in frustration, before turning to the crowd.
"Listen, all of you," you tell, earning curious stares from every pokemon.
"You said you didn't want to break the sisters' hearts, right? Think, what would happen if I left?" you ask.

All the pokemon start murmuring, Lucario and Vaporeon included.
"That's... that's a good point..." Lucario admits, his paw traveling to the back of his head as he rubs it in an exasperated manner.

You smirk proudly, before speaking again.
"Listen up. I say, just give me some time, alright? I'm sure that the legendaries won't lose control," you remark.

Lucario perks up as a few pokemon speak.
"And if they do?" he asks.

You stare at him with a dead serious look.
"Then, I will leave." you state.

Once again, the crowd of pokemon starts murmuring.

They keep it up for a while, before Lucario looks at you again.
"Alright, human. Here's the deal: if those sisters won't lose control again, like you say, we won't bother you anymore," he says.
"But if they do, you'll leave?"

You nod.
"Yes." you say.

All the murmuring quiets as you speak. Lucario nods.
"Alright. Now go back to them. And keep your eyes open," he warns.

"Fine." you reply as you turn around, starting to walk away.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Reminescences of the meeting

choices: Azelf brings you back to her sisters
"But first... I-I kind of need something..." she says embarrassed...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Human!"
"Where are you?!"

These two screams echo through the whole forest. You recognize the voices: Uxie and Mesprit.

You mentally slap yourself. You totally forgot they were asleep. Most probably, they woke up and, not seeing you around, they must have assumed that you left while they slept.

Meaning, they're searching for you.

You look back at Lucario.
"I gotta go. Like now." you urgently tell, getting the jackal to nod his head.
"Alright, go. But be careful," he warns.
"Watch out for those three."

You quickly nod.
"I will," you say, starting to walk away from the clearing.
"See you around!" you exclaim as you enter the forest again, leaving Lucario, Vaporeon and the whole pokemon crowd behind.

--

You run through the forest, in direction of the lake. You're afraid that if you don't find the legendaries soon, they'll jump to conclusions and they'll really start thinking that you left, while you only really took a walk to find Lucario and the other pokemon.

Your run comes to a halt, though, as a blue titaness you recognize as Azelf comes out of nowhere. Your feet lift off the ground, and your heels stop your run.

Azelf notices you too late; the giantess manages to brake herself, but such rough stop causes her tails to dart forward, knocking you onto your back.
"Ow..." you cry in pain.

"Sorry... I didn't notice... you..." Azelf apologizes from above, before realizing who she hit.
"Human!" she suddenly chimes.

You sit up, just in time to notice the giantess bending to grab a hold of you and scoop you up.
"Where were you? We thought you wanted to leave again!" Azelf scolds.
"Azelf, relax! I wasn't trying to leave!" you shout, rubbing your aching back.

Azelf's eyes narrow. You notice them glowing blue.
"You weren't trying to leave...?" she asks again. Once again today, the answer is forced out of you:
"No!" you say. The giantess' stop glowing, and get lidded by her eyelids as she sighs in relief.
"Stop playing with my willpower!" you cry, irritated.

"Sorry. Just making sure." Azelf apologizes, her eyes opening back up.
"But we were worried! Me and Uxie woke up and found Mesprit screaming! She found that you weren't there anymore, and she thought you left while we were sleeping!" Azelf explains.

"I told I didn't have the intention to leave anymore; I meant it, Azelf," you firmly reply.
"All I was doing was exploring around, nothing more!" you lie.

"I know, I know," Azelf says.
"But, remembering about earlier, it wasn't the first thing we thought..." she explains in an apologetic tone.

"No problem, I guess..." you sigh. Azelf smiles a little, before thinking about something.

"Hey, speaking of which, what you told me earlier... was it all true?" she asks.

You look at her.
"Yes. All of it... at least I think..." you reply, scratching your head.

The giantess' head tilts.
"You think...?" she asks.
"Yes... I was told it, so I'm not completely sure..."

Azelf nods.
"When will the season end?" you question the blue giantess.
"More or less, two weeks," she responds.

You feel a lump forming in your throat. You forcefully swallow it as the color drains from your face.
"T-Two weeks?!" you ask.

Azelf nods.
"Yes. But don't worry; if those things really happened... I'll make sure you will be safe... safe from us..." she assures.
"What if you'll really lose control?" you ask her.

Azelf shivers at the perspective.
"Promise me something," she says instead of replying.

You look at her, confused.
"What?"

The giantess looks at you.
"If my sisters, and I too, will lose control, get crazy with lust... promise me you won't run away. Find a good place around, hide until the season is over, but don't leave us... just promise me that you won't leave..." she says.

Your mind goes back to the promise you already made to Lucario, and to the whole crowd of pokemon.

Regardless, you find yourself speaking:
"I promise."

Azelf smiles down at her paw moves towards her bosom.
"Thanks." she says, the paw pressing you against her chest. The other soon joins in as Azelf hugs you.

You sigh, before hugging back. Azelf's smile widens. For some reason, the closeness to this human makes her feel... good. She usually distrusted humans, but this one little guy easily gained her and her sisters' trust, along with Mesprit's love.

What was so special about him...?

A while passes quietly, before Azelf pulls off, breaking the hug.
"We... we should go back now..." Azelf mumbles.

You agree with her, but soon discover her staring right at you intently, not moving of an inch. You also notice that her blue cheeks are covered by a red shade.
"Uh, Azelf?" you call out.

"Huh?" she says, startled, like she just broke out of some kind of trance.
"Uh, aren't we supposed to be going back to your sisters?" you ask, recalling what she just said.

The giantess' cheeks grow even redder.
"Oh... y-yeah, we sh-should go..." she replies.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Afternoon worries

choices: "...Fine I guess..." you reply. Keep Mesprit company for a while
"Uh... I'm pretty tired too... can't we go to sleep?" you ask
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Azelf looks at you in her paws as she feels her nethers starting to burn with lust. Her heat picked the worst moment to act up.

"Azelf? Are you alright?" you ask the titaness, concerned for her well being.
"I-I..." Azelf stammers.

It would be so easy! The human already helped Uxie and Mesprit, right?

She just has to ask you to help her with her problem...

Her problem... the one problem that caused so many others... but she needed...

No.

Azelf shakes her head in an almost frenetic pace. She can't...

"AZELF!" you suddenly shout while thrusting your hand in her fur.
"U-Uh?" the giantess asks as she opens her eyes to look straight at you.

"What is going on with you? Why do you look like you're in pain?" you ask her. Azelf grits her teeth.

She has only one chance to tell you. Can she tell it? Should she give in? After all... just for once...

"I-I h-have..." she says, determined to reveal it. Right before thinking about Mesprit.

Her sister had openly declared her love towards the human... and more than just once. Azelf's mouth closes back up; Mesprit and Uxie are still wandering around the forest, unaware that their sister was the one that found the human.

If Mesprit catches Azelf in the middle of her 'fix'...

The giantess swallows loudly, repelling the image of herself facing her sister's wrath. Then, Azelf looks back at you.
"I-It's nothing... just a headache... you know, being a guardian, you've got that a lot..." she lies, justifying her weird behavior.

You slightly tilt your head.
"Sure that you're alright? Can I do anything?" you ask, still worried about the giantess.

Azelf smiles. This little one was sure caring...
"Don't worry, I'm alright... It'll go away in a bit," she replies, before her heat makes her grunt in pain again.

Knowing that the won't be able to resist it for much longer, Azelf quickly ponders what to do.
"Come on... let's go find my sisters now. They're still searching for you..." she says.

You nod your head, silently agreeing as Azelf turns back, floating deeper into the forest in search of Uxie and Mesprit.

--

"Human! Where are you?!" Mesprit calls one more time, feeling her eyes starting to grow wet.

She couldn't believe it. Her human left her while she was asleep.

She had woke up, and her precious little love wasn't there! Of course, with the events of the morning, it wasn't hard to figure out why. The being of emotion felt betrayed. Was that why the human refused to go to sleep with her when she offered him to?

He abused her trust, and he was gone!

Before Mesprit could start crying, though, a noise got her attention.

Rustling.

She looks around, spotting a few plants shaking, producing the sound.
"Human?" the guardian asks, hopeful.

But her hopes are shattered as a yellow headed pixie comes out.
"Nope. It's just me, Uxie," the newcomer tells, before assuming a sad expression.
"I'm sorry Mesprit... I-I couldn't find him..." Uxie then says.

In response, Mesprit leans forward, letting herself fall into the open paws of her sister, tears starting to run down her face. Saddened, Uxie embraces her sister, pulling her closer.

Just then, Azelf comes out of nowhere.
"You'll never guess who I..." the blue giantess abruptly stops as she notices Mesprit crying in Uxie's arms.

But, nonetheless, she got her sisters' attention; Mesprit rises her head to look at Azelf, while Uxie points her closed eyelids on her blue sister.

Or, more specifically, on the tiny human held up by her blue sister.

Mesprit is the first to react.
"Cutie!" she screams, darting forward.

Unlike she had been earlier, Azelf is now unable to avoid her pink headed sister, who grabs the human from her and closes him in a hug.

"You were trying to leave again! Why?! Why were you-" Mesprit shouts, not sure whether should she feel happy or mad.

You, however, interrupt.
"I wasn't trying to leave again! What, can't I walk around anymore?" you ask.

Mesprit releases her grip on you and glares down at you.
"We were worried! I was worried! I thought you wanted to leave me again!" she scolds.
"Yeah, well I didn't! In fact, here I am!" you snap back.

Before you and the giantess could further argue, you are stopped by Uxie, who floats closer.
"Now, before you say or do something you might regret..." she says, picking you from Mesprit, holding you in front of her yellow face.

"Now, you weren't leaving again, were you?" she asks.
"No."
"Is it the truth?"
"Yes."

"It is, Uxie," Azelf suddenly perks up, earning her sisters' attention.
"I made him talk - just making sure, Mesprit!" she quickly defends as she sees her sister's glare.
"...And he wasn't trying to get away again."

"Exactly. Just exploring around a bit," you lie with a convincingly serene voice.

The moment these words come out of your mouth, Mesprit roughly grabs you again, and hugs you tightly.
"Oh, cutie forgive me! I'm sorry for yelling at you, I was just really worried!" she says sorrowfully.

"N-No problem..." you breath, feeling your bones aching from the tight hug. You look at Azelf and Uxie.

"Help..."

--

The rest of the day fades away quietly. Aside from Mesprit's way-too-heartfelt manner of apologizing, nothing much went on.

No more questions were asked as the three sisters were content with your explanation, ‘I was just exploring around’.

Though, you felt observed. Naturally, with all of Mesprit's attention focused on you, it would be obvious to guess why, but you really felt weird.

But your questions were answered when, at some point, you discovered Azelf staring at you intently.

The blue giantess was probably keeping an eye out on her sisters. They were helped, the heat won't act up for a few days now... but she had to make sure nothing bad happened to the human or to her sisters.

--

Eventually, the moon takes the sun's place in the sky.

"Did stealing willpower ever work to find a mate?" Mesprit casually asks as she swallows a mouthful of berries.
"Uh..." Azelf blushes.

The conversation had been going on throughout the whole 'dinner'. You contended yourself staying aside and listening them talk, not really wishing to be the object of their speeches.

But eventually, your and their meals finish.

Uxie gives a satisfied sigh, which is followed by a yawn.
"I'm full. And I'm going to sleep." she says as she gets up.
"Already?" Mesprit huffs.

Uxie shrugs, before floating off.
"Think I'm going too..." Azelf yawns, getting up and following Uxie.
"You two are no fun!" Mesprit shouts as they leave.

Right then, Mesprit looks at you.

For a few moments, you look at each other, before a smile brightened Mesprit's face.
"Cutie~" she says, reaching out for you.

"You're not going too, are you? Would you like to keep me company for a while?" she asks, lifting you up to chest level.

"... Why? What are you up to?" you ask. Mesprit snickers.
"Nothing special~" she replies.

You scratch your head.
"Uh... well...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Back with the Trio

choices: Maybe... it's a good time to tell Mesprit what you know?
No way! Insist that you can't tell!
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Uh, sure?" you reply. Mesprit's smile widens, becoming a grin as you finish your sentence:
"Why not?"

Not even a second after you had said that, you are pulled forward at light speed as Mesprit encloses your comparatively small body in a tight hug... too tight.

"Thank you!" the giantess chimes excitedly.
"C-can't... breathe..." you say as you feel the oxygen leaving your lungs. You feel like those, along with the rest of your organs could pop out of your ribcage at any moment.

Darkness starts to fill your eyesight. But, luckily, Mesprit breaks her hug. You ungracefully drop onto her soft hand as you inhale deeply, greedily filling your lungs with air. Regardless, you still feel the pain of the way-too-loving hug.

"Hehe... I'm sorry..." Mesprit apologizes as she starts to caress you with her free paw.
"Couldn't resist, I had to give you little cutie a hug~"
"Ah... Ahh..." you respond with the talkativeness of a Magikarp out of water.

"Warn me the next time..." you whisper, making the giantess giggle.

--

"Feeling better?" the pink headed guardian asks you as you sit up.
"Better than before for sure..." you reply, feeling your sore bones starting to stop aching.

"I'm sorry," Mesprit repeats, before grinning down at you again.
"But now, as I was saying before, we're going to do something really nice together~" the giantess says.

"...What?" you ask, trying to hide a hint of fear. You had already experienced Mesprit's games, and you found that she had manipulated your emotions.

You also found that you didn't like her playing with your emotions.

However, your fear doesn't escape Mesprit's senses.
"Aw, why are you scared? I'm not going to do anything to you!" she says, her smirk shrinking into a reassuring smile.

To empathize her sentence, the pokemon giantess lowers her head on her hand, right where you are standing. Her lips press into your whole being as she kisses you.

Your fear suddenly fades, but it's replaced by embarrassment as your cheeks flash bright red. Mesprit pulls off and snickers.

"Uh..." you say, sounding much like a Slowpoke who found that a Shellder just bit its tail. Mesprit giggles.

"...So, what are you up to?" you opt to repeat your previous question, not quite knowing what to say.
"Well, I just wanted to do something together, you know," she says.

The ground below quakes lightly, and your world shakes as the giantess lays down on her back, her large paws keeping your far up in the air.
"Okay...? What, exactly?" you ask.

"Well, we've been pretty... close, right?" she asks, one of her eyes closing as she winks. You blush, but awkwardly nod your head.
"Then, I believe that I can tell you a bit more of our story," the giantess states.

You, however, look at her confused.
"Your story...?" you ask, not recalling any story.
"Don't you remember our little game~?" Mesprit recalls.

Your mind is filled with memories of you staring at a glaring Mesprit while she-
"Oh!" you suddenly exclaim with realization.
"That story!"

Mesprit nods with a smiles.
"So? Would you like to hear more?" she asks.

You, however, shake your head.
"... Are you going to play with my emotions again?" you ask her. She giggles.
"Nope. Not this time," she says, reassuring you a bit.

"Okay? Why not?" you respond, making her smile brightly.
"Good." Mesprit says, gently lowering you, setting you down on her chest, rising her head to better see you.

Her smile fades as she begins her tale, bad memories filling her head. You sit down on the smooth ground, your arms wrapping around your knees as you listen.

"As I already told you, me and my sisters were beaten, the Lakes were reduced to nothing," she starts.
"I remember it like it was yesterday. Humans attacked us. They... they hurt us," she says with a glare, her voice contorting into one of hatred. Hatred for the people who hurt her and her family.

You nod, starting to feel concerned.
"Go on," you say, signaling that you're listening.

"Do you know what I remember?" Mesprit asks instead. You tilt your head, curious.

"I remember opening my eyes. I could feel pain in my whole body. It hurt so much..." she closes her eyes. You start to pity the three sisters.

"Yeah..." Mesprit continues, clearly feeling your pity.
"It hurt. But, at least, humans didn't catch me or my sisters. I... I think that wasn't their intention. But, nonetheless, my body was in pain, I felt broken. Me and my sisters, we guardians weren't able to protect the Lakes. That's pretty bitter, you know," she states.

"I can imagine it," you reply.
"I remember getting up. Azelf was still fainted. But Uxie - Uxie. She was sitting in front of Lake Acuity, crying as she watched her destroyed Lake!" Mesprit says with a voice your can't decipher. Sadness for sure, pity as well... but you can't really understand what else is present in her tone.

"... What happened then?" you ask.
"You already know," Mesprit responds, gazing at the starry sky.
"That day, me, Uxie and Azelf made a deal: protect the Lakes at every cost. And never, ever trust humans," she says.

For some reason, her facial expression shifts into a serene one as the giantess gazes at you.
"And then, like ten years later, my sister brought home one little human who managed to steal my heart," she says, making you blush.

But then, her expression changes again, into a sad one.
"And then, my sister had him help her, she erased his memories and I found that he wanted to leave me," she adds. You suddenly understand what the tone she used earlier was: jealousy.

After the last remark, she goes quiet for a while. You do as well, not finding anything good to reply with.

But, suddenly, Mesprit speaks again.
"Funny thing," she says.
"When Uxie took your memories, she didn't even know she was being watched." she states.

You freeze up.
"... What do you mean?" you ask, feeling a crushing weight on your heart.
"You know, this morning, I was thinking about what Uxie did to you, when a Lucario and a Vaporeon come out. They told me everything that Uxie did to you la-" Mesprit abruptly stops upon sensing your surprise, along with sudden fear.

The giantess looks at you, those golden disks that are her eyes staring deep into your soul.
"... You already know about this, don't you...?" Mesprit asks, realization hitting her.
"The pokemon you mentioned. Were they the Lucario and Vaporeon?" she asks.

You swallow nervously, but don't reply.
"Did those two tell you what Uxie did around here? Is that why you wanted to leave?" Mesprit asks with both curiosity and concern, her earlier doubts coming back.

"It's not that..." you timidly respond. In response, Mesprit tilts her head.
"Then... why? Why did you want to leave? Will you tell me at last?" she asks.

You're in cage. Mesprit wants to know again. Sure, she's in a better state of mind than she was earlier today, but you're not sure if she'll believe you or not.

Also, for what you know, she could think Lucario just mistrusted you, and came up with an excuse to make you leave. As a result, Mesprit would go hunt him and Vaporeon down.

However, you're sure that Mesprit would believe you... right?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Continuation of Mesprit's tale

choices: Mesprit wants to explore your new abilities further...
Mesprit yawns. She wants to sleep for now...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"No, Mesprit... I... I can't tell you," you say.
"Yes, you CAN tell me," she says with decision, determined to find out whatever reason might have made her precious human want to leave her.

However, you shake your head.
"No Mesprit," you firmly reply.
"You wouldn't like to know it, trust me,"

The giantess stares at you intently, before sitting up. Gravity works against you, and you fall down from Mesprit's chest.

You hit the ground before you can even scream, though you soon take notice that you actually hit Mesprit's paw, which she usefully moved to catch you.

"Of course I won't like whatever reason made the only one creature I ever loved want to leave," she says, making you blush.
"I just need to know. Please..." she pleads.

You however remain firm on your reasons.
"No. I... I simply can't, Mesprit. You'd probably hate me..." you say.

The last statement causes Mesprit to perk up.
"I would never hate you!" she says with indignation.
"I'll repeat it: you're the only one guy I ever loved so far, and you're probably the only one I'll ever truly love." the sentence makes you blush.
"So, again, why did you want to leave?" she questions again.

You remain silent.
"I don't like this discomfort of yours, you know," Mesprit continues after a quick check to your emotions.
"So, don't you think it'd be easier if you simply talk?"

You shake your head.
"I simply cannot say it Mesprit. I'd... It'd shatter your heart. I don't want that..." you say, letting yourself fall on your rear onto Mesprit's soft hand.

The giantess closes her eyes, and inhales deeply.

And then, she decides to change her approach. If insisting didn't work...

"I love you, human," she says, not opening her eyes.
"I really do."

The titaness suddenly opens her eyes and moves the paw holding you to her face. Before you can even formulate an answer, you find yourself being pressed into Mesprit's face.

"D'you feel how strong this love is?" she asks, applying more pressure, pushing you against her face more as she begins nuzzling you softly.

That's when the red jewel on her forehead starts to glow. Though none of you notices that: Mesprit has her eyes closed, and you are currently too busy being shoved into her right cheek.

You pull back, and are about to reply, when you actually do FEEL it. The love emanating from the pink headed giantess, along with her genuine concern for what you don't want to say.

"... Mesprit, I really feel it!" you suddenly cry, bringing an open palm to your forehead.
"See? It's really that stro-"
"No, I mean, I literally feel it!... Since when I'm empathic?" you ask yourself, confused.

Mesprit's gaze shifts into a curious one. And you feel her curiosity too.
"Empathy?... How can this be?" she asks, just as confused as you are.
"I dunno." you reply.

Mesprit thinks for a moment. Before a smile spreads wide on her face.
"You and me - we've been so close that... I must have accidentally transferred some of my power to you!" she exclaims. This gets you to look up at her, flabbergasted.

"What?" you ask.

"That makes sense. Now you should be able to feel others' emotions!" she exclaims, before looking at you weirdly.
"I wonder..." she then says, her previous conversation with you completely gone from her mind, replaced by this new discovery.
"Focus. What do you feel from me?" she asks.

You focus.
"... Excitement?" you say. Mesprit nods.
"Good. Now, try to modify that." she instructs.
"What?" you ask, even more confused.
"What do you mean, ‘modify’?"

"Yeah, try to change the excitement into sadness." she repeats.
"...And... How do I do that?"
"Focus on my excitement and try to change that."

You nod, and focus on the emotion emanated from the giantess. Not quite sure of what to do, you imagine it was sadness and look up at Mesprit again.

She didn't even blink, she's still looking at you expectantly. But, not feeling any alteration in her emotions, the giantess huffs.
"Nope, I think you can't modify emotions... yet. Maybe, with a bit of training..." she ponders with a hint of delusion.

You both go quiet after her last remark. She thinks about the possibility that you might even be able to manipulate emotions, while you're still trying to process what happened within the past hour.

It started with Mesprit, who wanted to know why you wanted to leave and now you're suddenly empathic. Really weird how life can change in a matter of minutes.

"Truly amusing," your train of thought is stopped as your attention is drawn by Mesprit's voice.
"It's... Simply wonderful that you've got my power... at least some of it now. It makes us even closer!" she suddenly exclaims, embracing you.

Again, you feel love emanating from the pink headed guardian. Not quite sure of what to think, you hug back.

The embrace lasts for a while, before your attention is yet again drawn by the giantess as she...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: An empathic gift

choices: "A-Alright... I-I'll help..." you stammer. You agree to help Azelf
"A-Azelf, w-we can't..." you stammer. You refuse to help Azelf
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:

"Okay, here we go," the giantess says, giving a slight smile as she hovers upwards. Once she's at several feet above the ground, she glances at her lake one last time.

"You don't mind flying instead of teleporting, do you?" she distractedly asks while contemplating the lake below.

Recalling the feeling of nausea you felt whenever you were teleported within the past day, you quickly nod.
"Absolutely." you reply.

Azelf's gaze finally shifts elsewhere. The blue mountain looks at you, smiles and proceeds to fly in direction of Lake Acuity, leaving Lake Valor behind.

--

You both keep quiet for the whole trip back to Uxie's lake. For some reason, Azelf is flying really slowly.

Suddenly, the air gets colder, suggesting that you're almost there.
"Hey," Azelf suddenly calls. You turn back, discovering her staring at you with a smile.
"Yes?"

"Thanks again for... you know..." she says, blushing. You blush as well as a vague smile appears on your face.
"Don't even say that."

Azelf's smile fades.
"Please... not a word about it..." she mutters pleadingly. You nod your head.
"It'll be a secret, trust me." you tell, making the giantess smile again.

Just then, Azelf hovers above a noticeable lake. Even from this height, you can see two large heads, one pink and the other yellow.

Azelf flies down. Apparently, her sisters noticed her: the two heads suddenly turn in your direction.

--

"Okay, where the actual hell were you?!" Mesprit verbally assaults Azelf as she fully descends to the ground.

The pink headed giantess searched for her sister and the human in the whole Lake Acuity. However, it was like they vanished! And Mesprit had her suspects of what the two of them could have been doing behind her back...

"Relax, sis. Just flying around. I needed to talk to the human," Azelf calmly replies.

Mesprit gazes at you. Soon enough, you find her paws reaching out for you as the giantess grabs a tight hold on you and picks you from her blue sister, grabbing you in a hug.

"Now you've gotta tell me: what did you do?" Mesprit asks you. You look up, straight into the golden eyes of the giantess.
"Nothing, Mesprit. Really nothing. We just talked." you answer untruthfully.

Mesprit nods.
"But-" Uxie starts to feel cut out. She places a paw on Mesprit's shoulder as she speaks up:
"Come on Mesprit, they didn't do anything," she reassured, before pointing her closed eyelids at Azelf.
"Right?"

"Of course."

Mesprit finally lets herself smile.
"Alright!" she says cheerfully, her quick change of mood surprising you. The giantess gazes at you sweetly.
"Truthful and loyal." she remarks.

You suddenly feel bad. Luckily, Mesprit doesn't seem to detect your negative emotions as she hugs you.

--

The sun completely sets.

Nothing much went on after your return to Lake Acuity. Just Mesprit's usual displays of love and what you assume are the usual speeches of the three legendaries.

However, you take notice that Azelf doesn't mention what you told her at all.

She must have decided to wait for a better moment...

After a quick dinner (if fish pokemon for the three sisters and a bar of chocolate you luckily found in your bag can be called that) the three decide to hit the hay.

--

"You coming?" Mesprit calls as she enters the cave after Uxie and Azelf.
"Coming," you reply as you look back, at the dark depths of the forest.

Looking into the thickness of it, you swear you see a pair of crimson eyes staring at you... you blink several times, and the eyes disappear.

Must have been your mind tricking you, you guess as you walk into the cavern.

Mesprit picks and hugs you against her chest.
"Night, girls!" she exclaims, getting drowsy, incoherent mutterings in response.

The giantess turns to you, and presses her lips on your head.
"You sleep tight." she says.
"You too." you reply, stroking the giantess' fur with hand, making her emit pleased sighs.

Then you both go quiet.

Within a few minutes, Mesprit is asleep. Shortly after, you fall asleep too.

Only then, no longer hearing noises, a figure rises and hovers beside Mesprit.

"I don't like playing with other's minds," Azelf whispers as she floats closer to you, who are being held in place by Mesprit's paws. The serene expression on both your and Mesprit's face makes her smile.

"But it'll be impossible for you to leave once you've met the real Lake Trio."

Her eyes glow blue as she looks at you intently, your own eyes briefly glowing of the same color underneath your eyelids.

Content with her actions, Azelf returns to her original spot beside Uxie and lays back down, closing her eyes as sleep finally claims her...

--


Your eyes open. You sit up, then stand up as you take a look around, noticing that you're standing before Lake Acuity.

Weird.

You remember going to sleep inside of the cavern...

Your blood freezes within your veins as you remember about Lucario. He told that you participated to a pokemon meeting. However, he didn't mention that you actually agreed to do so.

Were you taken away from the three sisters again...?

Your attention is drawn by a noise you don't recognize at first. But then, it gets stronger as the bushes around start to shake.
"W-Who's there?" you ask, fearing, as you finally make out what the noise is.

Giggling.

You look around, trying to find where it's coming from, when suddenly you are grabbed by your neck from behind.

Startled, you look back, finding yourself face to face with... Mesprit?!

It's Mesprit alright, but something's wrong... she's one foot tall!

"Hi cutie!" she chimes as she rubs her head against yours.
"M-Mesprit...?" you stammer, incredulous.

The pink headed guardian giggles.
"Yep. Not just me though," she says, pointing at something behind you.

You look backwards, and air leaves your lungs, like you were just punched in the stomach.

Floating there are Azelf and Uxie, one saluting you with both paws in a cheerful manner, the other quietly smiling at you, paws clasped behind her back.

"...Okay. What is happening?" you ask as calmly as you can.
"Well, we figured that our sizes might be a little scary for you," Azelf says, floating closer to you, emulated by Uxie.

"But with our original sizes, you are the giant! Look at you!" Mesprit chimes as she grabs a hold of your neck again, pushing her head against yours, lovingly rubbing it against your left cheek.
"We figured that like this..." Uxie speaks up.

Mesprit releases you as the three float in front of you.

"It'd be easier to play!" they exclaim at unison.

Recovering from your initial surprise, you stare at the three and laugh a bit. Who could have guessed that the three giantesses were in reality one foot tall each?

You wake up, taking notice that you're not laying on the smooth, warm fur of Mesprit anymore. Instead, you're laying on the hard, cold stone ground of the cavern.

You feel quite dazed, and your mind clings to the last remains of your previous dream about the sisters. You flush red.

Was it just a lucid dream...? The sisters didn't really shrink, did they?

You sit up, rubbing your eyes, before opening them and glancing around. Around you, two titanesses called Azelf and Uxie are still sleeping soundly.

However, Mesprit is nowhere to be seen, a large space where once was her body is left in her place.

Yep, it was just one big, lucid dream... or nightmare...

Confused, still dazed with sleepiness, you feel your stomach growling softly.

Almost feeling like you don't want to do anything, you stumble to your backpack, take a hold of it and start dragging it out of the cave.

The blinding sunshine hits you, making you close your eyes. Doing so, you don't notice a familiar, pink headed giantess shifting her gaze on you.

"Good morning, lovey!" Mesprit greets you with a smile. Before you even know it, she had already grabbed you in a hug. You feel her gigantic lips landing right on top of your head.

"Mornin'..." you say with a yawn.
"Looks like you really can't stay without me! I've left the cave only five minutes ago!" she says cheerily.

You ignore the comment and yawn again, before freeing your arms from her grasp and opening your bag, searching for something edible.

You let out an irritated sigh as you take notice that your food is running short, thanks to those cursed dark type weasels who stole most of it when you first came here to Lake Acuity.

Sensing your irritation, Mesprit perks up, looking down at you with concern.
"What's wrong, dearie?" she asks, releasing you and letting you stand on her open palm.

The giantess suddenly wears a worried expression.
"You're not planning to leave again, are you?" she asks.

"Then, what's up with you?" she asks again.
"I'm running out of food," you bluntly reply.

Mesprit's face brightens up again.
"That's it? Well, let's go get some then!" she says cheerily.

"No." you reply, surprising the giantess.
"What? You just told me you're running out of food..." she repeats your words.

"Actually, for some reason, I feel like I don't want to do pretty much anything right now."

Mesprit's smile fades away as she tilts her head.
"You don't want to do anything?" she questions.

Mesprit doesn't respond. Once again, she can feel her heart pounding the walls of her chest.

The giantess gently puts you down and watches as you sit down and lean back against the stone wall of the cave, closing your eyes.

Luckily, Mesprit shakes her head back and forth.

You shrug.
"Well, I don't know. Nothing happened last night. I just went to sleep..." you reply, before remembering about your dream.

You flush red again. And your embarrassment strikes Mesprit's senses.

Azelf... did she make the human want to help her with her own heat?

Mesprit clenches her fists as she feels her ire rising.

You, however, are unaware of this as you recall the weird dream you had.

Can you tell Mesprit what you dreamed about? Would she be offended by it?

Sensing you growing flustered, Mesprit lowers herself.
"Whatever happened. Tell me." she says in an imperative voice, startling you.

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
The three sisters start circling around you, doing some kind of dance, sending you into a state of happiness.

The pokemon of Lake Acuity told you they were dangerous...
how can you believe it anymore? These three are the very own embodiment of harmlessness!

Then, they suddenly stop; again, Mesprit grabs a hold of your neck as she hugs you again. You hug back, before feeling a foreign weight dropping onto your right shoulder.

Looking to the side, you notice that it's Azelf, who hugs your head, smiling.

Before you can react, a third body hugs your torso. It doesn't take long to realize that it's Uxie.

You remain like this for a while, before hearing Mesprit talking:
"Now, ready for some fun?" she asks innocently.

You nod your head. But what kind of fun she was talking about, you'll never find out...

Suddenly, your surroundings begin to wane. The Lake, the forest and the three sisters fade away.

You open your mouth to scream, but no sound comes out of it.

And then, darkness...

--

You wake up, feeling quite dazed. You rub your eyes as you try to recall the weird dream you had.

What just happened?

Lost in the memories of that dream, you barely register a voice calling out a single word:
"Human."

This voice is very low, but you still detect the growly tone in it...

Your eyes open up fully. The first thing you notice is that you're still held in place by Mesprit's paws; second, the legendaries are still asleep; third, the voice keeps calling out for you:
"Human... Human..."

You slowly and carefully wiggle your way out of Mesprit's embrace and stand onto the wide surface of her bosom. The effect is immediate.

Sensing the lack of you in her sleep, Mesprit starts flailing her arms around, mumbling incomprehensible, incoherent sounds as she tries to find you anywhere on her.

One decently-articulated sentence gives you an idea of her dreams:
"Cutie... don't go... don't leave..." she cries.

This causes you to smile as you decide to help the giantess deal with her nightmares.

Kneeling, you place your hand on her fur and start stroking her.
"Not going anywhere, promise," you whisper. Your words, paired with your petting, seem to have an effect: Mesprit's arms slowly relax back into their original place on her chest, her mouth closes back up, shifting into a smile.

Smiling, you turn your attention to the side. You walk to the end of her chest and look down, spotting a very annoyed-looking Lucario staring up at you with his arms crossed.
"Will it take anymore time?" he grumbles, before adding:
"...Are you afraid of coming down?"

You huff as you slide down Mesprit's side, landing before the jackal.
"Hello again," he growls.
"Hello," you respond, looking back at the sisters.
"Should we go for a walk? This place doesn't seem... appropriate." you remark sarcastically as you start walking towards the beginning of the cave, Lucario following.

Soon, the moonlight and a pleasant breeze greet you into the quietness of the forest.

"We need to talk, human. Again." Lucario says as he catches up with you.
"I know," you reply.

"You changed your mind. Why?" he asks, getting straight to the point.
"Easy. I never really wanted to leave," you admit.
"Your tale scared me alright, but then... I simply decided to trust them, alright?" you say.

Lucario huffs.
"Do you know what results your decision will bring?" he asks.
"Yeah, yeah, them losing control, going crazy and going on a rampage," you recall, stopping to face the jackal, who stops as well.
"But, who guarantees that?"

Lucario smirks.
"Everyone around here." he says.
"Good point," you admit.
"But you know what? I told Azelf."

Lucario looks confused.
"You told Az-" his eyes shut wide open.
"You told Azelf about what the heat makes them do?!" he asks.

You nod. The black and blue pokemon face palms.
"You knew we pokemon didn't want to do that! You broke her heart!" he says, pointing an accusatory finger.

"Yes. Yes I did. But she listened, understood and believed me," you retort.
"And she assured that she's going to handle it."

"Really? What if she's the first to lose control?" Lucario remarks.
"Well, she controls willpower, no? She should be able to keep herself under control." you reply. Right before remembering how she couldn't earlier today.

Lucario is seemingly reading your mind.
"Well, too bad she isn't," he says.
"And that brings us to the point. You should really leave. For your sake, for us pokemon's sake, and for this whole lake's sake."

You, however, shake your head.
"I'm sorry, but I can't," you say in a convincingly sorrowful voice.
"You told me the you didn't want to break their hearts, right?" you recall.

Lucario nods.
"You did..." he points out.
"I know," you huff.
"But, have you thought about what would happen if I left?" you reason.

Lucario doesn't even blink.
"I know what you're saying," he says.
"Sure, they'll be heartbroken... until this cursed season is over, and they'll be back to normal. They'll probably won't be so loving like they're now then. If you manage to survive until the season is over," he says.

"You say that," you snap back.
"I trust them, alright? Now, I've gotta go back if you don't mind," you tell, starting to turn around.
"See you around," you remark with a smirk.

Lucario watches you leaving for a moment.

"Should have known," you mumble as you see a very familiar black and blue pokemon walking out of a bush, his crimson eyes staring daggers at you. You're pretty sure why.

"Hi." you salute despite his clearly unfriendly glare.
"Hello, human," he responds as her walks closer to where you are sitting.
"We meet again." he adds, making you smirk.

"Can't really figure why..." you joke. However, the stern gaze Lucario gives you tells you that he isn't in the mood for jokes.
"Cut the sarcasm, will you? This is serious!" he cries.

In response, you glare at him and turn your head to the side, gazing at the giant wall that is Mesprit's side to check if she woke up.

Luckily, she didn't and your gaze returns to Lucario.
"Keep your voice low." you say, earning a nod from the jackal, who inhales deeply. You begin to get up.

Lucario patiently waits for you to get back on your feet before speaking:
"We need to talk again, human," he says.
"I figured that out..." you respond.

"You don't want to leave anymore, human," he begins, quite predictably.
"As a matter of fact, no." you bluntly reply.

"And you may realize: it's a problem," the jackal remarks as he starts walking around you.
"Ever considered that, maybe, it won't be so bad?" you answer, looking at the sleeping mountain that is Azelf.

You recall the promise she made, ‘I'll handle it’.

Your attention is drawn by Lucario again.
"It won't be so bad? Human, you are risking. We are risking," he says, putting particular emphasis on the word ‘we’.

You wait for Lucario to calm down a bit. The black and blue pokemon sighs, before continuing:
"We all are risking. You, me and every other pokemon around this lake!" he exclaims.

Again, you glare at him and look at the three sleeping giantesses.
"Quiet!" you hiss, turning your head to face him again.


Lucario lowers his head and starts inhaling and exhaling heavily.

Then, his crimson gaze rises up again as he looks at you.
"Why, human?" he asks.
"Why don't you want to leave anymore? You're in danger. Those three - they can't control themselves, you know it. So why... Why risk your own life?... As a matter of fact, why do are you even attracted to those three? They're pokemon, you're human..."

"Do I look like I care? Mesprit openly declared her love towards me. Who am I to judge love?" you respond.

"It's lust, human. The heat made her talk." Lucario replies. Your start to grow tired of this argument.
"Yeah? The heat made her also try to kill her own sister?" you remark out loud.

You cover your mouth with your hands, and you lower your head, intently staring at the floor, avoiding Lucario's gaze.

You wait to calm down before speaking again:
"Lucario," you start in a serious voice.
"Would you ever leave the only one creature that called you ‘the love of my life’ so far?" you ask, before looking at Mesprit.
"Even if it was while she was... um... trying to eliminate her sister..." you add.

"If I knew my mate could be a threat to me, I WOULD leave her..." he says with a smirk.
"It's the heat season for me too, you know. And I'm losing my time here with you instead of actually finding a mate." he says.
"And that's the point: you need to leave. Preferably, right now, while those three sleep..." he points out.

You sternly gaze at him.
"I won't be doing so." you respond.

Lucario drops his smirk.
"You need to." he says.
"No, I don't." you reply.

"You're putting yourself in danger. And us as well."
"Trust me, I'm not." you snap back.

At this point, the jackal goes quiet, and stares at you coldly.

"You know what?" Lucario suddenly asks, sounding exasperated.
"Do as you wish!" he then shouts.

Uxie moans in her sleep. Alerted, you look at the giantess, then at the jackal, glaring at him for the third time while pressing your index finger on your lips, non-verbally expressing yourself, ‘Shut up!’.

Lucario's mouth closes as he looks at you coldly again, before turning around and starting to walk away.
"When those three lose all control," you hear him whispering.
"Don't say we didn't warn you."

With that, he disappears into the forest, engulfed by darkness and vegetation. You give a triumphant smirk as you walk up to Mesprit again and lean back against her body, letting yourself slide back into your previous sitting position.

You cross your arms behind your head and your eyes close as you breath in fresh air, enjoying the afternoon breeze that blows around the lake.

While you relax, you start thinking. Now that you've dealt with Lucario, pokemon around here should leave you alone... right? After, the jackal said ‘Do as you wish’...

You're not sure of what to expect now, though. If Lucario is right, Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie will lose control someday, and they'll starts using you like a common toy, a common toy whose only purpose would be to sexually please the three giantesses until you break...

The image is a horrible one to think of. However... Azelf assured that she'll handle it...

... Hopefully, she will... Right?

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Your attention is caught by a sudden stretch of a massive pair of arms suddenly rising, along with a loud noise that you register as a yawn.

Thinking that it might be Mesprit waking up, you quickly get up and walk away, fearing that she might roll over and crush you into dust.

However, your fear turns out to be for naught as you notice that Mesprit is still very asleep; the gigantic arms fall back down on, and you notice they actually belong to Azelf. The giantess places her paws on the ground as she helps herself sit up.

The blue headed pixie blinks a few times after waking up and drowsily glances around, spotting you staring up at her.

"Hey," Azelf says.
"Hey," you reply as she yawns again.

The titaness then fixes her gaze on you as she stares at you in silence for a couple of moments.
"Come over here," she then says, patting a patch of grass beside her.

Curious, you nod and walk up to her, where her massive paw rests on the ground. You sit on the back of her giant hand. And then immediately regret doing so as the giantess rises it up in the air, bringing you in front of her monolithic eyes.
"Can we talk for a while?" she asks.

You blink a few times, confused, before quietly nodding your head.
"Sure," you respond.
"About what?"

In response, the giantess lets herself fall back down on the ground, which quakes softly, while her paw shakes making you fall off your perch.

You let out a cry of surprise as you hit something soft. Startled, you get back on your feet, realizing that you fell onto the giantess' chest.

Her paw lowers and her head rises as she gives a small smile.
"S-So?" you stutter, still startled.
"What did you want to talk about?" you ask.

Azelf's smile wanes.
"The things you've told earlier..." she says, effectively getting you to listen.
"Was it all true?"

You sit down on the soft ground and nervously bite your tongue as you look elsewhere, while nodding your head. Azelf's gaze travels up to the sky, her facial expression shifts into one of sadness.

"And we call ourselves guardians..." she bitterly mutters.

Your heart sinks at the statement.
"Look at the bright side," you say, trying to cheer the giantess up.
"At least, it didn't happen yet... so, now that you know it, you can keep yourself under control, no?" you tell

"I suppose..." Azelf responds.
"I mean, if my sisters try anything, I can steal their willpower. But..."

"...But...?" you ask, curious about her line of thinking.
"But, what will happen if I too lose control? If I end up going crazy? Who will keep you safe then...?" Azelf asks, mostly to herself.

"Can't you tell them too?" you ask. Azelf shakes her head.
"No. I know them, they'd be heartbroken for Arceus knows how long..." she replies.

You go quiet, not finding anything to reply with. The giantess quiets down as well, her gaze avoiding yours. An awkward silence falls between the two of you, interrupted only by the snoring of Uxie and Mesprit.

Until Azelf suddenly perks up and looks at you.
"Do you think... can... can I hug you?" the giantess asks, blushing.

The question makes you blush too.
"What?" you ask.

You don't get the chance to repeat your question, though, as the giant paws of Azelf rise up and fall down upon your body, pushing you against her chest. The sudden display of affection makes you flush red. And you notice Azelf's lips curling into a smile.

"I feel better," you hear her whispering as she gazes down at you.
"Thanks." she adds.

"Uhm... No problem?" you ask, taking notice of the paws on your back starting to move, dragging you up to the giantess' cyan face.

"Uh..." the question never leaves your lips as Azelf's suddenly move, pressing themselves into your face. It's just for a moment, before the giant pair leaves your face, revealing a blushing you.

"What was that for...?" you ask, embarrassed.
"Just a small sign of my appreciation. For telling me the truth." she says, placing you back down on her chest and releasing you.

You sit up, and try to physically shake the blush off your face, before looking at the smiling giantess again.

"So, what's it like?" you casually asks.
"What?" she asks.
"Being so big... What's it like?" you repeat, trying to change topic to rid Azelf's mind of its previous line of thinking.

Azelf's smile fades as she looks at you intently, wondering the meaning of such question.
"It sucks." she bluntly responds after a bit.

You're taken aback by such bluntness.
"A-And... why, may I ask?" you question.

Azelf closes her eyes and sighs heavily.
"Simple really. This size might be useful for protection, but what did we trade for it? The chance of making any friends. The possibility of keeping a mate. And, last but not least, it turns out we're dangerous to our lakes during this cursed season..." she explains.

You mentally slap yourself. Why did you have to ask a question worse that made Azelf even more depressed?

"You know, you're a really good listener," she compliments with a bit of a smile.
"Quite cute, too..."

The last remark causes you to blush.

"You know, it's comforting to know that me and my sisters can still make friends with someone... because, we're friends, right?" she suddenly asks.

You smile.
"Definitely." you reply, making the giantess smile again.
"Good." she giggles.

"Yep. We're really good friends..." Azelf repeats. Though, this time you detect something within her voice.

Something somewhat familiar...

"REALLY good friends..." Azelf repeats for the third time. Your smile fades, and your heart pounds your chest as you notice what it is.

Lust.

You quickly recall that Azelf wasn't 'fixed' yet. And, if she's anywhere similar to Mesprit, you know that she's going to be delirious without carnal satisfaction.

However, recent discoveries left you unwilling to 'help' again.

"Y-Yeah, that's right. We're really good friends. Now, could you let me down, please?" you ask, while desperately looking over her still sleeping sisters.

Damn.

Azelf looks at you and blinks innocently.
"Why? Going somewhere?" she asks.
"N-No... just need to drink..." you lie, cursing your not-so-firm voice.

Azelf grins at you.
"Oh, then I'll come with you. I need something too..." she says seductively while winking.

You swallow.
"Az-" you are interrupted by a large finger covering your mouth.
"Shh... You know what I need, don't you?" she asks rhetorically.

You back up onto the giantess' body, her paw falling onto her chest.
"Azelf, you're just delirious!" you shout, trying to make her snap back to her senses.

"Probably..." she says with the last remains of her lucidity.
"... But I need this so much..."

You need no further confirm: Azelf is really delirious.

And you do the only thing you can think of in this situation: your turn back and run across her gigantic body. Jumping down isn't an option, so you opt to run to the side of Azelf and try to slide down. Hopefully, the giantess will have a hard time in catching someone so minuscule on her monolithic body.

However, all your plans are shattered as you suddenly stop and fall down, your body deprived of willpower.
"Heh, you clever little one, you caught me by surprise," the giantess says.

Soon enough, you feel her gigantic hand wrapping around your immobile body.
"But now, I'm not in the mood for games. I need help," she says, starting to get up.

You gaze at Uxie and Mesprit. Still asleep...

"Azelf, stop this! You told me you weren't going to lose control, remember?!" you purposely cry at top of your lungs for two reasons: one, to wake the two sleeping sisters; two, it might actually work to make Azelf snap back to reality...

And, while your shout only made Mesprit moan in slight annoyance, it definitely started something in Azelf.

The giantess'movements cease as she looks at you, looking dazed. You soon realize that it's her soon-to-fade lucidity, which is trying to fight back her lust.

"Yeah! You told me you'd protect me, don't you remember?!" you press on, watching as the giantess grabs her head in her free paw, letting out a cry of pain.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A chat with the giantess

choices: Wait for her to calm down a bit, then reveal your presence
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Unable to move, you watch as Azelf opens her eyes, those huge, golden disks fixing on you a confused stare.

"H-Human?" she asks, looking extremely dazed.
"What happened? I remember that we were talking, but then?" she asks.

"First, could you give me back my willpower?" you say with a not-so-subtle hint of annoyance. Azelf looks even more confused.
"W-Why, did I take that?" she asks.

If you were able to move your head, you would have nodded.
"Yes!" you cry instead.
"Oh... I'm sorry... you'll have it back now..." the giantess apologizes.

Her fist releases you, and you find yourself able to move again.
"Thanks." you sigh.

Azelf blinks.
"Why did I take your willpower?" she asks, rubbing her forehead with her free paw.
"It's weird, but I can't seem to remember anything past our chat..." she says.

"And so, Lucario was right... they don't remember..." you mumble to yourself.
"Come again?" the blue headed guardian asks.

You give a deep sigh, before staring up at the giantess.
"Azelf," you firmly say.
"It happened... It happened to you as well..." you admit.

The giantess blinks, perplexed.
"What happened to me...?" she asks, before hastily formulating an explanation by herself.
"Uxie didn't erase my memories too, did she!?" she suddenly asks, looking back at her sisters.

Both Mesprit and Uxie are still sleeping, happily unaware of whatever happened in the past minutes.

Seeing her yellow headed sister still snoring with her eyes closed as usual, Azelf calms down, breathing in relief.

"No, Azelf," you speak.
"That happened to you..." you mention.

Again, the giantess' gaze shifts on you.
"‘That’...?" she repeats, getting more confused by the minute.

That before hard reality struck her. Like a whole mountain fell upon her. Her eyes shut open and her mouth trembles as she tries to formulate a sentence.
"I-I d-didn't... m-my..." she places her paw over her mouth.

Maybe, she's just jumping to conclusions. So, she patiently waits for the human to tell her what happened.

The silenced giantess looks at you expectantly. You sadly nod your head.
"Azelf... you just tried to use me..." you admit, mentally slapping yourself for your brutal honesty.

The giantess blushes deeply.
"How did that happen?!" she suddenly exclaims.
"I don't know! We were talking, and then you suddenly changed!" you respond, before remembering something.

"That's the exact same thing that happened with Mesprit," you recall.
"She was normal one moment, and the other she was delirious! So... that means that the effects of your heat are... unpredictable..." you conclude.
"Plus, once you return to normal, you have no memory of it..."

Azelf stares at you flabbergasted, her mouth hanging open. How could she protect the human, or even her Lake, if she could change in any moment without even knowing it?!

Azelf looks at you in silence, feeling broken inside. She feels tears starting to grow in her eyes.
"I... I'm sorry..." she sniffles.

"I-I n-need to go now..." the giantess says, placing you down on the ground and turning around, before starting to ascend.

"What - no! Azelf!" you cry, trying to get her to stop. However, Azelf doesn't listen. Your ears catch a feeble sob coming from the giantess.

You desperately look around, noticing her tails lifting off the ground.

Without even thinking, you dash towards one of the giant twins and hop onto it, hanging on for dear life as Azelf takes her leave from Lake Acuity.

Just then, Mesprit and Uxie stop snoring as they start to wake up.

--

"Whoa!" you exclaim as you cling to Azelf's right tail, while the giantess soars the skies at a dangerously high speed.

Due the high speed, your cry goes completely unheard as the giantess keeps flying to an unknown destination.

As for Azelf, she keeps flying aimlessly. She just needed to get as far as she could from the human, not knowing that the same human is currently risking his life while clinging to her tail at like 2000 feet above the ground.

And, while you bless your good grip, Azelf feels the need to cry. Hard. Most probably, the human couldn't stand the sight of her now.

Even worse, if he tells her sisters... Mesprit is going to kill her!

Several tears fall as the titaness keeps floating in a random direction, before opening her eyes to see where is she going.

Right below, she spots a random mountain.

Perfect.

The blue headed pixie starts to descend. And, at the bottom of her tail, you sigh in sheer relief.

Finally, the flight came to an end.

--

Azelf sits down behind the mountain, her tails moving out of the way as she sits. Immediately, the giantess places her paws over eyes and starts crying.

Meanwhile, down below, her tails land. And your feet touch the ground.

Fighting the urge to throw up, you stagger forward, not quite feeling your legs after clinging to Azelf soaring the skies at supersonic speed for so long.

You're also pretty grateful for the fact that you didn't become a red stain underneath Azelf's butt right now.

You recover a bit and look up at the giantess, noticing her crying. You approach her.
"Azelf..." you say.

Right before a giant tear falls right in your direction. You dive out of the way, the tear splashing behind you.

You get back on your feet and take a few steps back, breathing in relief, before looking at the titaness again. You fear that any further attempt to get her attention might just end up with you drowning in one of her tears.

But, seeing her cry is truly a heart-shattering sight... the giantess could really use some comforting now... She must be thinking that you hate her now.

Or maybe, she's thinking about what Mesprit would do to her is she ever finds out what she attempted to do with you...

You shiver at the thought, and quickly make a mental note to keep your mouth shut about it.

Your attention shifts back on the crying giantess as you try to decide what to do, whether should you risk and get her attention or wait for her to calm down and then make your presence clear to her.

You spend a few more moments deciding, before finally making your choice.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: The sorrow of a giantess

choices: Azelf brings you back to Lake Acuity
Actually, she's not headed for Lake Acuity, you find...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Mhh-hh~!" Mesprit moans cheerfully as she stretches, the remains of a good dream clinging to her mind.
"What a nice nap!" the titaness exclaims.

"I agree," Uxie chimes as she starts to get up.
"After all the agitation of the morning, sleeping was the right remedy," she says.

Mesprit gives a giggle, before glancing around, her golden eyes scanning the clearing where Lake Acuity is. But Mesprit is searching for something in particular.

Or, for someone in particular.

Not spotting her little human anywhere, Mesprit frowns.
"Cutie...?" she calls out for you. Her call goes unanswered.

Just as worry starts to seep into Mesprit's heart, she feels something tapping her shoulder.
"Sis..." Uxie suddenly says. Mesprit turns around, noting that Azelf was missing as well.

Mesprit's heart pounds her chest from within.

Did her little human try to leave again? Was Azelf trying to find him?

"They must be together," Uxie says, making Mesprit sigh in relief. Right before a new fear entered the pink headed legendary's heart.
"Sis... do you think they...?" Mesprit asks, feeling her own rage rising just at the mere thought of it.

Uxie seems to understand her sister's line of thinking. She swallows as she carefully picks her words.
"Well... it's a chance..." she says, before quickly adding:
"B-But, let's not be hasty, okay?"

Mesprit sighs as she calms down a bit.
"You're right - like always. I don't have to jump to conclusions," she says.
"But, for some reason, I feel really bad..."

In fact, for some reason, the pink headed giantess sensed a hint of sadness coming from somewhere. She's not sure of its source, though.

The feeling she senses is very feeble. Someone was feeling very sad, she could tell, but it was very far away.

For a moment, Mesprit wonders who it might be, before shrugging and shaking off the feeling.

"You alright?" Uxie asks, noticing her sister's uneasiness.
"Yeah. Just worried for him..." Mesprit responds.

--

Little did the being of emotion know that the sadness she sensed was coming right from her missing sister.

You stand in front of the crying giantess, deciding to get her attention and try to comfort her.
"Azelf!" you call out for her.

However, your voice is drowned out by the giantess' tears, which keep falling like two waterfalls from her eyes, streaming across her cheeks and splashing on the ground below.

"Azelf!" you cry out, louder, though still unable to get her to hear you.

"Some guardian I am! I can't even control myself!" she says, her voice filled with shame.

"AZELF!" you shout at top of your lungs as you stare up at the giantess.

This time, you note, she opens her eyes, and glances at you. Those huge golden disks widen at the sight of you.
"Y-You?! H-How did you get here?" Azelf stutters.

"... I think that a better question would be ‘How did you get here alive’..." you recall the rough ride you had.
"However, it doesn't..." you don't get to finish.

Two large, strong paws get a hold of you, and they lift you up as the titaness suddenly hugs you.
"I-I'm sorry! I'm so so-sorry!" she sobs.

You remain silent for a moment, before hugging back.
"Shh... it's not your fault, Azelf. You can't control yourself," you say in a comforting voice.
"Y-You don't h-hate me?" she asks.

Such question makes you indignant.
"Are you kidding?" you hiss.
"Azelf, I would never hate you for something you don't have any control over."

The giantess sniffles.
"Yes... b-but... we h-hurt. We hurt pokemon and people... this stupid heat..." she stammers.

You look up, giving a warm smile.
"You know, Azelf, I believe that whoever proves to be truly sorry deserves a second chance, no matter what they did," you say.
"And plus, you did not hurt me, did you?" you ask.

"Well, no... but we could have! And t-that's why you were leaving!" she cries.
"If only I had known... I would have let you go when I found you leaving..."

You frown.
"I was making a mistake!" you shout, taking Azelf by surprise.

You sigh.
"Look, I already told it: I like you and your sisters, Azelf. You three are the best things that happened to me so far. Trying to leave was a mistake." you state, before smiling again, pressing your head into her soft chest.
"And I have to thank you for stopping me."

After your last sentence, the giantess spends an incalculable amount of time staring down at you, tears running down her cheeks.

Though, unbeknownst to you, these ones were of happiness.

Finally, the giant pixie gives you a smile.
"I-I... I feel better..." she sniffles, removing one of her paws from your back. It travels up to her eyes as she wipes her tears away.
"Thank you."

You smile.
"You're we-" the phrase never leaves your lips as Azelf brings you up and moves you to her lips, which pucker up and press into your whole upper body.

She holds the kiss for a whole minute, before pulling off, leaving a blushing you. Azelf blushes as well.
"Those were truly kind words. I really felt at peace," she remarks.

"Heh... you're welcome..." you respond as, once again, she hugs you, the human she unknowingly started to fall for...

--

"They still didn't return..." Mesprit says as she gazes at the sky. Wherever her human was, she missed him. She woke up, wanting to play with him to help herself forget the rough day she, her sisters and him had.

However, such scheme wasn't realisable since her playmate was missing. That highly disappointed the giantess. She doesn't have a clue of where you are... for what she knows, you could be even trying to leave her again...

"Give them time, Mesprit," Uxie says from behind her.
"We don't even know if they're actually together..." she adds, before deciding that it was a stupid thing to say.

As a matter of fact, Mesprit lowers her head.
"The human didn't leave... did he...?" she asks, trying to convince herself that it was true.

Uxie smiles.
"He's one nice human among other like him. I don't think I he would have double-crossed us." she says.

Mesprit remains silent.
"I... I'm sorry..." she then says, her smile dropping. Mesprit perks up.
"For what?"

"For taking his memories. I was so shocked that I didn't even think twice," Uxie admits.
"You had a good reason, I guess," Mesprit responds as she turns around to face Uxie.

"I... I'm sorry too, Uxie. I'm sorry for saying that you raped him... and for... you know... trying to hurt you..." she says, ashamed.

Uxie doesn't reply, but she floats forward, grabbing her sister in a hug. Mesprit closes her eyes as she returns it.

--

"... Don't know what I would have told Mesprit if you fell off..." Azelf says upon hearing how you actually got here.
"Yup. It's been one rough ride..." you respond, shivering at the mere thought of it.

Azelf giggles, before casually looking at the sky, noticing that the sun is close to setting.

"Hey, it's quite late," she says.
"I think we should go back to the lake..." she adds, before looking at you with a smile.

"What do you say?"
"After all that happened today, resting sounds great," you say as you wiggle a bit in her paws.

"... Yeah... I'm sorry you had to see my sisters fighting..." she says. You shiver at the memory.
"It was scary to see Mesprit and Uxie like that," you admit.

Azelf nods.
"Well, come on, let's go," she says, before smiling as she notices you adjusting in her hug.
"And I think you'd be fine traveling like that."

You laugh.
"How'd you guess?" you joke. Azelf giggles as she starts hovering in midair, before starting to float upwards.

Then, she turns around and starts flying.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Two heartwarming moments

choices: ... Azelf is getting up. Looks like she wants to go back now...
... Two other giantesses suddenly come over. Mesprit and Uxie found you...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Another gigantic tear falls in your direction. You take a few steps back, and watch as it splashes on the ground, forming a small puddle.

This inevitably leads you to take a decision: you've got to wait for her to calm down.

At least for a little bit. Otherwise, you're going to drown in one of her tears.

So, you move up beside her and sit down next to her, trying to ignore the sobs and the cries coming from above.

--

The giantess keeps crying for quite a while, before you finally hear her stopping. Your gaze travels upwards, and you notice Azelf removing her paws from her eyes, which she then opens.

Your heart skips a beat: her once golden eyes are now completely red, glazed with tears that keep falling.

Azelf sniffles a couple time.
"Some guardian you are!" she cries, unaware of your presence.
