"How can I even think of returning to Lake Valor now!? I should be protecting it, and instead... I-I..." she bitterly cries, not even able to finish her sentence.

Your expression drops into a frown.

"And the human," you perk up, hearing her talking about you.
"The human probably hates me now!" she exclaims, her own phrase backing her into sobbing.

You have heard enough, you decide. You get back on your feet.

"How am I going to explain this to Mesprit and-"

"AZELF!" you shout at top of your lungs, interrupting her monologue.

Apparently, the titaness heard you even though her sobs. Her paws leave her eyes, which open up as her gaze moves onto you.

"Y-You?!" she cries in surprise.

"Yes. Me," you respond, walking up in front of her.

"H-How did you g-get here?" she asks.
"It doesn't matter," you reply, shivering at the memory of you hanging to her tail at like 2000 feet above the solid ground.

You gaze back at the titaness.
"Azelf, I do not hate you!" you exclaim.
"And I can't even imagine how can you think such thing,"

The giantess blinks perplexed.
"Y-You d-don't?" she stutters, her massive paw wiping a few tears from her eyes.

You sigh and shake your head.
"Look, I know it's something you can't control, how could I blame you for it?" you rhetorically ask.

The only response you get is another blink of her reddened eyes. But then, Azelf suddenly moves, and leans forward, her paws reaching out for you.

You stand still and let her large blue paws slide underneath your arms, before clasping behind your back and lifting you up. The giant pixie moves you upwards, and hugs you.

"I-I'm so-sorry! I-I'm sorry!" the giantess shouts, more tears streaming down her cheeks like two miniature waterfalls.
"You're just the nicest little creature ever and... and I-I-" you interrupt.

"You are part of the sweetest trio I've ever met!" you shout. Out of ideas to comfort her, you spread your arms, grabbing as much as you can of her chest in a hug.

Azelf sniffles.
"I-I... I c-could have hurt you..."
"Look. I-I understand it, alright? You can't control yourself because of your heat. But I don't hate you for it... as a matter of fact, nobody does!" you exclaim.

Azelf tilts her head, curious.
"Yeah, the pokemon who spoke to me didn't want to tell you that because they didn't want to break your and your sisters' hearts!" you mention.

You then go quiet and push your head against the giantess' chest, a comprehensive smile taking place on your face.

In response, the pixie hugs you even tighter.

Azelf keeps crying for a good while more, before her paws start to loose their grip on you. The giantess' left hand then closes in a fist around you.

Then, Azelf brings you up to her face.
"I-I'm truly sorry... pl-please, f-forgive m-me..." she stammers.

"Azelf," you say, opting for a risky move.

Then, much to the giantess' surprise, you lean forward, pressing your lips against her huge cheek. The smooth blue surface suddenly grows red underneath your lips.

And so do your own cheeks.

You hold the kiss for about thirty seconds, before pulling off, blushing wildly.

Both you and the giantess stare at each other in silence for a while, you too embarrassed to talk, Azelf still trying to process what just happened.

Your palm slams against your forehead as you realize just how dumb this was.
"Azelf, I'm-" you have no time to reply.

The giantess suddenly looks at you and, seemingly snapped out of her trance, she leans forward, pushing her lips into your comparatively tiny form.

A powerful sucking overwhelms your body as the giantess smooches you for a whole, eternal minute, before removing her face from you, her lips almost pulling your skin off along with them.

Your blush widens.
"Ehm..." you say, but are cut off by the titaness.

"I feel... at peace..." she says with a serene look on her still blushing face. The stream of tears running down her cheeks starts to subside.
"Thank you."

"Uh... you're welcome..." you dizzily mutter, making the giantess giggle.

Then, her temporary smile drops back into a frown.
"I... I'm really sorry about before..." she apologizes.

You shake your head to rid your face of the red shade.
"Don't be," you respond with a smile.
"You don't have to be sorry. It's not your fault. It's simply something you can't control..." you say.

"Y-Yeah... but, I-I could have u-used you and I wouldn't have even known about it..." she replies.
"But you didn't. That means, you still have a little bit of lucidity whenever your heat acts up..." you reason.
"That's good to know."

Azelf nods.
"I guess that now... that now you want to leave again..." she bitterly says, lowering her head.
"And I cannot blame-"

"No." you interrupt. Azelf perks up. You smile.
"I'm not leaving," you continue.

Azelf stares at you for a whole minute, trying to decide if you're lying or not. But then, she sighs in relief, and smiles at you.
"Thank you. Mesprit would have killed me." she says.
"... Please, not a word of this with my sisters," she adds, dreading Mesprit's reaction if you ever told her.

"Agreed." you respond. Azelf smiles, her eyes starting to return to their characteristic golden color.

You smile back. But your smile soon fades as you notice...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Azelf's most romantic moment

choices: Azelf meekly reveals what happened earlier. Her sisters must know, she decides.
No way! Azelf keeps quiet about what happened between you and her!
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Azelf suddenly places her free arm on the mountain behind her as she suddenly gets up.
"We've got nothing more to do here," she explains upon seeing the questioning look on your face.
"We're going back now."

"Okay." you reply.

The giantess smiles.
"You are really one kind little human," Azelf says with a smile. Her eyes partially close as she wears a serene expression.
"Like just a few can be found nowadays," the sentence makes you blush.

The pixie giantess smiles even more.
"D'you know what you deserve?" she asks.

You ponder an answer, but it never leaves your lips as Azelf suddenly moves forward, gently rising your head with hers and pushing her lips against yours.

Your eyes shut wide open while your whole face burns as it grows red, a burning sensation pervading each and every inch of your body.

All while Azelf's tongue travels out of her mouth and slides into yours, your own tongue not even putting up resistance as it is overpowered by Azelf.

The giantess holds the kiss for a couple minutes, before finally pulling off, her blue face covered in a red shade.
"Hehehe..." she merrily giggles.
"Did you like it? That was just a small sign of my gratitude!" she says.

You look at her, feeling dazed. And then, you collapse onto her open paw.

Azelf giggles.

"Let's... uh... never talk about this." you say after a while. Azelf nods.
"Agreed. If Mesprit finds out about this, we're both dead," she says with an awkward look as she starts hovering in midair.

You shiver at the thought.

A smile reappears on the giantess' face.
"Thank you for... y'know..." she says, blushing vaguely.
"I only did what every other guy would have done... Or at least, what they should have done." you reply, smiling back.

"Sweet talker." the pixie gently pats your head, before hugging you as she starts flying to Lake Acuity.
"By the way, not one word with my sisters... about what happened back at the lake... and here..." she says pleadingly.

You nod your head.
"Agreed."

--

A good half an hour passes. You sit with your arms and legs crossed on Azelf's cupped paws, your eyes closed as you try to ignore the huge sense of vertigo.

Traveling like this is way better than hanging to her tail, but still...

"Human? We're here."

"Mh?" you open your eyes to look down, noticing indeed Lake Acuity below. Azelf starts to descend. Soon enough, the giantess hovers into the clearing where the lake is.

Though, there's no trace of Uxie or Mesprit.
"Anybody around here?" Azelf calls out.

Right after she says these words, a voice responds.
"Sis...?"

Azelf turns around to face Mesprit, whose eyes widen as she spots you in her sister's paws.
"Cutie!"

In a matter of seconds, a pink and blue mountain floats forward, snatching you from Azelf and pushing you against a smooth warm wall that is her chest.
"Sweetie, you had me worried!" Mesprit exclaims as she hugs you tightly.

"Sorry..." you respond, making Mesprit smile.
"Why? You didn't leave me! That only proves how loyal you are!" she chimes cheerfully, before a bad thought finds its way into her mind.
"...Because, you didn't want to leave again... right?"
she asks.

You sigh.
"No, Mesprit," you respond.

"Yeah, he was with me," Azelf confirms as she floats closer. This gets Mesprit to glance at her sister.
"Where were you two?" she asks.

"Nowhere important. You know, just flying around," Azelf lies, giving a bit of a blush as she remembers what happened between you and her.

That is not something Mesprit must know. However, Azelf's pink headed sister senses her embarrassment and gives her a weird look.

However, before anything else can be said, a yellow headed pixie floats out of the thick vegetation around the lake.

Uxie briefly stops as she spots Azelf and the human in Mesprit's paws.
"Oh... you've returned..." she quietly says, flying closer to her sisters.

"Where were you?" she then asks while giving a smile.
"By the way, glad you're still here," she adds while pointing her eyelids on you.

You smile back.
"Why? Did you doubt me?" you ask.

"Not even a moment." Mesprit says as she kisses your head.

Uxie stifles a giggle.
"Yeah, that's exactly how she acted when she found you nowhere in sight," she says, unable to keep herself from laughing. Mesprit blushes as she rises her head, glaring at Uxie.

The yellow headed guardian looks at Azelf.
"But, sis, where were you anyway?"

Azelf blushes again.
"Just flying around..." she repeats her lie. Again, Mesprit's senses detect her sister's embarrassment. And, with nobody to interrupt her, she asks:
"Why are you feeling... embarrassed?" she asks while floating closer to Azelf, drawing both her and Uxie's attention.

"What?" Uxie asks as Azelf's eyes widen.

‘That's it. We're dead. It was nice meeting you, Azelf.’ you think as you gaze at the sky.

Suddenly, a frown appears in Mesprit's face as she remembers that you - HER human - were with Azelf.
"Sis?" Mesprit asks, while her grip on your becomes tighter.
"WHAT did you do with him?" she asks.

Azelf glares.
"I did nothing to the human!" she screams.
"Stop jumping to conclusions, you stupid wh-" the pixie giantess is interrupted as Uxie floats in between her and Mesprit.

"That's enough," Uxie says, before looking at Azelf.
"If you did nothing to the human, then you can tell whatever is embarrassing you, sis," she says.

"She did nothing to me, honest," you chime in. Azelf looks at you smiling.

Uxie looks at you as she tries to determine whether you are lying or not. Her closed eyelids pointed on you make you feel uncomfortable, knowing that she could open them and make you forget things...

Uxie nods as she looks back at the blushing Azelf.
"If that's true, then you can tell us whatever is embarrassing you," she says, her face contorting into a serious look as she remembers about what Mesprit tried to do to her earlier today.

"After all, nothing could be worse than that..."
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: An embarrassing situation

choices: ... meekly nod your head. Let Azelf reveal the truth...
... frenetically shake your head. It's not the right time...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Suddenly, before your and Azelf's eyes, a shadow falls upon the blue headed pixie. Azelf has barely the time to rise her head as she notices a pink and blue blur coming down at light speed.

At the same speed, you are rudely snatched from Azelf and are shoved into a smooth, warm wall. Startled, you look up. Your fear fades, and you give out a sigh of relief as you notice Mesprit hugging you, while gazing down at you with a smile.
"Hi cutie! Did you miss me? I know I missed you!" she exclaims.

You look back, noticing Azelf staring at the scene confused.

And then, suddenly, a second giantess comes down. Only at a much slower pace.
"When we sensed that you two were here, she hit the ground running..." Uxie explains with a sigh as she hovers down, looking first at you, then at Azelf.

"Speaking of, why are you here?" the yellow headed giantess then asks.

The question causes Mesprit to loosen up her hug and look back at her blue sister.
"We thought that the human wanted to leave again, and that you were searching for him..." she says, before gazing down at you.
"Cutie, were you trying to leave again?" she asks, dreading your response.

Before you have a chance to speak, Azelf speaks for you:
"No no no, nothing like that," she says. Mesprit gazes back at her sister, ready to reply.

But the words die down in her throat as she notices something: Azelf's eyes are red.

"...Have you been crying?" Mesprit asks, before checking Azelf's emotions and assuming a confused expression.
"But you're... you're joyous!" she exclaims.

Azelf nervously laughs.
"Heh, you see, I... I kind of had a problem," she says.
"And the human hel-" Azelf is interrupted by Mesprit, who suddenly wears a frown upon her face.

"Are you saying that MY human helped you with your heat?!" she shouts. Azelf flushes red.
"No!" she cries in response.
"I..." she quickly remembers that, even if she wasn't actually helped, she tried to have the human anyway while she was unable to control herself.

The blue giantess stops to look down. Mesprit senses her embarrassment as well as her shame.
"No?! Then, why are you ashamed?" Mesprit asks again, self-convincing that Azelf really had the human help her.

A new thought, worse than the first, penetrates Mesprit's mind.
"... Have you... have you used your power to force him to help you?!" she shouts.

Fearing another imminent fight between sisters, you, who have been staring at the two quarreling giantesses in silence, try to interrupt:
"She did not-"

"Of course not! I didn't do anything to him!" Azelf snaps back, interrupting you.

"Girls!" Uxie tries to interrupt the argument, but she poorly fails to do so.

"Yeah? Why were you crying then!?" Mesprit asks again, her anger rising.

Everything made sense: Azelf needed help, so she asked the human to fix her. The human most likely refused, and Azelf forced him to help her. As a result, she felt guilty about it and starte crying. However, she was also joyous because her heat was soothed.

"I... I had a problem. So I came here to think alone for a while. But the human somehow managed to follow me. All he did was try to comfort me! Guess what, he did it!" Azelf cries.

Mesprit growls at her sister. She nearly forgets about you in her paws, and is about to try to hit Azelf, when Uxie suddenly places herself in between her two siblings, turning to face Mesprit while spreading her arms wide in front of Azelf.
"Sis, don't do anything you might regret. Remember this morning?" she asks, shivering at the memory.

"Uxie is right, Mesprit!" you chime in.
"And so is Azelf: she's telling the truth!" you exclaim.

Mesprit's gaze shifts on your who are still standing on top of her large palm. Her anger seems to wane in a matter of seconds.
"... Did it really go like this...?" she asks you in a much calmer voice.

You nod your head.
"Yes! Azelf didn't try anything funny! She-" you look at the blue titaness, remembering how she suddenly lost control.

It wasn't her fault, and you haven't got the heart to blame her for it.
"... She seemed sad about something we both know," you risk saying, earning a curious stare from Mesprit.

True, what you had told Azelf must remain a secret between you and her, but you don't see anything bad in saying that you and the giantess share a secret.

However, Mesprit and Uxie were now curious.
"... What thing?" Uxie asks as her arms fall back in place, and she hovers closer to her pink headed sister, who is currently holding you while gazing at you with curiosity.

"I'm sorry, but I can't tell it," you say, shaking your head, immediately regretting telling that information.

"Why? What did she do?!" Mesprit asks, making a not-so-subtle motion for Azelf, who glares daggers at her sister.

"She didn't do anything!" you cry, exasperated. Seriously, this day couldn't go any worse...

"Alright. Then, why was she sad? Why did you have to comfort her?" Uxie chimes in.

You remain silent, and look down.

Mesprit stares at you for a couple of seconds, before looking at Azelf.
"Sis?" she asks.
"What is the human talking about? Why were you sad? And what do you know that we don't?"

The blue giantess gets up, and gazes at you.

Feeling those golden eyes of hers staring at you, you return her gaze, understanding that Azelf is silently asking what should she do, whether to reveal the secret you and her share, or keep quiet about it.

You...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Another sister fight...

choices: "I think... I think I've got a solution..." Uxie suddenly says...
"We'll think about something," Uxie suddenly says, "For now, let's go back...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Following her blue sister's gaze, Mesprit looks down at you with curiosity.
"Cutie...?" she asks, growing more and more curious by the second.

What secret did her precious little human and her sister Azelf share? What was so important about it?

You ignore Mesprit's gaze and keep yours fixed on Azelf. The blue titaness keeps looking in your direction with a concerned expression.

Suddenly, her voice rings in your mind:
‘Should we...?’

You hesitate. They're in a better state of mind than this morning but...

You bite your lower lip, and take a decision.

Azelf watches as you move your head up and down, nodding. Got the answer, the giantess inhales deeply, before exhaling as deeply.

"Alright. I'll tell you," she says, floating over Mesprit, picking you from her.

Before the pink headed guardian can complain, Azelf speaks to you:
"I... I'm not sure I can really tell this though. After, you are the one who told me in the first place... mind lending a hand?" she asks you.

You nod.
"He knows what?" Uxie says, before Mesprit floats in front of her.
"Yeah, will you tell us this big secret of yours?" she asks.

Azelf sighs before turning around to face her siblings.
"Well... this... thing..." she starts.
"It... it's about us-" Mesprit suddenly glares.

"It's not between me and the human Mesprit!" Azelf suddenly shouts while blushing.

"... I mean... it's about us three," she says, calming down a little, making Mesprit and Uxie perk up.
"... Us three?" Uxie asks.

Azelf nods meekly.
"Yes. A-Apparently... w-we..." she stammers, before stopping in mid sentence. You find her paw gripping you tightly.

"You have a certain problem," you clarify as the pressure around you begins to loosen.

Mesprit and Uxie look at you curiously.
"... Problem...?" Mesprit asks. Both you and Azelf nod.

"... Let me guess," Uxie chimes.
"This problem is the one the pokemon of Lake Acuity told you about?" she asks.

You swallow. Telling the truth would mean putting the inhabitants of the lake in danger... or not? After all... it's not their fault if these legendaries can't control themselves...

So, you risk replying:
"Yes. Precisely."

Uxie's closed eyelids linger on you for a couple seconds, before the giantess nods.
"Okay. And I assume that's your motivation for wanting to leave us," she says.

You nod.
"Okay, I'm glad we're getting somewhere," Mesprit chimes in.
"But the point is: this thing you and Azelf know and that we don't. What is it?" she asks you while floating closer, her size becoming even more imposing from your point of view.

"Ehm..."

Your diseasness strikes Mesprit's empathy.
"Come on, don't be discouraged now," she huffs, before gazing at Azelf, feeling the same discomfort being emanated from her too.
"Just say it,"

You turn around to look at Azelf, who looks back down at you.

"Ehm..." Uxie speaks up as she too floats closer.
"I don't mean to cause any pressure, but I'd like to know this too..." she says.

You huff loudly, before turning around again.
"Your heat." you say.

Already knowing your story, Azelf looks at her sisters in silence, noticing them wearing confused looks upon their faces.

"... Heat?" Mesprit asks, not sure of having heard good.
"It's a problem for sure, but..."
"It isn't that terrible, is it?" Uxie finishes, before hovering back.

"I mean, yes, you helped me and Mesprit with it-"
"And I'd appreciate if you stopped bringing that up,"

Uxie chooses to ignore the last remark.
"... Maybe... you're scared of helping? Or... did we hurt you while you were..." she stops, a not-so-subtle shade of red taking place upon it.

The sentence causes both you and Mesprit to blush as well. What Uxie meant was: ‘While you were inside of us?’

"No no, not that..." you hastily respond.
"It's-" you feel a lump in your throat. You forcefully try to swallow it and talk, but it simply won't go down.

However, Azelf doesn't seem to be having such problem. The giantess looks at Uxie.
"The heat, Uxie. It makes us lose control, sis," she bluntly says.

This causes both her siblings to gasp.
"W-What are you saying, sis...?" Mesprit stutters, feeling dazed.

Azelf closes her eyes.
"I'm saying that we become uncontrollable. Crazy with lust. We..."
"... Start wanting more. And more. It's effects are unpredictable," you continue.

"And when we really lose it..." a moment of silence follows.

Mesprit and Uxie stare at you and Azelf with two hanging mouths, waiting for you to finish.

Which soon escapes your mouth, leaving like a boulder on your conscience:
"... Y-You... You go on a rampage. Around the lakes." you finish, closing your eyes and turning your head elsewhere, dreading the giantesses' response.

Azelf's free paw places itself in front of you as the giantess attempts to shield you against her sisters' incoming reaction.

Which is nowhere close to what the blue giantess imagined.

Mesprit blinks a few times. It was like a whole mountain was thrown at her.
"We... w-what..." she mutters, dazed.

"B-But... H-How can you tell...?" Uxie asks, suddenly feeling shocked.

Azelf sighs, somehow managing to control the storm of emotions raging within her.
"It happened," she says.
"Twice already," you chime in from behind her paw. Azelf slightly smacks you with it, causing you to fall on your behind onto her massive paw.
"Ow..."

Azelf looks back at her siblings.
"Apparently, one minute we are normal, and the other we lose control and..."
"... Try to fuc-" Azelf's paw moves menacingly closer to you.
"... Ehm, I mean, mate with the first living being you see..." you clarify.
"And that'd be me..."

Mesprit and Uxie stare at you and Azelf, mouths wide open.

Until Mesprit suddenly thinks about something.
"W-Wait... so you really tried..." she says to Azelf, who nods.
"Yes. I tried... having the human. But he managed to talk sense into me. That's why I came here... that's why I was crying..." Azelf says, before exhaling and looking down at you.
"... I'm sorry..."

You look back at her and smile sympathetically, before looking at Mesprit, who stares at Azelf, not sure of what to think.
"The same happened to you, Mesprit," you say, obtaining her attention.
"M-Me?" she asks.

You bite your tongue and nod.
"You were normal one moment, and the other you... tried using me. Azelf's arrival stopped you." you recall

At this point, Mesprit's can't hear anything more.
"I-I... can't believe..." she says, floating back, away from you, grabbing her face in her paws.

Uxie too seems to be on the verge of tears.
"T-The lakes..." she mumbles, before turning her head in your direction.
"The human too..." she turns around, placing a paw over her already closed eyelids.

Soon, the sobs of the two titanesses are the only thing that can be heard.
"Uxie... Mesprit..." you mumble.

But a large paw moves in front of you. It belongs to Azelf.

The titaness looks at you dejectedly.
"Give them a moment..." she suggests. You swallow, before looking back at the two sisters.

Now you truly understand why the inhabitants of Lake Acuity didn't want to talk to them about their problem...

--

"I-I-I'm s-so-sorry!" Mesprit suddenly cries, flying forward and snatching you from Azelf.
"I don't w-want t-to hurt you! I-I didn't want to s-scare you!" she then shouts as tears river out of her eyes.
"I-I l-love you..."

The pink headed giantess grabs you in a tight embrace.
"I know. And it's alright, really," you partially lie.

While this whole situation is all but alright, you are somewhat relieved to have told them. Now, they should be able to find a solution...

... Right?

"I-I... I t-thank you for telling the truth..." Uxie suddenly says.
"B-But now... you want to leave again, don't you?"

Mesprit sniffles.
"Cutie..." she says, causing you to look up at her.
"I-If you still want to... to go..." she says, sniffling again.
"If you want to go again... we will let you..."

You smile.
"No. I don't." you say, taking both Mesprit and Uxie by surprise.

"N-No?" Uxie parrots back. You nod your head.
"But," you continue with a serious expression.
"We'll need a solution. Otherwise..." you don't finish your sentence.

Upon hearing your intention to stay, Mesprit wipes a few tears, before lightly kissing your head, silently thanking you.

Then, silence falls between you and the three sisters.

Looking past Mesprit, you catch a glimpse of Uxie. She's seemingly thinking. Hopefully, about a solution to this dire situation.

She is the being of knowledge after all...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Telling truth to the titanesses

choices: Mesprit staring down at you seductively...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Uxie removes her paw from her face as she sighs.
"I-I can't think of any possible solution," she slowly admits, looking exasperated.

Mesprit and Azelf look at their sister dejectedly. Even for the being of knowledge, this was a complicated situation. A riddle waiting to be solved.

"So... what now?" you ask.
"We can't risk. If you lose control again..." you pause to swallow.
"Me, and the pokemon of Lake Acuity would be in danger..." you conclude.

Uxie gets closer.
"No need to worry, at least for now," she says, earning a curious stare from you.
"Our heat was soothed. It won't act up for a day or two more," she clarifies.

"Oh, maybe YOUR heat was soothed!" Azelf chimes in.
"I'm the only one without help here. And I might just lose control at any moment..." she says, while eyeing you in Mesprit's paws.

Which start to tighten their grip on you.
"Then hurry up and find a partner," Mesprit says, before fixing a stern gaze on Azelf.

The message is clear, ‘He's mine!’. The blue sister glares.

Again, Uxie finds herself floating in between her siblings to prevent another argument.

"We'll think about something later on," Uxie says to Azelf, sighing as she shakes her head.
"For now, let's go back to Lake Acuity." she adds, taking notice that the sun is about to set.

"Fine." Mesprit says with a sigh.

The three giantesses then go quiet as they start floating upwards.

Then, the three focus.

And your surroundings fade away as they teleport.

--

"I'll never get used to that..." you dizzily mutter as you materialize again.

Mesprit giggles as she lowers her hand to ground level. You leap off her massive paw, your feet making contact with the grass around Lake Acuity.

"So? What now?" you ask as you turn to face the three titanesses, their bodies casting huge shadows as they stare down at you.
"Do we try to find a solution? Or...?" you ask, rubbing the back of your head.

"Well, of course we need one. But-" Uxie is interrupted by a loud growl of her own stomach. The pixie blushes.
"I don't know about you, but I can reason better with a full stomach," she says.

Your own belly chooses this moment to growl, reminding you that you haven't been eating since this morning, and that you've actually ate just once. As a result, your own stomach now loudly asks to be filled with its remaining daily meal.

You blush too, looking up at Uxie.
"Point taken." you remark, sending the three sisters into giggling.

--

You lean back against the trunk of a large tree, holding some berries that come from the large pile that Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie collected.

Discarding a few tamato berries from your hands, you lazily bring a casual berry to your mouth and bite it while you watch the three sisters talking to each other.

From what your ears manage to catch of their speeches, you get that they're talking about what they've learned from you. They're talking about their problem, maybe trying to find a solution...

"... Why are you all by yourself?" Uxie suddenly perks up, causing Mesprit and Azelf to look back as well.

"M-Me?" you ask. The pixie nods.
"This problem involves you too, right? Why don't you come here, so we can talk about it together?" she suggests.

Seeing the expectant looks upon the sisters' faces, you slowly nod, before walking up to them. You silently sit beside Mesprit, who smiles.
"Much better!" she chimes, playfully patting your back with one of her tails.

"Now, anyone with a good idea?" Azelf says, swallowing a few berries.

"Well..." you timidly speak up, drawing the attention of the giantesses.

"When you tried to... uh..." you don't know how to say it. Azelf blushes.
"Yeah, I tried having my way with you," she bluntly says.
"What about it?"

You too flush red.
"Well, when I talked to you. You seemed to understand me, you fought your heat and you snapped back to reality..." you recall.

Mesprit glares at Azelf, who ignores her and focuses on you instead.
"You're saying that if you could manage to make us normal again by simply talking?" she asks.
"It's a hypothesis..."

You notice Uxie shaking her head.
"What you did might have been just luck," she bluntly says, a hint of sorrow in her voice.
"If it doesn't work, we could easily... use you..." she adds, blushing while feeling ashamed of herself.

"That's a possibility..." you admit.

--

The pile of berries disappeared a while ago, and you still can't find a logical conclusion to this problem.

"There ought to be a solution..." Azelf mutters.
"You're right," Uxie says, before giving a yawn.
"But you know what? We can find one in the morning. I'm tired." she says, getting up.

"Are you three coming?"

"Sure thing," Azelf yawns.
"All I want now is to hit the hay and sleep on it." she adds, before looking at you and Mesprit.
"Are you...?"

Before you can respond, Mesprit's paw slams against your mouth, silencing you.
"... You can go without us," she says with a sly smirk.

Uxie frowns.
"Arceus, don't tell me you are losing control!" she exclaims.

Mesprit laughs.
"Aw come on! I'm lucid! I just want a moment with this cutie here," she says.

Azelf and Uxie look at each other, before shrugging and starting to float off, in direction of the cave. Mesprit's smirk widens.

Her paw leaves your mouth.
"So...?" you ask, causing Mesprit to giggle.
"We're not going in the cave, cutie," she says.

"Tonight we're sleeping out here," Mesprit continues as she starts laying down.
"So nobody will try anything. And I dare anyone to take you away from me," she adds.

As usual, her paws wrap around you.
"Look at the sky," you hear the giantess saying.

Doing as instructed, you look up, noticing the sky enlightened by billions of stars and, of course, by the moon.

You sigh.
"Great. Now we're laying together under the moonlight: huge romance cliché incoming," you sarcastically remark, causing Mesprit to giggle loudly.
"You can say that!" she says, before both of you go quiet.

Mesprit then gives a yawn.

"Cutie... don't ever leave my side..." Mesprit drowsily says as she snuggles up to you.
"Won't do that." you reply as you hug the giantess. Mesprit smiles brightly.

And soon, you find her upper body moving as she leans forward, placing a kiss on your face.
"Sleep tight dear..." she mutters as she lays back down.

"You too," you respond, starting to pet her.
"Gentle giant."

The guardian giggles again, before relaxing. Soon, her breath slows down, her chest starts to rise up and fall back down.

Mesprit just fell asleep.

You smile as you lay your head against her soft chest, enjoying the warmth, the smoothness and the beats of her heart.

Before you even know it, you fall asleep too...

--

Your sleep is bothered by something as you are rudely awoken, feeling like a really short time passed since you fell asleep.

Your eyes open as you drowsily look around, trying to spot whatever disturbed you.

And, in the darkness of the night, you notice...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Seeking a solution

choices: Just help Mesprit and get it over with...
Before you can decide, Lucario and Vaporeon come out and pull you away!
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
In the darkness, you notice two golden eyes staring at you, a smile spread on a giant pink face.

Mesprit is staring down at you. Quite seductively.

"M-Mesprit...?" you drowsily stammer, before yawning. The giantess giggles.
"Oh, did I wake you up? Silly me." she says.
"Sorry sweetie."

"It's alright..." you reply, taking notice that you're still firmly grasped by her.
"... Why are you awake anyway?"

"Couldn't sleep. So I was watching you sleep instead - you're so incredibly cute while you sleep~" she says with a giggle.

You flush red.
"Uhm... okay?" you respond, unsure of how to feel about this.
"That's kinda... uhm... cute. Weird for sure, but cute in a sense."

Mesprit appears pleased with your answer as she smiles brightly.
"Cutie..." she says while her paws start moving upwards, dragging you along with them up to the giantess' face.

Before you can react, Mesprit leans down, her lips making contact with your forehead as she briefly smooches you, before pulling off.

You blush, but smile at the giantess.

"You have no idea of how much I love you~" she chimes, while happily nuzzling you. You smirk.
"I think I have a pretty close idea. I mean you... ehm..." you pause, your smile fading.

But Mesprit just giggles.
Tried to eliminate Uxie?" she says.
"U-Uh... yeah..." you say, cringing at the thought. You can still feel your skin prickling as you remember that.

Mesprit smiles as she senses your emotions.
"In my defence, love cannot be without jealousy." she states while shrugging.

"Yeah yeah... try to avoid that in the future..." you say, making the giantess giggle again.
"No promises~" she responds.

You both go quiet after her last remark. The giantess starts to caress you gently. You caress back, all your remaining wishes to leave suddenly waning.

Instead, you start to feel like you're getting even closer to this pink headed guardian, who's only shown you love since you met her.

Mesprit senses your emotions and smiles brightly.

Right before feeling something... like her body suddenly caught fire...

"Oh no..." she mumbles, closing her eyes and gritting her teeth. It couldn't be... after what her human told, she couldn't allow it...

"... ‘Oh no’ what...?" you ask her while looking at her face, noticing her with gritted teeth.

Slowly, Mesprit's expression relaxes. A red shade spreads across her face as she opens up her eyes, looking at you again while wearing a smile.

"... Oh nothing~" she chimes while bringing you up again and starting to nuzzle you.

"Hmm... Sweetie..." she says quietly as she rubs you against her face, smothering you.

"Hey!" you tell as you try to push yourself back, failing in doing so and having to submit to the display of affection.

Finally, after a while, the giantess pulls you back, staring at you seductively... more seductively than before.

"What's gotten into you?" you ask as you try to regain your breath.

Mesprit giggles, gently lowering her paws to let you on the ground. Then, the ground shakes as she rolls on her side, her gigantic face standing in front of you.

"Well... there's something I need cutie..." she responds while eyeing you intently.

"... What...?" you ask, before realizing.

The pained expression.

The red shade on her face.

Her even-more-seductive attitude.

Your eyes shrink. Mesprit just went into heat again.

"Oh..." is all you manage to mumble. Behind you, two faces suddenly peek out of a bush...

--

"There she goes again..." Lucario mutters while looking at Mesprit.
"What do we do? Do we take him away?" Vaporeon asks concerned about you.

"... While Mesprit is awake? It would be the equivalent of suicide." Lucario responds.
"I say, let's wait and see how things go..."

--

"M-Mesprit... we can't..." you hastily respond while stepping back.
"... Remember what I told you before...?"

The giantess huffs lustfully.
"Yes. I know - rampage and all..." she responds.
"But I need this... I need you so much..."

You step away from the lustful giantess, who eyes you like a Mightyena while breathing heavily, her face growing even more red.

Your first thought is about running right into the cave and wake Azelf up. She said she'd protect you, no?

But... then again, running would cause Mesprit to chase you... it could be easier to just help her and get this over with...

Whatever should you do, it's up to you.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Mesprit staring down at you seductively...

choices: Azelf doesn't reply, her cheeks flaring up as she suddenly looks lustful...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
You stare at the pink headed guardian and she stares right back at you, breathing sultrily.
"Come on... I need you now..." she breaths lustfully while slowly moving to sit upright. Even though she's merely sitting, she still towers above most of the vegetation around - and of course, you.

You don't respond or move as you try to take a decision.

Running would inevitably cause Mesprit to chase you... still, you decide, it would be better than the risky alternative.

"Aaand..." you tell, before hastily turning around and sprinting away into the thick, dark forest. Mesprit blinks a few times, bemused, before giving a smile.

"Oh~ I see~" you hear her voice as you run away. The giantess gets up, starting to hover in midair as she looks in the direction you went.

"I love this game~"

Soon, you hear the rustling of a few plants and assume that Mesprit started chasing you as you predicted.

You pay her no mind as you keep running towards your objective: the cave.

The cave where Azelf and Uxie went to sleep. Your only chance was to wake Azelf up - she was to one who could stop Mesprit until she calmed down.

Soon enough though, the plants around you start shaking as Mesprit gets closer. Without thinking, you dive into the first bush you see, your heart pounding the walls of your chest and your brain screaming for you to do something - anything that might pull you out of this situation.

Slowly, you peer out of the bush, noticing an unmoving, hovering mountain of blue and pink looking around to spot you.

Although Mesprit had the power to sense emotions, she was having a hard time at finding her little human. It was too dark, and she couldn't see his little body anywhere. Although, she could sense his emotions and could tell that he was pretty close to her location.

"Oh, cutie~" she calls seductively.
"I'm having fun! But now, show yourself so we can play some more~ I know you're close~ I'll find you~"

You swallow, hastily trying to formulate a plan just as Mesprit starts searching in the bushes, her giant paws digging into the vegetation as she tries to find you.

Finally, you come up with a decent plan... maybe a quite predictable one, but it could still save you if it works.

You kneel down and start crawling from bush to bush, trying to not produce any sound as you try to find a rock on the ground. Mesprit perks up, hearing the bushes shaking behind her.

She giggles as she approaches the bunch of bushes you're hiding in.

At the same time, your hands get a hold of a small rock. You firmly grasp it as you look out of the bush, noticing Mesprit searching right in the bush before the one that serves as your precarious hiding spot.

Not finding you, the giantess stops, moving her paws to the next bush...

Hastily, you throw the rock out of the bush with all the strength you could muster. Due to the darkness and the giantess' size, it goes completely unnoticed, but it is enough to produce a rustling sound when it lands across the vegetation behind Mesprit.

The giantess turns around, having heard the sound. She giggles.
"Comin'~" she chimes as she hovers away from your hiding spot.

Only once you hear no more sounds and assume the area is clear you dare to sigh in relief as you get out, starting to run again, intent to reach the cave.

--

Luckily, you make it to the cavern without Mesprit finding you. Panting, you get inside. At least, now you're safe from the lustful gaze of the pink headed giantess.

Nonetheless, you had to wake Azelf up. Mesprit was still out there searching for you, and she wouldn't stop until she got her satisfaction.

Quietly, you move deeper into the cave, soon coming across two sleeping giantesses. Uxie and... Azelf.

You quickly move towards her, walking up to her face.
"Azelf..." you call out to the snoring giantess.

No response.

"Azelf." you call, a little louder this time. The only response you achieve is an incomprehensible muttering from the blue giantess, before she resumes her snoring.

"Azelf!" you shout.

The giantess' eyes shot open as she woke up, hastily looking around.
"Wha...?" she drowsily muttered as her gaze landed upon you.

Her eyelids relax a bit as they partially cover Azelf's eyes.
"You..." she quietly says, before yawning, hot air blowing from her mouth right into your small body, menacing to blow you away.

"What's the big deal...?" Azelf asks, annoyed because you rudely woke her up. You pay it no mind as you nervously fidget around.

"It's Mesprit! She went crazy!" you hastily explain.
"I managed to escape her, and she's searching for me, and-"

"Calm down, will ya?!" Azelf interrupts.
"Let's start over - my sister did what?"

You sigh.
"She... she suddenly went into heat... I ran away, she's still out there searching for me..." you explain.

Azelf blinks.
"H-Heat...?" she asks right before recalling what you told her about it.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A dangerous 'game'

choices: Suddenly, Uxie comes over, awoken by her siblings...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Azelf stares at you intently. Her gigantic eyes lay there, inches from you. You can see yourself in those eyes - you're sweating, sleepy and scared to death.

Then, the blue giantess in front of you begins moving. Her paws push against the ground as she helps herself up, the top of her head gently brushing against the ceiling of the cavern.

Azelf looks down at you, extending a paw.
"Let's go." she simply says.

You step back.
"... Are... Are you kidding?! She's searching for me!" you shout, your voice echoing around the cave. Uxie moans in her sleep as she rolls over her side.

Azelf looks at her, then back at you, a finger from her free hand placing itself over her mouth as she gestures you to keep quiet.

"... I know. But come on! It's just Mesprit! I'll handle her." she says.

"... Right now, that isn't Mesprit." you respond.
"It's a sexually-hungry beast."

Azelf sighs.
"We're losing time - quit being a coward and let's go!" she exclaims determinedly as she scoops you up and heads out of the cave.

"W-Wait... I don't want to come!" you say, desperately. If Mesprit managed to get her paws on you...

Azelf sighs and fixes on your a stern gaze... before deciding to change her approach.

Her expression softens and her eyes close.
"I won't let her take you. I promise." she says determinedly, while gently petting you with a paw.

You sigh, slightly reassured, but not fully convinced.
"B-But... what if she does...?" you ask.

The giantess smiles.
"I'll handle it - just trust me. You do trust me, right?"

You sigh again.
"Fine..." you mumble as the giantess starts moving.

She hears a few cries coming from the forest and decides to follow them.

"Sis..." you hear her mumbling every now and then as she heads deep into the forest.

--

Mesprit still hadn't given up on finding her human. He was still hiding from her - she needed to find him soon, her desires were uncontrollable!

"Cutie...? Come on out wherever you are! I need you!" she called lustfully, a fire burning within her.

The giantess turned back and started floating away... right before she bumped into something moving. Something moving and solid.

"Ow!" both she and whoever she ran into cry.

The giantess rubs her head, before opening her eyes.
"Watch where-" she notices Azelf rubbing her head too, before she opens her eyes as well, fixing them on Mesprit.

"Sis?"
"Sis."

Mesprit's gaze travels down to her sister's paw as she notices her holding something. And there, she spots the same one person she was searching for all along a - her human!

He was pale, clinging to Azelf's paw.

You physically shake - the impact had almost thrown you off your precarious perch.

You slowly looked at Mesprit, finding her smiling at you.
"Cutie! There you are!" she chimed while moving forward.
"Now we can finally-" Azelf closed you in her fist and spun in place, avoiding Mesprit while making you dizzy.

"Sis, what are you reduced to?" she asks in a lecturing tone.
"You already forgot what he told you... us? You can't allow your heat to make you lose control! None of us can!"

Mesprit huffed.
"I'm fine - just give him here and go back to sleep!" she responded, reaching out to snatch you from Azelf.

The blue giantess floated back.
"Won't do that." she stated defiantly while glaring at Mesprit.

The pink headed guardian growled as she got ready to tackle her sister... before finding that she couldn't move. At all.

"Azelf..." she cried upon realizing that Azelf just stole her willpower. Again.

"Sorry sis... it's to keep you from doing any harm to the human... or to Uxie's lake..." Azelf said, earning a glare from her unmoving sister.

"Mesprit - please..." you chimed in from your perch on Azelf's paw.
"You're in a delicate state of mind now, you need to stop this..."

Mesprit huffed.
"I am fine! It's just this cursed heat - help me get rid of it!" she said you.

"... You are not fine!" you responded with exasperation as your eyed the giantess intently.
"And you're frightening me... this is not the Mesprit I know... this is not the Mesprit I love..." you admit.

Mesprit's eyes widened at the statement.

"Aw, that's adorable!" Azelf chimed as she eyed you with a smile. You blushed, but looked over Mesprit.

For a few moments, a few eternal moments, she looks extremely dazed.

Maybe... your words had managed to have an effect on her?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Confronting Mesprit

choices: "We'll... We'll shrink back to our original sizes."
"We'll shrink... and you along with us."
"Shrinking would mean giving up on protecting the lakes... we can't..."
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
From the shadows, a third giantess appeared.

Said giantess was the guardian of this lake, Uxie. And she looked pretty dazed.

Azelf and Mesprit slowly gazed at their yellow headed sibling, who yawned and rubbed her closed eyes.
"What's the yelling about...? I was trying to sleep, y'know..." she said, not bothering to hide her annoyance.

Azelf frowns.
"Good. Keep doing that. Keep on sleeping while Mesprit rampages around your lake!" she says, eliciting a glare from the pink headed guardian.

"I did no such thing..." she retorts, desperately trying to move but also not wanting to actually move.

Behind the eyelids, Uxie's eyes widened.

"Rampage...?" she drowsily asks, before remembering.
"... Oh goodness..."

Azelf nods with a serious gaze fixed on her face.
"The human came to me... told me that she was chasing him..." she made a motion for Mesprit, who would have shrugged if she could have moved.

Mesprit sighs.
"Look... I simply... I needed help... I need help... I can't bear this..." she whines.
"And sis - lemme go..."

Azelf shook her head.
"Not until you're stable again." she said.

You watched as the two siblings started to quarrel.

However, you discover that you don't have much time to think about, because the ground suddenly recedes beneath your feet. You try to turn around, but you find that you're being held in place by a strong psychic force.

Soon enough though, you land on something soft and the psychic grip fades, allowing you to turn around to see that you're standing on top of Uxie's paw.

The giantess' visage is in front of you, an immense mass of yellow. Her eyes are dangerously close to you. One quick opening, and you'd forget everything.

However, those eyes remain perfectly still, you note. Instead, Uxie's lips part as she speaks,
"... I... am truly sorry... about what my sister attempted to do... please... forgive her..." she says dejectedly.

"... No problem... I'm fine anyway."

"See? He's fine - I would never dream of harming my human! Sis, let me go!" Mesprit chimed as she glared at Azelf, who smirked.

"Nope. You're unstable... and can't really do anything about can you?" she said mischievously.

Mesprit growled... before she too got a smirk on her face.

And Azelf suddenly moved back, looking dazed. She blinked a few times.
"If I could still feel emotions, I would be angry." she says in a neutral voice.

From behind you, Uxie sighed heavily.
"Please stop being brainless idiots." she said to her siblings.

"You're the one talking, smarty-pants." Mesprit retorted.

Uxie sighed, and gently put you down on the ground before floating closer to her siblings.
"This is serious... we need a solution to this problem, and we need it now! So, you two stop fighting!" she said imperatively, turning her head to Mesprit.

"You give Azelf her emotions!" she hisses.

Mesprit bites her lip; Azelf, who was being quiet, suddenly perks up, able to feel emotions again.

Uxie turns her head to her.
"And you... don't give Mesprit her willpower yet because her mind is still unstable."

"HEY!"

Uxie sat down, emulated by Azelf. The yellow headed titaness turned around to look at you.
"Please... come over here..." she says.

You gulp, and reluctantly walk up to the three sisters.

"Cutie..." you hear Mesprit mumbling as you approach.

Mesprit looked at Azelf.
"Sis... lemme go... I want to hug him..." she told dejectedly.

Azelf smiled, and happily let go of her now calm sister.

Mesprit finds that she can move again and she looks down at you.

Gently, the giantess bends to pick you up. You fight the urge to cower and let her pick you.

True to her word, Mesprit hugs you to her chest, her gigantic head resting against your upper body.

"I'm sorry... I tried... I couldn't control myself..." she apologizes. You blush, but hug back.

"Aw!" Azelf chimed.

Uxie was smiling, but then sighed.
"Look, it's all very touching, but we should really try to find a solution to our... ‘heat problem’..." she says, blushing.

"... Right." Mesprit says, sitting down as well, not letting go of you though.

Uxie looks at you.

"Human... when Mesprit went into heat... did you try talking to her?" she asks.

You timidly nod.
"Yes... but it... It didn't actually work this time... guess that means that you were right, Uxie..." you admit.

Uxie nods, before looking at her siblings.
"Think. Hard. We have to find a solution." she says.

Silence falls among the four of you as the three sisters and you try to think of a solution... there ought to be one, a solution that might help these three giantesses...

You perk up.

Giantesses... they are dangerous, because they are giantesses... however.

"You three grew yourself, right?" you casually ask.

"Yeah... why?" Azelf asks.

Uxie perks up. She understood your kind of thinking.
"... Because, the other way around, we could shrink ourselves so that we aren't dangerous anymore! " she exclaims.

Azelf and Mesprit react simultaneously,
"What?!"

"We... We can't..." Mesprit says, looking at you intently. Giving up on her size would mean not being able to cuddle her precious little human anymore... and she enjoyed that. A lot.

Azelf is reasoning on another line of thinking.
"Sis, we need to be big... how are we going to protect the lakes if she shrink?" she asked.

"Like we always did before growing." Uxie seemed firm.

"... So that-" she made a nervous gesture for you.
"... can beat us up again? Ruin the lakes again?"

"We'll be ready. It's the only way... like this, we are far more dangerous than humans are." Uxie replies.

"B-But... what about us...?" Mesprit asked you.

"What?" you ask in confusion.

"Me and you... I kinda like you comparatively tiny..." she awkwardly admits.

"Sis, that's dumb." Uxie tells. Mesprit huffs and hugs you.

"... Unless... he could shrink with us..." Azelf ponders.

You pale.
"But... that way, we'd be back to square one!" you exclaim.

"Hmm..." Mesprit mumbles.

There was no way out of this. And yet, this was the only solution...

Either the three shrunk - with or without you - or remained big in order to protect their lakes.

The three legendaries take a good while to think to themselves. Then, after an incalculable amount of time, Uxie suddenly picked you from Mesprit, placing you on the ground, before gripping her two siblings and pulling them closer

You hear them whispering. You listen, desperately trying to hear what they decided, but you can only make out single, senseless words.

But, much to your relief, the legendaries soon split up to make their decision clear to you.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: The ultimate solution: shrinkage

choices: You wake up the next morning
You're awakened again by one of the sisters
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"Human... Uxie is right. This big, we are dangerous to our lakes... to the life around them... to you." Azelf said in shame.

"So, the only solution to this problem is that we shrink back down to our original sizes," Uxie chimed as the three encircled you.
"If only we were able to control ourselves..." Uxie continued dejectedly.
"I mean, we all got powers... turns out we all abused those." states shamefully, causing Azelf to blush.

"Hold on, I never actually abused my powers!" Mesprit chimes in. Uxie perks up.
"... Really, Mesprit? Never played with someone's emotions?" she asks.

"Ehm..." you timidly raise your hand, causing Mesprit to look at blushing, before sighing.

"... Let's just do it." Mesprit says, closing her eyes as the blush spread across her face.

Soon, Mesprit was emulated by her sisters as a strong psychic force filled the area around Lake Acuity.

The three start glowing.

You take a few steps back, your eyes glued to the scene.

And, soon, the three legendary sisters start shrinking.

Soon, they reached the size of small hills. Then, they shrank to the height of trees. Then, they matched your height.

And, at last, they ultimately shrank to one foot tall, to the point where they didn't even reach your knees.

You watch, shocked. Such giantesses were in reality that small?... It made sense, you guessed - they were all pixies after all...

Mesprit was the first one to open her eyes. She glanced around, noticing that it worked - she and her sisters weren't towering above the vegetation anymore.

And finally, her gaze landed on you.

A smile brightened her face as she flew over you. Even at such small size, Mesprit was still quite strong, you notice when a pink and blue blur tackles you to the ground. A pair of arms wrapped around your neck as you find the hyperactive pixie hugging you.

"Cutie! You're the giant now!" she said happily as she fidgeted on your motionless body, her head lovingly rubbing against yours.

You laugh a bit... despite the fact that Mesprit is kinda choking you.

You slowly sit upright, the pixie clinging to your neck.

You move a hand on her head as you pet her, eliciting a pleased moan.

Azelf and Uxie get closer to you smiling.

"Ten years... we've been living with that size for ten years..." Azelf mumbles as she looks around, admiring her now huge surroundings. She was used to tower over things... seeing the world from this perspective again was quite weird.

"You can't believe this all is happening, huh?" Uxie chimed.

"This size's got some advantages~" Mesprit says, crawling up to your shoulder and pushing her head against your chin, not letting go of your neck though.

You smiled... before yawning.
"So...?" you ask.
"What now? Do we just go back in the cave... possibly catch some sleep?" you ask, hopeful.

Next to you, Mesprit giggles mischievously... that giggle was something you learned to fear.

"Not yet, I'm afraid... although you do have a point..." Azelf said, yawning.
Y'See, we shrunk... but we're not done yet..." Uxie giggled.

You stare at the three, confused... before remembering.

‘Unless... he could shrink with us..."

The color drains from your face.
"No... No... bad idea... bad bad idea..." you tell as you try to get up to back away, forgetting that Mesprit is still clinging to your neck.

The pink headed guardian giggles playfully.
"Nope~... don't misunderstand me, my love for you is the same, but I want my little cutie back~" she said cheerfully, her sisters hovering closer with smirks painted on their faces.

"But... you told nothing about me shrinking!" you complain as you ponder running... though that'd be useless, you figure.

One, they fly and would catch up in no time; two, Mesprit is still gripping your neck; three, Azelf could just steal your willpower to stop you.

"Don't I have a choice...? I mean, the lake is safe... but I wouldn't exactly be..." you say with a sigh.

"Oh, sure you will, we'll make you small enough so that we can still see, hear - feel~ - you...come on!" Mesprit said, leaving you and joining her sisters in front of you.

You sigh deeply before a psychic force surrounds you. You look down, noticing the ground getting closer as the legendaries drain your size with their psychic powers.

"A few inches... we need to be able to see and hear him..." Uxie mumbles to her sisters, who nod, careful to not overdo the shrinking.

You shrink, to the point where you're matching the height of the pixies, the even smaller.

And then, blades of grass start towering above you. Just then, the shrinking comes to an end. You looked at yourself, noting that you couldn't be bigger than the tips of the sisters' tails.

And you're picked up by a pair of large paws belonging to Mesprit, who smiled down at you, emulated by Uxie and Azelf.
"And here's my cutie~" the pink headed pokemon chimed, pecking your cheek, making you blush.

"And now that's settled..." Azelf said, one of her tails coiling around your torso.
"Let's go back to sleep." she chimed, floating away in direction of the cavern, dragging you along.

"Hey!" Mesprit yelled as she and Uxie chased their blue sister.

Only once the area was cleared, two pokemon came out of their hiding spot behind a few bushes.

They quietly walked towards the lake.

"I can't believe this..." Lucario said with a smirk.
"We're all safe... after all those years، it's finally over..."

"Vaa..." Vaporeon told with a dejected expression.

"... What do you mean, ‘he isn't safe’?... Are you talking about the human?" Lucario asked.

"Vaa-on..." the blue pokemon says, nodding her head.

"I know, they'll still lose control... but they can't harm us or the lake anymore..." Lucario said.

"On..." Vaporeon retorted, causing Lucario to sigh.
"Yeah, they can still harm he human... and? He chose that by himself... and, perhaps, they won't actually hurt him..." he responded.

"Vaa!" the blue quadruped cried.

"... He can't take the risk...?" Vaporeon nodded.
"On! Vap!"

Lucario looked at her intently after the last remark.
"... How are we supposed to rescue him? You'd risk fighting three legendaries over a tiny human who consented... kind of?" he asked.

"Vaporeon!" was Vaporeon's reply.

"Even if they're not giant, they could still crush us to paste! No no, count me out." Lucario said, starting to walk away.

Vaporeon sighed.
"Vaa..." she mumbled dejectedly.

‘I'm doing it somehow.’

--

"Wow... this place looks gigantic like this! Don't you agree?" Azelf asked you, her tail rising up to her smiling face.

"Yep... especially from my point of view..." you say.

Then, your world shakes as you're gripped from behind and roughly pulled back by Mesprit, who hugs you while glaring daggers at Azelf, who snickers.

Mesprit looks at you with a much softer expression.

"Bedtime, cutie~" she says sweetly as she laid down, emulated by her siblings.

"This place looks so empty..." Uxie said.

"We'll have to get used to it... I mean, we've been big for ten years..." Mesprit said, her paws wrapping around your small form.

"Yeah, great, why did you shrink me as well?" you casually ask, drawing the attention of the giantesses... to you anyway.

Azelf smiled.
"Because we're used to you being small... and also because that size makes you kinda cute." she said, causing Mesprit to sigh.

"... Sleep tight, everyone." she said, pecking your head before laying her head on the hard, stone floor.

Your ears register the answers of Azelf and Uxie, before you too close your eyes and sigh.

It'll be hard to adjust to this, you figure...

You yawn. Running from Mesprit, hiding, getting her sisters, witnessing them shrinking before being shrunk yourself... that all left you quite tired.

Soon enough, sleep comes to claim your consciousness.

Darkness overwhelms your mind, and you gladly let it, falling into a deep sleep.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Shrinking

choices: Before you could reply, one of her sisters suddenly came out!
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Your eyes opened, your gaze darted around: you were sure you heard a noise.

Yawning drowsily, you noticed that you were still laying on Mesprit; the comparative giantess was asleep, Uxie too.

But Azelf was awake, her golden eyes piercing the darkness as she sat upright in silence, leaning back as she stared at the now endless cave. Earlier tonight, there wouldn't have been much space to move around; now, this place was immense.

You stared at the awakened pixie for a couple moments. She looked deep in thought.

"A-Azelf?" you called, causing her gaze to fall on you.

For a moment, she smiled, happy to have someone to talk to, before she placed a paw over her mouth, silently telling you to be quiet.

The blue giantess approached her sister whose body was your bedding.

Gently, Azelf moved Mesprit's paws out of the way and picked you up.

In perfect silence, she fluttered out of the cave with you in her grip. Moonlight showered you and her as she sat down, leaning back against the stone wall of the cave.

You found yourself being manipulated as Azelf turned you around in her grip, before you were pushed against her chest.

You pulled back a bit and relaxed, looking up at the blue titaness.

"Couldn't sleep?" you questioned sympathetically.

"I could ask you the same thing." she replied with a bit of a smirk on her face,
"Nightmares?"

"I could ask you the same thing," you parroted back,
"And no... you woke me up."

Azelf blushed.

"... Sorry."

You smirked at her.

"So? Why couldn't you sleep?" you asked again. The pixie sighed.
"There's... a bit too much in my mind." she revealed.

"Like?"

For several moments, Azelf didn't respond, and gazed away from you. The paws resting on your back started petting you.

And then, the giantess looked back at you. She was blushing.

"I don't think you want to hear the boring musings of a guardian... just go back to sleep, I'm sure you're dying to catch some." she bluntly said.

You huffed.

"There's a bit too much in my head too, Azelf," you replied,
"In case you haven't noticed, I'm, like, one inch tall. And I don't even know why." you lectured.

The blue guardian giggled.

"You do. Mesprit told you why." she recalled her sister's insistence on shrinking you too.

"That doesn't explain why you and Uxie agreed," you chimed.
"Heck, you were the one suggesting this!"

"I told you," Azelf instantly responded,
"That size makes you kind of cute."

She said that with a smile and a blush.

"Ehm... there's a pokemon that seemingly likes me a lot sleeping in the cave behind you..." you reminded her.

Azelf titled her head, and your world shook as she adjusted her position on the hard ground.

"... ‘Seemingly’?" she repeated,
"She nearly killed Uxie for you."

You sighed.

"Please don't bring that up... it was so..."

"Scary?" Azelf finished, before giving off a sigh too,
"Tell me about it - I've been with those two for my whole life, you have no idea of how much times I had to stop them before they did something the would have regretted." she said.

"Hm..."

Both you and the giantess went quiet, and the paws holding you resumed petting.

A peaceful silence fell between the two of you, like a barrier that separated you and Azelf from the rest of the world; a barrier that was only penetrated by the sound of the wind and your breathing mixed with Azelf's; a barrier that could be shattered at any moment with just the slightest word.

Only after a while, Azelf finally broke the silence with a deep sigh. You, who had almost fallen asleep, sprang back to a very awake state.

"It's... It's this all." the giantess mumbled.

"Hm?" you asked. Azelf sighed again as a light breeze blew past her and you.

"Nevermind... you wouldn't understand." she said.

"I'll try to." you calmly reassured.

She looked at you with a small smile.

"It's... I can't sleep because of this all," the guardian admitted,
"I mean, one hour ago I was incredibly big and now I'm one foot tall; I liked to think I was more calm than those two in there-" she made a motion for the cave behind her,
"... And I lost control - sorry about that..."

You waved a hand dismissively, showing that you didn't hold any hard feelings.

Azelf continued.

"And then there's this stupid heat, it's slowly killing me from the inside!" she yelled.

"Shh!" you hastily placed a hand over your mouth to avoid Azelf waking one - or worse, both - of her sisters waking up, noticing you and her talking about such subject alone, late at night.

"... But you're normal again now, no? Can't you... I dunno, find a real mate?" you asked.

The blue guardian sighed.

"See? You don't understand. No one does..." she sourly said, looking down for a moment.
"My sisters and I, we're all legendaries. You humans want to capture us, thinking that our power is a blessing..."

"I didn't." you justified.

"... You're all are wrong. It's a curse." Azelf stated, her paws gripping you a bit more tightly in frustration.

"We use our power to protect the lakes and the pokemon, but what comes of it? No one wants to have nothing to do with you. They're all scared, even when we're not big. And when someone finally finds the guts to even talk to us... they run off after the first time." she bitterly revealed.

"Oh..." you said, blushing, while feeling sorry for the blue pokemon. You recalled that Azelf was the only sister you didn't help though.

The great giantess loosened her grip.

"That's right... it sucks to be a legendary. You can ask anyone." she continued.

Again, silence fell between you and her, but it wasn't the same pleasing silence of before, no, it was an awkward silence.

Then, Azelf perked up.

"Human." she said,
"You helped my sisters... why weren't you afraid?"

The question took you aback.

"Well..." you started, feeling embarrassed,

You are awakened from your sleep, feeling something soft and wet sliding over your face.

You try to fight it, but you are eventually forced to open your eyes and hazily look forward, noticing a blue mass sitting in front of you.

You rub your eyes, feeling your face wet. Then, you look again, managing to make out the silhouette of a familiar Vaporeon.

"... What do you want...? In the dead of night...?" you drowsily ask as you yawn, trying to sit upright on Mesprit's chest... only to find her paws keeping you perfectly still. The only thing you could do was raise your head to look at the now giant blue pokemon.

The quadruped pokemon looked at you, before her left paw raised as she pointed to you, then to herself, before her paw ultimately fell in direction of the exit.

You blink at few times, your brain trying to process what she just said... or tried to say.

"Y-You... You want me to come with you...?" you ask, trying to lift Mesprit's paws a bit... but failing poorly in doing so.

Vaporeon nodded as her muzzle leaned closer, her mouth opening as she got a grip your feet.

"W-Wait...!" you exclaim, before looking back at Mesprit, who luckily remains asleep.
"I don't know if you noticed, but I'm kinda the size of a bug and unable to move..." you say, causing the Vaporeon to release your feet and look at you.

She tilted her head.

You sighed, before your world shook as the titaness you're resting on tumbles over her side, her grip loosening slightly... nonetheless, Mesprit held you quite tightly.

You sighed.

Seriously, too many things were happening too fast for you to process.

First, the sisters are titanesses that threaten to kill you and destroy the lake while in heat, then Uxie erases your memories, then the legendaries shrink down, only to shrink you too to a few inches...

"... Seriously, just tell me what you want and let me return to sleep... please..." you tell Vaporeon, who moves in between Azelf and Mesprit to face you.

Seen like this, the legendary sisters looked so innocent... no one could ever guess what they've done in the past... and, still, they had enough power to wipe away the entire lake if they just wanted to, let alone a tiny human.

All he had to do was wait for the next time they went into heat - they would ‘insert’ him, only for him to came out as a crushed corpse.

Vaporeon couldn't allow that - the human had willingly helped Uxie when she told him about the pokemon that crawled inside of her.

He earned her trust, and she wanted to help him.

"Vap..." the water type said, making you stare at her perplexed.
"Uh... can't understand ya..." you say, obviously unable to understand Vaporeon and far too tired to want to decipher what she was saying.

The quadruped pokemon pointed at the three sisters, before her gaze fell on you and she shook her head.

"... Uh... I mustn't... I mustn't stay with Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie...? Is that what you're saying?" you ask, causing the Vaporeon to nod.

You briefly look back at the three sleeping sisters... they had solved their problem by shrinking themselves, what else could Vaporeon want?

"... Why? I think that their heat won't cause anymore trouble..." you say, before yawning.

Vaporeon nodded... before pointing to you.

"M-Me?" you ask.

An annoyed groan echoed in the cave as Azelf started to fidget in her sleep, before her eyes suddenly open.

The blue giantess turns her head to glance at you. She blinks a few times.
"Keep it down..." she murmurs as she rolls over her side and resumes snoring, apparently not having noticed Vaporeon, who sighed in relief.

Again, the water type points at you, then to the legendaries, then to you again, before... her face became red.

And you finally understand.

"... You're trying to say that these three aren't a threat to the lake or you inhabitants anymore, but they're still a threat to ME?" you ask.

It made sense.

The sisters shrunk down to their original sizes... but shrunk you too, and you were currently the size of an ant to them. They could still hurt you really bad...

You shake of the thought... they would never do something like that.

"Look... I can't come with you, Vaporeon... despite what it looks like, these three are harmless! They would never hurt me... on purpose..." you frankly say.
"And plus, I'm a bug right now. If I leave them, who'd take care of me? I can't exactly do on my own right now..." you add, bitterly thinking that, if you leave, you wouldn't even make it out of the lake alive.

--

"Hey! Lemme go!" you cry as the Vaporeon exits the cave the sisters sleep in, you hanging from her lips. Knowing the type, you were sure she wasn't going to hurt you... but you weren't quite sure of what would have happened if you tried to flee.

The giantess gives no response as she simply keeps walking towards an unknown destination.

"Hey! I'm talking to you! Let me go!... I'm feeling sick..." you say as you swing back and forth, feeling nauseous. This was definitely NOT the best way to travel.

Obviously, your brain registers these as secondary facts due the more important nature of your current problem: you were kidnapped.

Luckily for you, Vaporeon mercifully stops around Lake Acuity and lowers her head as she gently lets you down on the grass. Her giant blue eyes were placed right in front of yours as she looked at you up close.

You knew that Vaporeon wasn't going to hurt you; she was trying to rescue you from the legendaries, and you appreciated the gesture... but you can't deny how such usually adorable pokemon looked absolutely terrifying from your perspective.

There you were, at the mercy of a giant pokemon who you barely knew... sure, maybe you had known her better on the past, but you forgot about her after Uxie erased your memories, so you couldn't possibly entrust your life in the paws of this giantess.

"... Will you explain, please, why you did that?" you finally break the silence as you sit upright while Vaporeon raises her head.

"Vap." she responded, her voice menacing to break both your eardrums. That only contributed to give you an accurate idea of how small and helpless you really were.

"Can't understand ya..." you remind her as she gives a disappointed sigh.

"Vaporeon..." she said, wearing a confused look upon her face. That look made quite the statement, ‘I've already told you.’

You huff as you cross your legs.
"Yeah, I get it - you wanted to save me," you say, pausing to inhale deeply.
"Thing is: there was no need to. I am safe."

Seriously, was this going to be your life now? Carried around like a doll, giving off awkward explanation? If Mesprit woke up without finding you, she'd do nothing but freak out and search for you... until she found you with another girl pokemon.

Then you would have to give one heck of an explanation...

You look back at Vaporeon, noticing her staring down at you. The water type gently shook her head. You sigh, trying to recall the last statement you made before getting carried by your train of thought.

"... I'm not safe?" you say, finally managing to remember what you said.

This time, the blue giantess nods.

"... Where's Lucario?" you ask.

The giantess sighed as she shook her head.
"He's not here?" you inquired, and she nodded.

"Vaa-on..." she said with a somewhat indignant expression. You blink.

"... He didn't want to come with you?" you guessed.

Again, Vaporeon nodded.

"... Why did you come alone?... Why did you take me away?" you inquired again.

The water type smiled... and you soon found her huge blue head lowering on your whole being, her slick cheek nuzzling you into the hard ground.

You smiled a little.
"Guess you must really like me, huh?" she gave an happy cry in response.

You sighed.
"Look. I understand that you want to protect me, and I'm grateful for it. But, seriously, the legendaries aren't going to hurt me, I'm sure." you say, trying to convince Vaporeon. It'd be easy, you figure, you've got pretty valid arguments.

The pokemon remained silent as she slowly raised her head.

"Look, for starters, what if I needed my size back? We would have to go to them again, no? And I don't think they'd be pleased to see me with you..." you say, desperately hoping she'd reason with your first attempt. Unfortunately, Vaporeon merely tilted her head, signaling you to go on.

"... Okay, two, I don't think I'd be safe with you either... It think that most of your friends there..." you pointed to the forest.
"... would like to have me as a snack... or for..." you paused to blush.
"... For... ehm... 'other purposes'... just see what happened with Uxie..." you recall, and the blue quadruped blushed.

It was true. It was full of wild pokemon out there... well, that wasn't totally accurate. It was full of wild, horny, hungry pokemon... meaning that the human risked being eaten... in more than just one way...

Regardless, Vaporeon shook her head and offered a determined smile.

"You'd protect me, huh?" you say as you awkwardly scratch your head... before you got an idea.

"Say... would you protect me from Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie too?" you asked, causing Vaporeon to look down at you confused.

"Yep... when those three wake up and find me missing, don't you think they'll just... I dunno... search around the lake to find me? What if they find you? What would you do then?" you asked.

This fully got the pokemon's attention. Now she looked doubtful, she knew you were right.

How would she face the wrath of the legendary guardians...?

The blue titan looked back down at you, offering a sigh.

"So?" you asked.
