1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Vaporeon looked back at you and wore a look of determination upon her face; a look that clearly told ‘I'll protect you’...

You, however, didn't agree with such thing,

"... No no no, bad, bad idea... those three will kill when they find you!" you shouted.

This gigantic blue pokemon wanted to keep you with her, protect you... but she couldn't protect you against three legendaries, one of which had deep feelings for you!

Vaporeon stared at you, a sly smile appearing on her face,

"Vap..." she chimed.

You rubbed the back of your head, uncomfortable.
"They won't find ya, huh?" you asked, and she nodded, suggesting that what you said was exactly what she meant.

You sighed, wondering how you ended in such predicament... why didn't Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie shrink you after shrinking themselves? Why did this Vaporeon want to ‘rescue’ you from them? They weren't a danger anymore, no?

All your thoughts were interrupted as you noted the Vaporeon's large head coming down again, mouth wide open, her dark, fleshy insides exposed.

Before you could even think of something to say, she had bitten the back of your shirt and lifted you far up in the air as her head rose.

You sighed, your body shook as each step Vaporeon took made her slender body vibrate.

For a brief moment, before your hazy mind was assaulted with more important preoccupations, you wondered where she was headed.

--

Normally, the many water-types Lake Acuity housed lived in the lake... but with a human ‘guest’, Vaporeon necessarily had to find someplace else for the night.

A hard task since she only knew two places in the forest, both of them out of the question; one was the cavern where the three sisters currently slept, the other was the cave that served Lucario as a den... and he made it clear that he didn't approve the idea of helping the human. If she asked him, she was sure that he was going to throw her out because he didn't want to have anything to do with the human.

Not anymore.

Vaporeon finally stopped, her gaze falling upon the small entrance of a cave she never saw before.

You noticed it too.

"Vaa..." came from the corner of the water-type pokemon, assaulting your poor ears.

You shivered slightly as the giantess started walking again.

Vaporeon carefully made her way inside the cavern and found that there wasn't no one inside... aside from a few Zubat that were hanging upside down from the ceiling.

You gulped, trying to shake off the horrible image of one of those pokemon, whose faces were entirely occupied by the large fang-filled mouth, feasting on your blood before swallowing your now extremely small body.

The mental image made you shiver, but Vaporeon didn't seem to notice.

Instead, she appeared to be... blushing?

"Vap..." she said you, gently lowering her head until your feet touched the ground again. Only then you noticed that she was flushing red, but smiling reassuringly.

You paled.

"Oh no, you're in heat too, aren't y-" the blue pokemon started to shake her head frenetically.

Then, she started to move in circles around you, her body and elongated tail coiled around your whole being, trapping you as the giantess laid down.

Her face was in front of you, you noted by her gigantic blue eyes that were fixed on you.

"On..." Vaporeon said happily, giving you a few playful licks, causing you to wonder whether you should laugh or sigh in exasperation.

Ultimately, your choice fell on the second option.

"Look," you said dejectedly.
"They're going to find us... the legendaries I mean... bring me back to the cave, or they'll harm you..." you repeated, wanting to get out of this situation - and wanting to avoid this kind pokemon getting hurt, but mostly because you wanted to get out of this situation.

However, the water-type simply smiled again, determined, before closing her eyes.

Her head fell on a side.

Within a few minutes, Vaporeon was asleep, you could judge by her breath slowing down. It was an almost imperceptible sound, but your shrunken ears could catch even the most inaudible sound now... even the occasional, frightening cry from the Zubat above.

But then, realization hit you.

If Vaporeon fell asleep... you'd have a chance to flee, get back to the three legendary siblings!

...

Almost immediately, your brain discarded the idea - you wouldn't last long in this state out in the middle of a forest... and you were sure, whenever Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie woke up in the morning and noticed you missing, they'd hunt you down... especially Mesprit.

The pink-headed guardian was probably going to crush Vaporeon for technically kidnapping you...

Again, the idea of getting free and running away penetrated your thoughts, tempting you... you'd be back with the sisters and Vaporeon would be unharmed...

This time, your mind had some problems getting rid of the idea.

It was too dangerous, you told yourself, you couldn't possibly risk your life like that. Sticking with this Vaporeon was your only chance now... she wasn't even asleep...

... But still, the idea lingered in your mind.

"A-Azelf?" you wear a confused expression as you watch the giantess' eyes getting partially lidded by her eyelids as she lays back down on her stomach with a neutral look.

"Azelf!... What's wrong? You have to stop-" you note something odd... all of sudden, this cave seems even darker.

"She doesn't care anymore~" a voice echoes inside of the cave.

You tremble upon hearing the sweet... yet terrifying voice of Mesprit.

You slowly look up, noticing the pink headed guardian looking down at you with a lustful smile.
"You almost had me beat... but I'll have you know, I'm good at this kind of games~" she chimes playfully.

Azelf looked at her.
"This is no game sis, you've gone crazy - gimme back my emotions..." she spoke with a calm tone, unable to feel emotions anymore.

Mesprit smirked at her emotionless sibling.
"You took my willpower earlier... guess we're even sis!" she snickered, before looking at you again, and extending an arm.

"Enough playing. Now, let's-"

Mesprit never got to finish as she was suddenly hit by a strong psychic blast, which sends her straight into a wall of the cave.

The whole place shakes as the giantess collides with the hard wall, dust and small rocks raining from the ceiling. Startled, you look back at Azelf, who was still wearing a neutral look.

"... That wasn't me." she answered before you could even speak.

"As a matter of fact, that was me." Uxie's voice chimed.

You turn around, noticing the yellow headed pixie getting closer to where you and Azelf are.

The pixie seemed to gaze down at you.
"... Are you alright? Did she do anything to you?" she asks with concern, recalling that you and her sibling were sleeping outside.

You glance up at the relatively harmless giantess and nod.

"I... I'm fine... I managed to run..." you say shakily, and Uxie nodded her head.

A loud groan emitted from behind you and echoed inside the cavern, sending shivers down your spine.

Mesprit was recovering.

The pink headed giantess placed her hands on the damaged stone wall and pulled back, rubbing her head while glaring at Uxie.

"You... YOU...!" she cried, angered, as she flew towards Uxie with a murderous glare.

But the pixie intercepted her attack with her paws and roughly slammed Mesprit into another wall of the cave, which shook again at the impact... seriously, this place was going to be destroyed by the two titans if they didn't stop.

You watched as Uxie held a struggling Mesprit against the wall and leaned in closer.
"I'm warning you, Mesprit. Stop this, or I'll knock sense into you." she said.

Mesprit snarled in response as she freed one of her arms from Uxie's grip; Mesprit's paw lingered in midair for a moment, before slamming into Uxie's head as her sibling slapped her across the face, the slap resounding inside the dark cavern.

Uxie cried in pain as she pulled back, freeing Mesprit. She placed a paw on the cheek Mesprit had slapped... before she snarled, her eyelids suddenly parting as she gave Mesprit a death glare.

You hurried to cover your eyes, while Azelf meekly closed hers.

A second later, an explosion roared inside the cave, then the sound of rocks hitting the ground and distant, angry cries.

You didn't need to watch two guess what just happened.

Your eyes slowly open as you look to the side, wearing a terrified look: one side of the cave was completely destroyed, rocks falling from a large hole that was caused from the impact of the two giantesses.

You slowly walk over the hole, noticing the two siblings fighting on the ground, Mesprit on top of Uxie as they repeatedly hit each other.

The two remained locked, Uxie rolled on top of Mesprit and hovered in the air, trying to punch her opponent, who dodged.

Uxie's arm hit the ground... you swore you felt it shaking beneath your feet even at such distance.

Mesprit grabbed Uxie's arm, and threw her. The yellow headed pixie was sent flying into the forest, many pokemon evacuating it in fear.

You watched as Mesprit flew towards her sibling... before they completely disappeared from your sight.

You stood there, dumbfounded... they were going to destroy the lake if they kept this up! The inhabitants feared the sisters' heat, but this was much worse!

"Oh God..." you whispered, dreading the catastrophic consequences that this insensate fight will bring to the lake, to the life around it and possibly to the whole Sinnoh region...

"Hey..."

You turned around, Azelf was staring at you.

You slowly walk over her, noting that she was still wearing an emotionless look upon her face.

"... Your sisters are going to kill each other, aren't you going to do something?" you say as calmly as you could.

Azelf looked at you.
"I don't care... I mean, I can't care... Mesprit stole my emotions... God this is so weird, it's horrible and I can't feel bad about it..." she said.

You groaned.

"Great. They're going to annihilate the lake. Just great." you said, feeling sick.

"I... I can't do anything... But you... It's up to you to stop them..." the giantess said.

You perk up. How was she expecting you to do that?!
"M-Me?! How can I stop them?!" you cried.

Azelf looked at the ceiling.
"I'm sure you'll come up with something... hurry..." she quietly said.

You were about to explain how you are just a bit bigger than a ant to them, when a loud scream assaults your ears.

"Crap..." you mumble to yourself as you turn around and start running.
"Be careful..." you heard Azelf say as you exited from the giant hole Uxie and Mesprit made.

You looked around, picking up the screams of the two siblings and you ran in the direction they came from.

--

Your eyes are greeted with a terrifying... yet pitiful sight.

Mesprit and Uxie, covered in bruises and scratches while they kept fighting around the lake.

You looked around, finding many pokemon staring at the fighting sisters in terror.

Your gaze returns to the Mesprit and Uxie; the second was on the ground, but suddenly sat up, grabbing Mesprit's head with both paws and slamming her face into the ground repeatedly, Mesprit growling in pain.

You had seen enough, you decide.

Your legs seem to move on their own as you run up to the two as they grab each other again, starting to roll again.

"ENOUGH!" you shout as Uxie was about to roll on top of Mesprit... and Mesprit was about to roll on top of you!

Both sisters' eyes widened as they heard your voice, but it was too late...

You close your eyes waiting for the giantesses to roll on you, reducing you to a flattened mess on the ground...

Nothing happens.

"Cutie move!"

You opened your eyes, noticing Uxie and Mesprit holding each other in place with their psychic powers.

You blinked.

"Move!... Quick!" Uxie repeated, struggling to hold Mesprit.

You gulp, thanking whatever higher saved you as you silently walked back, putting a good distance between you and the two sisters, who finally let each other go and fall on the ground, causing it to shake from the doubled weight due Uxie being on top of Mesprit.

The yellow headed giantess raised her head and looked around her lake... she felt sick.

Smashed trees, destroyed vegetation, terrorized pokemon... the human almost killed.

Uxie looked at Mesprit... who avoided her gaze.

"WHAT HAVE WE DONE?!" Uxie shouted, her eyes closing. Her head slid on Mesprit's chest as she started crying loudly.

Mesprit looked at her, before her head turned as she looked back at the startled you.

Mesprit too felt tears welling in her eyes... she had almost killed her precious little human... and Lake Acuity, but more importantly her little human.

"I'm... I'm... I'm s-sorry!" she stuttered, looking away as she too started crying, her lament becoming one with Uxie's.

"Ehm..." you say, relieved that they finally stop fighting... but frankly quite confused about how this ended.

You really thought they were going to start fighting again after you were safe...

You stare at the two crying sisters and ponder your next move.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Sisters showdown

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
You watch the two crying titanesses, not knowing what to do. You couldn't risk getting too close to comfort them - one tear was enough to drown you.

And trying to comfort them from a... safety distance seemed quite stupid...

You casually look back at the forest, noting that the pokemon that were watching before were all gone... probably back into the forest or lake.

Mesprit and Uxie were done fighting each other, so there wasn't no more danger.

You sighed.

Lucario and Vaporeon warned you about their heat, but you never actually considered the chance of the titanesses trying to hurt each other. Sure, they had tried in the past, but Azelf had stopped them.

Now, without Azelf's intervention, Mesprit and Uxie went wild... and destroyed a good percentage of the lake, scared the hell out of its inhabitants and almost killed you.

You sigh as your gaze returns to the two giantesses, who were still crying.

You had to do something, you had to try to comfort them somehow...

Your legs seem to move on their own as you take a step, then another, and another as you slowly make your way to the crying pixies.

You stop by the giant body of Mesprit and place a hand on her giant hip, slowly rubbing the smooth surface in an attempt to both get her attention and comfort her.

Feeling your touch, Mesprit opens her eyes to look down at you... you are assaulted by a strong fit of sadness: her eyes were completely red, tears running down her cheeks as she cried.

Mesprit's lament was lessened as she moved her massive paw in your direction and grabbed you. You find yourself getting lifted high in the air, before Mesprit unceremoniously pushed Uxie off her chest to hug you.

The yellow headed giantess sat upright, tears running past her closed eyelids and her mouth repeatedly letting out sobs.

"H-Human..." she managed to stammer, before grabbing her face in her paws, caught in another fit of regret.

Mesprit too sat up.
"... We-We're sorry..." she said, remorseful, your sadness and pity making her cry harder.

"... I know." you simply respond, hugging Mesprit back the best you could and smiling bitterly.
"But... stop crying, please... you're guardians, don't cry in front of others." you tell, even though there was no one but you and the two siblings.

Even though their tears, Uxie and Mesprit blushed.

"H-H-How can we call ourselves guardians? W-We are dangerous t-to our lakes... to everyone a-and e-everything..." Uxie stutters as she sniffles, once again observing the catastrophic results that the fight caused.

"... I'm supposed to guard this lake..." she mutters dejectedly.

Mesprit sniffled.
"And Azelf..." she suddenly perked up.
"Azelf!" she cried, hastily got up and hovered in direction of the cavern.

Uxie let a couple more tears fall from her eyes before getting up as well.

She had another task to achieve...

--

Mesprit hovered inside of the cave from the hole she and Uxie made earlier when they collided into it.

Immediately, a blue mountain came into sight.

Azelf was still laying down on the stone floor, looking at the ceiling intently, still wearing a neutral expression.

"Hate me all you want - I'm sorry." Mesprit told dejectedly as she focused on her blue sister for a moment.

Azelf blinked a few times, suddenly able to feel emotions again.

And the giantess holding you was assaulted by anger, disappointment, concern.

Azelf slowly rose up and glares at Mesprit.

"You..." she said calmly, but venomously. Her paw darted forward, snatched you from Mesprit's grasp and gently lowered to the ground.

Azelf moved closer to her pink headed sister.
"How many lives out there are gone? Just because you couldn't control yourself?" she asked, pointing to the destroyed part of the cave.

"Ehm..."

"The pokemon are all fine... Startled, but unharmed."

All the eyes shifted on Uxie, who entered the cave through the hole and sighed dejectedly.

"The lake though... there's at least 23% of damage..." she said, before looking at the hole.
"... 23.2%..."

Azelf stares at two, paws on her hips.

Uxie and Mesprit looked away in shame.

"This is all your fault." Azelf said calmly, looking at Mesprit.
"You let your heat make you lose control!"

Mesprit looked back at her blue sibling.
"... Mine? Uxie attacked me!" she retorted.

"I only wanted to protect the human!"
"I would have never harmed him!"
"That was exactly what you were doing!"
"I just needed help!"
"Weren't you listening? We can't be helped - we lose control you idiot!"

Mesprit glared at Uxie, who gritted her teeth... before Azelf floated in between them and separated them.
"If we all start fighting, this lake is doomed."

Uxie sighed.
"You're right." she said, and the three legendaries quieted down to look at the floor intently.

You stare at them for a few moments, before breaking the silence,
"... So? What are we going to do now?" you asked, causing their gazes to shift on you.

Uxie shook her head and turned to her sisters.
"You two... go back to your lakes... I'm already dangerous enough to mine, and I need to restore Lake Acuity now." she said.

Azelf quietly nodded, and so did Mesprit... but you're left confused.

"... What about me?" you ask, again drawing attention.

Mesprit looked at you confused.
"What do you mean? You're coming home with me..." she responded, before narrowing her eyes.
"Why are you... afraid?" she asked.

"Ehm..."

"I dunno... because you chased him down, stole my emotions in front of him, almost destroyed a lake while you were out of control?" Azelf remarked sarcastically, and Mesprit sighed.
"Thanks for sugarcoating it sis..." she said, before looking down at you.

"... So? Don't you want to come along?" she asked, seemingly depressed.
"... I can't be helped. I can't call myself a guardian. You're literally the last thing of my life..."

You sigh, exasperated.

"Though I understand if you don't want to come... but - hey, are you planning to leave again?" she asked.

"What - no!" you respond, rubbing your head to try and rid it from a lingering pain.
"No no... Mesprit I'd really love to come, but... I'm not sure..."

"Thinking about it, I could really use a hand in restoring the lake..." Uxie chimed in.

Azelf adopted a small smile.
"Hey, I got it!" she said, looking down at you.
"Why don't you simply choose with which of us you want to stay? He can come with you, Mesprit, or with me, or remain here with Uxie, and we could see you anytime! It's perfect!" she explained.

"Hm..." you replied, think about it... it was actually a good idea. You wouldn't be forced to leave, and you can choose which sister you were going to stay with.

"Well... It's admittedly a good idea... Although I still want you to come with me. " Mesprit said, gently picking you up and holding you close to her eyes.

"Let him choose Mesprit." Uxie said as she and Azelf got closer.

You quiet down as you try to choose.

Uxie... the shy, sweet Uxie... who had the power of erasing memories. If she went into heat again, she could do anything to you and simply make you forget it...

Mesprit... the sweet Mesprit that loves you... and is the most wild of all three...

Azelf... calm, rational, responsible... with the power of stealing willpower...

You sigh.
"I'll stay with..."
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Splitting up

choices: "... Come on, let's just go to sleep." Mesprit said
"... D'you think... can we talk for a moment?" Mesprit asked
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"... Mesprit!"

That name echoed inside the cave for quite a while after it left your mouth. Your perch shook, Mesprit had almost let go of you, but managed to keep her paws cupped under your body. You regained your balance and glanced at the legendaries.

The three siblings were staring at you, shocked. Uxie and Azelf knew what their sister had tried to do to you. Mesprit knew as well, and was ashamed of herself for letting her heat control her.

Nonetheless, the same Mesprit felt shocked.

Her precious little human was giving her a second chance...?

You looked at her, feeling conflicted. On one side, she had just attempted to have you against your will; on the other, she was out of control and she was now half-depressed. Something told you that you had to stay close to her...

"Cutie..." she murmured softly. Slowly, her paws started to retreat, you along with them as Mesprit pulled you in a gentle hug.

"A-Are you sure about this...?" Azelf suddenly asked as her sister moved forward and made a 180 degree turn, facing both her and Uxie.

"... What do you mean sis?" Mesprit asked glumly.

"Mesprit, you're a wild card." Uxie bluntly chimed in, mentally bracing herself for Mesprit's reaction.

The pink-headed sister frowned.
"Why, aren't you? Just look at you lake..." she retorted.
"That was entirely your fault! I should throw you out!" Uxie hissed.

The two giantesses started growling at each other, and you felt a strong fear rising at the perspective of the imminent fight... that never came.

Azelf suddenly flew in between the two, arm spread as she held both her siblings back.

"Quit it." she sternly said.

Mesprit flew back, sensing your fear. She looked at you dejectedly.
"... Sorry, sorry. Here, let me fix you..." she offered as your fear was suddenly replaced by a sense of calm, which was quite odd given the circumstances.

"... Thanks." you sighed.

The giantess smiled, before looking back at her siblings.

Azelf was floating forward.

"Come on sis... the human made his choice, so let's leave." she said. Mesprit nodded as the two giantesses floated to the exit of the cavern, Uxie following.

It was still nighttime.

"Bye sis." both Azelf and Mesprit said at unison.

"Bye Uxie..." you timidly chimed, earning a smile from the yellow-headed pixie.

Azelf and Mesprit flew upwards, to the point where they were flying above the whole Lake Acuity.

The two giantesses looked at each other, before one of Mesprit's paws left you to close around Azelf's.

"See you sis," the blue pixie said, before looking at you.
"And you... be careful. Both of you - I'm talking to you Mesprit." she bluntly, receiving an indignant expression from her sister.

Then, the two started to fly in opposite directions, Uxie watching them from below, before looking forward and sighing.

"Need to restore the lake..." she muttered dutifully, before starting to float in direction of her lake.

--

After Uxie left too, two pokemon came out, looking up and watching as Mesprit and Azelf left.

They would be noticeable in the sky for quite a while more given how big they were.

"And so... it happened... those two went on a rampage again..." Lucario said, exasperated.

"Yeah but... two of them left now, no? That should be good... but the human..." Vaporeon lowered her head dejectedly.

Lucario growled.
"He should have left when we told him to." he simply said.

Vaporeon sighed.

--

From your perch on Mesprit's paws, you looked down, catching one last glimpse of Lake Acuity before it disappeared in darkness.

Mesprit released you and, holding you in one paw, brought you to her face. She was smiling, you noted.

"Cutie... thank you... I knew you would have never left me..." she said, genuinely glad that you opted to stay with her.

You smiled back.

"... Look, I-I... I'm sorry for earlier..." Mesprit apologized shamefully, losing her smile for a moment, before smiling again.
"... But I won't waste this chance, I promise!" she chimed.

"... I hope so..." you mumbled in response.

Mesprit giggled, and lowered her in her paws. And you soon found yourself struggling in between her paws and her lips.

"H-Hey... stop that..." you were blushing, embarrassed.

Mesprit simply smirked.

--

"... We already came her at some point, huh?" you broke the silence as Mesprit flew down, fluttering above her own lake, Lake Verity.

The giantess nodded, seemingly having cheered up to some better mood.

"Yep... don't you remember?" she asked, before remembering herself and adopting a dejected expression.

You nodded.
"Not sure... y'know..." you recalled Uxie erasing your memories.

Mesprit sighed.

"Well... I'd like to forget the whole experience." you joked, attempting to cheer her up.

The pink-headed guardian giggled.

Then, her golden eyes fell on you as she stared at you intently.

"Human..." she mumbled,
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Solitary love

choices: "... Human, tell me something please..." Mesprit asked, curious
Mesprit decided to let it slide... for now
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
For a moment, Mesprit's lips lingered open as if she was about to say something.

But that moment quickly passed, and her pink lips fell back in place as she choked back whatever she was about to say.

The pink giantess sensed your curiosity.

"... Yes?" you asked.

"Nothing." the giantess quickly replied, before adopting a smile.
"Come on, let's find someplace where we can sleep... I actually have one, but..." she looked in direction of Lake Verity; you followed her gaze, spotting a solitary cavern on a small island in the middle of the lake. It looked hopelessly too small for Mesprit to fit inside.

"... I get it." you replied, causing the giantess to giggle.

Without adding another word, the pixie started floating into the depths of the forest surrounding her lake, seeking for a cave, or maybe a clearing, where she could spend the night with her human.

Her human... the same one she almost killed earlier.

Mesprit suppressed the urge to tear up.

The human had conquered her heart; it wouldn't be worth living without him, she thought.

A while passed in complete silence as Mesprit flew past trees and too-small caves.

Until she finally found an opening that looked big enough for her to fit in.

She smiled down at you, before starting to squeeze herself inside the gigantic cave... at least, to you it was gigantic; to Mesprit, it could be compared to a simple door.

Inside was nothing out of ordinary; stone walls, stone floor, stone ceiling... occupied by Zubat and Golbat, hanging upside down, wings crossed, asleep.

"... About those..." you pointed out, instinctively bringing your hands to your neck in a protective manner.

Mesprit looked up.

"They won't dare... it'd be the last thing they do." she hissed as if one of the bats had already bitten you.

The whole cave shook, shaken by an earthquake that was caused by Mesprit laying down; a few Golbat flew away, awakened and scared.

Mesprit looked at you, smiling... for some reason, you felt like that wasn't a joyful smile. But, after what happened earlier, you guessed that she was simply regretful.

Regardless, you risked asking her,
"Mesprit, how are you feeling?"

She stared at you for a moment.

This was the last occasion to talk, get some of the remorse off her chest... but, she didn't want you to worry for her.

"I'm fine." she said, maybe a bit more hastily than she wanted,
"Good night cutie. Love you~"

She leaned forward, gently pecking you before laying back down. The large paws holding you pulled you in a hug.

Your head rested against the endless land that was her chest. You looked up, discovering that the giantess was staring at you, her smile gone.

"Mesprit, don't think bad of yourself, you lost control... but we all do sometimes, no?" you said sympathetically, trying to cheer her up.

She looked away, ashamed.

"You don't threaten to exterminate a whole lake..." she pointed out,
"... Or its inhabitants."

You smiled,
"Lake Acuity isn't entirely destroyed... and the pokemon were all fine," you recalled, before yawning.
"Seriously Mesprit..."

The giantess looked back at you, smiling.

"You're sweet. But, please, don't worry for me, go to sleep. Use what is left of the night, cutie... who knows what'll happen tomorrow," she reasoned, gently petting you.

You grinned reassuringly, before laying your head on her chest again.

And, in a matter of minutes, you were asleep, exhausted from what you witnessed throughout the night.

Mesprit stared at you, her smile gone, replaced by a sorrowful expression.

She had almost killed you... you were about to be crushed beneath her body, because of a stupid fight with her sister.

But it was undeniable: the whole thing was her fault... she lost control.

She - and her sisters - had to learn to control themselves... or else the lakes, the pokemon and, most importantly, the human were going to be doomed.

"... I'm sorry..." the giantess whispered as she closed her eyes.

Then, sleep claimed her as well, and she followed it without opposing.

--

You opened your eyes, feeling extremely drowsy.

You looked around, your vision blurry.

You rubbed your eyes, before looking around, discovering that you were sitting on the soft grass, next to a bluish-grey wall. It was morning.

"... Mesprit?" you called, remembering what happened yesterday.

The wall twitched.

"Oh... you're awake..." Mesprit's voice came from above.

A small pile of berries was pushed in front of you; it reached your waist.

You looked up, noticing the pink-headed guardian eating her own meal from a veritable mountain of berries in front of her.

"... How are you feeling?" you casually asked as you grabbed a berry.

Mesprit sighed.
"Since I wasn't helped last night... not good," she replied.

You opened your mouth to reply, but...

"No, thank you. Being helped renders me dangerous... so don't help me, I'll be fine." she interjected your question.

You stared at her, before starting to laugh.

"What?" the guardian asked.

"Nothing... but they told me I wouldn't have had a say in the matter..." you recalled.
"Guess they were wrong after all,"

Mesprit looked confused for a second, before she realized,

"Oh... the pokemon of Lake Acuity..." she recalled, before feeling a bit indignant.

They had told her human to leave, that she was basically going to rape him?

"... If you tell who those pokemon were, I'll have a word with those guys..." she said you, eating another handful of berries.

You immediately regretted speaking.

"Ehm... no." you replied.

Mesprit stared at you.

"... You mentioned a pokemon that could speak your language... I can find ou-" the giantess interrupted herself.

A pokemon that could speak the human language...

Her mind flashed the vague memory of a pokemon, black and blue.

A Lucario. He could speak human...

But... it couldn't be him, he had revealed her ‘What Uxie did to that poor human...’, that meant he didn't despise the human, no?

Mesprit shook her head... but, she found, the thought was quite persistent.

It was a possibility...

Mesprit kept staring at you in silence, deep in thought.

You started to feel uncomfortable.

Just what did she want?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Piecing it together

choices: "M-Mesprit, I d-do... But I-I'm scared..." you admitted
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"... Do you think... can we talk for a moment?" Mesprit asked while sounding unsure.

"Ehm... Mesprit is kinda nighttime... and I'm kinda sleepy, can it wait until tomorrow morning?" you asked, leaving out the fact that you just witnessed her fighting Uxie. Not to mention that you were almost killed in that fight.

"I'm afraid not... I need to talk to you, cutie, right now..." Mesprit replied, shaking her head.

You groaned from the lack of sleep and the still fresh fear present in you; Mesprit was sensing that, and she felt guilty for causing it.

"Okay... why not?"

The giantess allowed herself to smile a little, but you noticed that something was definitely wrong with her.

You shook off the feeling; probably, Mesprit was just feeling bad for what she had done... or probably because you didn't fix her heat again.

Either way, you really hoped this didn't take long, all you really wanted right now was to sleep.

Holding you in front of her hill-sized head, the giantess sat down by her lake, causing the ground - and the water too - to shake from the tremors.

Without saying anything, Mesprit suddenly pulled you in a hug, and remained silent for a couple minutes, leaving you confused.

Didn't she want to talk?

Some time passed, and a barrier of silence formed around you and the titaness; not even the wind was blowing anymore, as if it didn't dare to shatter the silence.

It felt like you and Mesprit were isolated from the rest of the world.

But then, the guardian of Lake Verity finally spoke, breaking the silence,

"Human," she started calmly, though you picked up on a hint of sorrow in her voice. You were released from her hug and once again brought in front of the giantess.

"I... I'm sorry, human," Mesprit continued, her voice cracking,
"I lost control and tried to use you; I attacked my sister and ruined her lake..." she exhaled heavily.

"Mesprit..." you muttered, but the giantess didn't even hear you as she continued,

"I... don't know why you're here right now,"

You shrugged.
"You asked me to come with you, no?" you recalled, although ‘asked’ didn't feel like the right word... ‘demanded’, maybe? ‘You're coming home with me’... yeah, that DID sound demanding.

Mesprit sighed, and you felt much like you were back to the first time she played with your emotions.

"Yeah. And you didn't want to. But when given the choice, you still chose to come here with me, knowing that-" she hung her head in shame,
"... Knowing that I represent a menace to you."

She inhaled deeply at that, then exhaled just as deeply; she repeated the process several times before she looked at you again.

"Why." she asked.

Your heart leaped from your chest to your throat - how were you supposed to answer?... As a matter of fact, why were you even here, talking with her about this?

Like she said, she DID represent a menace, why did you pick her?

Without being able to formulate a proper answer, you opted to remain silent instead, limiting yourself to look at Mesprit dejectedly.

The giantess closed her eyes.

"... I dreaded this answer." she admitted, and her grip on you grew a bit tighter.
"You don't even know why we're here talking, do you?" she asked.

A part of her wanted to giggle, because her human, the one she was so fond of, was clueless of his own reasons, and that made him look adorable.

But Mesprit knew that this wasn't the right time to laugh.

"Wha- no!" you hastily replied, feeling like this chat was going to sink into a disaster if you didn't think of something smart to say.

"Mesprit, I-I... didn't want to leave you alone, okay?" you said, and the pink-headed pixie raised an eyebrow.

You lowered your head.

"I didn't want to leave you..." you repeated, a bit more convinced.

It was Mesprit's turn to remain silent after your poorly-stated sentence.

She sighed.

"So you are telling me that you really, really wanted to stick with me?" she asked, her eyes seeming to be looking deep into your soul.

You were growing more and more uncomfortable with this chat.

"I-I... of course! I mean, you do seem to-" you trailed off and blushed, while Mesprit sensed your embarrassment.

She leaned back a bit.

"Go on, human," she encouraged.

You gulped.

"... You seem to... like... me?" you offered.

After your remark, Mesprit raised her head a bit, making you feel smaller than you already were in comparison with her.

"I love you more than anything." she declared. Oddly, the sentence, which was expressed so many times and was usually accompanied by a smile (or a growl of anger I regarding what happened with Uxie), was spoken by an unsmiling Mesprit.

"... I know." you replied, blushing.

Mesprit sighed.

"What I want to know is: do you love me back... even after what happened tonight?" she asked, and finally her serious expression changed into one of sadness.

You looked at her, a thousand answers forming in your head but none of them being actually able to leave it through your mouth.

Mesprit closed her eyes.

"Silence again." she whispered dejectedly after a minute of you unspeaking,
"That wasn't the answer is was hoping for."

She sensed a storm of emotions raging inside of you, but she quickly blocked her powers.

You were suddenly hugged by the giantess again, and were kept against her chest.

Time seemed to stop in its tracks, and you weren't able to calculate how many minutes - or hours - Mesprit kept you restrained behind her paws.

But then, she finally opened her eyes and looked down at you; her eyes, once so expressive, now looked somewhat void.

"I felt love from you, you know, so I know for sure that you did love me back before," she stated, and her paw suddenly began caressing you.

You didn't reply.

Mesprit sighed.

"I'm not sensing your emotions right now, so I'm going to repeat my question. I want you to be honest with me, cutie." she said solemnly as the hug was broken and you were brought back in front of her.

"Do you still love me?"

You hesitated.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Sorrow and Sadness

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
In front of you was the giantess whose heart you conquered; behind were the truly horrible things she had done.

You felt conflicted, like two walls were closing around your heart, squishing it in between.

Mesprit kept staring at you, eyes half lidded, an unreadable expression on her face as she waited an answer.

But, not seeing it coming, the pixie closed her eyes in a way that reminded you of Uxie.

"You're being silent again..." she said breathlessly, her mouth barely opening to let her words come out.

Beneath you, her paws vacillated.

"You do not need to answer, dear human... I-I understand..." she stuttered.

You felt an invisible grip surrounding you as you were pulled up by her psychic powers and hovered past her palms.

Mesprit looked down, seeming heartbroken. It wasn't very hard to see why.

"I... I'm sorry," the giantess continued as you began descending to the ground.
"I caused you so many problems..
it was because of me you wanted to leave, right?"

Your heart skipped a beat, Mesprit was jumping to conclusions.

Again, her gaze was on you, and your heart seemed to stop: her eyes were full of tears, which rolled down her face like two streams of water.

"Mesprit..."

"But I'll tell you what. I-I'm not going to stop you. I love you, I don't want to hold you back. S-So... you may lea-"

"NO!"

Your descent abruptly halted as Mesprit shot you a tearful stare of confusion.

At this point, you were starting to grow irritated by the misunderstanding.

"Y'think I still want to leave? You think I would have come here with you if I wanted?" you asked, before continuing,
"Listen to me, Mesprit, you caused me no problems! I didn't want to leave because of you!" you shouted.

Mesprit swallowed, taken aback by your sudden outburst.

"B-But..." she sobbed,
"... W-Why didn't you reply to my question?"

You sighed, but noted with relief that you had started to float back up.

You landed back on top of the hands of Mesprit, but avoided her gaze.

"Well?"

Another sigh.

"It's... hard."

The pink-headed pixie blinked, confused by your statement.

"... ‘Hard’?" she parroted back.

You meekly looked up.

"Mesprit, I come from a society where admitting love to a pokemon is the equivalent of condemning oneself. They teach you that loving a pokemon is wrong." you admitted.

Mesprit looked horrified.

"Nothing can stop true love!" she exclaimed, her paws traveling up to her face as she held you in front of her giant eyes.
"And you, you helped me with my heat, you helped Uxie with hers with no hesitation... not too much." she recalled.

"You needed help, I helped you. That's what good people do." you replied tiredly.

You only wished to sleep right now, to wake up thinking of this whole situation as a mere dream.

However, Mesprit seemed intent to continue this talk.

"I sensed love from you."

You didn't reply to that, but a firm blush took place across your cheeks.

The giantess wiped her tears, looking at you calmly.

"Let's try again; we're alone, no one that can hear or see you doing what your kind defines ‘wrong’," you wanted to reply that the last time you thought you were alone with her, you were in reality being watched by the scared inhabitants of Lake Acuity, but you remained silent.

"... I want you to answer, human, and I need you to do it honestly." she said, and you braced yourself for the incoming question.

"Do you... still love... me?" she asked slowly.

You looked at the giantess in the eye.

"O-Of course." you stammered, closing your eyes,
"Of course I do. Mesprit, you and your sisters, I already mentioned that I like all three of you... but you, Mesprit, you've been the sweetest living being I've ever met. Of course... I love you." you admitted, blushing furiously and keeping to avoid her gaze.

Silence followed your statement, and lingered between you and Mesprit for a while; you glanced at her at some point, noticing her looking to the side with a paw over her mouth.

Then, she finally looked back at you.

She opened her mouth several times, but no sound came out.

When it did, it took you aback.

"Is this the truth?" she asked softly.

You nodded in response.

The giantess didn't initially reply; she seemed focused on an imprecise spot past your shoulder for a second.

But finally, for the first time since this talk began, Mesprit let a smile spread across her cheeks.

"Even after all we went through... you still love me..."

Before you could respond, you found yourself silenced by a giant pair of lips finding their way to you, taking your whole upper body.

The pink pair lingered on you for a couple of minutes.

Then, Mesprit finally pulled back, but her head remained glued to your body; it began nuzzling you.

"Thank you."

You smiled.

An eternity of you being rubbed up and down Mesprit's cheek passed before she finally pulled off you, smiling lovingly.

"Come on cutie, we still have a few hours ahead of us. Let's get some sleep." she declared, causing your mind to cheer.

The giantess got up and started hovering through the woods, holding you against her chest; she spotted the large opening of a cave and headed for it before squeezing herself inside.

A few Golbat flew out as the giantess went deep into the cavern and laid down, causing the whole place to shake.

The guardian stared at you with a smile.

"Good night, cutie," she said, again pushing her lips against you.

The kiss was quicker this time.

"Yeah... good night." you replied, flushing red.

The grip of her giant paws tightened around you. You laid your head against the immense chest and relaxed.

Your mind thought about what happened tonight for less than a second, before you finally drifted off in a wonderful, dreamless slumber.

The last thing you felt was the gentle stroking of a giant paw on your back, before everything became dark.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Genuine feeling

choices: You decided to follow Lucario. What was he up to?
You decided against it. Whatever he had to say, you weren't leaving.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Seven days passed since your moving from Lake Acuity to Lake Verity. A week since you openly declared your love to Mesprit.

And life was really great right now, although you missed Azelf and Uxie. Since your arrival, you didn't hear of them again.

But Mesprit's behavior was too contagious for you to linger on such line of thinking for too long.

Knowing that you forgave her for everything she had done in the past, Mesprit was happier than you ever saw her.

Life around Lake Verity was being quite normal (as normal as living with a giantess, and a pokemon giantess too, could be), if not a bit boring, and the guardian of this place was being quite serene.

Aside from her emotion-manipulating games, Mesprit wasn't doing anything weird. She wasn't even asking you to ‘fix’ her heat anymore, though you were sure that you saw her blushing madly while looking at you at some point. However, as long as she didn't try anything, it was fine. Sometimes, you woke up in the mornings, only to find yourself laying on the stone floor of the cave, the air inside carrying a heavenly scent; you suspected that your giant host had been trying to take care of her heat by herself, but you didn't mind.

You had to admit, life couldn't be better right now.

You met some pokemon during your explorations of the Lake, but none of them ever made any attempt to approach you; instead, they only shot startled stares and fled.

You didn't know how to feel about that.

So, basically, everything was fine and uneventful.

Until the morning of your eighth day at Lake Verity.

Today, Mesprit woke up late.

Drowsy, but with the usual smile she constantly wore while around you (and that was basically all day, all days), she floated out of the cave that became like a home to you.

"Mornin' human~," she sang cheerfully, her lips landing on top of your head,
"Mornin'..." you replied drowsily, not even blushing anymore after having gotten used to the giantess' displays of love.

Sun rays greeted the both of you with a comforting warmth.

You trapped in her embrace, Mesprit hovered towards the Lake and sat down by the sparkling water, before telekinetically drawing a small hill of berries with a mere flick of her hand.

"Here." she chimed, handing some to you and taking the rest for herself.

"Tha- hey..." you interrupted, your fingers stopping in the act of grabbing a berry as sunlight was suddenly eclipsed.

You looked at Mesprit, but she was looking up.

"... Azelf." you heard her mumbling.

Azelf?

You looked up as well, but you soon discovered that there was no need to: said azure giantess was already coming down, filling your whole sight in a matter of a second.

"Hey sis!" she greeted, a spreading on her face.

Mesprit didn't smile.

"Azelf... what are you doing here?" she asked instead.

The blue sister looked confused.

"For Uxie, no? She- oh wait, how are you? Oh, and human! Nice to see you again!" she chimed, extending a large paw to pat you.
"How are you? Did Mesprit try anything?" her face now showed concern.

The pink-headed guarding bit her lip at the blunt question, but you smiled in response.

"Everything's fine."

Azelf smiled again.

"Glad to hear that. At least someone's happy..." she suddenly frowned.
"Stupid heat... it's killing me." she clarified.

"Don't even mention that." Mesprit retorted, holding you a night more tightly.

Silence followed the statement, before the titaness holding you decided to change subject,

"Hey, what were you saying about Uxie?" Mesprit wondered.

"Didn't she call you too?" Azelf questioned,
"She called me last night, told that she finally restored Lake Acuity and that we could go back there... possibly without starting anymore fights around there."

Mesprit blinked.

"Uxie restored the Lake?" you parroted back, getting a nod from the blue giantess.
"That's good news, no?"

"Yeah... I wonder why she didn't call me though..." Mesprit mused.

Azelf waved a hand in response.

"Whatever, you can ask her, no? Let's go."

--

Lake Acuity didn't change since the last time you saw it. Well, aside from the fact that the vegetation that was destroyed in the horrible fight between Mesprit and Uxie was now completely restored and verdant again.

A certain Knowledge pokemon was waiting by the water of the Lake itself, and smiled as she sensed the two giantesses and you approaching.

"Hi there," Uxie greeted calmly as Azelf and Mesprit hovered in front of her.

The pixie's closed eyes seemed to land straight on you.

"It's good to see you again. Are you alright?" she asked.

"Yep." you replied from Mesprit's grasp.

"And you, sis?" Mesprit asked.

Uxie's expression fell.

"Aside from the obnoxious fact that I haven't been sleeping lately to restore the Lake and tranquilize the pokemon, that my heat is being quite bothersome and that I can't do anything about it... I'd say I'm decently fine."

"Oh, I feel you." Mesprit and Azelf replied at once while you felt a tingle of sadness for the yellow-headed pixie.

You couldn't be sure, but you felt the eyes of all three sisters moving to your form at the mention of their heat being still there.

Then, Uxie looked up, and specifically back at you.

"Well, I believe we have some catching up to do. Why don't you tell me what has been going on?"

--

Like your whole week, the day passed pretty quickly, between the attentions of the three sisters.

Despite their heat, they seemed way calmer than you had anticipated. Mesprit and Uxie didn't even mention their fight or its consequences, though you noted them staring at each other at some points.

Now, sun was replaced by the moon and, after a quick meal, the three declared their intention to rest.

"I even had to fix the cave." Uxie chimed smugly while looking at Mesprit, who avoided her gaze.

You weren't paying attention though, too focused on a particularly fascinating bush.

Only when the loving Mesprit extended a paw to grab you, you stepped back.

"I'd like to stay up for a while more," you told upon noticing her confused stare.
"I wanted to explore around, if that's alright."

The titaness smiled.

"Of course, cutie!" she chimed, unaware of what you were truly up to,
"See you later then! Be careful!" she said.

You smiled as you watched the giantess moving up beside her sisters, who looked bemused.

"... Are you still planning to leave?" she wondered, a feeble hint of disappointment in her voice. Azelf didn't say anything, but stared at you, expecting an answer.

"Oh, trust me, he's not." Mesprit jumped to your defense with a smile. Clearly, after you admitted you loved her back, she began trusting you a lot more.
"Besides, if he wanted to leave, wouldn't he have done it when it was only me and him instead of waiting for us three to be around?"

Both Mesprit's siblings seemed convinced by the explanation.

Uxie shrugged.

"Well... you know the way." she said as she began floating away, followed by her sisters.

"Be careful!" Azelf chimed, while Mesprit blew you a kiss.

Shortly after, the trio left completely.

You dug your hands in your pockets as plants behind you began shaking.

"You're back," a voice spoke as you turned around to face a familiar Lucario.
"You should have never came back."

"And, nice to see you too." you sarcastically replied,
"Are you gonna tell me I have to leave again? Because these days have been the best of my life." you told.

The jackal sighed.

"Instead of running, you grew even more attached to them?" he asked in a tone that made you understand that he couldn't believe what he was saying.

"Exactly. Because Mesprit didn't try anything, and I'm sure the other two didn't either." you mused, though not mentioning your recent feeling towards Mesprit. You were sure that was going to disappoint the jackal, and it was none of his business anyway.

Like he was none of his business your decision to remain, but he didn't seem to care, or at least not to the point to stop spying on you.

Lucario shook his head at your statement.

He began walking towards you; a thousand thoughts began darting across your heads, but Lucario walked past you, gesturing for you to follow,

"Come with me human, we need... a more secluded place." he said in a neutral tone, leaving a perplexed you behind.

You were unsure of what to do: one part was curious about what Lucario wanted, though you could assume it, while the other wasn't up for a discussion of any kind, let alone an argument with the many, many inhabitants of Lake Acuity, which you expected wherever Lucario wanted you to go along with him.

An impatient growl coming from the jackal made you take your decision.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Meeting again

choices: You got back to the cave and went to sleep
A noise distracted you on the way back... Screaming? What was going on?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
You shrugged and decided to follow the Lucario out of curiosity, though you already knew what he was going to say, what his purpose was: make you leave.

He attempted to make you leave at least three times, managing to convince you two times before you were stopped by the same giantesses you were trying to run from.

This time though, you had no wish of leaving, and you were getting tired of the attempts of this Lake's inhabitants.

"Alright," you said, defiantly digging your hands in your pockets,
"Lead the way."

The jackal nodded as he began walking while you followed him.

It was a quiet night, the silence only interrupted by the chilly breeze that blew around the snowy Lake Acuity and by the cries of the nocturnal pokemon that came out to eat during the dark hours.

You kept walking behind the Lucario, feeling your feet sinking into the snow with each step you took.

You started to regret your decision; you could have been in the soft, warm embrace of Mesprit, and you were out in the cold instead.

Lucario didn't seem to have such problems though, you could tell by the way he kept walking silently, without complaining. Either he didn't feel cold at all or he felt it and was complaining to himself, mentally cursing you for having him do all of this.

This felt like a little payback, you childishly thought with a smirk, having him walk in the cold.

Speaking of, how much time have you been walking already? It felt like hours.

"Hey, may I know where are we going?" you broke the silence.
"Just a bit more. Keep up human." Lucario's growly voice replied.

You felt tempted to turn around and leave, but you ignored the voice in your mind that told you to leave Lucario by himself without even knowing that you left until he arrived to wherever he was bringing you.

And, true to his word, the steel-type walked into a deserted clearing before stopping, causing you to stop as well.

"This'll do it..." you heard him muttering, before he turned around to face you.
"Now, human, we-"

Lucario didn't even start talking that he was interrupted by the chiming cry of a pokemon.

He looked past you, and you turned around to see a familiar Vaporeon walking towards to where you and Lucario were standing.

"Vap!" she exclaimed, smiling at you.

"She's glad you managed to remain alive," Lucario grumbled, before glaring at the water-type,
"Did you follow us?"

The Vaporeon nodded her head, before walking up beside the jackal and shooting him a glare as she began barking indignantly.

Lucario blushed.

"I didn't think you'd want to talk too..." he stated, only causing the barking to grow louder.

Lucario waved his paw at her, and the Vaporeon reluctantly quieted down, her barking reducing to a mere growl.

"... Sorry," the aura pokemon was addressing you with this,
"Now, as I was saying, we need to talk human,"

You rolled your eyes,

"I've heard that before," you replied in an almost bored fashion as you gazed at the two pokemon in front of you,
"Lemme guess, I need to leave because those three sisters are dangerous to me, to you and to the whole Lake, right?"

Vaporeon smirked at Lucario, who folded his arms and huffed in annoyance; he opened his mouth, seeming ready to reply with a sadistic comment about this being serious. But he sighed, deciding that he didn't want to start a fight.

"Well... yes," he replied, sounding vaguely embarrassed,
"It's-"

"For my own good as well as yours, right?" you interrupted, and the Vaporeon nodded her head in response.

You sighed.

"May I ask something?"

"Go ahead."

"I've been away for a week, no? Did Uxie try anything with all of you since I wasn't there? I mean, according to what you said, she should have started hunting you to pleasure herself... did she?" you asked.

Lucario looked surprised by the question.

"... No." he replied,
"On." Vaporeon confirmed with a nod.

"Mesprit didn't try anything with me either, and I'm sure Azelf didn't do anything while at Lake Valor, because she mentioned that her heat is ‘killing her’, like it is with all three of them." you said, before pausing to swallow,
"Don't you get it? Since I told them what they do, they're trying to control themselves."

Both pokemon listened with serious expressions.

Lucario looked deep in thought.

"You're right," he declared after a while of thinking,
"They're trying to control themselves. But it's like you said, they can't fight their heat, none of us pokemon can. You mentioned that their heat is ‘killing them’?"

You nodded. Lucario exchanged a brief glance with Vaporeon, before he looked back at you.

"Then the situation is worse than it was before."

You felt a knot tying itself around your stomach.

"... What do you mean?" you dared to ask.

Lucario signed, looking exasperated.

"They're trying to keep themselves under control, alright. But, by doing so, their heat is increasing. It'll gradually make them suffer more and more, if it already hasn't, until they won't bear it anymore and-" Lucario trailed off, but Vaporeon spoke for him,
"On..."

For some reason, you managed to break the language barrier for the single word she spoke,

‘Rampage...’

You gulped as a fit of fear began spreading throughout your whole being.

But then, you recalled your time with Mesprit, your declaration of devotion towards her. And those memories seemed to fill you with courage.

"... I'm sure they won't," you stated firmly,
"If they managed to control themselves so far, why shouldn't they be able to keep it up until the end of the season?"

"... That's a... remote possibility," Lucario admitted,
"But it'd be much safer for you to leave, human. Trust us."

"And what about you?"

"We'll hide," he replied,
"Like we always do." Vaporeon nodded dejectedly at this,
"On..."

"Sometimes they find some of us... I don't envy those pokemon..."

Again, the grip of fear closed itself around your stomach, but you ignored it.

"I'm sorry, but I'm not gonna leave. I'm sure those three are gonna control themselves and won't go on a rampage." you declared, causing the Lucario to sigh deeply, before he looked back at you,

"I don't want to oppose to your stupid wishes, human, so I'll ask you once: are you completely sure about this?" he asked with a very serious expression, while the Vaporeon shot you the biggest pair of puppy-dog eyes you've ever seen.

You hesitated for a moment, before you gathered the courage to reply,

"Yes."

Lucario nodded, while the Vaporeon stared at you dejectedly.

"Then this conversation is concluded. Good-bye, human, try to stay alive." he said as he turned around, beginning to walk away.

The Vaporeon tracked his walk, then looked back at you.

"On..." she said, causing the Lucario to stop and glance backwards,
"She'll escort you back to the cavern." he said, before disappeared into the thick woods.

Vaporeon walked up beside you.

"Uh, thanks." you said, getting a meek smile in response.

With a mix of fear, determination and drowsiness running around within you, you began walking, Vaporeon following up.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: The calm before the storm

choices: You woke up the next morning
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
With Vaporeon walking beside you through the quiet forest, you headed to the cave where the three sisters currently were, your mind sunken in a sea of thought.

According to what Lucario told you, Azelf Mesprit and Uxie should have lost control soon because of their heat, rendered unbearable by the lack of sex. And if that happened, they were going on a rampage.

A part of you believed in that possibility, but the other silenced it as you repeatedly reminded yourself that those three would have never laid a finger on anyone on purpose. Unless someone threatened their lakes. You firmly believed that the three legendaries could control themselves if they managed to so far.

The Vaporeon beside you was eerily quiet, but you figured that she was probably reasoning on your same line of thinking.

"So, ehm... some night, huh?" you asked, attempting to make casual conversation.

A sigh.

"Those three won't lose it, I mean... they managed to keep themselves under control for a week, no? Why shouldn't they be able to do the same until the end of the season?" you said.

Vaporeon blushed at this.

"Vapo..." she incomprehensibly muttered in response while you realized the reason of her flustered behavior.

"Hey... you're in heat too, huh?" you asked.

The red shade on Vaporeon's cheeks grew wider as she closed her eyes and nodded for several times.

"... Who's your-"

"Vap! On!" the Eeveelution interrupted as she pointed to something in front of you; alerted, your gaze darted to it, but you took notice that Vaporeon was simply pointing at a cave, which was your destination.

"Oh..." you mumbled as you halted, turning to face the water-type again.

"So, uh..." you knelt, gingerly bringing a hand to her head; she gladly accepted the offer as you began rubbing behind her ears, eliciting a small moan.

"See you around, I guess." you said.

At this, the blue pokemon looked at you longingly, before she stepped forward, stood on her hind legs and leaned forward, licking your cheek a few times, a pink shade spreading across her cheeks again.

Then, she fell back on all fours.

"On..." she said with a gentle smile, before she began walking past you. Soon, you saw her form disappearing into the forest and you sighed.

Then, you turned around and walked into the cavern, your ears almost immediately getting assaulted by the snoring of the legendary sisters.

Smiling to yourself, you walked deeper inside the cavern, finding three familiar giantesses laying down beside each other; two of them were asleep, but the third...

Hearing your footsteps on the hard stone, Mesprit perked up, shooting you a wide grin.

"Hey..." you said as you began hovering in the air, held by an invisible psychic grip.

"I was waiting for you," the giantess said as you floated into her open paws, which gripped you softly, holding you in front of the face of the titaness.

Mesprit's grin grew wider.

"I knew you weren't going to leave," she continued while you were lowered down, right into her lips, which placed a little kiss on the side of your head.
"I told Uxie, Arceus knows how much time it took to convince her that you were coming back."

You smiled.

"You were right - here I am." you said while the paws that held you gently placed you in top of your bed, Mesprit's bosom.

"It means we can go to sleep then," she chimed.

"... Wait, Mesprit," you called, but you got no response: the giantess opened her mouth, which was a cave itself, and yawned deeply, sending a wave of hot air in your direction.

"Hm?"

"I was asking myself... you're still in heat, no?" you asked,
"All three of you are, right?"

Mesprit blushed vaguely.

"Why the reason of such thoughts, cutie?" she replied with another question, a suspicious expression on her face.

You blushed too.

"... It's making you... suffer, you mentioned that, right?"

At this mention, Mesprit closed her eyes, and the blush on her gigantic visage grew stronger.

But she opened those golden eyes of hers shortly after, smiling down at you.

"You shouldn't worry of such things, human. As long as I've got you..." she began, but you interrupted,

"No, please, let us talk," you said, before noticing the look she gave you at your demand,
"... I mean, you haven't been asking me to... y'know... and I wanted to know why."

Mesprit looked perplexed.

"What do you mean, ‘why’? We both know-" Mesprit had to interrupt herself, because Azelf moaned something incomprehensible in her sleep, protesting against your voices piercing the silence and bothering her slumber.

Mesprit ignored her blue sibling.

"You were the one telling us, remember? That doing that is dangerous for you, and for the whole Lake for what matters." she recalled, before offering a sigh and looking at you with her eyes sparkling.

You began feeling uncomfortable under her golden gaze.

"Mes-"

"You're wondering why I didn't lose control again, like I did back then?" she questioned.

You bit your lip and looked off to the side, nodding meekly.

Mesprit sighed deeply.

"I was so close to killing you just last week," she started.
"I let my heat best me, I tried using you and attacked my sister, not to mention I started a fight that destroyed a good percentage of this Lake. Mercifully, all the pokemon were fine, but I almost crushed you, remember?"

Of course you remembered, the memory of the giantess busily fighting Uxie, her body straight on yours before it was stopped by a Psychic. You weren't going to forget that so easily, unless Uxie opened her eyes to make you forget again, which was something you didn't exactly wish for.

Your train of thought was rudely interrupted as Mesprit continued after a long sigh,

"Since then, I swore to myself that I'd have never let my heat control my actions again. That's why I haven't been asking you to ‘fix’ me anymore," she explained, before adopting a look of determination,
"For the sake of Lake Verity. For the sake of you," her gaze softened at this,

"For the sake of our love."

You blushed again, along with her.

"Each time it happens, I think about what would happen to you if I ever-" Mesprit interrupted herself and shivered at the thought, before she looked back at you, smiling cheerfully,
"And that thought gives me strength, strength to fight back my heat."

You smiled at the mention.

"Not sure how to feel about that, Mesprit," you said, causing the titaness to giggle.
"Neither do I." she replied, before another yawn escaped her mouth, mixing with the snoring of her two siblings in a single, loud noise that took up the whole place, like an orchestra of bodily music, which had its own soothing power.

"... Can we go to sleep now? Or have you got something more awkward to ask me?" Mesprit snickered.

"No no... I'm pretty tired too." you replied as you yawned too.

The arms of the giantess traveled to you, her paws clasped together behind your back, pushing you deeper into Mesprit's chest.

"Sleep tight, cutie~," the titaness sang cheerfully, before her eyes closed.

"Yeah, you too." you distractedly replied as your eyes closed and your body relaxed.

For some reason, a few moments before you fell asleep, your mind went back to Lucario and how wrong he was.

Perhaps Azelf and Uxie were still a danger, but Mesprit definitely wasn't.

Not anymore.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: A little chat before bed

1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
"... Azelf!" you exclaim.

At one time, Uxie huffed, Mesprit sighed and Azelf smiled brightly.

You had to pick Azelf - she's the most calm of the trio. Your chances would improve to a decent level with her.

"But... why?" Mesprit asked dejectedly as she watched her blue sister bending to grab a hold of you.
"Because... uh..." you quieted down, unable think of any good excuse.

‘You're dangerous,’ and she was going to be even more depressed than she already is.

"... Don't need to give an answer. We understand..." Uxie said as dejected as her sister.

Luckily, Mesprit decided to let it slide. She closed her eyes and sighed.

Then, the giantess opened her eyes again, snatching you from Azelf.
"... One minute, please." she said as she turned around, holding you close to her mouth.

"Listen... be careful around Azelf... whenever she likes someone, she usually gets... close." she whispered.

"... Okay?" you asked, briefly recalling the moment Azelf tried to have you... she wanted a hug... and then she stole your willpower.

"... Why are you telling me that?" you asked again.

"... I'm warning you. Next time I see you, you two better not have done anything weird, or I'm going to-" Mesprit closed her eyes and inhaled sharply, her free paw clenching in a fist as she held back her threat.

Then, the giantess slowly opened her eyes to give you a dejected look.

"... I'll... I'll come pick you up in a few days... until then..." her lips moved forward as she gave you a gentle kiss.
"... Please be fine."

You smiled as the giantess turned around, handing you back to Azelf, who smiled.

"Don't worry sis - I'll take good care of him. Bye!" she exclaimed, you holding your ears in pain from the sonic assault.

Mesprit glared as Azelf giggled awkwardly.
"Hehe... starting now..." she said as she started floating backwards, until she reached the exit of the cave, at which point she smiled at her siblings and turned around.

"You'll see... we'll have fun, me and you." she reassured gently as she exited the cave.

The moon was still high in the sky, suggesting that it was still quite early to be awake.

The ground below started to recede more and more as Azelf flew up and headed to Lake Valor, holding you close.

Inside the cavern, Uxie and Mesprit sighed at unison.

"Well... he made his choice..." Uxie told.
"Wonder why... he barely even knows her..." Mesprit mumbled to herself, before turning to face her yellow headed sister whose eyes were closed as usual.

"Sis... I'm sorry for... this all..." she spoke with sullen voice as she went to hug her sister, who happily returned the hug.
"It was my fault too..." she said, smiling dejectedly, before letting go of Mesprit.
"Now go sis... I need to restore Lake Acuity..."

Mesprit bit her lip in sorrow and nodded as she too exited the cave. Uxie watched her leave, before exiting herself and looking up.

Mesprit was already far up in the sky.

The lone pixie looked around her partly damaged forest and sighed.

"... Guardians, huh?" she sternly scolded herself, before shaking her head.

"Let's get to work."

--

"Home sweet home."

Azelf hovered down, stopping above the waters of Lake Valor and looking around.

"Been away for a day... all the same." she happily said as she moved to the ground, gently letting you down.

"Seems obvious to me... I mean, what could happen in a day?" you asked.

Azelf smirked.
"Hush, you never know what might happen when you later your guard down for too long." she said, before extending her arms up in the air.
"And now..."

The ground beneath your feet shook as you lost your footing and fell on your rear.
"... Ow..."

Azelf just carelessly laid belly-down.

You saw her smiling, eyes closed.
"I finally get to sleep without those two attempting on each other's lives~" she said, obviously referring to her sisters.

Still startled, you adjusted to a less precarious position and watched the giantess in front of you... her golden eyes suddenly opened again as she stared down at you.

"Oh... sorry..." she teased with a smirk upon seeing the startled look on your face.

Before you could reply, you discovered her large paw moving towards you as she grabbed you in her fist and shifted on her side, hugging you.

"Mhh... sleep tight..." the blue giantess moaned, closing her eyes again, her giant paws pressing you deep into her chest.

You blushed as you leaned your head against her chest.

All you wanted to do right now was sleep on and hopefully forget the frightening fight you witnessed.

Luckily, sleep DID come quite soon as Azelf, Lake Valor and your consciousness faded away.

You fell asleep, deep into a sweet, dreamless slumber.

--

The sun shined brightly.

It was around midday when you and the giantess cuddling you finally started to wake up.

Sunshine fell on the eyelids of the sleeping titanesses, who slowly opened her eyes.

The guardian of Lake Valor gives a deep yawn, before looking down, discovering the she was holding a still-sleeping you.

"H-Human...?" she asked herself as her gaze darted around.

This wasn't Lake Acuity...

"Hey, weren't we-" memories started to seep from the depths of her mind. Memories of violence, sadness.
"Right." Azelf whispered as she yawned again.

"Well, rise and shine human." she said as she looked at you, gently shaking your small form.

You moaned.

"Come on... wake up..."

You gave an annoyed groan as you opened your eyes, shooting Azelf a tired gaze.
"... Azelf." you said with a yawn as you recalled the events that occurred last night.

The giantess nodded cheerfully.

"Mornin'..."

--

"Seriously, how do these things fill you up?" you asked as you bit into a berry.

"They don't." Azelf replied dejectedly as she swallowed a mouthful of berries.
"I have to eat like a ton a day and I'm not even close to be satisfied!" she said, throwing another handful in her mouth.

"Didn't you mention that you eat fish pokemon too?" you recalled.

The blue mountain next to you blushed.

"We... try not to do that too often..." she awkwardly replied.
"I mean-"
"Not that I like to kill but I need to eat!" you and her concluded at unison, Azelf smiling down at you.

She was growing to enjoy the presence of this human...

Perhaps...

"Say..." you asked at some point.
"How come you never realized your heat was dangerous?"

Immediately, you regretted asking - maybe it was an indelicate question to ask...

However, Azelf simply shrugged, wondering how the chat landed on such topic.

"I have no idea." she bluntly responded, lazily leaning back against a tree slightly bigger than her.

"Hm..." you said.
"Hey, is it still bothering you after yesterday? Because you look pretty fine..." you pointed out.

Azelf looked at you.

"... That thing is killing me from within." she revealed as she slowly leaned down, laying flat on the ground.
"I managed to control myself after I... almost had you... but it's still there... it hurts..." she looked down.

"I'm... sorry to hear that...?" you tried, taking a few steps, placing some distance between you and the giantess.

Her gaze rose as she looked at you again. And she was quick to cover the distance between you and her. You suddenly remember Mesprit's warning, ‘Whenever she likes someone, she usually gets close...’

Was this the occasion?

"Human..." the pixie giantess started with a pleading voice.

It would have been adorable to see her laying down, wearing a painful expression... if it wasn't for the fact that she was 200ft tall and looked all but innocent. You'd call her intimidating instead.

"No." you interrupt before she can even speak. You couldn't - it was dangerous... and Mesprit made a not-so-subtle threat about it.

"Please..."

"No."

Azelf sighed.
"Listen to me - I don't know how much longer I'll control myself... I might lose it at some point... do it while I'm still thinking straight, and your permanence here will be much more pleasing for us both." she said.

You signed in exasperation.
"Azelf... I can't..." you said.

"Why not?"

"Mesprit is going to kill me..." you admitted, recalling her unfinished but still very clear threat. Azelf smiled sympathetically.
"Like she can without her willpower... and then, who says she's going to know?" she said with a reassuring smile.

You looked at her, slightly reassured but not completely sure.

"Come on..."

You felt conflicted.

On one side, Azelf was suffering; on the other, you were going to be suffering if Mesprit found out.

Could you really betray her trust?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Conflicted feelings

choices: "... Forgive me." she decides to 'convince'you by changing your will...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
Mesprit sat by the lakeshore of Lake Verity, staring at her own reflection in the water dejectedly.

She felt horrible.

She felt like the title 'guardian' didn't fit her anymore, her precious little human had opted to stay with Azelf, Uxie's lake was partly destroyed...

What was she reduced to?

Even though she was incredibly big, she felt insignificant right now.

She had let her heat corrupt her mind, she tried to murder Uxie, both destroyed one of the three great Lakes and both almost killed the human...

The human.

Her precious little guy, the one creature that had her heart... scared by her. Gone with Azelf.

"Cutie..." Mesprit murmured to herself, sliding a paw into the water and moving it across her reflection. Maybe it was just her depressed brain pulling pranks on her, but she saw it speaking.

"... Just what life have you got anymore? Seriously, the human was the last thing you had and you let him go with your sister..." the reflection scolded.

Mesprit began to tear up.

"It was his choice..." she meekly responded.

"You had to convince him to come with you... Now, think of all the nice things he might be doing with Azelf right now..."

Mesprit frowned.
"... He wouldn't dare." she said, desperately trying to self-convince of it.

The reflection seemed to laugh.
"Like he did with Uxie?"

The giantess was about to respond, when...

She was distracted by a Floatzel, surfacing from the lake and shouting angrily in her direction... before noticing who had been making the water shake for a while.

Mesprit watched as the Floatzel hastily muttered an apology before disappearing underwater again.

The giantess looked down, noticing that she was still moving her paw in the water, causing almost the entire lake to shake.

She sighed as she pulled her paw back and turned around, opting to look at the ground instead.

Just then, she felt something...

... Remorse? It was very faint though...

She instinctively looked in direction of Lake Valor.

"... Cutie?"

--

"... Azelf..." you said to the towering giantess, who stared at you lustfully, feeling her whole being consumed by the heat.

She couldn't bear it anymore...

However, you made up your mind. You didn't want to abuse Mesprit's trust, she was the first to confess her feelings for you, you wanted to be loyal go to her... and you also wanted to avoid facing the consequences of your betrayal, but you mostly wanted to be loyal.

"... I'm sorry Azelf... I can't help you." you said.

The giantess looked at you with a disappointed look.

"... I-I... don't want to anger Mesprit." you continued, feeling uncomfortable as you met the gaze of the lustful, disappointed Azelf. It was like you were in presence of a goddess, her golden gaze was as heavy as a boulder on your heart.

You were starting to feel scared.

Then, the giantess finally spoke,

"Look. I understand - loyalty to my sister, that's adorable," she said, trying to be comprehensive, but feeling dazed because of her heat.

It made her head spin, her breathing heavy, her cheeks flared up and her heart pound her chest from within. She had to put an end to that all... or better, you had to put an end to that all.

"... But I need this so much - and for God's sake, come here!" she exclaimed in annoyance.

You, who took a few other steps away, found yourself levitating in the air and on top of the giantess' paws.

"... Sorry." you apologize awkwardly. Azelf sighed.
"Don't worry... point is, this is not just you helping me! It's also you avoiding me losing control! Think about it, human, if I lose it, I'll just force you to do it!" she paused to sigh in exasperation.
