You noted her cheeks completely red because of her lust, her eyes glazed.

She had a point... If she lost her lucidity, you'd have to deal not with a sexually-hungry Azelf, but with a totally out of control sexually-hungry Azelf.

Apparently, she was reasoning on the same line of thinking.

"I-I... don't want to hurt you human... I do really like you... you're one good human, it'd be... horrible to lose you. For my sisters... for me." she said dejectedly as she hugged you to her chest.

You blushed.

"Feeling's mutual... otherwise, I would be on my way home right now..." you told, causing the blue giantess to hug harder.

"See? We... we like each other, no? Why won't you help me?... I can deal with Mesprit if she ever finds out, but I can't deal with this heat anymore!... Please..." she plead, giving you another lustful look.

The giantess suddenly lowered herself and let go of you, gently placing you on the ground and laid in front of you, her mouth exhaling heavily, blowing humid air in your face.

She inhaled just as heavily, before speaking again,

"I feel like I'm on fire... my head's spinning, I need relief..." she said.

Somehow, this reminded you of your first time with Mesprit.

But you were starting to grow tired of this.

"Azelf... we can't. I can't... yes, I like you too, that's undeniable, but I don't want to anger Mesprit," you repeated.
"Plus, even if you're actually lucid right now, it could still be lethal to me... so, I'm sorry, but I won't help you." you said, gently but firmly.

Azelf stared at you, looking somewhat dizzy.

Then, she spoke.
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: Justified refusal

choices: "... I... fine..." you meekly accept to leave
"I... I won't leave.* you firmly persist in staying
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.content:
You watched the two giant siblings crying on each other. You didn't know what to do - how could you calm two desperate titanesses when you could have been easily drowned in one of their tears?

You sighed, and stood there without moving, opting to wait for them to eventually calm down...

A tap on your shoulder.

You turned around, noticing a black paw on your left shoulder and a familiar blue jackal. The Lucario from earlier.

"Hey..." you said, wondering what he wanted from you but at the same time having an accurate idea.

"... Those two just almost destroyed Lake Acuity. It was over you, I must assume." he spoke, his grumbly voice echoing in your ears because of the closeness.

You shot a look at the two sisters: Mesprit had her eyes closed, Uxie had her face buried in her sister's chest. So they weren't paying attention. And their lament quite certainly covered your and Lucario's words, so they couldn't hear either.

"... Mesprit lost control. Uxie tried to stop her but... things kinda got out of hand..." you dared to explain. Lucario nodded.
"Azelf?" he asked.

You gave a deep sigh.
"... Mesprit stole her emotions... she's probably still staring at the ceiling of the cave." you revealed, somehow still hoping that this all was nothing but a nightmare. You brought a hand to the back of your neck, apparently scratching it while you were in reality pinching yourself.

Nope. You were wide awake, Mesprit and Uxie just tried to kill each other, Lucario was still in front of you.

The bipedal jackal fixed on you a solemn gaze as he folded his arms.
"... So, do you finally understand why you need to leave? D'you comprehend the power of these three now?" he asked, causing you to perk up.
"Again?"

He nodded.
"I don't know why you wanted to stay with them after what happened this morning... I don't know why you want to stay after this. But, point is, you can't." he said.

You sighed.
"... I recall that I already told you that I'm not going to leave, Lucario. Especially not now." you told with annoyance. This was the third time he tried to make you leave... fourth if you included the meeting you couldn't remember about. Nonetheless, you were getting quite tired of his stubbornness.

Hearing your words, the jackal moved a step forward.
"Human..." he told calmly, but you interrupted.

"Look... I've done it, alright?" you admitted. Lucario stared at you in confusion.
"What exactly? Did you let one of these two have sex with you ag-" you blushed and interrupted hastily by waving your hands back and forth, uncomfortable.
"No no no... I've told them what their heat causes around here... Azelf told that she'll protect me... I must assume that she'll extent her protection to the whole lake..." you admitted.

Lucario's crimson eyes widened as his eyelids opened up completely.
"You did WHAT?!" he yelled, before adopting a look of indignation.
"You! You knew that we didn't want to break their hearts! Why did you?!"

You looked back at the two crying siblings - they didn't hear the loud cry of the Lucario.

You gazed back at him.
"... I didn't know that you didn't want to break their hearts until now... and quite frankly, it broke mine more than theirs to tell about it." you recalled the moment you told it - Azelf had started crying, like Mesprit and Uxie did much later.

Lucario looked at you.
"Of course you knew it! I've personally told you-" he stopped.
"... Last night..." he said breathlessly, remembering that Uxie erased your memories. You raised an eyebrow.
"... Sorry." the jackal apologized, blushing, before shaking his head.

"... But the point is that you have to leave, human. There's no choice - if you remain, they'll keep fighting until they end up killing each other or destroying this whole place!" he told quite pessimistically.

You sighed.
"... What about you pokemon?" you asked as you casually glanced at a group of pokemon who were staring directly at you and Lucario.
"If I leave, won't they hunt you down?" you asked.

The jackal sighed.
"We'll be fine... we've gone through this countless times now, and those sisters hopefully don't manage to get us... except for that poor Snover... not to mention that Floatzel... they didn't end so well..." Lucario recalled with a blush, causing you to shiver.

Again, he sighed, this time all his exasperation detectable in his sigh.
"Look... if you don't want the same to happen to you, you gotta leave... also, they could start fighting again if you don't..." he said.

You opened your mouth.

"Before you tell ‘no’ in any other way, look around." he interrupted before any sound could escape your mouth.

You did as instructed.

The two giantesses still crying, the lake partially destroyed... pokemon looking at the two titanic sisters in shock and terror.

They were all scared, some were gazing at the sisters, others were glaring at you. One was staring at you pleadingly. You recognized her.

Vaporeon.

"You see? They're scared human," Lucario unnecessarily stated.
"They're scared by the possibility of another fight like this one, a fight that might happen again if you don't leave this lake." he told.

From his exasperated voice, you could tell that this was his last attempt.

As for you, you felt conflicted. You didn't want to leave the sisters, but you certainly didn't want the pokemon of the lake to be scared... and, of course, you didn't want another fight between Mesprit and Uxie. You looked back at them, they were still crying, a veritable lake of salt water had formed around Mesprit's head, while her chest was wet from Uxie's own tears. You felt sick.

Did you really have the heart to leave?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121211.title: The fourth attempted

choices: "You see..." you say. Time to reveal the truth...
"Forget it." you say. Maybe... wait for a better moment...?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.content:
"So? If it wasn't Uxie, why were you leaving?" Azelf repeats as she lowers herself to better hear you.

You open your mouth, but whatever was coming out from it dies down in your throat as you feel a lump forming, blocking your words as your mouth closes.

You were firm on the intention of leaving... but now, you find that you're not so sure about it anymore...

Your sudden agitation doesn't go unnoticed.
"Hey, are you feeling alright? You're all white!" she exclaims. Quite surely, you must have went pale as a sheet as you realize that you don't want to leave anymore.

You take a few steps back and grab your head in your hands.

They are dangerous.

They are dangerous.

They are dangerous.

You glance past the worried-looking Azelf, at Mesprit and Uxie, who are still hugging in silence.

They love you...

Your thoughts are reduced to nothing as you are suddenly grabbed by a large hand. Whose paw is this, you don't know.

The paw releases you. You fall flat on your rear. Another paw gently removes your arms from your face, and you notice that it was Azelf the one that scooped up. She looks extremely worried.

"I apologize if I'm wrong, but you're not feeling well. Your soul isn't feeling well, am I right?" she asks. You look at her, meekly nodding your head.

"Is It because you feel like you don't want to talk? I can lend a paw with that if you want," she offers.
"No..." you whisper.
"... It's just... it's just..."

"It's just...?" Azelf repeats, getting more and more curious.

"I'm not so sure about it anymore, Azelf," you finally say. However, the giantess doesn't seem to understand.
"About what?" she asks, tilting her head in a confused manner.

You rise your gaze.
"About leaving, Azelf. I'm not sure about it like I was before," you explain.

The titaness stares down at you for a moment, before a smile appears on her face as she feels her heart perking up within her chest.
"Tell me you aren't kidding." she says.
"Tell me you aren't making me say this," you retort.

The giantess blushes.
"No no, you're telling it yourself," she assures.

Apparently, Mesprit and Uxie are listening to the conversation, you judge as Mesprit suddenly breaks the hug and turns around, fixing her eyes on you.

Before you even know it, she floats forward, scoops you from Azelf and brings you up, pressing you against her pink cheek.
"P-Please... D-D-Don't g-go... You are my l-love..." the giantess pleads, tears sliding between you and the wide surface of her cheek.

Your limbs go limp. You close your eyes and bite your lower lip in a useless attempt to keep yourself from crying.

You drop against Mesprit's cheek and let your tears roll down your own cheek. Your own tears become one with hers.
"I-I don't want to l-leave you girls..." you sob.

Mesprit tightens her hug as she too closes her eyes, tears keeping sliding down. Soon enough, you feel another surface pressing your further into Mesprit's skin.

Glancing backwards, you notice that Uxie just grabbed her sister in a hug, pushing her own cheek into Mesprit's, pushing you deeper.
"Then don't." she says as she starts to cry again.

Somehow, her words succeed where they failed last night: they shatter your resistance. Your wish to leave wanes away all of sudden.

"I-I don't want to l-leave you..." you repeat.
"A-And I won't."

Your words aren't greeted with cheers, like you expected, but with more tears instead.
"Y-You..." Uxie stammers.
"Y-You're staying...? Y-You mean it?" Mesprit asks.
"Yes. I mean i-" your sentence is never finished as you feel a third surface pressing into you.

It doesn't take long for you to realize that Azelf joined in this group hug, with you in the middle of it.

However, you're sure that the three legendaries got what you were saying anyway.

Your cry and the legendaries' becomes one, a cry of both pain and joy.

--

"WHAT is he thinking?!" the figure of Lucario growls behind the bushes that serves him and a certain pokemon as a hiding spot.

Just then, Lucario is slapped by Vaporeon's tail.
"Quiet!" she barks while keeping her voice low.
"Do you want them to discover us?"

Lucario meekly rubs the back of his head that was unceremoniously hit.
"Can't you simply talk before slapping me?" he mumbles.

Vaporeon smirks.
"Anyway, the point is another: the human wants to stay..." Lucario tells, his ears drooping.

Vaporeon flinches.
"What?" she asks, incredulous.
"Does he realize that he's in danger?"

Lucario nods.
"He does. He just doesn't care. He got too close to the legendaries, and now he doesn't want to leave!" he exclaims, exasperated.

"What do we do then? We try to talk to him again?" Vaporeon asks.

"What else can we do? The human mentioned the pokemon around the lake, me included. If we do something against him, the legendaries will hunt us down..." Lucario reasons, shivering as he thinks of himself and the other pokemon facing the wrath of those three giantesses.

Apparently thinking about the same thing, Vaporeon backs away in a scared manner.
"Right..." she tells.
"But what do we do then?"

Lucario sighs.
"We'll think of something..." he mutters as his paw finds its way to his face. He shakes his head slowly.

Why couldn't the human simply stick to his decision?

--

"Well, one good cry never hurt anyone," Mesprit sniffles. Uxie and Azelf pull off, letting the giantess remove you from her cheek as she wipes her tears away.

Mesprit then looks at you.
"So... er... you're staying?" she asks, hopeful.

"Yes." you reply, nodding your head.

All three guardians smile. Mesprit leans forward, lovingly catching your face in between her lips as she smooches you.

"That's nice," Uxie tells, hovering closer.
"But now, just out of curiosity: why did you want to leave?" she asks.

You freeze up. You totally forgot about that...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.title: Second thoughts...

choices: ... Sadness. Apparently, the believe your story...
... Anger. They still don't believe it...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.content:
"Ehm... you see..." you mumble, bringing your hand to the back of your head as you rub it, not sure if you should really answer to the giantesses or not.

The three sisters stare down at you with curiosity as they wait for you to talk.

"Uh..."

Sensing your reluctance, Mesprit speaks up:
"Cutie, you don't have to be scared to talk," she says with a sweet voice.
"We probably won't like whatever reason made you want to leave... but nothing will change if you tell us, promise,"

At this point, Azelf moves up beside Mesprit as she looks down at you.
"That's true. So you can go ahead and talk, and nothing is going to happen to you," she reassures.

"Plus, if you tell us whatever is tormenting you, we can seek a solution together, right?" Uxie says as she too moves closer.

"I know, b-but... I c-can't..." you stutter.
"Yes, you can!" all three of them say at unison.

Everyone's gazes, minus Uxie's, fall on you, who are staring up at the three giantesses, trying to decide whether should you tell them or not.

You inhale deeply, then exhale as you let out a sigh.
"Alright," you say.
"I'll tell you."

Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie smile.
"Let's sit down," Uxie suggests.
"I have a feeling that this is going to be interesting..."

You take a deep breath as the three sisters starts to move.

"It happened last night," you start as the three sit in circle, you standing in the middle of it. Their gazes are locked on your comparatively tiny body.

"At least, I think that's when it started..." you nervously say as you gaze at Uxie, who blushes.

"Apparently, I was woken up and lead to a meeting where the inhabitants of the Lake were. Though, I can't remember what they said or did..." you tell.

"But, if you still can't remember - sorry again - why did you want to leave again?" Uxie asks.

You look at her.
"The... the pokemon approached me while you three were arguing," you admit.
"They've told me what actually happened last night, and then they've told me the reason of why I tried to leave twice..."

"And that's the point of the situation," Azelf interrupts. You look at her and nod.

"And that reason is...?" Mesprit questions.

You feel a lump in your throat. Have you really got the heart to say it?

"... Go on, cutie... Please..." Mesprit says softly as, again, she senses your reluctance.

You remain silent. And so do the three giantesses.

Until...

"You mentioned a pokemon that could speak human language, right?" Uxie recalls. You meekly nod.
"Okay, and what did he tell you? Something involving us?" she asks.

Again, you nod.
"Yes. Apparently, he told me... he told me that you..." you shut up, unable to tell it. Images of the reaction of the three legendaries flash across your mind... and you don't like any of the scenarios that briefly cross your mind, before fading, replaced by new ones.

"We what?" Azelf asks.

Again, you sigh, not seeing any way out of this.
"Apparently, while you're in heat, you three are... dangerous..." you mumble.

A moment of awkward silence follows.
"What...?" Mesprit asks, blinking.
"Dangerous...?" Uxie questions, as perplexed as her sister.

You nod.
"B-But... why? W-What did we do? And what our heat has to do with this anyway?" Azelf stammers.

You turn to look at her.
"I'm not sure, but... you apparently lose control," you say.
"If I got it right, you are initially satisfied. But then, you start wanting more. And more," the jaws of the three sisters start to hang open the more you speak.

"And... what happens then...?" Mesprit asks, blushing.
"Well, you keep asking for more and more, until you feel so lustful that-" your vocal chords are like paralyzed.

You don't find the courage to say it

"... That? What do we do?" Uxie asks.

You don't respond as you sir down as well, staring intently at the floor.

"You are scared," Mesprit suddenly speaks up.
"You are afraid to tell us, aren't you? But, you've came this far... no point stopping now, cutie..." she says as she moves a bit closer to you.

Your head perks up as you glance at the legendaries: all three are looking at you intently.

One last, regretful glance.

Then, the words leave your mouth:
"Y-You... you get crazy with lust," you say. The mouths of the three hang open before you even finish:
"And you go on a rampage."

You lower your head, feeling your eyes starting to grow wet.

You've told it.

"R-Rampage!?" Azelf asks, shocked.
"You are kidding... right?" Uxie asks as she looks at Mesprit.

The pink headed giantess remains silent as she checks your emotions: no doubt about it, her little human is dead serious.

"Also," you continue, briefly rising your head again to look at Uxie.
"Pokemon around here don't seem to remember you ever doing that. I believe that it's because of a certain reason Uxie..." you mumble, before lowering your head again.

"Y-You're that I erased memories of those around more than just a few times...?" she stammers, feeling her heart sinking.

You don't reply.

"But, who told you these things?" Azelf chimes in.
"You mentioned a pokemon that could speak your language, right?" she then recalls.

You nod, then look at Mesprit.

Surprisingly enough, she looks pretty calm... she's gazing at the sky, her paw over her mouth. She seems to be thinking.
"Wait a minute... a pokemon that could speak human..." she mutters, before looking at you.

"I've... I've actually met one today," she admits. In a moment, general attention shifts on her.
"Yeah, a Lucario..." she recalls, before her eyes shut open.
"H-Hey, now that I think about it... he told me what Uxie did to you!" Mesprit cries.

Your heart skips a beat as Azelf and Uxie look back at you.
"Did he tell you all these things, cutie?" Mesprit asks.

Seeing no point in denying it, you quietly nod your head, before closing your eyes.

Silence falls among the four of you. After a while, you open your eyes back up to see the reaction of the three legendaries.

They're staring at you, mouths gaping open.
"B-But, it's impossible! I've never heard of things like this happening!" Mesprit shouts.

"Me neither. But-"

"You know what? What if this Lucario simply didn't trust you? He came up with some excuse to make you leave!" Uxie chimes.

"I don't think so, Uxie. Apparently, there were many pokemon that agreed to what her told me..." you say.

The next few minutes pass without anyone saying anything. But then, you watch as the sisters' facial expressions change into ones of...
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.title: Truth is never easy to tell...

choices: "Why don't we go home?" Mesprit suggests... ‘home’?
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.content:
"Uh... Ehm..." you say incoherently as you try to decide, whether you should tell the sisters what their heat makes them do, or if you should just keep quiet about it, wait for the proper moment to tell them.

After all, they didn't lose control yet... but, what if they end up losing control before you can explain the situation to them? Would they listen to you? Or would they be so caught with lust that they wouldn't even care?

The perspective is sure dire...

"So? We are listening, cutie," Mesprit tells with an impatient voice that expresses her disappoint at your mutism.

"I-I... was leaving because... because..." you can't bring yourself to get the words out of you.

‘Because you are dangerous when in heat.’

You just need to speak these words, then tell them what you mean... Easier said than done...

Your lips fall back in place as your mouth closes again. Silence falls in between you and the giantesses.

Until they finally got tired of waiting and started jumping to conclusions, each one of them pondering of a different reason that might have moved you, the human, to leave.

"Was it something we did?" Mesprit asks. You move on her palms so that you face her.
"No, Mesprit." you reply.
"Was it something I did?" she asks again, getting an identical response:
"No, Mesprit."

Azelf hovers beside her sister, her eyes fixed on you.
"Perhaps... did we scare you? In any way?" she asks.

You feel a lump starting to form in your throat. You forcefully swallow, before replying:
"No, Azelf. You didn't scare me," you start laughing nervously.
"Well, maybe at first when Mesprit-" a large paw blocks further words.
"Let's keep that for ourselves, sweetie," she suggests, her face going from pink to red.

Uxie perks up.
"... Alright, what did you do...?" she asks, pointing her closed eyelids at Mesprit.

Said giantess pretends to not have heard, and looks to the side, still blushing madly.
"Mesprit... did you do the thing you just blamed me for?" Uxie asks with a not-so-subtle hint of indignation.

"What!?" Mesprit shouts. Your eyes shut open, and a blush spreads across your cheeks as you realize what Uxie is talking about.

Rape.

Still silenced by Mesprit's paw, you try to express yourself:
"Mh mh! Mhh!" you shout, sounding much like a raging Primeape.

"Not again..." you hear Azelf muttering.

"Not at all! He agreed! And we're not even talking about that!" Mesprit defends.
"I just asked the human to play for a bit, that's all!"

"Play what?" Uxie asks.
"Mhh!"
"Just... just a game with emotions..." Mesprit sheepishly admits, flushing red and lowering her head.
"‘You've been using your powers to...’" Azelf recalls with something between a smirk and an expression of indignation.

"That's totally hypocritic," Uxie bluntly says. Mesprit glares daggers at her.

Feeling the growing tension, Azelf quickly hovers in between her sisters.
"Now, before you try to eliminate each other again,
don't forget the point of the situation," her gaze suddenly shifts on you.

Realizing that she still got you silenced, Mesprit blushes again and releases you. You open your mouth to better inhale fresh air.
"Thanks. Was starting to suffocate," you tell. Mesprit glances at you sorrowfully.

"Now, did Mesprit's game make you want to leave?" Azelf asks. You turn to her, and shake your head.
"No. It wasn't because of that. Mesprit's game was completely harmless," you answer truthfully.
"See? Told you would have liked it." Mesprit remarks, before remembering her current situation and hurrying to shut up.

You notice Uxie and Azelf nodding their heads.
"Alright. Mesprit didn't do anything, then? Did you willingly... help her too?" she asks.

You glance back at the pink headed guardian, smiling gratefully as you remember that you had to do it for Mesprit to forgive you, which she did.
"Totally." you reply, causing the giantess behind you to smile.

Uxie nods.
"Okay. But the problem remains then: why did you want to leave?" she repeats the very first question.

You go silent again.

However Uxie remembers one of her earlier deductions. The giantess perks up.
"Did we do something... but, not to you yesterday?"
"Huh?" you ask, suddenly feeling nervous.

Uxie just guessed right, although she doesn't know it... yet.

Your nervousness doesn't go unnoticed as it is detected by Mesprit's empathic abilities.
"I think you got it, sis," she says. You swallow.

"That's it?" Uxie asks, before continuing:
"Alright, what did I - or we - do?" she asks. You don't reply.

"Was it because you saw me handling those Sneasel when they stole the eggs? Did that scare you?" she asks, feeling guilty as the thought that you were trying to leave because of her emerges in her mind again.

"No," you reply, sighing deeply.
"Then-" you interrupt.

This time, you're sure of your answer:
"You know what? Forget it. Just... forget it. I'm tired of this," you bluntly say, before turning to Mesprit.
"Now, would you be so kind to let me down? I've got to take this off," you motion for your bag, which is still hanging from your shoulders.

Mesprit nods.
"I'll come with you," she says, dreading the chance that this could be simply another attempt to leave. However, a quick check to your emotions tells her that you're actually... happy?

"Alright." you reply with a smile. The giantess nods, before floating off, marking the end of the interrogation.

--

"So, you're really staying?" Mesprit asks as you place your bag in a corner of the cave.
"Yep," you reply, before turning to her, starting to walk out of here.
"I'm not going anywhere."

Mesprit smiles as she follows you out of the cavern.
"Hey, since you're staying, what do you say if we do something together? Me and you? Alone?" Mesprit asks.

"... you're not talking about sex again, are you?" you ask. The giantess giggles.
"Nope. And I won't be for a day or two more," she pointed out, winking.
"No, I'm talking about something we can actually enjoy," she says.

"Sure." you reply, intrigued.
"What do you have in mind then?"
1343312111112121211212112121222121121212.title: Not the right time...

choices: ... you start walking towards the cave
134331211111212121121211212122212112122.content:
"I'm sorry," you say.
"But I can't tell you my reasons. I... I simply need to do it..." you say.
"Need? You need to leave?" Uxie asks.
"Aside from what Uxie did, did we do something wrong to you?" Azelf questions, sincerely concerned about you.

"What? No! You've done nothing to me!" you reply.
"Then, what ‘need’ have you got to leave us? To leave me?" Mesprit asks you, trying to fight back her sadness.

She still can't believe it. You, her precious human, want to leave her for no apparent reason... after everything that happened between you and her...

"I-I... I can't... I can't tell it... just trust me... just let me go..." you say, still not quite believing what happened in the last hour. These three are dangerous because of their heat... but the heat will have to end somewhen, right?

"M-Maybe I'll come back someday..." you try to convince them.
"B-But..." the rest of the statement dies in Mesprit's throat.

The three legendaries stay silent for a minute as they try to figure out what could have they done to you...

Or maybe... not to you...

Uxie looks at you.
"Maybe... not directly?" she asks.
"Huh?"

"Did... did we do something... not to you? Something that scared you enough to make you want to leave?" she questions.

You pale. She just spoke the truth.

Surely enough, Uxie deserves her title of ‘being of knowledge’.

A mere glance to your face is enough of an answer for the three.
"Then, if we really did nothing to you," Mesprit starts, quite relieved that she didn't do anything wrong to her little one. But, still, the problem remains.
"What did we do? Who did we harm in any way? Will you tell us?" she asks.

Again, you don't reply, not wanting to put the local inhabitants in danger. And not wanting to shatter the trio's hearts either.

However, Mesprit soon decides that she's had enough of this silence of yours. Her human will have to make his decision, once and for all. She can feel it, you loved her back. Now, it's time to see how strong that love is.

"Alright, fine." the giantess says. Her paws lower as she places you down on the ground.
"I'm going to give you a choice. You can leave me, leave us, if you really wish to do so," she says solemnly.

"But if you do, it'll be like we never met. Whatever we had together will shatter, disappear," Mesprit says with a noticeable hint of sadness. Looking better, you notice her eyes sparkling with forming tears. Each letter that came out of her mouth hurts you, like you were repeteadly crushed by a truck.

Nonetheless, you ask:
"Or...?"
"Or, you can reach me into the cave. We'll forget this whole situation and I won't ask nothing more about it..." she points to the forest.

"Leave, or stay, it's up to you, dear." she adds, before look to her sisters.
"Please, don't ask anymore questions: let him choose by himself." she says, turning around and hovering away, disappearing within the confines of the woods.

You stare at the point where she was a second ago, dumbfounded. Something taps your shoulder. You find that it's a gigantic tail. You look backwards, noticing that it belongs to Azelf.

"Know it, the same goes for me." Azelf says dejectedly, floating into the forest as well, following her sister, leaving you alone with Uxie.

You look up to her, finding her staring down to you.
"You aren't going?" you ask, almost resignedly. The giantess tilts her head.
"I'm afraid yes, dear. However..." you watch as her body lowers.

Soon, you're standing face to face with the guardian.
"I trust you'll make the right choice. I'm sure you know what is best for yourself," she says, leaning forward to place a light peck on your cheek.

You flush red as the giantess stands back up, looks at you dejectedly one last time and hovers into the forest too, leaving you all by yourself.

You stand there for a few moments.

"What to do...?" you mutter with an exasperated sigh.

"Want an advice?" a voice speaks from behind you. You turn around and watch as the familiar figure of the Lucario you met earlier comes out of the woods, an as well familiar Vaporeon following silently.

"You..." you mutter.
"Were you spying on me?"

"At all. Just checking if you told them about us," he replies.
"... Thanks, anyway."

You wave a hand dismissively, before turning back to the direction the three sisters took.
"I must decide..." you mumble.

"Well, you already wanted to leave earlier, didn't you? The decision is easy," Lucario recalls.

"I know, but... I'm not so sure anymore..." you tell.

You hear Lucario growling and Vaporeon barking something.
"Aw, come on! Your own life over the friendship... or whatever it is with those three?" he says.

"...Yes?" you reply.

Lucario huffs.
"Whatever human. The choice is up to you. Go ahead, throw your life away!" he growls. You clench your fists.

Realizing that he maybe was too harsh, Lucario quickly adds:
"If you want to leave, though, we'll still escort you."

The following moments, silence falls between the three of you.

You try to take a decision, whether to go after the three sisters or leave them.

...

"Okay..." you mumble, having taken a decision. Lucario and Vaporeon watch you as...
134331211111212121121211212122212112122.title: Safety or love?

choices: You decide to believe them... and leave.
You simply can't believe it... just go back to the sisters.
1343312111112121211212112121222121122.content:
"What...?" you question, recovering from your surprise and looking at the Lucario with curiosity.

"We actually already met before," he says, backing you into a surprised state.
"Did we? I'm sorry, but I've got no clue of who you are." you bluntly reply.
"Maybe you, though. Aren't you the same Vaporeon from yesterday? The one who told me about those pokemon slipping up inside Uxie?" you remark, looking at the quadruped water type, who nods her head.

The Lucario smirks.
"Of course, you can't remember about me, or our meeting, can you? Not after what Uxie did to you..." he says.

Your heart skips a beat as you hear his words.
"What... How do you know that?" you ask.
"We saw her. We saw her opening her eyes and forcing you to look into them." the Vaporeon speaks up. Sadly, being no pokemon, the only reply you can give is a confused stare and a blink of eyes, which, in clear body language, means: ‘What?’.

"We saw her opening her eyes. She forced you to look into them. That's why you forgot everything about last night, our meeting included. That also explains a few things that happened around here..." the Lucario helpfully translates, while glancing at the Vaporeon.

That was the reason of why nobody could remember Uxie going on a rampage, made uncontrollable because of her heat.

Suddenly, your legs feel weak and you discover that you can't stand properly anymore as you almost fall on your knees.

The description of the events that apparently occurred last night matches the one Uxie told you yesterday, ‘If you look into my eyes, you will forget everything’.

So these two are speaking the truth. They really saw the giantess wiping your memories away.

But, if that's true... you really had a meeting with them, one you couldn't possibly remember.

You question about it.
"Yeah, that brings us back to the point: our meeting." the Lucario says, while holding out a paw to help you up.

"Thanks." you say as you get back on your feet.
"So, what are you talking about? Does it involve Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie?" you say, while mentally struggling to remember.

All you accomplish, though, is a vague sense of déjà vu.

"Precisely. It was about them we talked you about. About their problem." he says, now looking dead serious.
"Problem? You mean their heat? Because I think... heh... I might've helped them a bit..." you say, blushing faintly.
"That's exactly where the problem is!" the Vaporeon says, walking closer to you.

Again, you stare at her confused, causing her to give a deep, annoyed sigh.
"That's the problem, human. You did help them. But you dug your grave." Lucario bluntly says.

Your blood seems to freeze at the last statement.
"... What... what do you m-mean?" you stammer, starting to get scared.

"Listen up." Lucario says.

--

Once again, you feel your legs unable to hold you anymore. Slowly, you sit down, and grab your head in your hands. You can literally feel it spinning, and you find your heart aching. Like really a lot.

Lucario just told you what he apparently told you last night. He told you what you couldn't remember.

And you only manage to tell three words in response:
"This. Is. Crazy." you say.

He kneels down, getting to eye level with you.
"I know, it may seem crazy. But it's the truth, we can assure you," he states.

You feel tears starting to form in your eyes. The three legendaries, they apparently caused damage to the inhabitants of the Lake they protect because of their heat.

And, according to Lucario's words, you would be their next victim...

You shake your head, refusing to believe any of it.
"I can't believe it. I don't want to. I spent a day with those three sisters. Not only they were lucid, they were the sweetest living beings I ever met! They didn't - and don't - represent any threat, I can assure you that!" you exclaim.
"They don't, for now, since their heat was satiated for a while. But it'll come stronger. And stronger. Until they turn into sex crazed beasts, and use you until you-" the Vaporeon doesn't have the courage to finish her phrase.

Not that you understood what she said, but seeing her shudder only makes you feel more uncomfortable.

Lucario and Vaporeon argue for a moment, and you see the water type wagging her long tail, which causes Lucario to growl with annoyance.
"She said that you're in danger more than us right now. Those three will turn into lustful beasts that will be the last of your problems." he translates.

You understand what he means, and shudder at the thought that those three might end up killing you. Maybe not on purpose, but the thought is still terrifying.

Before you can reply, though, the Lucario speaks up again:
"And that's the point of the situation: you need to leave. We will escort you to-" you interrupt him.
"Leaving? I c-can't! Those three would be heartbroken!... I would be heartbroken!" you exclaim, desperately trying to find a point against Lucario.

Your mind simply refuses to believe that the three legendary sisters could hurt... nobody really! And you less of everyone!

"We know this is hard for you. But it's for your own sake," the Vaporeon says. Somehow, you make out the meaning of her words.
"I'm sorry, but I really can't believe this... and maybe I should go back. Those three were arguing when I left them, I'd better check on them." you say, getting back up, and turning to walk away.

However, Lucario places a paw on your shoulder, stopping you.
"Maybe you don't believe us now," he starts.
"But you need to. If you don't, you might end up believing us anyway... When you're nothing more than a broken sex toy." he says.

You briefly imagine what he just described. And you end up frenetically shaking your head to get rid of the thought.

Lucario continues.
"The choice is up to you, human. You can believe us, if you want, and we'll take you away from the Lake and to nearest city," he says.
"... Or...?" you dare to ask.
"Or you can go back to those three sisters, and throw your life away. But remember that we warned you," he says.

You turn back, looking into the pokemon's crimson eyes for a moment.

And, ultimately, you make your choice...
1343312111112121211212112121222121122.title: The ugly truth

13433121111121212112121121212221211222.content:
"I'm sorry," you start.
"But everything's just... unbelievable. And I don't want to leave those three sisters, so..." you say, gently moving a hand to remove Lucario's paw from your shoulder.
"I made up my mind." you finish.

Lucario stares at you for a few moments, before nodding his head.
"If that's what you want... have fun..." he remarks with a hint of sarcasm as he turns around, starting to walk away.

You hear Vaporeon sighing loudly, making her annoyance clear.
"Pay it no mind," she says, though you can't understand her.

And then, she looks at you with pleading eyes.
"Please... don't get killed... And if you change your mind,
we'll still take you to safety." you don't make out the meaning of her words. So you just kneel down and pet her head. She lets you, and moans as she feel you rub.

A call from Lucario claims her back to reality. Barking something in response, she makes her way towards him. The two briefly glance at you, before disappearing into the woods.

You stand there, still somewhat confused about what they told you, before deciding to go find the three legendaries.

Soon enough, though, it turns out it isn't necessary.

The world around you suddenly shakes as you discover a familiar, azure giantess suddenly coming out of nowhere, looking worried, and stops as she sees you.

"Uh... hi, Azelf?" you say. In response, the giantess hastily picks you and brings you to her face.
"You! We need you, like now! The situation got out of ha-" she abruptly stops.

You hear someone crying distantly:
"I refuse to believe this!" you cringe as you recognize Mesprit's voice.

Instinctively, you look at Azelf who, not adding another word, hugs you to her chest and floats off, in direction of Lake Acuity, where her sisters are arguing.

--

If you weren't solidly held in Azelf's arms, you would have fell.

Floating in front of you are Mesprit and Uxie, one looking really angry, the other looking somewhat scared. They appear to not have even noticed Azelf. And if they did, they didn't pay her any attention.

"I refuse to believe this, Uxie!" Mesprit repeats.
"It's the truth! That's why I had to make him forget!" Uxie retorts. You quickly remember that you're the cause of the argument.

"This makes no sense at all! Why would the human -
my human! - have wanted to leave?" Mesprit inquires.
"That's exactly what I was trying to discover! He just told me that her wished to leave! Where could I find the heart to let him?" her yellow headed sister asks.
"You could have simply tried to talk sense into him! You erased his memories before even knowing what reason he had to leave. And I still don't believe it," Mesprit says.

And, for the first time since Azelf brought you here, her gaze shifts on her blue sister. More specifically, on you.

And her frown changes into a small smile as she hovers closer and gently snatches you from Azelf and hugs you to her face.
"Cutie! Uxie there is saying you meant to leave. But you would never leave us (me), would you?" she says, her voice going from venomous to honey-sweet in a second.

Before you can reply, though, Uxie hovers closer as well.
"Dear... I don't know how to find the words to say this... but you meant to leave for some reason. I... I am ashamed of my actions... but I had to make you forget, do you understand? I am sorry." she says, lowering her head.

"Well... I sure don't wish to leave none of you..." you reply truthfully. Even if you believed what Lucario said you, you couldn't have escaped anyway.

Not in the middle of the day, when the three could have found you in less than five minutes.

"See, Uxie? This little one doesn't wish to leave like you said... why would he have wished to leave last night?"
"I'll tell it again: that's what I was trying to figure out." Uxie replies, as she gently picks you from Mesprit, who stares daggers at her sisters.
"Hey-" Uxie interrupts with a movement of her paw, which only irritates Mesprit further.

Uxie holds you in front of her gigantic eyes, causing you to cringe once again. Even though the situation, the giantess smiles: seeing the human scared is kind of cute. Like the resistance he put up to avoid her gaze last night. It didn't work, but still, it was admirable.

"Don't worry, you. I'm not going to do anything to your... I just wish to know, did me or my sister do something to you yesterday? Something wrong? Or maybe, not to you? None of you will do anything to you, so I beg you to be truthful." she ask with a sweet smile, succeeding in reassuring you.

A bit.

"Uxie, nor you or Mesprit or Azelf did anything wrong. You were simply the sweetest creatures I ever met. I don't know about last night, I don't remember whatever I did, but I do not wish to leave..." you say. You catch Azelf and Mesprit smiling, maybe relieved by the fact that they didn't do anything bad to you.

Or maybe because you called them ‘the sweetest creatures I ever met’.

At this point, you feel light-headed for some reason, and you discover Uxie staring at you intently through her closed eyelids as she scans your mind.

Then, the sensation fades, and the giantess smiles.
"Okay. Thanks for your sincerity, dear." she says.

At this point, you are again snatched by Mesprit, who hugs you tightly.
"See Uxie? He didn't wish to leave, and he doesn't wish to leave. So I think you should-" Uxie interrupts.
"I already apologized. And I'll repeat it again, I only made you forget because you wanted to leave!" she says, pointing at you.

"And this only leaves one question: if it wasn't us, why did you wish to leave?" she asks, mostly to herself.

You however start to feel nervous.
"Don't ask me. I can't remember. And I didn't believe Lucario..." you whisper.

However, Mesprit seems to hear the last name.
"Lucario...?" she asks looking down at you, seeming confused, before remembering something:
"Hey, now that I think of it, a Lucario told me about what you did Uxie! He and a Vaporeon..." she says.

Your blood seems to freeze. Uxie turns around.
"A Lucario and a Vaporeon? Oh no, did someone see... me..." Uxie says, noticing the nervous look on your face.

In a moment, the attention of the three sisters is on you.
"You didn't tell completely everything, did you?" Uxie asks after a few moments of hesitation.
"Tell us everything, sweetie. Everything." Mesprit says.
"It's the only way to solve this. Come on." Azelf adds.

You're in cage. If you tell what Lucario and Vaporeon told you, you're not certain of how the sisters would take it.

After all, you didn't believe it yourself. But, apparently, you believed to it last night, and you wanted to leave... something you regret. But it is also true that everything started from what you have been told.

Of course, not saying anything is an option too. But you feel like that an attempt to avoid the trio's questions wouldn't be exactly wise...

So, once again today, you find yourself forced to make a choice, wether to tell everything to the three, or say nothing and face the consequences...

The three sisters stare at you intently, their gazes feeling like a weight on your heart.
"Whenever you're ready, dear," the three says with reassuring smiles, eager to find the truth.
13433121111121212112121121212221211222.title: Quarreling legendary sisters

13433121111121212112121121212221212.content:
Mesprit's heart leaps in her chest as she hears the words of the Lucario.

Now someone saw what Uxie did? So... was it true? Uxie did really erase her precious little one's memories?

Did he really admit-

Mesprit frenetically shakes her head, causing the Lucario to take a few steps back and the Vaporeon to disappear underwater again, fearing that the agitated pink headed giantess could kill them with a single swing of one of her tails.

Mesprit simply refuses to believe the words of the duo. For what she knows, they could lie to her.

No, the only solution to this situation is one: find Uxie and demand answers from her, since her little one can't possibly remember anything of last night.

That if Uxie really made him forget something.

And then, there is still one major problem: where is Uxie?

Too many questions in her mind, Mesprit decides that she needs to be alone for a while.

"I'm sorry," she says to the Lucario, trying to sound polite.
"I need... I need some privacy..." she speaks, rising herself from the lakebed and hovering upwards.

And, before the jackal can say anything, she had already left for an unknown destination.

--

Meanwhile, back inside of the cave, you are going nuts!

You walk back and forth, trying to come up with an answer. Why can't you remember anything of last night? You remember sleeping with Mesprit, but then?
"I don't know, Azelf, did I do something wrong to Mesprit? Why did she look so... sad?" you mutter.

"First, could you stop walking on my belly? It tickles," you halt yourself. The giantess smirks.
"Thank you. Relax, will you? You made it up to her. Heck, you slept together! Do you sleep talk?" she asks.
"... No?"
"Then, you didn't say nothing wrong either. So, Mesprit isn't like that because of you," she states.
"Alright. But why I can't seem to remember anything after going to sleep?" you ask.

Azelf shrugs.
"Well, it's normal to not remember exactly everything when you wake up. Maybe-" the giantess abruptly stops as she casually looks in your eyes.

You see her gigantic, golden eyes widening.
"... Maybe...?" you ask.
"Nothing." she replies.

Suddenly, you find her large paws coming down on you, pushing your whole being down as she embraces you for no apparent reason.

You look up at her. And you recognize the look she's giving you.

The same shocked and dejected look that Mesprit gave you earlier.

First Mesprit, now Azelf?
