Mesprit didn't want to punish the human, Mesprit wanted him. That couldn't mean anything bad.

Right?

Azelf remembers the talk she had with her sister yesterday. Specifically, she remembers four words, ‘I love the human’. Azelf can't deny that she feels sorry for what she did to Mesprit... but she also can't deny how good it felt, to finally have her heat soothed.

The human was the very first living being that offered help, she couldn't let the opportunity escape, could she?

Azelf decides to discard this line of thinking, opting to focus on the problem she found out about earlier.

The human's eyes were glowing yellow; Uxie is still missing. The two things are linked by a third fact: Uxie had erased the human's memories.

The only question is: why did she do such thing? What reason could Uxie have to make the human look into her eyes? Azelf saw her sister with her eyes open only a few times - and everytime, she hurried to close hers.

What did the human do to make Uxie use her powers?

"Azelf." a familiar voice calls the giantess from behind, interrupting her thoughts.

Azelf turns around to face Mesprit, who is holding the human.
"Oh. Did you two make up already?"

"Yep." you respond.
"Couldn't stay mad at you~" Mesprit chirps, nudging you with her head, almost throwing you off her open palm.

Despite her thoughts, Azelf smiles. She's about to tell how adorable the scene looked, but she quickly swallows her words as she remembers that Mesprit probably didn't forgive her yet.

"Mesprit I'm so-"
"Save it. I am quite happy now. So I'll forgive you. Just-" Mesprit is interrupted as Azelf gets up and grabs her in a hug.

The gesture would have been adorable, if it wasn't for the fact that the sudden hug made Mesprit throw her paws in the air, throwing you about 215 ft above the ground.

Your heart skips several beats, and you scream out in terror as you fall down.

Only the psychic intervention of both sisters saves you from becoming a red mess on the ground.
"Whoops! Sorry!" Azelf exclaims as you are floated back in the relative safety of Mesprit's paws.

Your heart resumes its beating, and your face slowly - very slowly - regains color.
"As I was saying: Just don't do that again." Mesprit says to her sister.
"Sure thing. Or, sure things."

--

"What are you two hiding?" you ask the two legendaries, who are currently speaking in their natural language - repeating their names over and over.

"Don't worry about it." Mesprit says with a quick glance at you, before going back to speaking with Azelf.

"I'm not worried, I'm curious. You two are hiding something from me, I'm sure of it." you say, trying to not sound too defiant.
"It's nothing, really. Just, uh, family stuff." Azelf lies.

"Really? What about Uxie?" your words have the extraordinary result to interrupt their speeches.

Mesprit sighed, before turning to you.
"It's Uxie we are talking about." she reveals. You rise an eyebrow.
"We... We can't seem to find her anywhere, and we're kinda..." Azelf says. Mesprit finishes her sentence:
... Worried about her."

Not knowing - or not remembering - what happened to you, you nod your head, buying the explanation.
"I'm sure she's fine. I mean, what could could possibly hurt her?" you say, trying to be positive.

Then, for a moment, you catch a glimpse of something transparent behind Azelf and Mesprit.

It looks like... a shadow. And, for some reason, it has a vaguely familiar shape...

You rub your eyes; when you open them, the shadow is gone. The two legendaries in front of you look back, discovering nothing.
"Hey, are you alright?" Mesprit asks concerned.
"What did you see?" Azelf questions.

You hesitate before answering:
"Nothing."

The two legendary sisters look at you confused for a few moments, before shrugging at the same time.
"Hey, could you take a walk or something? We kinda need some privacy..." Mesprit says you.

You shrug and nod your head, guessing that they need to talk about something important.

You turn around, starting to venture into the forest, leaving Azelf and Mesprit behind.

--

You walk for about half an hour, exploring the woods around Lake Acuity. You've always liked exploring. That was the whole reason of your meeting with the three legendaries. If it wasn't for Uxie, you would probably be a frozen sculpture in the middle of nowhere right now.

You empty your mind of these bad thoughts and keep walking, enjoying the silent nature around you.

...

Suddenly, you stop as a mysterious smell catches your nose. You sniff the air.

An inviting smell of pecha berries just spread around you. You turn around, moving a step towards it... only to stop right after. What if it's a trap?

Remembering about certain thieving - not to mention perverted - Sneasel that live around here, the idea of a trap doesn't sound so improbable.

However, you don't recall such ice/dark types using sweet scents to lure people or pokemon into traps. It's the exact opposite, they prefer to sneak behind their victim and attack.

Maybe there's some grass type around?

So, maybe this sweet smell isn't a trap after all, and you're curious enough to find out about it's source. Whether to follow the smell or not, it's up to you.
134331211111212121121211212122212121212.title: Keeping secrets

1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.content:
You hesitate for a few more minutes. The chances that this smell is a trap are the same ones that it is not.

So, with a shrug, you decide to investigate the source of it. You move a step in its direction. Then another, and another as you walk towards whatever is producing this sweet scent.

A gust of cold wind blows past you, but you ignore it. You're genuinely curious, and you want to find out what this smell is, so you grit your teeth, adjust your jacket and keep walking.

For some reason you can't explain, you feel like someone is watching you... you shake your head to rid yourself of the feeling and go on, deeper into this seemingly endless forest, intending to satiate your curiosity.

The scent gets stronger and stronger each step you take, and your ears start to catch faint noises... you listen attentively, capturing muffled words. It's almost like whatever, or whoever is producing the sweet scent you are chasing is trying to be as quiet as possible.

Your walk soon comes to an end though. A literal vegetal barrier made by several trees blocks your path. However, the smell here is stronger than ever, and the whispering became a little bit more loud, though still not loud enough to allow you to
hear the words.

Too curious to let it slide, you start rubbing your head, trying to find a way to get past these trees.

There ought to be one, there must be one. You just need to find it...

--

Meanwhile, the two legendary giantesses you left behind keep talking to each other. The human had left a while ago, allowing them to talk freely.

And they have quite a lot to discuss about.

"So, let's see: what reason could Uxie have to do such thing to the human?" Azelf asks.
"Azelf, that's the first problem: we don't know," Mesprit replies.
"And the human can't possibly remember. The only way to get answers would be asking Uxie, but-"
"She's hiding from us. Look, can you detect her presence?" Mesprit closes her eyes, trying to feel her sister psychically.

However, the attempt goes poorly: Mesprit can't feel her. Uxie is probably blocking her sisters' psychic powers. After all, the pixie has the strongest mind power, and she knows how to use that.

"She's keeping us from finding her." Mesprit states.
"Exactly. So, we have another problem: we need to find her." Azelf says. Her sister shakes her head.

"Right. How do we find her? We can't detect her, but she can detect us. I've already searched Sinnoh and I've found nothing. If we get too close, she'll see us coming and she will flee..." Mesprit reasons.

"We need a plan."

--

You stand there.

You had found a way to get past these trees, the problem is how to realize it...

Slowly, you walk towards the shortest tree you find - which is huge anyway - and place your hands on the trunk. Then, you place your left foot on the roots and your right one on the trunk as you start climbing.

Soon, your left foot leaves the ground as well as you get a bit higher.

Not without difficulty, you manage to climb up to the first, lowest branch of the tree.
"Wow... that's harder than I thought..." you say, envying the Pachirisu you see on the higher branches.

After resting for a bit, you resume climbing, desperately trying to ignore the vertigo while remembering to absolutely not look down.

After a while, you manage to climb to the higher branches of this tree. You stop on a particularly high one and stop to rest. Then, remembering your objective, you peek your head through the branches, inhaling again the mysterious smell, and hearing muffled words again.

However, the way too thick vegetation still blocks your view. So, the only way to find out the whole thing is to climb down, to the other side of the barrier.

Eagerly, you start climbing down...

--

Only when you're at a few feet above the ground, you leap down, landing softly on the snow-covered grass.
"Done..." you mutter, before looking around, discovering a small path to your left. The scent, and the whispering are coming from there, you realize.

You hastily walk towards it. But your walk comes to a halt.

You notice what - or rather who - is making that smell as you see...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.title: The mysterious scent

choices: "Sure! I'll help you out!" you reply
"I-I can't, Uxie. I promised Mesprit..." you reply
1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.content:
The path ends with a small, secluded clearing. You notice a titanic body sitting there, back turned to you. Said body is furry, azure in color and with a yellow, round head; two twin tails rest on the ground behind it.

You give a big smile as you call out:
"Hey Uxie!" the giantess' head perks up.

Slowly, that head turns around, pointing two closed eyes in your direction.

Uxie feels her heart sinking as she sees you walking towards her smiling, suggesting that you didn't find out about what she did.

Which is a good thing. But the giantess feels comprehensibly guilty about it.
"Oh, it's you..." she says, smiling a little as you halt beside her.
"Yep! Good morning!" the titaness giggles.

"I believe it's a bit late for that..." she responds.
"But, say... this was your first night here. How did you sleep? Was it good?" she asks.


"Yeah! I slept like a rock! I don't know what you did last night to soothe me, but it was great! Thanks!" you exclaim, leaning forward and getting an armload of fur as you gratefully hug Uxie's side.

Uxie's heart leaps within her chest.

She had deleted the human's memories and he was grateful! This only contributed to make her feel worse.
"I did nothing at all. Thank the Lake," Uxie says, remembering the excuse she had made up last night.

You snicker in response.
"Good one!" you reply.
"You're sweet. But you're missing something..." the giantess says.
"What am I missing?" you ask, finally releasing her fur.
"My arms are up here."

Not even a second later, you are grabbed and brought against the giantess' chest as she hugs you tightly.
"Better, don't you think?" she chimes.
"Can't deny it." you reply.

Uxie smiles even more. You couldn't possibly know about her internal pain.

The giantess woke up early this morning, finding you sleeping with her. Recalling the reason of why you were laying on her chest, she gently put you down and left the cave to come here - the most secluded area of Lake Acuity.

She needed to do some thinking; the whispering you heard earlier was coming from Uxie herself, who was thinking aloud. About what reason might have made you want to leave her and her sisters.

It was a self-imposed task, she simply had to find out. Otherwise, the giantess isn't going to forgive herself for wiping your memories away anytime soon.

But then, you had found her.

Uxie is unsure whether your today quite cheerful attitude makes her feel better or worse.

You are being cheerful only because you can't remember the heartache you felt last night, when you were firmly intentioned to leave Lake Acuity.

Remembering about it, Uxie's smile drops. If she never woke up, if she never noticed you leaving, if she never erased your memories, you would have left. Possibly, without ever coming back; the giantess wouldn't have dealt with that so easily, she's sure of it...

Uxie decides to rid her head from these sad thoughts. She returns to reality. And she hears your voice calling her:
"Uxie?... Don't misunderstand me, this is adorable, but a hug isn't supposed to last this long..." you say.
"Hm?" she replies, casually looking down to notice that she is, in fact, still hugging you.

Her cheeks go from yellow to crimson red.
"Oh, ehm, sorry," she sheepishly says, while releasing you, letting you sit on her left, open palm.
"I was thinking."

You shrug.
"Say, you did manage to find me here. That was pretty clever of you," the titaness compliments. Only to earn a questioning stare from you.
"This is the most private place around Lake Acuity.
Come on, tell me, how did you find me?"

"Well, I followed this sweet scent that led me here. I climbed up those trees and-"
"Sweet scent? What are you talking about?" Uxie interrupts, curious about the scent you talked about.

"Yeah, there was this sweet smell. I initially thought it was a trap of those Sneasel, but then I decided to follow it. It led me here," you pause to laugh a bit.
"And it was just you! The last living being who would harm anybody else!" you say.

Again, Uxie's heart pounds the insides of her chest with the force of what might be compared to Arceus' Judgement. And a dark type one. However, the pixie focuses on what you told her. Otherwise, she would have started crying.

"Sweet scent...?" she parrots back, trying to figure out what you are talking about.
"Yep. It was - Hey..." you pause to sniff the air. Again, that wonderful scent of pecha berries. And it's coming from down below.
"What?"
"I can smell it again..." you say.

Genuinely curious, Uxie emulates your actions and sniffs the air, effectively picking up on a sweet smell...

The guardian's face goes from yellow to white, then from white to bright red as she realizes what the smell is. So lost in her thoughts, she didn't even notice it earlier... is it really that strong?

"Uxie? Are you feeling fine?" you ask, noticing the shift of color her face went through.

Uxie shakes her head.
"I-I think I know what this smell is... this is so embarrassing..." she mutters.
"Embara-" you suddenly understand.
"Oh..." is all you can say.

‘Stupid heat... go away... it's not the right time...’ Uxie thinks as she starts to feel the effects of the problem; her body burns with lust, her nether regions start to become bothersome.

Uxie looks at you.

Well, you are here with her... nobody else knows of this place...

Uxie mentally slaps herself. After what she's done to you, how can she even consider it? True, you don't know about it, but still...

The giantess grits her teeth. No, it isn't the time for morality, she decides. Her needs to be satisfied.

Noticing the giantess in pain, you feel a huge urge to help... only to remember that Mesprit already got angry with you twice already. If you do it again, she might not forgive you...

You nervously pretend to cough, awaiting for the fateful question.

Which doesn't take long to come:
"H-Human... I'm sorry, but... m-mind lending me a hand... ag-gain?" she stammers with embarrassment.

You purposely breath in deeply. That gives you a few seconds to think, whether you should help Uxie or keep the non verbal promise you made to Mesprit.

In the end, you exhale what you took in as you open your mouth to reply:
1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.title: Found

choices: Suddenly, the real Mesprit comes by, searching for you
1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.content:
In the end, you make your decision.

"Okay, I'll help you out!" you exclaim with a smile.

True, you made a promise to Mesprit... but, helping someone is a greater deal, right? And then, Mesprit doesn't need to know about it... and even if she does, you're doing it to help, she'll understand...

Uxie pays your thoughts no mind, and shows off her brightest smile.
"You are one kind human, you know that?" she says sweetly.

The giantess feels internally ashamed of doing this, but she can't resist it. She simply can't.

Her paws lower as she sets you down by her legs. Which slowly part as a vertical pair of gigantic, pulsing lips comes into view.

You look up to Uxie, searching for some kind of confirm on her face.
"Whenever you are ready." she says, her cheek burning with a bright red shade. Clearly, the titaness isn't totally comfortable with the whole thing, even though you've done it once already.

Upon hearing the confirm you were seeking for, you nod your head and move a step towards the giantess' sex. Then, you take another as you start walking, soon getting past her feet and legs, stopping by her crotch.

"Uhm..." you say, the last remains of your uncertainty trying to fight back the determination to help Uxie.
"Just do it... please..." these four, simple words shatter your resistance like glass as you, once again, nod your head.

Then, you look forward, both your arms extending as you press your open palms onto the fur covering the warm flesh that lays beneath it.
"Oh!" the giantess cries from above, signaling you her first wave of pleasure.

You ignore the moan, and keep rubbing, occasionally speeding up or slowing down as you try to pleasure the lustful titaness.

You're doing something good, it seems, you can tell from the pleased mutterings coming out of the giantess' mouth along with moans of pleasure.

Soon, you decide that mere rubbing won't get you nowhere, and you opt to spice things up. You start rubbing more vigorously, your nails starting to scratch the flesh of Uxie's sex; your fingertips slide along the length of the gigantic lips as you try tickling her.

What you accomplish are giggles, moans and grunts of pleasure coming out of her mouth, replaced by deep breaths. All while the flesh and the fur grows wetter and wetter, the blue fur starting to get stained with white stuff you recognize.

Then, before you even know it, Uxie moans louder than before, and you barely register the stream of juice that rivers out of her.

You take a quick leap back, avoiding getting touched by the fluid, before looking up to the giantess; her once yellow face has turned completely red, her chest rises and falls in a frenetic fashion along with her breath, which sped up. Her tails flail weakly behind her, suggesting that they've been swinging through the whole process.

"Hey, I can imagine the answer, but... are you satisfied?" you ask.

A smirk paints on the giantess' face.

She gives no response, but her paws travel to her crotch. Her lips are pulled apart, and Uxie shoots you an expectant look... at least, you can assume it's an expectant look. It's hard to tell since her eyes are always closed.

Anyway, getting the gist of her message, you nod as you once again walking past her legs and slide into her sex, your view getting eclipsed as she closes her lips back up, enjoying having your body within hers...

--

Your world is squeezed as the walls around you connect, almost breaking your bones.

Uxie just collapsed on her side, you judge.

Luckily for you, the giantess quickly rolls on her back as a second wave of her love juice erupts around you, washing you out into the light again.

Which soon gets obscured as a giant paw grabs you and carelessly brings you up, towards the smiling face of the titaness.
"Y-You... w-wonderful... t-thanks..." she stammers. You dismissively wave a hand.

Uxie rests on her back for a couple of minutes, before placing the elbow of her free arm on the ground as she sits up.
"You were perfect," she says, her free paw finding its way to you as she starts cleaning you from her juices.

"It was nothing..." you reply.
"Stop being modest. You helped me again, I can't even find the words to express my gratitude..." she says. All the red blood cells in your body choose this moment to move to your cheeks as you blush.

"And for that," Uxie continues, wiping the last drops off your body as she cleans you up.
"I think you deserve a reward."

"What rewa-ah!" you exclaim as a large pair of yellow lips physically assaults you, Uxie smooching you over and over until you're completely breathless.

She pulls off, giggling merrily while you stumble on her paw, trying to not lose your footing.
"Warn me next time..." you dizzily mumble, before shaking off the nausea.

A thought then penetrates your mind.
"Hey, I think I should go back to Azelf and Mesprit now... it's been hours since I left them..." you say, before recalling something.
"Actually, they're searching for you. They look pretty... worried..." you reveal.

Uxie's head perks up.
"Worried...?" she parrots back, before realizing. Azelf and Mesprit aren't worried, they're searching for her because they want answers.

Most probably, they found out about what Uxie herself did... Maybe, they were the ones sending the human to find her?

No, she decides, the human looks clueless. He would have never agreed if he knew what she did to him...

But then-

"Uxie...?" your voice cuts off her thoughts. Uxie looks at you.


"Listen, I nee-" Uxie is interrupted as she hears a voice crying:
"Human? Where are you?"

Both you and the giantess recognize the voice.
"Mesprit." you say.
"And she's looking for you..." the Uxie mutters, before continuing:
"Listen, you must go now. But, please, don't tell my sisters that I'm here," she says.

"Uh, okay?... Any reason?" you ask, curious.
"I can't tell now. Just promise," the giantess sees the skeptical look on your face.
"... Pretty please?" she asks.

You shrug.
"Alright. I promise." you reply. Uxie smiles and leans forward, briefly pecking you, before muttering a ‘See you later’.

Then, your surroundings fade as the giantess teleports you.

--

As you regain the ability to see, you look around, finding yourself back on the other side of the vegetal barrier you got past earlier.

Now, you expected to see a certain giantess around. But instead, no one. Which is weird. Mesprit wouldn't go anywhere unseen...

A sound draws your attention. You turn your head to notice a creature flapping its wings, before stopping on a tree. And you take a good look at it: blue wings, yellow and green chest, white neck and a black, note-shaped head with a big, red beak and a pointy, black tail on the opposite side of its body.

A Chatot.

You stare at it as it stares back at you, before it talks again, in a very familiar voice:
"Human! There you are!" it exclaims, emulating Mesprit's voice. Did this bird just prank you?!

"Hey, don't make fun of me!" you exclaim, irritated. The bird snickers.
"What? Don't you like playing?" it says. You growl at it.
"Suit yourself, cutie." it cries mockingly as it flaps its wings, flying off the tree and into a casual direction. You, however, don't lose sight of it.

Your legs move on their own. You won't let some random bird make fun of you or the three sisters.
"Get back here!" you exclaim with rage.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212121.title: Helping a pixie... again...

choices: You get out of Uxie; she regains her powers
Azelf and Mesprit manage to find Uxie
13433121111121212112121121212221212122.content:
Azelf senses her sister coming back and starts to panic.

If Mesprit finds the human within her, and after he had 'fixed' her... she's going to kill her! So, hastily, Azelf thinks of a way to get out of this mess.

And, soon, she comes up with an idea.
"Well, we do need to find Uxie after all..." she mutters, while closing her eyes as she focuses. Soon, the human appears on her paw.

You are greeted back to the outside world by the face of an agitated blue giantess.
"H-Hey there," Azelf says, smiling a little. Before you can reply, she talks again:
"Listen, we don't have much time, Mesprit is coming back... so I need to send you away for a while..."
"What?!" you ask, shocked.

"Don't worry! I'll just send you to Uxie... You know, if Mesprit finds us like this, we'll be in trouble," she says, not mentioning, though, the details of her plan.

Uxie is the most sensible of the trio. So sensible in fact, that a great amount of pleasure disabled her powers.

The being of knowledge had the strongest mind power of the three, and she could easily use that to keep even her sisters from finding her psychically by deviating their own psychic powers.

However, without being able to mask her presence, Uxie could be easily traced. So, Azelf is actually going to send the human to Uxie's-

"... Alright." you reply, knowing that Mesprit probably won't be forgiving you for a second time.

Azelf nods, and hastily cleans you up from her own juices, before pushing you to her face as she briefly nuzzles you.
"Thank you~" she says, before placing a quick kiss on your forehead. You blush as her smooth lips are pressed on your face, before she pulls off, producing a smooching sound.

Then, the giantess holds you in front of her face. With a smile, Azelf closes her eyes and focuses on you again.
"See you later, dear." she says.

Before you even know it, you disappear from her paws in a flash of light. Azelf opens her eyes, giving a sigh. She felt bad for lying to you, but she couldn't risk Mesprit finding her in such state, stained with her own love juices and still red from the love making.

After a few moments, a huge shadow that Azelf recognizes as Mesprit flies over.
"Hi Mesprit," Azelf mutters as her sister flies down to her.
"Azelf," Mesprit begins.
"Where's the human...?" she asks, concerned, before noticing the state her sister is in. The same state Uxie was in yesterday when she had her way with HER human.

Mesprit's dejected look changes into a frown. First Uxie, now Azelf?

How many other times is it going to happen?

Azelf notices Mesprit's face, but says nothing as her sister speaks up:
"Azelf... you just 'had fun', didn't you...?" Azelf looks down.
"Well, actually yes. It was becoming unbearable, sister," Azelf whines.
"I understand that, but the human is-" Azelf looks back up.
"I didn't do anything to the human. I solved the thing by myself, alright?" she lies, showing the paw she used to clean you off, resulting in it being still stained with her cum.

Mesprit is taken aback by the explanation, and blushes for thinking bad of Azelf.

She really needed to stop jumping to conclusions.

"Sorry," she apologizes. Azelf smiles. She managed to solve her first problem.

"But... where is the human then?" Mesprit asks again, remembering her first question.

Azelf laughs nervously.
"Hehehe, you see, it's a long story..." she says.

--

You materialize again, expecting to find yourself in front of a certain yellow headed pixie.

But as you get a look of your surroundings, you understand how wrong you were.

You find yourself in a dark, tight space. The walls have a fleshy texture. It's also somewhat damp and sticky in here. Yet, for some reason, this place seems incredibly familiar.

Then, as your eyes start to adjust to the darkness, you move hand to get a hold of something to get on your feet. But, as you touch one of the walls, a loud sound booms through the confined space:
"Oh!!" someone shouts. You stay still for a moment.

You did recognize that voice... Uxie? But... where is she...?

Realization suddenly hits you.

Azelf didn't send you to Uxie. Azelf sent you in Uxie!

--

"You did what?!" Mesprit shouts.

Azelf meekly nods her head.
"You do realize, right, that this just wrong? We need to find Uxie, alright, but why imply him in this? I didn't want him to even find out about it!" Mesprit cries.
"And he doesn't! But, by blocking Uxie's powers, we can easily find her wherever she is!" Azelf retorts.

Mesprit remains silent for a few moments, not sure of how to take the thing. She still had to deal with Uxie wiping her human's memories away, now she had to deal with Azelf sending her human inside of Uxie's body? Could her day get any worse?

And, most of all, could her little one's day get any worse?

"Poor my little cutie," she whispers dejectedly, letting a tear roll down her face.

--

"Please, tell me it isn't another Sneasel." you hear Uxie muttering to herself.
"What - no! Uxie, it's me!" you cry at top of your lungs, trying to make her hear you.

Fortunately, she seems to detect your voice.
"... Human?"
"Precisely." you reply.

"W-What are you doing in there? How did you end up there, dear?" she stammers, trying to process what is going on.
"I don't know! Azelf sent me here! She must have done it wrong!" you cry, your voice sending vibrations through the sticky walls of Uxie's womb.

Outside, the giantess lets out a low moan.
"A-Azelf...?" Uxie stammers, before realizing what really happened.

Azelf didn't do anything wrong. It was the exact opposite, she sent the human inside her on purpose! She knew about her weakness, and she used it against her - her own sister!

Azelf knew all along that she couldn't have used her powers to teleport you out... or deviate the psychic powers of her sisters... they could detect her at any moment!

"Listen, you have to get out of there. Try to get out. And be q-quick please," Uxie begs you.
"I-I'll try. But it's kinda tight in here..." you mutter your response, before starting to squirm, trying to get out from here.

Uxie moans again.

--

"Okay, focus now. We must find her," Azelf says while closing her eyes.

Mesprit the same thing and closes hers as the two focus their psychic powers.
"You know that I still don't approve what you did, don't you?" she says. Azelf opens one eye.
"It may be. But you want to find the human, don't you?" she retorts.

Mesprit remains silent, and focuses again, imitated by her sister.

--

After several struggles, you finally manage to reach the entrance of Uxie's womb.

You squeeze yourself through the tight opening, falling onto the slick and warm floor of her vagina.
"Uxie! I'll get out now!" you shout.
"Be quick!" Uxie cries from outside as you start walking in direction of her vertical lips, the giantess letting out moans each and every step you take, making the ground beneath you vibrate as you walk towards the exit.
13433121111121212112121121212221212122.title: A weird new situation

choices: Let Uxie bring you back to Lake Acuity
134331211111212121121211212122212121221.content:
You keep walking towards Uxie's slit, to the point where light pours inside of her.

And, with one last moan from the giantess, you finally leap out of her body and into the sunlight again. You take a look at yourself, noticing that your clothes are covered in sticky slime.

Then, you glance upwards, discovering the familiar yellow face of Uxie, her eyes closed as usual. And yet, those closed eyes of hers are staring right down at you as she lets a small smile spread across her face.

Uxie breaths in relief as she feels her psychic powers coming back. To make sure that it really happened, she tries using psychic on the human, who starts hovering in the air.

Satisfied, she opens up her paws and lets the human float into them as she closes him into a hug.

You're shoved against a wall of smooth, blue fur as Uxie hugs you against her chest.
"Hi there, dear," she says. You look up at her, and notice her eyelids glowing yellow for some reason...

--

"Oh!" Azelf exclaims as she opens her eyes back up. She just felt like her psychic powers were weakened.

"I think that he got out of there Mesprit..." the emotion pokemon opens her eyes as well.
"I noticed," she says, glaring at Azelf.
"I knew it was a bad idea! I just knew it! And now... the human..." she adds with a sob, thinking about what Uxie could do with the human in her paws...
"Hehehe, come on! It's not like she'll do anything to him! Ehm... maybe? I mean, she li-" Azelf nervously says. However, Mesprit interrupts:
"Do not finish that sentence." she says, both annoyed and worried.

Azelf's plan to find Uxie went poorly. And now her little human was in the paws of the same pokemon who erased his memories for an unknown reason, and both are at an unknown location. Possibly alone.

Alone.

Mesprit yelps, feeling forming tears starting to make her eyes damp.

Uxie could easily have her way with her beloved little one and she couldn't do anything about it! Even worse, maybe she already did it. Maybe she even made her little one forget it again.

And the more Mesprit thought about the possibility, the more she self-convinced that it was the only logical explanation. Was Uxie really having the human over and over, only to make him-

Mesprit's train of thought is cut short as Azelf suddenly places her paws on her shoulders, making her rise her head.

The blue giantess felt bad for the human as well - majorly because this situation was her fault. Plus, he was the first mate she's had in years. The least she could do was worry about him.
"Come on... staying here will solve nothing..." she mutters dejectedly.

Mesprit sniffles and nods as Azelf helps her up. Then, both hover upwards, leaving Lake Acuity behind as they commenced their quest to find their sister and the human...


--

"So where are we, Uxie? And why are we here?" you ask Uxie as you glance around, noticing her floating on some sort of island, sea surrounding it. You don't actually know Sinnoh too well, but this definitely isn't Lake Acuity.

"Well, we're at Iron Island, home of many steel-types of Sinnoh. And I'm here because I... uh... needed to check something," Uxie lies while cleaning off the thin layer of slime covering your comparatively tiny body, mentally scolding herself for not being honest to you.

But ‘I needed to think about why I had to erase your memories’ didn't seem like the perfect thing to say...

"But tell me, did you sleep well? After your nightmares...?" Uxie then asks.

This is the moment to find out, wether the human had discovered about what she did or he still doesn't have a clue about it.

"Uh, yeah! I had no more problems. I feel great!" you exclaim happily.

Uxie breaths in relief. Apparently, the human had no idea of what she did to him last night. Maybe Azelf and Mesprit found out, maybe they're searching for her, but the human is clueless. That's all that matters to her. She'll confront her sisters later on, she decides.

"That's nice," she replies, pushing you to her face as she nuzzles you.

As she rubs you against her gigantic, yellow face, you extend your arm forward, starting to pet the red gem on her forehead.

Uxie lets out a loud moan:
"OH!" she exclaims, almost breaking both your eardrums. A blush spread on her cheeks right after.

‘Note to self: red gem is a soft spot,’ you think.

"Hehe, sorry about that..." the pixie mutters, giggling nervously, before adding:
"Hey, I've got nothing more to do here, so... want to return ho- ehm, Lake Acuity?"

"Already? I mean, I just got here, I kind of wanted to explore around..." you admit while rubbing the back of your head.
"Though, if you want to return to the Lake, that's fine with me..." Uxie smiles.
"Oh, no no, the choice is up to you! If you want to stay for a bit longer and explore, I really don't mind." she says cheerfully.
134331211111212121121211212122212121221.title: Dodged a bullet...

choices: "Could you help me around the Lake again?" she asks with a smile
"Ehm... could you help me with... it... again?" she asks embarrassed
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"If you want to go back to Lake Acuity, there's no problem with me. I'm fine with it," you say.

Uxie smiles.
"Did anyone ever tell you that you're sweet?" she says, placing a small kiss on your left cheek.
"If you really mean it, then let's get going." she adds, placing you down on her shoulder.

"Uh... sure I won't fall off? I mean, because that would be bad. Really bad." you say, trying to not think about yourself falling off an incredible height, hitting the water and sinking without emerging again...

But Uxie simply smiles.
"Of course you won't fall, dear. Here," she says, her closed eyes gleaming yellow, you glowing of the same color as you're enveloped in psychic energy.
"All safe and sound!" the guardian of Lake Acuity says happily while floating off the island and in direction of her own home.

--

"Where could they be?!"

For the past hour or so, Azelf and Mesprit have uselessly searched around the whole Sinnoh to find their sister and the little human she's holding with her.

Sadly, they seemed to have just disappeared as the duo couldn't find them anywhere!

"My little cutie... where are you...?" Mesprit mutters as the two stop near Azelf's home lake, better known as Lake Valor.

The blue pixie smiles sympathetically.
"Looks like you really developed a close bond with him, didn't you Mesprit?" she says.

Mesprit looks at her sister.
"Close bond? I love him!" she remarks, not caring of the red shade spreading on her pink cheeks.

‘So do I,’ Azelf thought to herself. Only to assume a flabbergasted expression right after.

Did she just admit to herself that she was in love with a human...?

The pact she and her sisters had made, forgotten. All because of a single, little human.

...Well, that wasn't totally correct.

She was in love with the human. The same sweet little guy who had so kindly helped her with her... physical problems.

Thinking about it, Azelf can't help but flush red.
"Azelf?" Mesprit calls out, snapping her back to reality.
"Uh?"
"What are you thinking about? You're kinda... red..." Mesprit points out.
"Oh... ehm... I'm sure it's nothing..." Azelf replies, before rising her head. Her gaze briefly fixes on the blue sky as she closes her eyes.

‘Yep, It's official. That little one stole my heart as well...’ she mentally says, blushing even more, letting a small smile spread on her face.

Then, she opens her eyes back up and looks at her pink headed sister.

She couldn't admit around Mesprit. She wouldn't take it exactly good. Also, Mesprit could always feel emotions. One wrong move, and Mesprit could just check Azelf's emotions and find out the truth.

Azelf sweat drops as she watches her sister staring intently at the floor, submerged in her own thoughts about the human.

‘I need to be careful...’ she thinks.

Then, Mesprit rises her head again. She uses a paw to wipe the tears from her eyes, before fixing her gaze on Azelf.
"Come on, sister. We need to find them." she says while starting to hover upwards. Azelf nods and follows.

‘I need to find him...’

--

"Home sweet home." Uxie mutters while hovering above the waters of Lake Acuity.

She flies over the lake shore and the psychic aura surrounding you fades as Uxie gently picks you from her shoulder with her paw.

"There you go," she says, slowly and carefully lowering her paw to ground level. The wind blows past you as she opens her fist, letting you leap off her paw and onto the snow-covered grass.

"Thanks." you thank the giantess, taking notice of a few pokemon fleeing into the depths of the forest upon seeing her.

Unknown to both of you, a certain couple didn't flee. They just hid in the thick vegetation, which does a great job in concealing them...

--

"So, they returned..." Vaporeon cries.
"Uxie. And the human..." Lucario grunts with a subtle hint of annoyance upon seeing that the human came back.

"Don't be mad at him. It isn't his fault, Lucario. He can't remember us. Or what we said to him..." Vaporeon remarks almost pitifully.

"I know. But still, that's not good. Not for him. Not for us." the jackal replies, starting to walk away from the bush from where he was watching Uxie and the human.

"Hey, where do you think Mesprit and Azelf went?" Vaporeon distractedly asks, still not leaving the bush that serves her as a hiding spot.

"I don't know," Lucario replies flatly.
"Maybe they're off searching for Uxie , ignoring that she's here. Mesprit wasn't too pleased when she left." Vaporeon nods.
"Should have listened to us..." she mumbles.

Right before letting out a suffocated cry:
"Lucario! Come here! Quick!" Lucario rushes to the bush, peering through the leaves to see Uxie talking to the human with a smile...

--

"Uh, what? Sorry, I wasn't listening." you reply. You're sure that Uxie just asked you something, though you did not hear it.

The giantess smiles.
"I actually asked if you wanted to help me..." she repeats her request.
"Help you with what?" you ask back.

You crane your neck to fully look at the yellow headed pixie's face. And you watch her lips part as she replies...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Back to the lake

choices: Azelf says nothing, but goes confront Uxie...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
A deep blush spreads on Uxie's cheeks, and you find her clasping her paws as she stares at you.
"Er... how can I say this..." she mumbles sheepishly.

"Say what?" you ask, curious about her sudden change of behavior.
"Well... I can't find the right words..." she mutters, before giving a defeated sigh.

"Listen," she says before you can ask what's up with her.
"I kind of... I need you again..." she says, her blush growing along her carnal desires. Unknown to you, she's currently imagining all the possible things that you and her could do now that you're alone... and she discovers that she doesn't mind imagining such things.

Still, you don't get the meaning of her words.
"Need me for what?" you ask, uncertain.

Before you finally make out what she means.
"Ohh..." you realize what she's asking for.

‘...Crap’

"Ehm... Right now, Uxie?" you ask her.

The pixie nods her head.
"If you want of course..." she mutters.

You remain silent for a moment, pondering your answer.
"Sure," you then reply with a sigh, before smiling a little.
"Why not?" the same moment the words leave your mouth, two large paws wrap around you and lift you off ground, pulling you up and pushing you into a large pair of yellow lips, which start repeatedly smooching you with glee.
"Great!" Uxie exclaims between kisses. Before realizing what she's doing.

Giggling nervously, she places you back down.
"Eh sorry. Don't know what's gotten into me..." she apologizes, before looking at you again.

"So, ehm..." she says embarrassed, her blush growing wider on her face. You notice movement on her lower side. You lower your gaze to see her legs parting, her vagina coming into view.


"Er... whenever you're ready, dear."

--

In the meantime, two frowning legendaries make their way back on the opposite side of Lake Acuity, home of their sister Uxie. And, her powers currently unavailable because of your... activities, the guardian of the Lake doesn't sense her sisters at all.

"Okay, it's official, they're gone!" Azelf cries, both annoyed and dejected.

"You can say that!... Oh, my poor, sweet little human...
where are you? Where is Uxie keeping you? And why did she erase your memories in the first place?" Mesprit cries, desperate. She last saw her little human hours ago. She came back the first time specifically for him... only to find that Azelf sent him inside of Uxie.

And thanks to that, now her little one is in the paws of the same yellow headed sister who had erased his memories the last night...

--

"Look!"
"It's our moment!"

--

"Where could they be? We searched the whole Sinnoh!"
"I don't know what to tell you. I mean, we've got no cl-" Azelf abruptly stops in mid sentence as she hears a faint sound that she registered as rustling.

She turned around, noticing, in fact, a few bushes rustling. Then, the noise grows weaker. Whoever is making it is now leaving, she thinks.

Hard reality chooses this moment to strike her.

Whoever is making that noise was listening!

"Azelf? Is everything alright...?" Mesprit asks. The blue titaness pays her no attention as she floats forward, following the noise to find out whoever was listening to the conversation she and Mesprit were having.

Completely ignoring the cries of Mesprit, Azelf disappears into the thick forest.

She keeps 'chasing' the sound of shaking leaves until it comes to an end.

And Azelf herself comes to a halt as she notices to little creatures staring up at her expectantly.

A Lucario and a Vaporeon.

"Hey, were you two listening to our conversation? That's not exactly nice, you know!" she scolds while staring daggers at the two pokemon.

"We weren't listening to your conversation," the Lucario defended.
"We were simply trying to get your attention," the Vaporeon continues.

Azelf's gaze goes from angry to curious as she stares at the small duo.
"Get my attention..?" she parrots back, confused, before giving a small smile, sure to have understood.

"I'll tell you, if you have any problems, ask Uxie. I'm not the guardian of this Lake..." she says in an apologetic tone.

However, the Lucario shook his head, backing Azelf into confusion.
"It's not that," he says.
"But we were hoping that you would have listened to us... unlike your sister, Mesprit," this last remark fully gets the giantess' attention.

"Mesprit didn't listen to you...? Did you want to tell her something?... Because she's kinda... not in the mood right now..." Azelf admits.

"We noticed," the Vaporeon speaks.
"That's why we need to talk to you. We know what Uxie really did..."

Azelf's eyes shut open.
"Co-Come again?!" she stammers, while lowering her head to hear the duo better.

"Yep. What your sister did to that poor human..." in an instant, the two find themselves securely held in the blue mountain's paw, which she brings up to her face.

"Alright, I'm listening."

--

Ah! Ngh... Mhh!" Uxie lets out a last, loud moan as she comes.

"Wond-Wonderful..." the pixie pants as you are ejected from her insides by a white, sticky wave of love juice.
"Eh, just helping..." you mutter a reply.

The pixie smiles, and gets a hold of you.
"That's simply sweet of you," she says while busily wiping you clean from her juices.

"Hey, do you think... do you think you could rub the gem on my forehead again?" she says once she's done.
"Sure thing." you reply. The giantess smiles as she places you on her own forehead.

You slowly reach the point where her red gem rests, in the middle of her yellow forehead. You place your hands on it, starting to rub it like Uxie asked.
"YES!YES!YES!" the giantess shouts loudly as you keep rubbing the lucid surface of the gem, seeing your own reflection in the red.

For a moment, you feel a vague sensation as you stare at your own reflection. Like you had just remembered something... bad for some reason...

You focus really hard, trying to remember what reason could you have to feel like this... but you don't seem to remember anything weird.

Shrugging, you shake the feeling off, and keep rubbing, Uxie moaning even louder.

Only when the giantess notices a few pokemon fleeing from the nearby area, she decides that she's had enough.

Slowly, one of her paws travels to you as she gets a hold of you.
"Eh... Might've crossed the line a little bit..." she says sheepishly, while standing back up.

She pecks your head.
"Thanks!" she says.
"No problem." you reply, smiling.

--

"Say what?!" Azelf cries as the Lucario and the Vaporeon finish their take.

"It's true, we assure you that." Lucario responds.
"And last time we saw Uxie, she was in the middle of... something..." he admits, blushing along the Vaporeon.

Azelf understands what he means, and gently lets the two back down on the ground.
"I see... thank you for telling me the truth..." she mutters, before turning around and disappearing into the forest again.

The giantess doesn't know what to think. Uxie had erased the human's memories and then lied to him, acting like nothing happened! And now, those two told her that she was-

Her thoughts are interrupted as she finds herself in front of a worried-looking Mesprit.
"Azelf, what happened? Why do you look so upset?" the pink headed sister asks with concern.

Right then, a loud cry could be heard:
"YES!" Mesprit curiously rises her head.
"Uxie...?" she mutters. Azelf begin to feel even worse.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Pixie pleasure

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Azelf remains silent. Could she tell Mesprit what she was just told from the Lucario and the Vaporeon?

She decides against it. Her sister wouldn't handle the news too well.

"Azelf?" Mesprit calls again, concerned.

The blue titaness briefly fixes her golden gaze on her. Then, without saying a word, she flies off, in direction of the Lake.
"What is happening...?!" she hears her sister crying again.

Azelf ignores her and keeps hovering towards the Lake.

"Eh, might've crossed the line a little bit..." she registers the voice as Uxie's, most probably talking to the human... to her beloved human!

Frowning, the blue mountain flies past a last set of trees before halting right above Lake Acuity. Over its shore, she notices a familiar giantess holding a an as well familiar little human.

--

Noticing the sudden movement on the opposite side of her Lake, Uxie turns her head to see a frowning giantess that is her own sister.

Uxie smiles.
"Oh... hi, Azelf," she says, gently letting you down on the ground.

The blue titaness glares at her, before looking at you with a much more soft gaze.
"Are you alright...?" she asks you.

You nod your head.
"Yep!" you exclaim.

Uxie frowns.
"That was a totally cheap shot, you know," she says. If she had her eyes opened, she would probably be glaring daggers at her sibling.

You ponder speaking up, before deciding that you'd better shut up and mind your own business. You don't have any say in a matter of family.

Azelf hovers closer to Uxie.
"May be. But you know what? I've heard a few interesting things about you, Uxie," she said accusingly.

Uxie tilts her head.
"But I don't think that this is the best place to talk," Azelf continues, before turning to you, a smile painting itself on her face.

"Will you excuse us for a while, human? We need some privacy..." Azelf says.

Before firmly placing a paw on Uxie's shoulder as the two disappear in a flash of light.

"W-What..." is the only word you manage to say before you feel trees shaking on the opposite side of the Lake. You turn your gaze to see an agitated, pink headed giantess coming out.
"Alright, what is going... on..." Mesprit takes notice that her sisters are nowhere in sight.

She looks around, but she doesn't spot them anywhere.

Instead, her golden gaze fixes on a certain human who is looking at her.

"Uh... Hi Mesprit." she hears his voice calling for her.

The giantess stares at the human for a moment, before flying straight towards him, paws extended, ready to grab him in a hug...

--

You suddenly notice Mesprit flying towards you at blazing speed. And the next moment, you experience what might be compared to being crushed by several boulders as the giantess encloses your tiny body in a loving, heartfelt hug which threatens to squeeze the organs within you and crush each and every one of your poor bones into dust.

Your breath is cut short, and the intense pressure menaces to pop your eyes out of their sockets.

Still, you catch yourself saying:
"I... I missed you tooooo..." you whisper, trying to use the least amount of oxygen possible. The only effect your words have is the giantess' grip growing even tighter.

--

You spend an incalculable amount of time trying to fill up your lungs with oxygen after Mesprit's way-too-affectionate hug ended.

"I'm sorry... Easy there..." the giantess mutters as she stares at you laying down on her cupped paws, struggling to regain your breath. She felt slightly bad - you already had enough problems, and she just almost suffocated you. Although, she thinks, you still don't quite know about your major problem - your memories took away by Uxie.

The golden eyed legendary sighs. Maybe she should just tell you the truth. Would she feel better if her human knew what really happened?

--

"So... what was that about?" you ask once you're breathing properly again.

Mesprit fixed on you a gaze of unlimited sweetness.
"Well... I think that you might as well know it now..." she says with a sigh, trying to take courage.

"Know what...?" you ask, before murmuring flabbergasted:
"Y-You... You aren't waiting for an egg or something, are you?" you ask.

Mesprit blushes furiously.
"What - no! No no no no, not at all!" she exclaims while shaking her now reddened face frenetically, almost throwing you off her paws.

For a moment, you feel incredibly dumb as your open palm makes contact with your face, producing a thud.

Uxie did tell you that humans and pokemon are incompatible, after all. You feel bad for asking such a stupid - but at the same time embarrassing - question.

"...Sorry." you mumble an apology.
"It's alright," Mesprit sighs while trying to gently shake off the blush from her face.

For a moment, both you and the giantess remain completely silent, before you speak up again.
"Ehm... so, what did you want to tell me anyway...?" you ask sheepishly.

Mesprit sighs again.
"Oh right, I forgot. Listen close..." she says dejectedly.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: The moment of truth

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
A bright light suddenly shines out of nowhere. Many pokemon flee upon seeing it. But other opt to remain around instead, knowing that the light is nothing new. It just meant that the guardian was back from wherever she was... in effect, while some pokemon dreaded the moments when the guardian was around, other feared when she wasn't.

Those moments meant that humans could freely come and go, doing what they wished.

"Here we are," Azelf says as she and Uxie materialize to the blue titaness' home, Lake Valor. There, they could talk without being bothered by anybody.

"Leave. All of you." she calmly, but imperatively spoke to the pokemon around the lake, who hurry to get lost as they were instructed by Azelf.

"So, what do you want to talk about, Azelf?" her sister asks.

The blue headed pixie glares at her.
"I think you already know what I wanted to talk about,Uxie." she replies.

She waits for an answer from her sister, but Uxie remains completely quiet, looking at the grass around the Lake. Azelf frowns.
"The human. Why did you delete his memories?" she asks, opting to get straight to the point.

Again, Uxie doesn't reply, and keeps staring at the ground.
"Why, Uxie, why? Did that human hurt you? Insult you?Or is it a more... personal matter?" Azelf asks.

The last remark succeeds in getting Uxie's attention as she rises her head, pointing both her closed eyes on Azelf, while a curious look appears on her face.

"What do you mean?" she asked.
"Did you... have him 'fix' you again? Is it why you wanted him to forget? So me and Mesprit wouldn't have found out?" Azelf asks.

Uxie's heart skips a beat. Inadvertently, her sister spoke the truth, although she couldn't possibly know. Uxie indeed had the human for a second time, but it was after she had deleted his memories. She must be careful with her words.

"None of the reasons you told. The human did nothing wrong to me. And I wasn't 'fixed' again!" she finally answers, blushing as she says - more like shouts - the last sentence.

"Then why?" Azelf presses on.

Again, Uxie remains silent.

Could she tell Azelf about it? Could she tell that the human meant to leave her and her sisters? That he had no apparent reason, that he didn't want to answer?... That he seemed in a hurry to leave the trio?

Only thinking about it, Uxie sighs, her heart aching at the bad memories. The human wanted to leave. She had to make him forget, she hadn't any other choice. And because of that, now Uxie had to pay the price of her actions and face Azelf.

The blue titaness seems to notice her sister's internal conflict, but she decides to not question about it. Maybe Uxie is just sorry about what she did to the human.

"He's done nothing wrong to you, you said. Then why?
Why, sister?" Azelf repeats herself.

Uxie shook her head.
"I... I can't. Y-You would never believe me. You'd think I'm making up excuses. Maybe you would hate me." she replies, suddenly understanding what the human felt like last night, when he refused to tell her the reasons of his wish to leave.

Those reasons were still a mystery to the pixie, and the whole thing was a mystery to her sisters. At least, the part where he wanted to leave.

"We are sisters. I would never hate you. Why would I hate you anyway?" Azelf asks with a much softer voice, repeating almost the same words that Uxie told the human last night, when she was trying to convince him to tell her the truth. Now more than ever, she feels like him.

"Come on, tell me." the last words successfully shatter Uxie's resistance like glass.

"Alright," she says, breathing in deeply.
"Listen up."

--

"I'll start from the beginning of it. Do you agree?" Azelf nods quietly as the two sit down.

Uxie gives another sigh, before commencing her tale:
"It happened last night. I woke up, and I saw the human, awake, walking out of the cave. I called him, asked him where he was going in the middle of the night," she starts.

Azelf nods.
"Go on," she says.

"He replied that he was going for a walk. I didn't believe him. I tried to get answers from him, but he simply didn't want to respond. So I decided to try with a different approach," at this point, Azelf raises an eyebrow.

"I did nothing weird. I just brought him to the Lake.
I tried to get him to talk. I reassured that if he told me, I would have told nobody, that I would have kept the secret. He kept refusing at first, saying that I would have hated him. I told him that I would have never hated him and he finally gave in..." Uxie says with a noticeable hint of sadness in her voice. Azelf notices her sister look away for a moment.

"Did he... did he talk?"

Uxie wipes a few tears from her eyes.
"Yes." she says. A moment of silence follows.
"... And...?" Azelf asks, knowing that this is the moment of truth.

"Azelf. T-The human told me that he... that he wanted to leave." Uxie forces the words out if herself while imagining her sister's reaction.

Which is pretty close to what she imagined: Azelf's eyes widen, her mouth opens and her whole being ceases moving as the words leave Uxie's mouth.

Several moments pass before the revelation fully sinks in the blue mountain that guards this Lake.
"What?" she then manages to ask.
"The human wanted to...?"

"Yes. I begged and pleaded him to tell me why he wanted to do so. But he refused, he told me that he simply had to leave," Uxie takes a deep breath.
"... And I... I took his memories away. What else should have I done? That human is the best thing that ever happened to me... to us!" she exclaims.

Azelf blushes.
"Er-"
"Do not even deny it. You still smell of sex." Uxie bluntly says, interrupting her.

Azelf blushes even more, but she shakes her head.
"I can't believe this Uxie. The human didn't want to leave, did he? You're lying!" she exclaims, pointing an accusatory finger.

Uxie sighs dejectedly.
"Just as I told. You don't believe me," she mutters.
"But you'd better believe it. I can't give anymore explanations, because that's all I know. And it's true, like it or not." Uxie says, before looking at her sister, waiting for her reaction.

Azelf sits there, silent, for an eternal moment, pondering how to react. Uxie seemed sincere, but could she trust her? She's her sister, she would never lie to her. Right?

...Right?

Azelf shakes her head frenetically. Her whole being is trying to believe what Uxie told her, but a voice in the back of her mind tells her that her sisters is very probably lying.

Why the human would have wanted to leave after all? He had no reason, and Uxie masked that by telling that he didn't want to talk.

Of course, that was a possibility. Like it was what Uxie said.

How to know which one was the truth?

Letting out a frustrated cry, the blue giantess looks at Uxie again, trying to choose what to do...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: A matter of family

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"Uxie... I-I..." Azelf stammers.
"I-I... I believe you..." she then admits.

Uxie's expression doesn't change.
"That's good. But the problem remains: what reason did he have to leave?" her problem quenched again, Uxie can focus on her primary objective again.

"I sure don't know," Azelf says, before a thought finds its way inside her mind.
"Hey, you know what? Your description of what happened matches the one I was told earlier..." she says, rubbing her head thoughtfully.

Uxie looks at her.
"You were told...?" she asks.
"Yes." Azelf replies, recalling the moment when the Lucario and the Vaporeon spoke to her.
"I was talking to Mesprit when I heard bushes rustling. I thought someone was overhearing, so I chased them. I ran into these two..." she explains.

"‘These two’ who?" Uxie asks, getting more curious as her sister speaks.
"Oh, a Lucario and a Vaporeon. They told me that they wanted to talk to me. At first, I thought they had some problem, and I told them to ask you. But they said that they knew what you did to the human. They told me that they casually saw you making him forget the reason of his leaving..."

Uxie mentally face palms.
"Casually, Azelf?" she asks with irony. Which her sister doesn't seem to detect.
"Yes, they told-" she suddenly realizes.
"...That wasn't true, was it?" she asks.

Uxie smiles a little.
"I'm afraid not. I think that those two actually saw that on purpose, whoever they are," she reasons.
"You mean... they were spying on you...?" Azelf asks with disbelief.

"Not me. I instead think that they were keeping an eye out for the human for some reason." Uxie responds, before placing a paw over her mouth as she ponders. Thanks to Azelf, she had new information, and the whole thing became brighter. Although by just a little.

The being of knowledge digs in her own memories, imagining herself and the little human talking, while two unknown pokemon were hidden somewhere nearby. They saw what she did...

A new idea springs up in Uxie's expert mind. What if those two were the cause of the human's sudden decision to leave? They must have seen him with Azelf, Mesprit and Uxie herself. They must have thought that he was a threat for the guardians.

Then, they told waited for the night to fall and they woke him, telling him to leave Lake Acuity.

The thing worked, it made sense.

"They saw us and the human together. They thought he was a threat to us, they convinced him to leave..." Uxie thinks aloud, gaining Azelf's attention.

"Do you think so?" she asks, worried. Did those two really menace the human? Or did they lie to him and convinced him to leave?

Azelf shakes her head. There was only one way to find out, and that was finding those two pokemon first.
"Let's go back to Lake Acuity. We need to find them." she said.
"Also, we need to watch out for Mesprit."

Uxie nodded as the two started flying, leaving Lake Valor behind as they headed to Lake Acuity.

--

The activity around Lake Acuity was pretty calm today.

That is Uxie's first thought as she and Azelf hover in the forest, the tall trees concealing their presence.

The yellow headed guardian feels Azelf tapping her shoulder. Uxie looks at her, discovering her pointing at something big and pink just out of the forest.

Uxie nervously nods, recognizing her second sister's head. She distinctly hears Mesprit talk:
"That's what happened..." that phrase meant two things.

One, the human is with her. Two, she just told him the reason of the agitation of the morning. Uxie and Azelf have to avoid her. At least, until they figure out what really happened.

So, the two start floating deeper into the forest, searching for two particular pokemon...

--

For the next two hours, the two legendary sisters aimlessly fly through the woods around the Lake, avoiding the area where Mesprit is.

They have to constantly watch out; if their sister moves, she would find them. And let Uxie have a piece of her mind. Something that the pixie didn't want to experience.

The quest doesn't have too much success, though, as they don't even find the shadow of a Lucario or a Vapo-

"Why didn't I think about this before? Vaporeon spend most of their time in water!" Uxie silently exclaims.

Azelf spends a moment realizing:
"The Lake!" she exclaims, before remembering that Mesprit is currently sitting right in front of it.
"How do we-" Uxie's spirit leaves her body and hovers in direction of the Lake, leaving her body - and her sister - behind.
"... Right."

--

Uxie's spirit slips into the water unseen. She starts floating around as she searches for any quadruped, long-tailed blue pokemon she could find.

... Too bad she doesn't find any.

Water types pay no attention to the shadow of Uxie as they swim past her, but not even one Vaporeon was among them.

The guardian searches for a while, before giving up. Her spirit floats out of the water, completely unaware that she was being watched.

--

Their bodies made of water, Vaporeon have the useful ability to disappear from eyesight when in contact with water.

That allowed one in particular to watch Uxie's spirit before she gave up.

It didn't take long for her to decide that the pixie was searching for her!

"We need to be careful..."

--

"So? Found anything?" Azelf asks as Uxie regains consciousness.
"Absolutely nothing," she mutters dejectedly.
"You?"

Azelf shakes her head.
"I found no Lucario," she says.


Uxie sighs loudly, a clear sign of annoyance.
"Okay, you know what? I've got a plan." Uxie says. Azelf eyes her with curiosity.
"What plan?" she asks.

"Let's wait until tonight. When the night falls, we'll stick around and see what happens. What happened last night could happen again, and in that case, we'll finally find out why the human wanted to leave." the yellow headed pixie explains.

"Do you think it'll work?"
"If they were the cause, perhaps they'll try to talk to the human again. And we'll be waiting for them. I really want to have a word with those two..." Uxie says.

Azelf nods.
"Alright. But I suggest that we don't let Mesprit know anything about this yet. She's still clueless... and angry... Let her stay with the human for a while, she'll eventually calm down." she suggests.
"Deal."
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: A new piece of the puzzle

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Your eyes open up a little bit. You find yourself staring at something big and pink, although the figure is very blurred because of your drowsiness.

Suddenly, the figure talks:
"You're awake? Rise and shine, human!" it says cheerily, while revealing you who just talked.

Your rub your eyes a bit and look up again, discovering the pink headed giantess who goes by the name of Mesprit staring down at you with a sweet smile. You also take notice that she's currently holding you with both paws.

"Hi Mesprit..." you mumble, before giving a yawn.

"Hehe, we really went overboard, didn't we?" she giggles.
"In effect, doing it even in your sleep was a bit exaggerated..." you drowsily reply.

The giantess flushes red.

Then, Mesprit gets up and hovers out of the cave. A nice breeze blows past you as you are carried out by the giantess. You notice the sun descended over the horizon, crafting an orange shade on the Lake.

"Where are we going?" you question.
"Simply taking a look around. To check if my sisters came back while we were asleep..." your attention is drawn at the word ‘sisters’.

"Mesprit, can we talk, like now?" you ask seriously.
"About?" she asks back, before remembering the events of the day.
"Oh..." she mutters.

"Yes. Any clue of why Uxie did something like that to me?" you ask. Mesprit shakes her head.
"Not a clue. I was there the whole time, I can assure you didn't say or do anything wrong. Not to her. Not to her Lake. Not to me or Azelf." she replies.

"Alright. Then why did she?" you question again.
"I do have a theory..." Mesprit mumbles.
"And that is...?"

Mesprit opens her mouth, only to close it back up the next instant.

Could she tell you about her idea? She isn't completely sure that her sister really had you over and over, only to make you forget right after.

What if she's mistaking? Not only it is something horrible to think of her own sister, but if that turns out to be incorrect?

"For-Forget it." she says, deciding to not share her theory. She doesn't want to risk and put the wrong idea of Uxie in your head.

"... Okay?" you reply. But you find that Mesprit isn't looking at you. Actually, her eyes are fixed on a common bush.

What is happening to her...?

Mesprit focuses. She's sure she felt a presence around. A strong presence. And she's sure of who that is.

‘Uxie.’ she telepathically says. Her call is greeted by telepathic silence.

Then...

‘Mesprit.’ her sister replies.

--

Uxie and Azelf, hidden deep into the thick vegetation of the forest, patiently wait for the night to fall. They cannot risk the two pokemon they're searching for be alarmed by the two giantesses floating around the Lake in an agitated manner.

So they sit quietly, careful to keep themselves out of Mesprit's eyesight.

"I'm bored." Azelf complains with a sigh.
"Why am I here anyway? I've got a lake to guard," Uxie frowns

"Because I need your help. And because you want to be here, don't you?" she says. The image of the human briefly travels across Azelf's mind.

The blue pixie smiles.
"You are right," she replies.
"Like always." Uxie smiles triumphantly, before frowning again. She needs to find out why the human wanted to leave. That, or she's going to hate herself.

Lost in her thoughts, Uxie's psychic powers get loosened a bit, but enough for a voice to penetrate her mind.

’Uxie.’ Mesprit's voice echoes in her head.

Uxie rises her head, fixing her closed eyes on Azelf, who shoots her an inquisitive gaze. The yellow headed guardian sighs, before telepathically replying:
‘Mesprit.’

--

You look up at Mesprit, finding her frowning.
"Mesprit, are you feeling alright?" you ask.

Again, she totally ignores you. For what reason, you would never find out.

‘Uxie, where are you? I think we need to talk...’ she says, trying to not sound too angry like she is in reality. There'll be time to be angry when she finds Uxie, she decides.

‘Agreed. But come alone. The human doesn't need to see this.’ Uxie states, before cutting the psychic link off.

Mesprit nods to nobody in particular, before turning her gigantic head back to you, discovering you staring up at her with concern.

"Mesprit... what happened to you?" you ask her. The giantess gives no response, but she gently lets you down on the ground, before finally deciding to reply.
"I'm sorry but... could you give me some time? I need to check something..." she says.

Before you can even answer, the giantess had already disappeared into a random direction, leaving you alone.

--

"What do you mean, ‘She is coming’?" Azelf asks.
"We need to settle this. Plus, Mesprit will help us too if she knows why I had to... you know it." Uxie replies. She didn't like talking about what she did to the human. It makes her feel comprehensibly guilty.

Before Azelf can say anything else, an agitated pink and blue titaness shows up, glaring daggers at Uxie.
"You-"
"Calm down already and listen to me!" Uxie says in an unusual stern manner.

Even if surprised by her sister's change of attitude, Mesprit still has no intention of calming down.
"Why should I listen to you?" she asks coldly.

In that moment, Azelf decided to speak up:
"Because we know what happened!" she exclaims. Mesprit just seems to notice her second sister.
"I do as well! Uxie-"
"Erased the human's memories because he wanted to leave!"

Mesprit flinches.
"... Come again?"

"Let's not shout, shall we? You never know who could be listening." Uxie declares.

--

By the time the story ended, the day has ended as we, the sun replaced by the moon.

"I don't believe any of it." Mesprit firmly declares.
"You just made this up, didn't you? Congratulations, the story was pretty convincing, I must admit," she says sarcastically.

"I hope so, since it was the truth." Uxie calmly states.
"Yeah, right! The human wanted to-"
"Check my emotions if you don't believe me!" Uxie interrupts.

Mesprit bites her lower lip, but does as her sister told.

Concern.

Sorrow.

Irritation.

"You are sorry..." Mesprit mumbles.
"Yes. What I did was wrong, I admit it. But I had no other choice. Otherwise, the human would have left m- us. But now we know something more about this." Uxie replies.

Mesprit looks at her sisters with curiosity.
"Yep. Apparently, some pokemon made him want to leave..." Azelf speaks up.
"Some pokemon...?" Mesprit parrots back.

Uxie leans forward, whispering something inaudible to Azelf. Or anyone who might be listening.

"What..." Mesprit suddenly remembers something.
"Hey, now that I think about it, those two tried talking to me..." she says.

"We believe that they might be the cause of everything..." Azelf explains.

"How can you tell?"
"Think, Mesprit. When was the last time humans came to this Lake?" Uxie says.

Mesprit ponders for a moment.
"When we were..." realization hits the pink headed guardian.
"They thought he is a threat!" she suddenly exclaims.

"Precisely." Azelf says. Mesprit's face twists with anger.
"If I ever lay my paws on-"
"No. If our plan works, I'll be talking. This is my Lake after all." Uxie solemnly says.

"What plan?"

--

"Understood?"
"Yes. We wait for the night." Mesprit says.
"And if they show up again, we'll have our answers." Azelf finishes.

"Okay. Now go back to the human."

Mesprit nods.
"Uxie?" the pixie blushes.
"I'm sorry..." Uxie smiles as Mesprit disappears into the forest again.

--

"So... what took you so long?" you ask while chewing one last berry. Since Mesprit came back, she didn't give you an explanation of why she suddenly left.

Mesprit shrugs while a few Magikarp disappear into her mouth. Something you don't totally approve but, after all, she's a pokemon.

She swallows, before turning to you.
"Trust me, it was nothing important. Now-" she exaggeratedly yawns.
"Let's call it a day, alright?" she gently picks you up.

"But... Azelf and Uxie?" you question.
"They're fine." Mesprit says as she carries you off into the forest.

--

Once their sister and the human disappear into the cavern, Uxie and Azelf come out of their hiding spot, and hide in the area behind the cave, waiting.

Time passes, but no one shows up. A few hours pass, and no pokemon comes out, especially not any Lucario or Vaporeon.

Azelf and Uxie keep themselves from yawning as they wait for anything to happen...

They decide to not risk and wait for a better time
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Several more hours pass as the night quietly goes on. The only sounds that break the silence are the wind, which blows past the leaves, making them rustle, and the occasional cries of the nocturnal inhabitants of Lake Acuity, who most probably left their lairs in search of food.

But two particular giantesses are no nocturnal pokemon at all.

Hidden behind the cavern where their sister and the human currently sleep, Uxie and Azelf fight against drowsiness to stay awake. They mustn't fall asleep. Not before finding out the truth they've been chasing for the whole day long.

They're close, they can't sleep right now. The only thing they need to do is spot two pokemon in particular and demand answers.

However, those two pokemon they're waiting for don't show up.

Some more time passes. Azelf gives a deep yawn.
"I'm sleepy..." she mutters while rubbing her eyes, trying to physically wipe the sleepiness out of them. Even the most skilled psychic type couldn't erase sleep from their minds, and Uxie and Azelf are no different.

"Focus, Azelf. You mustn't fall asleep." Uxie says, before yawning herself.
"We mustn't fall asleep." she adds.

However, her words are greeted by an unknown sound that echoes in the darkness of the forest.

Uxie turns her head, fixing her closed eyes on Azelf, discovering her laying down.
"Azelf...?" Uxie calls out, only to receive the same answer of before: snoring.

Uxie's open hand meets her face.
"Wanna do something? Do it yourself!" she exclaims as she realizes that her sister fell asleep, paws wrapped around a few trees as she sleeps. Almost like a human with those things they called pillows.

Humans... human.

The human.

Uxie remembers why she's doing this. Was the human... her human really threatened? Did those two pokemon, Lucario and Vaporeon, menace him? Forced him to leave?

"I must do this. That human is the sweetest thing I ever met. I need to repay his kindness, and will do so!" Uxie silently exclaims.

The human really was the sweetest, and kindest little thing she ever met. True, she had saved him from a blizzard storm, but he did repay her by helping her around Lake Acuity, by taking care of her home alongside the giantess herself.

Not only that, though. He warned her about those perverted pokemon who snuck their way inside her body while she couldn't even feel them. He was the cause if they got out of her.

He even agreed to quench her heat! Not once, but twice! The human is the only one Uxie herself ever called... a mate. A true mate... who she has to share with her sisters. Obviously, she and her sisters share one common feeling for the same creature.

Love.

Uxie blushes. She fell for him too...? All three legendary sisters, all three Lake Guardians are in love with a human?

"I wonder how this is going to end..." Uxie mutters to the, before focusing on her task once again.

But, soon, she discovers that her drowsiness is winning the consciousness. The giantess yawns loudly, while mentally struggling to remain awake.
"Must... not... sleep..." she says, while giving another yawn.

Then another.

And then, the ground quakes as the yellow and blue titaness falls down, asleep before even hitting the ground. Uxie's remaining consciousness is claimed by the soft, warm embrace of sleep as her mind drifts off to dreamland.

--

Just as Uxie falls asleep too, it begins to dawn, sun's first rays shining through the leaves of the trees, bits of light starting to enlighten the morning sky.

Then, a bush suddenly starts to shake as two pokemon come out of it.

"Looks like they're both asleep..." Lucario says, crossing his arms as he peers in direction of the cavern, discovering something pointy and blue poking from one side, while something round and yellow slightly visible from the other.

"Told you that we had to be careful," Vaporeon says, coming out from the bush as well, giving a small yawn.
"So, what now?" she then asks as she takes place beside Lucario.
"Should we enter and try to warn the human again?"

Lucario looks at her, his crimson eyes locking on her as he chokes back a laugh.
"Are you kidding? It's morning now. Azelf and Uxie may have fell asleep, but Mesprit could wake up at any moment.
We can't risk. They already discovered us. But since we didn't show up this night, maybe they'll believe we gave up." he says.
"I say, why don't we try tonight instead?" he suggests.

Vaporeon shakes her head.
"Lucario, you said it yourself. They're going to keep a close eye on the human. And he's already been with all the legendaries... and more than just once. We need to warn that poor guy..." she retorts, countering Lucario's logic.

"You have a point there." the jackal admits as he and Vaporeon start wandering around, unsure about their next move.
