"What should we do? Either we do it now, or we wait for a better moment..." the black and blue pokemon says, rubbing his head, pondering their next move.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Into the light

choices: They manage to slip away unnoticed
"WHERE do you think you are going?" Mesprit suddenly calls from behind them
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"Lucario, there won't be a better time to do it. The legendaries are asleep. We don't know for how long they'll be, so we should just go in there, grab the human and go before they wake up." Vaporeon says.

Lucario grumbles in response.
"You make it sound easy." he replies as he glances at the two legendaries sleeping outside of the cave.

True, Vaporeon had a point, what she just said made sense. However, Lucario is pretty reluctant to take this risk. If Mesprit wakes up and sees the two of them, she'll probably wake her sisters up as well. A giantess isn't exactly too silent, after all.

However, it is also true that the three sisters are most likely going to keep their eyes out for the human. And Lucario himself, Vaporeon and every inhabitant of Lake Acuity could not risk him be with the sisters again. It already happened too many times in two days, no telling when the three legendary giantesses will be consumed by their own lust and go on a rampage around Lake Acuity again.

Lucario shakes his head, as if trying to shake off bad memories.
"You are right," he says in the end.
"We mustn't risk the tragedy repeating itself again. That human must be warned as soon as possible." he lets out a low growl.
"And it means now." Vaporeon smiles.
"Glad you are reasoning," she says, starting to walk towards the entrance of the gigantic cave, which can easily hold all three Lake Guardians inside.

Vaporeon briefly stops, noticing that Lucario isn't following.
"Are you coming?" she asks. Lucario shakes his head once more, before nodding.
"Lead the way." he says, hurrying to follow his quadruped companion within the dark depths of the cavern where Mesprit and the human are currently resting.

--

The first look Lucario and Vaporeon take of their surroundings reveals them a dark, immense place, which could hold more than just a giant - which it actually does.

As they walk deeper inside, the sound of snoring gets more clear to the ears of the two pokemon and, soon, they manage to make out the silhouette of a blue and pink titaness they recognize as Mesprit.

The lone giantess is currently laying on the ground, snoring as she sleeps. Her dreams mustn't be very sweet, Lucario judges by the troubled expression present on her gigantic face.

Lowering their gazes, both the bipedal steel type and the quadruped water type notice the giantess' arms wrapped around something on her chest.

Well, more specifically, they're wrapped around someone.

The human quietly rests, lost in the furry landscape of Mesprit's chest, held in place by both her paws.

"Uhm... maybe there is something between them..." Vaporeon says.
"Yeah, lust. He gives them what they demand for, they cuddle up to him in exchange." Lucario bluntly states.

Vaporeon shakes her head as the two get closer to the gigantic body of Mesprit. The giantess sleeps on her side, so they have to figure out how to reach the human. Then how to pluck him from Mesprit's grasp and get away unnoticed.

As if fate itself decided to lend a hand, Mesprit suddenly rolls on her back as she sleeps.

Vaporeon briefly looks at the scene, before looking at Lucario and nodding her head. The jackal nods as well as he takes place beside the giantess.

Then, showing incredible ability, he leaps onto the land of blue fur that is the pink headed giantess' side. His hands grappling her fur and his legs swiftly leaping up, the black and blue pokemon climbs the giantess' body and finds himself on her belly.

If by any chance Mesprit wakes up now, he's gonna be in trouble - like he already was, after all. Luckily, the giantess felt nothing, and keeps on sleeping.

So, Lucario slowly starts walking towards her chest where her paws - and the human - rest.

A sudden movement of the giantess' stomach makes him trip and fall face down. The fur softens his fall but, still, he rises his head to check if Mesprit woke up from her slumber.

The giantess moans softly, but her eyes remain sealed. Lucario breaths in relief as he makes his way to her arms, soon finding himself close to the human.

Now there is only one more obstacle: pulling him out of Mesprit's grasp without her feeling anything.

Slowly, the jackal grasps the human's ankles, which are left out of the titaness' hug, and starts pulling slowly, gently sliding you out of Mesprit's embrace.

Lucario stops for a moment as he plucks you from Mesprit and waits; for a few moments, the giantess' arms flail around, searching the human's body, attempting to get a hold of him again.

Lucario dodges one of them as they fall back onto the human, pulling him up as Mesprit readjusts him on his original position on her chest. The giantess smiles in her sleep as she cuddles the human to herself once again, pushing him into her fur.

Lucario growls, and walks up to you again, getting a hold of you as he starts pulling again. This time, Mesprit's body reacts in her sleep, and tightens her grip on your own body.

As a result, Lucario lets go and falls again. Growling, he gets back up, grabbing you by your ankles again and pulling with all his might in order to free your body from Mesprit's strong grip; only after a while does he succeed to pull you out again. Weirdly enough, Mesprit's paws don't react this time like they did earlier as the jackal carries you on the wider surface of her belly.

Lucario pays it no mind. Sighing in relief once again, the black and blue pokemon gets a hold of you and lifts your body over his head as he carries you on his shoulder, over the edge of Mesprit's body. He looks down, finding Vaporeon staring up at him with concern.

Carefully, the jackal slides down onto the solid ground again. You don't feel any of it as you keep sleeping soundly. Vaporeon, who was watching every movement of her companion, rushes to him, silently cheering with a big smile.

Lucario smirks, before motioning for her to follow him put of the cave with a nod of his head.

Then, silently, the two pokemon start walking towards the exit of the cave...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Into the lion's den

choices: Lucario reveals the truth to Mesprit...
He decides against it and makes up an excuse
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"Excuse me," a somewhat familiar voice calls from behind Lucario and Vaporeon.

Both pokemon turn around to face a fully awake Mesprit, staring daggers at them.
"WHERE do you think you are going?" she spits venomously.

Before the duo can react, a giant hand darts towards them, closing them - and you - in her fist, which she successively brings up to her pink face.
"I have a feeling that it's going to be interesting to hear what do you have to say," she speaks.
"Why don't you get-"

"Uurgh... Cut it out, will you?" you mutter in your sleep, before resuming your snoring. For a moment, Mesprit's rage is put aside as the giantess looks at you.

Then, without saying a word, she moves forward, in direction of the entrance of the cavern. In the meantime, she makes sure to separate you from Lucario and Vaporeon, who don't speak a word.

--

Mesprit flies out of the cave, holding a sleeping you in a paw, while Lucario and Vaporeon are held in the other. The giantess discovers her sisters sleeping at the sides of the cavern.

"You almost did it..." she mumbles, before hovering over Azelf, starting to shake her gently.

Azelf moans, before yawning and opening one golden eye, which she fixes on Mesprit. Before she can proclaim her annoyance, though, Mesprit holds you in front of her sister, saying four simple words:
"Take care of him." Azelf's other eye opens up as well.

She looks at you, then at Mesprit, not taking notice, though, of the two captives held in Mesprit's other paw.
"Alright?" Azelf mutters, moving her own paw as Mesprit hands you to her, before flying off into some random direction.

Azelf stares at the spot where she was a few moments ago, before shifting her attention on you, who keep on sleeping, unaware of the shift of location that just occurred. Azelf stares at you for a few moments, before remembering that the human she's holding onto is the same one she loves.

The titaness shrugs, deciding to not question what just happened.

Azelf leans forward, pressing her lips on your forehead. Then, she pulls you in an embrace as she lays back down, closing both her eyes again.
"Sleep tight I guess..." mutters the blue titaness as she falls asleep again.

--

"You wanted to talk to me, right?" Mesprit asks while glaring at the two pokemon held in her fist when she feels she's got far enough.

Now that there's no risk of waking her precious little human up, she can let her rage flow uninterrupted.
"Here's your chance: talk!" she orders, her head darting forward in a menacing manner, her golden eyes piercing both normal sized pokemon's souls.

The duo remain silent. A quick check of their emotions reveals the reason to Mesprit: they're paralyzed with terror.

"The human. What did you do to him? Why he suddenly wished to leave? You know what consequence this had, don't you?" the pink headed legendary presses on.

The question brought a drastic change of expression on Lucario's face, which shifts from a scared to a neutral one.
"We did nothing to the human." he speaks.

"No? Then, why did he suddenly want to leave me and my sisters? You two, you threatened him, didn't you? Told him to get lost, am I right?!" Mesprit shouts, some flying-types fleeing from the nearby tress.

" Absolutely not!" Vaporeon speaks up.
"Absolutely yes!"
"Listen! We didn't threaten him!" Lucario shouts.


Mesprit looks at him, feeling rage emanating from him.
"Then why? I know for sure that you've been watching my sister erasing his memories on purpose. You were the ones that made him want to leave, weren't you? What did you do?" she inquires, trying to repress her anger.

At this point, Vaporeon looks at Lucario, trying to warn him, but she finds him speaking already:
"Yes! He wanted to leave because of us!" he exclaims. And then immediately regrets doing so.

Mesprit's fist tightens around him and Vaporeon.
"I'll ask nicely. What. Did. You. Do?" she demands.
"Nothing bad. We had a talk, that's all!" Lucario defends.

"About what? How dangerous he is to me and my sisters?" Mesprit breaths, before giving a sigh.
"Don't you understand? That human is no threat! He's with me for a reason!... he is my mate!" Mesprit exclaims.

Already knowing this particular, Lucario and Vaporeon stay still.
"Maybe you don't understand me," the guardian continues, pointing to Lucario.
"But you do, right? You can understand why I need him so much?" she says to Vaporeon.

"I do," the water type says, nodding her head.
"Then, why did you want him to leave? You knew his importance to me... to us sisters, didn't you?"

"We had our reason. And a pretty good one, too." Lucario says.

Mesprit's gaze shifts on him, an exasperated expression painting itself on her face.
"And that reason. What is it?" she asks, feeling her rage returning.

Lucario opens his mouth to reply...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: A giant problem

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Mesprit watches as Lucario's lips part as he talks:
"You're sure... you want to know?" he asks softly.
"You've come this far, so why not finish it?" Mesprit asks, trying to keep calm.

Lucario glances at Vaporeon, both start arguing before the eyes of the giantess, who watches them with confusion, not quite understanding what their words mean...

--

"You told it yourself! We don't want to break their hearts!" Vaporeon speaks.
"What other choice do we have? We knew all along we had to tell them someday, didn't we?" Lucario retorts.
"Yeah, but..." Vaporeon says, her ears drooping with sudden sadness.

However, Mesprit interrupts the short argument.
"‘Break their hearts’... are you referring to me and my sisters?" she asks with curiosity.

Lucario turns his head, his crimson eyes locking with her golden ones. The jackal nods in confirm.

"Break our hearts... what's that supposed to mean?" she asks again.

In response, Lucario's gaze becomes a much softer one.
"I will warn you. You won't like the ugly truth, maybe you won't handle it. Perhaps you won't even believe us," he says, his voice dropping its characteristic growly tone to assume a concerned one.
"So, I'll ask: do you wish us to continue?"

Mesprit repeatedly nods her head.
"Yes. You will tell me everything you need to say, and I'll judge if you are speaking the truth. So, no more questions:
just speak." the impatient giantess says.


Lucario glances at Vaporeon one last time, before looking back at the titaness, nodding.
"As you wish." he says.

--

You wake up, and give a deep yawn as your eyes open up, revealing your eyes to the world. The first look you take is of a blue, furry surface.
‘Mesprit.’ your mind says. You also take notice of something pushing on your back, keeping you still. Assuming that it's just Mesprit's paws, you wiggle your way out of the grasp and stand up, finding yourself on a belly. Though not Mesprit's.

In distance, you see the blue face of a certain snoring giantess you recognize as Azelf.

Weird.

You recall going to sleep with Mesprit, and Azelf was Arceus-knows-where with Uxie.

Slowly, you walk over the edge of the titaness' stomach and slide down her body. Just when your feet touch the snowy ground, you dare to ask:
"What happened?" you mutter to yourself as you take a small walk around, noticing the yellow head of Uxie peeking out from behind the cave.

"Uxie too...?" you mutter, before recalling what Mesprit had told to you yesterday. About what the pixie did to you. You stand there for a few moments, confused.

What should you do? Should you wake up the guardian, confront her yourself? Or wait for her to wake you up all by herself?

Either way, you have a feeling that she could repeat what she did before, erase your memories again if you decide to confront her too soon.

Maybe-

A loud scream echoes, interrupting your thoughts and drawing your attention behind you.

"WHAAAT?!" you stand still for a couple minutes.

...

Mesprit...?

--

"What are you saying?!" Mesprit shouts, unable to believe what she just heard.
"Told you you wouldn't have liked the truth..." Lucario mutters under his breath, before gazing up at the giantess again.

"This is all I've... we've got to say Mesprit. And it's all true, like it or-" Mesprit watches as the Vaporeon squirms out of her grip, leaps up and slaps the Lucario across the face with her tail, before landing back on her closed fist.

"Listen, we know that you can't believe us," she speaks as the Lucario rubs his left cheek, while protesting.

Obviously, Mesprit registers these as secondary facts as she focuses on Vaporeon, who continues.
"But, I can assure. Everything Lucario told, all of it... it really happened. We... we didn't want to tell it. We told you, we didn't want to break your heart..." the water type mutters in a convincingly dejected voice.

Mesprit stares at the duo in silence for a few minutes, before placing them down. Then, both her paws travel to her head as she covers her eyes and starts floating away at blazing speed.

Vaporeon looks up at Lucario, who keeps rubbing his cheek.
"Told you that would have happened..." she says.

Lucario glares at her.
"Yes. And I told you to stop hitting me." he hisses, receiving a smug smile in response.

--

Mesprit flies out of the forest and finds herself in front of the cave where she spent the night with her little one.

Speaking of which, her little one is there, wandering around while her sisters keep on sleeping.

You rise your gaze, noticing a pink giantess staring at you from distance. You smile at her.
"Hi Mesprit! Good morning! Slept-" you are cut short as the giantess flies to you, scoops you up and hugs you to her face.

Unaware of the true reason of this sudden display of affection, you just assume that she's feeling particularly loving this morning. Something you decide to return with a simple gesture. You briefly press your lips on her cheek.

Unknown to you, this started something in Mesprit. The giantess pulls off, briefly looking at you, dumbfounded, before shoving you into her lips, returning your kiss... only several times more.

While she showers your face with kisses, the giantess feels it.

Her heat.

She can feel her body - especially her nether regions - burning, crafting a displeasing sensation within her.

Well, no problem, she's holding the 'cure' right in her paws...

Mesprit suddenly remembers what the Lucario and the Vaporeon had told her. What they meant to achieve, and why.

Her eyes shut open as she realizes that she couldn't have you, her sweet little one again. She has to deal with her heat all by herself... how could she do it?!

Mesprit grits her teeth in pain. She has to! For the sake of the Lakes! For the sake of her human!

The giantess' gaze travels down on you, lust making her eyes sparkle.
"Mesprit... are you... feeling alright?" you ask, concerned for the giantess' flustered behavior.

The guardian doesn't reply, too busy fighting her heat. But it all ends as...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: The missing piece

choices: ‘The human is in danger...’ Mesprit says, telling the truth
‘I... nothing...’ Mesprit says, deciding to say nothing
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Mesprit keeps grunting to herself for a good while.
‘Must. Control. It!... Must. Control. Myself!’ she mentally says, before giving a loud shout:
"NO!" the scream almost breaks your eardrums as you are near to her mouth.

Instinctively, you look in her sisters' direction as you check if that scream has woken them up. Luckily, it did not; aside from a light change of position, Azelf doesn't give any signs of having woken up, while Uxie keeps on sleeping soundly.

Your gaze travels back to the source of that loud cry.

The giantess has seemingly calmed down, staring intently at the ground, a distressed look painted on her face.
"No..." the giantess repeats, this time in a mere whisper.

"Mesprit?" you call, concerned.

The pink headed giantess shakes her head back and forth, before looking at you.
"What?"

"Ehm..."
"Oh... don't worry, I'm fine!" she lies, smiling to you.

The skeptical look on your face tells her that you didn't buy it at all.
"No, Mesprit, you are not." you make your doubts clear to her.
"What's going on with you?" you then ask.

Your gaze locks with Mesprit's as you two stare at eachother for a few moments, before the giantess closes her eyes, letting a deep sigh escaping her mouth.
"You already know what it is, don't you?" she asks.

It takes you a second to realize what she's talking about.
"Your heat." you bluntly reply. Mesprit nods.
"Do we...?" you ask.

Mesprit shakes her head.
"Not today, sweetie. But... thanks for the support." she says with a sweet smile.
"But you it'll hurt you!"
"I'll be fine." Mesprit replies.

The giantess spends the next couple of minutes staring down at you with a sweet smile, while you stare back at her with a concerned stare.

"Come... Come on, let's go for a walk," the titaness says.
"Uh, okay?" you reply as the giantess hovers up.
"Where are we heading?"

Mesprit smiles.
"Well, I did promise, didn't I?"

--

Azelf keeps sleeping for a good while after her her sister's leaving.

She was having great dreams, the human somehow influenced her sleep!

Those dreams, though, soon come to an end as the sounds of the forest, of the morning pokemon starting to come out soon wake her up.

She desperately tries to cling to the last remains of a fading dream, but it's for naught. Muttering some incomprehensible words of annoyance, the giantess opens her golden eyes, before giving a yawn.

Then, she remembers about what had happened earlier. An agitated Mesprit gave the human to her, muttering ‘Take care of him’. The blue mountain lazily looks down to her arms, which are wrapped around... nothing. The human is missing!

"Where-" Azelf confusedly says, before remembering the events of yesterday. The human... was he kidnapped by the Lucario and the Vaporeon?!

Fully awakened, Azelf floats to Uxie, starting to shake her.
"Uxie! Wake up! Uxie!" she exclaims.

The pixie's eyes remain sealed, but her mouth opens to let a growly cry out:
"What?" Uxie says, clearly bothered from being woken so rudely.

Seeing her sister awake, Azelf pulls off.
"It's the human! He's missing!" she says.
"Azelf, he's probably with Mesprit..." Uxie says with a yawn as she slowly gets up

"Mesprit gave him to me earlier!" Uxie frowns.

She silently hovers inside of the cave, only to come out of it a few minutes later.
"Actually, Mesprit is missing too..." she mutters.
"She must have brought the human somewhere."

Azelf internally sighs in relief.
"You mean... he wasn't kidnapped while I was sleeping?"
"Don't think so, there was an high risk of being discovered... however..." Uxie focuses.

‘Mesprit... is the human with you?’ Uxie telepathically calls her sister.

The answer doesn't take long:
‘Yes.’ Mesprit replies, before speaking up:
‘Uxie, you, me and Azelf need to talk. Alone.’
‘Why? What happened?"

‘Remember the Lucario and the Vaporeon you talked about? You were right, they came.’ Mesprit says with a hint of... sadness?
‘And...? What happened?’

"We'll talk later.’ with that, the link is interrupted by Mesprit.

Uxie returns to reality to see a worried-looking Azelf staring at her.
"He is with her. And she found out something, sister." Uxie says.

--

"... Lake Verity?" you assume. In response, the giantess behind you gives a nod.
"I promised that you could have explored around. So, you get to take a look around, and I can check on my home." Mesprit says as she hovers above the Lake. Much like Lake Acuity, Lake Verity has a rich vegetation around it. The only difference is that here there's not even a snowflake.

Mesprit gently deposits you on the land.
"Now, you be good while I, uh, run some chores around here." she lies. She could sense her sisters getting closer to her, meaning that they are coming like she told.

"Okay?" you say, not even remotely suspecting what the giantess has to do in reality.

You turn around, starting to venture into the woods. You hear Mesprit's voice one last time before she fades from eyesight:
"Don't get lost!"

--

Once the human disappeared into her forest, Mesprit's face shifts from a loving one to a worried, saddened one. Her little human is in danger, and SHE is the danger! She and her sisters... she cannot allow herself to kill the little one she loves because of her stupid heat. Of their stupid heat.

"Mesprit..." the voice of Azelf calls her from within her mind.

The titaness sighs.
‘Girls.’ she replies. Should she tell them what she found out about? Or should she keep it to herself? After all, she's not sure of how her sisters would take the news.

But... they have to know... right?

‘You talked about those two pokemon. What happened?’ Uxie says getting, straight to the point.

‘I've dealt with them.’

‘And? What did you discover?’ Azelf asks.

For a moment, Mesprit remains silent, before replying...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Change of scenery

choices: ... the human staring at the scene!
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Mesprit bites her lower lip. Her sisters aren't ready for the truth just yet, she decides. She herself is still unsure of how to handle the fact that she and them actually are the threat they believed to be the Lucario and the Vaporeon.

‘Mesprit? You still there?’ Azelf calls.

Mesprit shakes her head, shaking the thoughts out of it while focusing on her sisters.
‘I... I found nothing...’ she says.

A moment of perplexed silence follows Mesprit telepathic, unsure statement.

‘What do you mean you, found nothing? You were holding them in place, weren't you?’ Uxie asks.
‘I was. Thing is, I got, uh, distracted and they fled..." Mesprit says with a convincingly sorrowful voice. Due what she learned, it resulted pretty easy to do that...


‘You are kidding.’ Azelf's voice speaks.
‘I'm not! I-’ Mesprit decides to take the opportunity to cut off the conversation.
‘The human's here! Gotta go!’ she lies.

The giantess hears one last sentence before the link is interrupted:
‘Say nothing!’ with that, Mesprit ends the conversation and goes sit on the opposite side of her Lake.

--

As soon as the connection is interrupted, Azelf looks at Uxie, before preparing to fly off, intending to reach her sister at Lake Verity.

However, a pair of large paws kept her from doing so. A quick glance revealed that Uxie was holding Azelf back.
"Let's just give some time to think. We'll talk to her later." the pixie suggests.

"B-But... Mesprit... The human..." Azelf complains.
"They'll be fine."

--

The pink headed guardian grabs her head in her paws. She literally feels it spinning in her paws as she tries to recollect her ideas.

She called herself a guardian. Of the Lakes, of the whole region of Sinnoh. And she was a threat to both pokemon and humans. To HER human.

And all because of one thing. Her heat. Her damned heat, the problem she shared with her sisters, the problem that could only be cured in one way.

And this way is the major problem.

Mesprit sobs, burying her head further into her paws. The situation could be solved, but it has one horrible consequence.

She couldn't be with her precious little human until the heat was over. She couldn't get any more relief because she could lose control at any moment. She always saw sex as a way of bonding, and the bond she developed with the human - she felt it growing between herself and him. The human loved her back.

And she could not have him again.

Tears start to pour down the giantess face, some ending up caught in her paws and some falling on the ground, the gigantic teardrops splashing loudly on the soil.

And in that precise moment, fate decided to be cruel to the poor legendary.

Mesprit rises her head from her paws, her cheeks going from pink to red as she feels it.

Her heat, which she already repressed earlier, just came back, impatiently demanding to be quenched. Mesprit lets out an ungraceful grunt, which is followed by a sigh.

She couldn't have the human fix her again... it was going to be a torture, staying without sex until the heat season was over.

Mesprit places a paw on her cheek, shedding a tear... and then, she looks at said paw.

Mesprit sniffles. If she couldn't have the human again... might as well solve the thing herself.

--

Quietly, the giantess sits down in the depths of her own forest. Pokemon flee as they see her.

Good. No one is going to watch her.

Sighing, Mesprit spreads her legs, starting to rub her sex slowly. A low moan escapes her mouth. Several others join it as she continues rubbing her slit, which grows more wet as she keeps touching herself.

To aid herself, Mesprit imagines herself yesterday, when the human 'fixed' her. Squirming and twitching inside of her, worshipping her insides like a devoted little servant with his goddess...

The new thoughts seem to help as Mesprit feels a new wave of pleasure overwhelming her body. Then another. And another as the guardian speeds up her rubbing.

But then, Mesprit could not keep it in anymore...

--

Just as she comes, Mesprit lets out a loud cry, before removing her paw from her sex, before gently placing it down on the ground.

Mesprit then closes her eyes as she recovers from her orgasm.

Shortly after closing them, the guardian of Lake Verity feels something wrong.

She feels... watched...

Mesprit opens up her golden eyes again. And her cheeks go as red as a tamato berry as she notices...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Mesprit's lie

choices: "... do you wanna play something?" she suggests
Mesprit and Uxie come by, interrupting Azelf
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Mesprit blushes as she notices the silhouettes of two familiar giantesses hovering down, towards her.

Quickly, she brushes her paw clean on the ground as Azelf and Uxie stop before her, both looking concerned.
"Mesprit..." Azelf mutters.
"Mesprit..." Uxie parrots.

"Hi girls..." Mesprit says.

"So, Mesprit," Uxie starts.
"You found nothing, you said? You had the truth at your fingertips..." Uxie remarks, getting straight to the point.

Mesprit quickly remembers to keep her mouth shut about what she learned. She's going to keep it a secret for the time being, she decides. She'll tell it whenever she feels ready.
"Told you, I got distracted. A Pidgeot flew around me.
I thought it was with those two and tried to get it, but the Lucario and the Vaporeon fled."

Both Azelf and Uxie remain silent at the explanation. Then, Uxie breaks it:
"Where's the human? I'd like to talk to him..." she says, before asking:
"Why did you bring him here anyway?" she asks.

"Kept a promise. And I honestly don't know where is he. I promised he could have explored around." Mesprit replies.


"I'll go get him!" before Uxie or Mesprit could reply, Azelf darts away into the forest, leaving her sisters behind.

--

Deciding that you've been walking for long enough, you sit down on a stump.

You close your eyes, inhaling the clean forest air. This atmosphere is sure soothing...

...

Your eyes open again. You just heard a noise.

You turn your head, noticing a bush shaking, producing a rustling sound.

You watch as out of a bush comes a small, brown quadruped creature with two big teeth coming out of its mouth. A Bidoof. And it stops right before you as it stares at you with a curious expression, clearly not used to see humans wandering around the Lake.
"Hi there," you say with a small smile.

The Bidoof stares at you for a while, studying you. You stare right back at it, before it decides that you're harmless and jumps onto your lap. You absentmindedly start to pet it, making it giggle happily.

While you pet the pokemon, your mind travels back to earlier today.

Mesprit seemed under distress because of her heat. Heck, she seemed to be in a lot of pain, but she refused your help anyway. You would've gladly done it again to help! After all, you've already done it several times, with all three sisters. One time more won't surely kill you.

Right...?

What could have gotten into Mesprit earlier? Why was she acting so weird? And why did she bring you here?

--

After a while of searching, Azelf comes to a halt at the sweetest scene shes ever seen: the human, sitting on a stump with a Bidoof on his lap as he pets the beaver pokemon.

The willpower pokemon smiles brightly. The human really loves pokemon.

For a moment, she imagines that she never grew, and that she's in that Bidoof's place right now. Again, the giantess smiles.

Azelf totally forgets about what she had to do, why she had to get you.
"We need more time together." she says. Only to regret it afterwards.

--

The Bidoof leaps off your lap and flees as you turn your head to face the giantess who just spoke. And the same giantess who comes out with a small blush.

"Any good reason to be spying on me?" you ask with a defiant smirk.
"I wasn't. Just looking for you. And I found you." Azelf says, turning her head to the side as she briefly looks elsewhere, only to look back at you the following instant.

You get up from the stump as the giantess hovers closer, holding out her paw for you to climb on. You step onto her paw, which she brings up to her face.

"What did you mean before, ‘we need more time together’?" you ask, recalling the words you heard coming from the giantess.
"Were you talking about me?" Azelf flushes red again.
"Yes." she admits, closing her golden eyes in embarrassment.
"I was talking about you."

You your forehead, unsure of how to reply.
"Alright?... Er, why do we... ehm... need time together?" you ask.
"Oh, I was just thinking aloud." you shoot an inquisitive gaze. The willpower pokemon sighs.
"You and me are technically mates, but we know so little about each other... that's kinda frustrating, since you spend most of your time with Mesprit or Uxie," she explains.

"Hey, now that I think of it, I already helped Uxie with Lake Acuity, and I played with Mesprit once." you recall.
"That's what I'm talking about."

You start snickering. Azelf glares.
"What's so funny?"

You look at the giantess, trying to control your laughter.
"Azelf... are you jealous?" you say.

The pixie blushes furiously.
"What? No! I'm just saying that we should do something together, nothing more!" she cries, only making you laugh harder.

You suddenly stop laughing. Actually, you find that you can't move anymore.

Your eyes, which are the only thing that can actually move, fix a curious and startled gaze on the giantess. You find her smirking at you.
"Now, not so funny, is it?" she says.

You feel yourself able to move again.
"Okay, what the hell was that?"
"Simple. I took your willpower. I do that." she explains, like it is no big deal.

"... Can't tell if that's awesome or frightening." you reply.
"Both." Azelf giggles.

You snicker.
"Maybe you're right." you tell her.
"So, you told you want to do something together?" you recall, patting the one of the giantess' blue cheeks.

Azelf nods slowly.
"Any plans?"

Azelf smiles. Your availability for her only makes her wish stronger this opportunity to be alone with you, at least from a while, without being bothered by her sisters, her heat or bad pokemon who try to make you, her little human, leave.

"Actually, yes. I have something in mind..." she replies.
"And that is?" you ask.

"Well, I may sound predictable, but...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Some time together

choices: "Let's spice things up..." she says with a seductive grin.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"Do you wanna play something? Together?" the blue giantess asks you.
"... Is it something related to my willpower?" you ask, recalling Azelf taking your will away.

If her idea of 'fun' is anywhere close to Mesprit's, she will most likely use her powers to play with you. Something you don't really want.

Azelf blushes a bit.
"Not necessarily..." she mutters sheepishly.
"If you want, we could play..." she mutters the last two words under her breath. As a result, you don't understand what she has in mind.
"Could you, uh, repeat that?" you say.

"I said, we could play... mountain... climbing..." Azelf says, closing her eyes and looking away, blushing massively.

You stand confused for a moment.
"Mountain cli-" you realize what she means.

‘Mountain’ stands for ‘body’.

"I got it." you say. Azelf meekly opens her eyes.
"And?"

You reply completely catches her off guard:
"Sounds fun! Let's do it!" you reply with excitement, earning a confused stare from the giantess.

Which successively shifts into a massive smile. Azelf's eyes lit up, and your ears get assaulted by high-pitched squeals:
"ThankyouThankyouThankyou!" the giantess cries. You dizzily mutter an answer as the blue titaness proceeds to sit down.

"I'll give you a small headstart. But the rest is up to you." she says, while gently lowering you down. You are placed on her lap.
"There! Now..." Azelf pats the tip of her pointy blue head and giggles.
"I won't play with your willpower, I'll be testing it. Let's see how much you can last without resting!"

As you regain your hearing, you look up to the giantess and nod your head, causing her to smile down at you. Your gaze then shifts on the wall of blue fur in front of you.

As much as fun as this sounds, this game has its risks. For one, you could fall off, straight to your death... you shake the thought off. Azelf would surely catch you before you hit the floor... right?

An impatient ‘ahem’ coming from upwards dissipates your doubts like wind with sand as you decide to play her game.

Gripping Azelf's fur with both hands, you place your foot on her massive belly and start climbing. To anyone, the task would seem impossible. But you are determined to do it. The giantess said that she wanted some more time with you, and you don't want to disappoint her.

So, you keep going onward, clinging to the smooth blue fur which currently has a dual function: for starters, it does a good job in covering Azelf's... private regions; second, it assures you a good grip as you continue climbing.

--

A while passes. Azelf keeps her gaze fixed on you, ready to catch you in case her precious human falls off her. Plus, it's fun seeing you climb her body like an insect.

Soon, you climb past Azelf's belly as you reach her abdomen; soon enough, you leave that behind as well as you reach two... hills that block your path.
"Azelf?" it seems that the titaness had already picked up on the problem as she smiles, blushes and replies:
"Go on. I'm okay with this."

Got her approval, you nod up to her and resume climbing. Though, you opt to not touch too much, and decide to climb in between her breasts instead, in her massive cleavage. You try to be quick, not sure if Azelf feels completely comfortable about this. You don't for sure.

Some time passes as you finally leave the two twin 'moons' behind and reach Azelf's neck, swiftly making her way towards her left shoulder.

The golden eyes above you fix on you a surprised state.
"Wow, I really figured you'd take longer!" the titaness chimes with a playful giggle.
"Come on, you're almost there!" she adds.

Nodding, you look in front of you, facing one problem: you've got to climb her face now, and it lacks any fur you can cling to.
"Uh..."
"It's up to you." the giantess intercepts your question before you even speak. You notice her closing her eyes, ready for what comes next.

Sighing, you place your hands on the bare skin of her face. It's just as smooth as her fur, but this surely won't be of any help.

Not without difficulty, you manage to climb up where the red gem all three sisters have on their foreheads rests. You briefly stop.
"Hey, Azelf, can I try something?" the giantess opens a single eye.
"Try wha-ahh!" she feels your left hand suddenly starting to rub the gem.

Your action has the expected effect, and Azelf starts moaning loudly in pleasure.
"Yep. This gem is your soft spot too..." you mutter, before stopping. Keeping that up could have caused Azelf to shake her head, making you fall of as a consequence. And you don't really want to start over... or become a red stain on the ground...

Azelf mutters some dejected words, bothered that the amazing feeling stopped so soon, but you pay her no mind as you climb the last of her face and onto the pointy tip of her head.

You manage to keep your balance as you cry out:
"Done!" you are snatched by a giant paw before you can even think of enjoying the view.

--

"It's been an hour and a half! Where are those two?" Mesprit says, annoyed.
"Calm down, sister. She might be still searching for him," Uxie says.
"Uxie, you know that I usually believe whatever you say,
but I highly doubt it." Mesprit bluntly replies.

"Don't know if to feel flattered or offended." Uxie mutters.
"Why don't we talk in the meantime?" she suggests.

"About what?"
"I don't know, maybe about what happened earlier with those two? You've been pretty vague on the argument," Uxie replies. Mesprit huffs.
"I told you, I got distracted." she for the third time today, Mesprit repeats her lie.
"But, didn't you learn anything at all from them?"

"No... nothing at-" Mesprit doesn't have the courage to finish.

Tears start to pour from her eyes as she leans forward, burying her head in her sister's chest fur.
"Mesprit! What's going on?" Uxie asks with worry.

The pink headed giantess sniffles.
"I-I... I don't want the human to leave, that's all." she lies.

Uxie's paws move as she embraces her sister.
"None of us does, and he won't, trust me." she says

--

After being barraged with kisses and words of appreciation, Azelf finally calms down.
"That was fun!" she chimes.
"Thank you!"

"You... you're welcome..." you mutter, trying to breath properly again. Once you do, you look up to the smiling giantess.
"We've had out playtime. Happy now?" you question.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Azelf's game

choices: Uxie goes back to her sisters
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"You can bet!" the blue pixie happily chimes, smiling down at you. You smile back, before absentmindedly looking at your watch.
"Er, Azelf? I think we lost the track of time. It's been almost two hours..." you point out.

"Heh, time sure flies when you're having fun!" she says, before remembering the reason of why she had to get you.
"And... we should go back. Mesprit and Uxie might be worried about us..." she says. You nod, silently agreeing with her as the giantess, holding you in a gentle but firm grasp, flies up, above the trees around Lake Verity.

She floats for a couple minutes, before finding what she's searching for... or who she's searching for. Azelf spots the familiar yellow and pink heads of her sisters... but, something's wrong.

Mesprit has her head buried in Uxie's arms while the pixie hugs her. Azelf loses no time and quickly hovers over them.

--

Something as big as a giantess is very effective to draw attention. In fact, Uxie rises her head in the newcomer's direction.
"Oh, there you are." she says.

This makes Mesprit rise her head from her sister's paws.

You, who are still held in Azelf's left paw, watch as the gigantic head of Mesprit rises up and look in direction of Azelf, who gently places you down in the meantime. Your heart leaps within your chest as you take a good look at Mesprit's face.

Mesprit's usually cheerful eyes are completely red, wet with tears that keep pouring down from them. The giantess' gaze shifts on you. She stares at you in complete silence for a few moments.
"Mesprit... why are you crying?" you ask, concerned about her.

In an instant, Mesprit frees herself from Uxie's paws and darts towards you. However, she ends up bumping into the same Uxie, who flies in front of her.
"Uxie...!"
"Azelf, take care of her." Mesprit is pulled back by the blue giantess that is her sister. Mesprit flails in Azelf's grip, but it's no use.

Meanwhile, a yellow headed giantess floats towards you slowly. You instinctively back away, recalling what she's done to you.

Uxie towers above you, her shadow engulfing your whole being.
"May I share a few words with you? Please?" you take a few more steps back.

Which results to be pointless, since the titaness scoops you up with minimal effort.
"Look, I understand. You are mad at me, you are scared of me. You probably hate me for what I've done to you. Well...
I hate myself too for it, alright? But... I had one good reason.
Which I intend to share with you." she says with sadness.

Your gaze shifts behind Uxie, to Azelf and Mesprit, who didn't lose a single word. Mesprit instantly stops flailing and looks straight at you, nodding her head, silently telling you that Uxie hasn't any malicious intent.

Trusting the pink headed guardian, you look back at Uxie.
"Alright..." you reply. The pixie giantess smiles a little, before turning to her sisters.
"A few moments of privacy, please." she says, before floating off into the forest, you held solidly in her paws.

--

"There. Now we can talk undisturbed." Uxie says as she stops after a few minutes of flight.

"Talk about what?" you say, somewhat uncomfortable.
"I think you already know it, dear," Uxie replies as she sits down, holding you in front of her face.

"You mean, you wiping my memories away?" you say, feeling quite betrayed. You trusted the giantess... you even let her have you twice, unaware of what she's done.

"Yes. That. We need to clarify this." she says.
"I don't have another choice, I suppose." you reply.

"Listen, what I did to you was horrible. Trust me, I hate doing it. I only erase others' memories when there's need for it." Uxie explains.

"Okay. Why did you need to erase mine?" you ask.
"First, promise me that you'll believe what I'll say. I assure you straightaway that this the one and only truth."

"Who can assure me that?" you say.
"My sisters, if you want. If don't trust, you'll trust the three of us, right? Especially Me-"
"I am listening!" you quickly interrupt. Uxie smiles.

"Good. Listen up." she says.

--

"I meant what?" you ask, not sure you heard good.
"Leaving. You wanted to leave." Uxie grimly says.
"Why would I have wanted that?"

"That's the point. We believe, dear, that someone's been threatening you."

For the second time today, your heart skips a beat.
"What?!" you ask, suddenly fearing.
"Yes. We believe that someone convinced you to leave us three sisters. For what reason, don't ask, because I don't know. I can only assume that they believed you to be a threat to me. To my sisters." Uxie explains.

"A threat? We got along so well!" you exclaim indignantly.
"I know! But you were so determined that I simply had to..." Uxie doesn't finish her sentence.

You stand there on her paw, confused, scared, angry.

Is this the truth? Or an excuse the knowledge pokemon made up? Well, there's only one way to find out...

"Uxie. Please, assure me that this is truth. Please. Please." you ask.
"I swear it." she says solemnly.
"And I'll share something else with you: whenever we're at Lake Acuity, watch out for a Lucario and a Vaporeon.
Keep your eyes out." she warns.

"Lucario and Vaporeon? Those two...?" Uxie nods.

"Do you believe me?" she then asks.
"You assured that this is the truth... and I... I'm sorry!" you blurt out, repressing the urge to hug the giantess.

Uxie tilts her head.
"Sorry for what? I should be the one sorry here." she says.
"Yes. But I thought bad of you!" you admit.

Uxie smiles.
"I'll forgive you. Only if you forgive me first, though." she says, giggling. You smile, glad that the giantess doesn't hold hard feelings for you.
"Deal." you reply.

Uxie doesn't reply, but leans forward, pecking your right cheek.
"The deal's sealed!" the yellow headed guardian merrily says.

Blushing vaguely, you smile. Peace had just returned between you and the giantess.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: A word with the pixie

choices: Unknown to them, someone is listening in secrecy...
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
Meanwhile, at Lake Acuity, various pokemon took advantage of the legendaries' absence and formed a small crowd, much like they did the other day.

Lucario, Vaporeon, even the Sneasel who crawled inside of Uxie. Almost every inhabitant of Lake Acuity is present. The only one missing is the human. But, every single pokemon in the crowd knows why he's not present.

First, it's the middle of the day; second, the legendaries won't let him out of their sights a single instant; third, his memories were erased by Uxie, so that the human didn't remember the first meeting or the pokemon that had participated to it.

Some pokemon are currently sitting on the ground, some on a few branches of nearby trees, some are more simply standing.

Vaporeon sits in front of the crowd and watches Lucario walk back and forth.
"What to do? The human cannot stay here forever. The legendaries will lose control sooner or later!" a Vileplume speaks up from the crowd.
"Right. And when they're done with him, they'll come and get us. We're only doing that human a favor." a Bellossom adds, getting some murmurs of approval.

"I know," Lucario halts his walking to face the crowd.
"But me and Vapid actually spoke to Mesprit about it and-"

"You mean, you told her about it?" a Buizel asks.
"Did you really had to talk about that? You probably broke her heart!" it adds.

Vaporeon steps forward, taking place beside Lucario.
"We didn't have a second choice. Mesprit caught us red-handed! What were we supposed to do?" she defends. Silence falls among the pokemon crowd.

"We don't know what happened after we talked to Mesprit. We only know that she and her sisters left. Now, we don't if Mesprit told her sisters what we told her; we don't know what her reaction was and we don't know how long it'll take before the legendaries lose control." Lucario says.

"So, the only thing I can say is: keep an eye out, all of you, for the human and for those three sisters. Whenever they lose control - and I'm sure it'll happen - we have to make that human leave." he says.

The crowd of pokemon starts murmuring again.

"But... the legendaries will be heartbroken if he leaves!" Vaporeon speaks up.
"So what? Better safe than sorry!" a Leafeon counters, earning a glare from the water type.

Just then, before the argument could get any further, three huge shadows obscure the ground.

Lucario quickly looks up to confirm what he already thought: the sisters are coming back to Lake Acuity.
"I'll tell you this: let's think about it for good, alright? For now, we have to go." he ends his speech with a small movement of his paw.

The crowd of pokemon begin to disperse as the Lake Trio returns to Lake Acuity. Only Lucario remains for a few moments more, before heading into the depths of the forest, disappearing into the thick vegetation as the three giantesses and the human Mesprit is carrying come to a halt above the Lake.

--

The rest of the day fades away rather fastly. The sun soon sets and gets replaced by the moon.

The three sisters gather berries for dinner as usual. However, you notice, Mesprit doesn't even lay a paw on them. Just what is going on with her? She's been acting weird from this morning.

And yet, when you question about it, she simply smiles, replying:
"I'm fine. Just... I'm not hungry." she says, earning two confused stares from Azelf and Uxie.

You don't fully buy what the titaness said. When you asked why she had been crying earlier, she didn't give any response but a vague ‘Don't worry about it’. You though that it was her heat at first, but you're not so sure about it anymore.

What is she hiding from you...? The more you think about, the more grows the fear that you might have accidentally done something to her.

Anyway, something's going on. And you intend to discover what.

--

After dinner, the legendaries declare their intention to sleep and retreat inside of the cave, you following close.

As usual, Mesprit gets a hold of your body, embraces you and lays down. You don't even attempt to protest anymore, knowing that it would be completely pointless.

After exchanging their ‘goodnight’, the sisters relax. And so do you; you close your eyes, enjoying Mesprit's rhythmic heartbeat, which, like always, does a good job in soothing you.

Within minutes, you are soundly asleep on Mesprit's chest. But the giantess couldn't sleep at all. She has too many thoughts scattered across her mind. Something close to lots of rubber balls bouncing back and forth within a closed room, and they keep her from getting some well-desired sleep.

The pink headed guardian waits for her sisters to be asleep too; as soon as she hears their snoring, Mesprit slowly gets up, careful to not wake you up.

Then, she moves to Azelf, gently placing you on her belly. It's only a matter of seconds before her sister's paws find their way to the human as she embraces him in her sleep. A smile appears on the giantess' face.

Unsure of how to feel about this, Mesprit decides to let it slide as she turns around and flies out of the cave, beginning her search.

The pale moonlight aids the giantess as she searches through the whole forest around Lake Acuity, but not finding, though, what she's searching for.

Or, more specifically, who she is searching for.

Dejected, Mesprit arrives to the lake shore and sits down, a paw traveling to her chin. She doesn't know how to feel about what she learned this morning.

How could she ever look at her own face again? She and her sisters lose control during the heat season. Apparently, they already did several times.

Mesprit chokes back a sob, her own words coming back to her mind, ‘Some guardian I turned out to be, huh?’.

And it is true. She feels like the doesn't deserve the title of ‘guardian’ anymore...

Her thoughts are rudely interrupted as a voice echoes in the darkness of the night:
"Sorry to bother you, but you were searching for me, I believe?" someone talks.

Recognizing the voice, Mesprit takes a deep breath, before slightly turning her head back, noticing a Lucario coming out of shadows.

"Precisely." Mesprit replies as the Lucario takes place beside her.
"Where's your friend? Vaporeon?" she asks.

"I'm afraid she won't be joining us," Lucario replies.
"Now, tell me, why were you exactly searching for me? Didn't I give enough answers this morning?" he asks.

"Yes," Mesprit replies.
"But nonetheless, we need to talk." she says with a hint of sadness in her voice.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: The second meeting

1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.content:
"Sure." Lucario replies, sitting down beside the guardian, paws wrapped around his knees.
"What do we need to talk about?"

Mesprit doesn't even look down, keeping her gaze lost in her own reflection into the water of Lake Acuity.
"What else?" she asks after a few moments of silence, needed to gather the courage to speak.

"The human?"
"MY human, yes." Mesprit replies, putting particular emphasis on the word ‘my’.

"You told me what the heat makes me do. What it makes us, me and my sisters do." Mesprit shudders as she recalls what the same Lucario and that Vaporeon told her earlier today.

"I need to know... what should I do about it? Should I tell my sisters... the human?"
"Your sisters don't need to know about it... for now. However, if you're seeking for an advice, the human should be informed of it... if you wish, that is." Lucario says.

"... Otherwise?"
"Someone else will tell him." Lucario bluntly says. Mesprit sobs.
"And then? What will happen to him?... Are you really sure that he's not going to be threatened?" Mesprit with sudden rage.

"100%, nobody will try anything against him." Lucario replies.
It takes Mesprit few moments of inhaling deeply before calming down.
"What do I need to do? What do we need to do?"

Lucario remains silent, and looks away.
"Tell me... please..." Mesprit says, poking him with her left tail.

Lucario gazes at her.
"I can't. You wouldn't take it good. And modestly, I don't want to see you sad... or angry..." he says, dreading the being of emotions' reaction.
"I promise I won't display such emotions in front of you." Mesprit replies reassuringly.

Lucario takes a deep breath.
"Sure you want to know?" he asks. The titaness nods her head.

Lucario looks upwards, his crimson eyes locking with Mesprit's golden ones as he faces her.
"Mesprit... let the human go. I know... it would be hard for you, but it's for the best." Lucario says softly.

Mesprit stays silent; the tears forming in her eyes speak for her. She wipes them away before replying:
"I'm afraid," she starts.
"That I cannot do such thing. The human is literally the best thing that ever happened to me. I will never ever let him go." she says, ignoring the blush spreading on her face.

"I think I figured that out," Lucario replies.
"But you may understand that ‘your’ human is in great danger. If he remains, you can't guarantee he'll be fine."

"I'll keep myself under control."
"And your sisters?"
"I'll keep an eye out for them. They won't try anything funny. Or else." Mesprit grimly replies. She's going to keep an eye out for her sisters for sure. Especially for Uxie.

The titaness notices Lucario shaking his head.
"Do as you wish, guardian of Lake Verity. But I suggest you think about it. If you truly love that human, you'll know what's best for him." he says.

Complete silence falls between the two pokemon. Mesprit's gaze travels elsewhere, and her right hand starts absentmindedly digging the ground up.

"So..." Lucario awkwardly says, but he gets no response.

"Mesprit?" he calls out. But the giantess isn't listening anymore, he finds. She's looking at the Lake glumly without paying her surroundings any attention. A clear message: Mesprit wants to be alone.

"Uhm... see you around I guess..." Lucario says the giantess as he takes his leave. Soon, a bush behind Mesprit shakes, suggesting that her left her to herself.

Mesprit stays still for a while, thinking. She couldn't let her little one go away, could she? She didn't need to think about it like Lucario suggested; that was simply out of question.

But such decision implies another, as well as painful as the alternative: her needs could not be satisfied again, not before her heat ends.

Fighting back tears, Mesprit slowly gets back up and starts floating in direction of the cave.

Soon, she finds herself at the entrance of it. Silently, the titaness hovers inside, greeted by darkness and the snoring of her sister deep within the place.

The giantess hovers deeper inside, stopping near her blue headed sister, Azelf, taking notice that she shifted position, now laying on her side, one arm on the ground, the other wrapped around the familiar body of the human.

Mesprit extends her paw. Inches from you, that paw hesitates, and Mesprit feels tears in her eyes.

The giantess sniffles, before slowly pulling you out of Azelf's grasp. Then, Mesprit sits down in between her sleeping sister. She spends a good amount of time staring at you, repeating to herself that she couldn't physically love you until the damned season is over. Lucario gave her an advice, tell the human - her human, her precious little mate - about her situation.

But could she tell him? How would he feel about it? Would he comprehend? Or would he be scared?

...

Would he remain with her, even knowing how dangerous his mate is? Or would he run away from her?

That's a given, Mesprit would never get over with his loss.

"My little human... what have we got ourselves into?" Mesprit whispers, before leaning forward, pressing her lips on your forehead. She decides that she'll keep what she knows a secret for the time being. Her human, and her sisters mustn't know anything... yet.

The giantess holds the kiss for a couple seconds before pulling away, you murmuring something incomprehensible in your sleep.

Then, Mesprit decides that staying awake for the night won't accomplish anything but worsen her already dire situation. So, the pink headed guardian decides to sleep on it.

Mesprit sighs in a sad manner, her body sliding from a sitting to a laying position. Much like earlier, the guardian embraces you and kisses your head, before laying hers down as well.

For an incalculable amount of time, the giantess stays awake, until her mind slowly started to slide into a deep, dreamless slumber. Which is a good thing to the giantess.

She expected to have nightmares.
1343312111112121211212112121222121212212.title: Talking under the moonlight

choices: You wake up and overhear them talking
134331211111212121121211212122212122.content:
Just as you're about to reach Azelf, a huge shadow engulfs your whole form. You briefly glance at the blue mountain, to find her slamming her legs close.

You look upwards, discovering a certain blue and pink giantess floating down, right a few inches above the surface of Lake Acuity.

You smile upon seeing Mesprit looking at you.
"Hello there Mesprit! Where-" you don't manage to finish you sentence as the giantess hovers over you, picks you up and hugs you lovingly in the blink of an eye, causing you to feel slightly dizzy.
"Missed you~" she chimes as she tightens her grip on you, pushing you more into the wall of fur that is her chest.

Azelf smiles seeing the scene, before remembering your current situation.

She tries to say something, but her sister shoots her a gaze that screams: ‘Shut up!’.

Currently caught in the middle of a display of affection of the pink headed legendary, you don't notice anything.

"So, where have you been Mesprit?" Azelf asks instead, changing topic.
"Oh, just went to check on Lake Verity! You never know what might happen while you're away!" Mesprit giggles.

To any ear, that giggle might have sounded sincere.

So sincere that nobody but Azelf could tell what is going on with Mesprit's sudden change of humor.

Within her, her heart is still beating faster than normal, her brain is still working wildly to come up with an answer to her questions while Mesprit herself tries to hold back the storm of emotions currently raging inside her like a cyclone.

Hugging her little human is a great help with that.

"Hey, is that why-" you get a mouthful of blue fur that chokes your voice.
"Hehehe, whoops! Sorry!" Mesprit apologizes in an irresistible cute voice as you spit out thick strands of her fur.

"Is that... Is that why you looked so upset? Were you worried about your Lake?" you ask, smiling.

Her smile shrinks instead, although not by much, so you can't really tell the difference.
"Of course! I mean, am I not a guardian?" she says somewhat proudly, masking her internal sadness.

It felt like she didn't deserve that title. Like it just didn't fit her anymore.

Mesprit shakes the thought off with an imperceptible move of her head, and leans down, lightly touching your head with her lips.

Glancing at Azelf, she discovers her smiling, the word ‘cute’ painted all over her lips.

"Say, what have you two been doing while I was away?" Mesprit chirps. Azelf blushes. And so do you.
"Nothing important." you both reply simultaneously.

Happily ignoring that Azelf was trying to have you as well before her arrival, Mesprit giggles again.

The golden gaze of the blue headed giantess fixes on you as you are hugged yet again by her sister. The human is the only one that ever agreed to help her with her problems since she grew to 200ft... she can't help but feel a slight hint of jealousy.

Mesprit and Uxie had their heat solved while she-

Sooner or later, human.

Her cheeks are crossed by a faint, red shade. Much to her irritation, she'll have to deal with her heat for longer, when she was so close to place an end to it!... Well, at least, temporarily.

The blue titaness shakes her head.

Sooner or later.

--

The day eventually fades away, the sun replaced by a wonderful, full moon.

For the whole time the sun has been up in the sky, you've been spending time with the two legendary sisters.

But no trace of Uxie for the whole day long. Whenever you asked about her, Azelf and Mesprit had different reactions; Azelf simply looked at you weirdly, while Mesprit immediately turned her head away. You swear you could hear a choked sob everytime she did that. None of the two, you noticed, did actually answer to you.

Also, a few times, you caught them giving each other weird looks, only to smile right after upon noticing that you were staring at them.

Though, aside from you concerns for Uxie and the weird actions of Azelf and Mesprit, the day went on pretty smoothly.

After a quick meal of berries - you assume that the giantesses don't want you to see them eating fish pokemon - the two decide that it's bedtime, empathizing the thought with exaggerated yawns.

Of course, you willingly agree with their wishes, not even remotely imagining the reason of why they wanted to sleep.

Or why they wanted you to sleep.

Once again, the two find shelter for the night inside the same cave where you last slept. The only difference is that it currently lacks of something.

Or someone.

"Hey, I didn't see Uxie for the whole day. Where...?" you ask again.

You, still grasped by Mesprit, feel her shake slightly behind you as she lays down, followed by Azelf.
"I... I'm sure she's fine. She must be doing something important around Sinnoh..." Mesprit says, before laying her lips on your forehead.
"Good night then, sweetie. Sleep tight." she says.
"Goodnight, you two. See you in the morning." Azelf says, yawning.

Pleased with the answer, you lay your head against Mesprit's chest, feeling her soothing heartbeat relaxing your mind.

At some point, you feel the giantess' chest moving along her rhythmic breath, probably meaning that she's asleep.

Slowly, you drift off too as sleep claims your consciousness.

Unknown to you, the two legendary sisters aren't sleeping at all.

--

Once she makes sure you're asleep, Mesprit opens her eyes, and dares to whisper:
"Azelf,"
"Yes." her sister responds from beside her, while slowly turning around to face Mesprit.

Her suddenly worried gaze told the pink headed legendary everything. Azelf noticed that gleam in the human's eyes, and she came to the same conclusion.

For some reason Uxie had wiped his memories away.

But, like the conclusion, she also came to the same halt.

Why did Uxie do such thing? And where is she? Why didn't she show up the whole day?

"We need to talk. About Uxie," Mesprit says, once again feeling her heart leaping in her chest.
"Yes." her sister agrees.
134331211111212121121211212122212122.title: Mesprit's return

choices: Reveal yourself awake and ask for answers
1343312111112121211212112121222121222.content:
"I have no clue!"

This voice, that you register as Mesprit's, roughly claims you back to reality from the warmth that a good dream brings.

You let out a yawn, which is greeted by complete silence. Your eyes open up a little bit, and you find yourself laying face down on the familiar furry surface that is Mesprit, both her paws laying on your back, keeping you still.

Just as you're about to get back to sleep, you hear her voice again.
"As I was saying, sister, I've got no clue about it... she repeats. You feel one of her paws gently sliding along the length of your back as she caresses you, believing you asleep.

Immediately, you're tugged back to reality as you realize that she and Azelf aren't sleeping, and are talking instead.

By the voice Mesprit is using, you get that it is about something important.

If it wasn't, why would they have waited for you to be asleep to talk?

And so, you decide to pretend to be still sleeping, only to hear what they're talking about, and to discover the reason of this secrecy.

"But, there must be a reason. I mean, did he do something wrong to Uxie?" another voice, that you recognize as Azelf, speaks up.

‘He’? Are they talking about you? If they are, what did you do to Uxie...?

"That's the point - he didn't!" Mesprit cries. You choke back a sigh of relief that would alert the two that you are listening to the conversation they were trying to keep secret.

Not that you like to eavesdrop, but if the two are talking about you, you have the right to know... right?

So you carefully listen to every word, while breathing slowly, pretending to be asleep to not reveal your awake state to Mesprit.

"He's been just perfect, the sweetest little thing you will ever find," Mesprit continues, before smiling.
"The only thing he did was... stealing my heart..." she says sweetly.

Good thing you aren't laying on your back. Otherwise, she would have noticed you blushing.

Azelf smiles.
"Heh, careful sister. Or I might just fall for him too..." she says with a nervous giggle upon noticing the glare that Mesprit gives her as the words leave her mouth.
"Hehe, kidding," she says, masking her delusion.

She wasn't kidding at all.

"Anyway, what reason could Uxie have to do it? He didn't do anything, you are saying..."

"At all! He actually helped her around the Lake!... And he..." Mesprit shakes her head, shaking the thought off as well.
"Stop thinking about that, Mesprit," Azelf says.

You frown. So they ARE talking about you! But... what did Uxie do to you?

For a moment, you focus really hard, trying to remember. You didn't see Uxie for the whole day, and yesterday... you can't remember her doing anything wrong to you!

"Well, can you think of anymore reasons? Did he do something around Lake Acuity? Did she... make love with him against his will?... Was he trying to leave?" you hear Azelf speaking.

Mesprit stays silent for a few moments. She didn't think about the last possibility.

But she quickly shakes it off.
"Leaving? Why would he want to leave?" she asks with a hint of disbelief.
"Well... heat problem... we are really big... it could be lethal?" Azelf reasons.

"Okay, first off, he's mine," she proclaims in a possessive manner.
"Second, I highly doubt it." you internally agree.

Why would you have wanted to leave? Sure, you were kinda afraid when Mesprit asked... forced you to do it the first time. But then, you willingly went along twice afterwards, so you aren't that scared anymore.

"Alright. Then why did Uxie wipe his memories away?" your heart skips a bit, and your blood seems to suddenly freeze.

Uxie did what?!

Is that why you can't remember? Uxie did really erase your memories? But why?

Maybe Azelf and Mesprit are talking about someone else? No, they're taking about you, you know it.

With your heart beating faster and your mind trying to find answers, you listen more carefully to their words.

"I don't know. I mean, he helped her with chores, warned her about those pokemon who slipped up inside her, he even helped with her heat... Why did she erase his memories?" at this point, you have no more doubts: they're talking about you.

Uxie had erased your memories? But why? What did you do to make her want to make you look into her eyes, like she explained yesterday?

You're pretty certain that you didn't do absolutely anything wrong. Or perhaps you did and she really deleted your-

For a moment, you imagine yourself cowering in fear while Uxie looms over you, much like she was with those three Sneasel who sneaked inside her; You imagine her scolding you with harsh words, before opening those gigantic eyes of hers and making you forget everything...

You keep yourself from shaking your head. You refuse to believe Uxie did something like that to you. Azelf and Mesprit must know that you're awake and listening, this must be some kind of prank.

Maybe-

"This little one is been just a sweetie. All he did since we met was help, and Uxie did something like that to him..." Mesprit says dejectedly.


You feel touched by her words, and enter a flustered state.
"I did nothing." you whisper. And then instantly regret doing so.

Did it go unheard? Or did the two legendaries heard you?

A few moments of unnerving silence follow your whisper. You can't see anything aside from Mesprit's blue fur, but you can definitely feel the gazes of both sisters suddenly shifting on you, locking on your apparently sleeping form. You feel all the weight of those four, golden eyes, a crushing weight that keeps you in place.

Not that you can move too much anyway, with the paws of Mesprit easily keeping you down.

After a few moments of pure silence, Mesprit speaks up again:
"Well, might as well join in since you are listening, don't you think?" she says with a sigh.
1343312111112121211212112121222121222.title: The secret listener

choices: Suddenly, you notice two pokemon approaching you!
13433121111121212112121121212221212221.content:
You feel Mesprit's paws leaving your back as she breaks her hug. And, deciding that you want to know what the two sisters were talking about, you get up.

As you get up, you are greeted by an annoyed gaze belonging to Mesprit and a concerned one belonging to Azelf.
"You know, it isn't exactly nice to overhear..." Mesprit scolds while you stand on her chest.
"Yeah, talking behind my back isn't as well," you reply bluntly, before remembering who you are talking to.
"Sorry," you add.

Mesprit sighs.
"It's nothing," she says, waving a hand.
"We should have told you earlier anyway..." Azelf remarks.

You look at her, remembering the reason of this.
"How much did you hear?" Mesprit asks you.
"Enough of it. And I didn't really understand what you two meant..." you say.

Both sisters sigh.
"What did Uxie do to me? She didn't really delete my memories, did she? You were kidding, right?" you ask.

Mesprit shoots you a dejected gaze, before an idea springs up in her mind.
"O-Of course! Uxie would never do-" Azelf interrupts her.
"Mesprit, there's no point in denying it," she says.

Mesprit looks at her for a few moments, before nodding her head. Azelf turns to you.
"Whatever you heard of our conversation, it's all true.
And no, we weren't kidding." she says, looking dead serious.

You stare at the two legendaries, expecting... or hoping that they would start laughing at any moment, confirming you that they are just messing with you. But neither Azelf or Mesprit drop their serious expressions.

"W-Wait... s-so Uxie did..."
"Yes..." Mesprit mutters under her breath as she looks at you grimly.

Your heart pounds the insides of your chest.
"B-But... Why? I didn't do anything!" you shout out in disbelief.
"We know, sweetie. What we don't know is why Uxie did such thing to you. We were there the whole time, you didn't do absolutely anything weird." Mesprit says.

"But then... why?" you repeat the question, still unable to believe this.
"That's what we're trying to figure out. But the problem is, we don't have any clue about her reasons. We actually think that maybe she might have done something...
nasty to you. Or maybe you meant to take a hasty decision..." Azelf mutters.

"Azelf, I can assure that I wasn't trying to leave last night... I mean, I would have wanted to leave again at some point, right?" you ask, trying to make sense out of this.
"And I'm sure Uxie didn't try anything funny with me... you girls should know her better than anybody else," you state.
"You're right, she's not the type of doing something against someone's will... but then, why did she-" you unceremoniously interrupt.
"Maybe you're mistaking...?" you say.

In response, Mesprit gives a somewhat sad smile.
"Dear, you don't know how much we wish we were mistaking... but we're certain of it, trust us," she says.

For a moment, you look at both giantesses dumbstruck.

And then, you absentmindedly run towards the edge of Mesprit's chest.
"... What are you-" she chokes back a scream as she sees you sliding down her huge body and onto the floor of the cavern.

Both Azelf and Mesprit watch as you run in front of them.
"I'm sorry..." you say.
"Where are you-"
"I-I need some air..." you declare as you run in direction of the entrance of the cavern.

Mesprit eyes you with worry.
"W-Wait! D-Don't go!" she stammers, hastily trying to get up to go after you.

However, Azelf suddenly moves a arm in front of her sister, stopping her. Mesprit shoots her a worried gaze and she notices her sister shaking her head.
"Let him. He needs some time to think..." Azelf states while retreating her arm.

However, Mesprit still seemed reluctant to let her precious little one wander around a dark forest, all alone in the middle of the night.
"B-But... it could be dangerous..." she says worriedly, trying to deal with many emotions at once.
"He'll be fine." Azelf replies.

--

You run aimlessly through the forest around Lake Acuity while trying to find an answer to your questions.

Desperate, you stop by the crystalline water of the Lake, and place a hand on your forehead, trying to collect your thoughts.

Uxie did really erase your memories? You cannot bring yourself to believe it. Uxie would never do something like that... or at least, not the Uxie you know.

Not the shy, sweet Uxie that saved you from a snow blizzard which almost killed you.

But, then again, Mesprit and Azelf looked seriously concerned about you. Did it mean that Uxie really-

You shake your head. How could they know? Uxie didn't show up for the whole day long!

Realization hits you hard, like you just hit the floor after several seconds of free falling, while another thought finds its way inside your mind.

Maybe Uxie didn't show up because she felt guilty? Because of what she did to you, the same human who had snuggled up to her just last night...?

Suddenly, you remember about yesterday night, the moment before you went to sleep.

You were with Uxie right where you are now, by Lake Acuity, while she was telling you that you had a nightmare, and that she meant to soothe you.

Again, realization struck you with great strength.

What if Uxie lied to you?!

"S-She wasn't trying to help me... t-this is a nightmare..." you mutter, still unable to believe what's happening.

For a good amount of time, you just stand there, looking at your own reflection in the water of the Lake that Uxie protects.

‘Then... It all was true? Uxie, did you really wipe my memories away? Why?! Did I do something wrong to you? Or to Mesprit? Or Azelf? I'm sure I did nothing! Why then? Why did she wipe my memories away?

Why?

Why?

Why?’ you mentally ask yourself, while trying to keep tears from falling.

Shaking your head in an almost frenetic manner, you decide to go back to the cave. Azelf and Mesprit are unaware about what you remember about last night, but maybe they could come up with a proper answer.

So, you hastily turn around and start to walk back to the cavern...
13433121111121212112121121212221212221.title: Nighttime revelations

choices: Just then, a huge pokemon comes by... Uxie?!
134331211111212121121211212122212122212.content:
You walk away from the Lake and into the forest again. You need to talk to Mesprit and Azelf, tell them what you know. It may not be much, but it would surely be a start.

While you walk, you try thinking about it yourself.

Uxie told you that you had a nightmare, and that she intended to help you get rid of it. But now you know that she had in reality erased your memories for some reason. But why? You can't remember anything happening before that! You just remember going to sleep with Mesprit!

... But then? What happened? Why did the yellow headed giantess delete your memories? What reason did she have?

... Maybe... she was jealous? Or... or maybe she... she really abused you and made you forget it? The mere hypothesis is horrible, and it is even more horrible that you're considering it. But it is a chance. Uxie is still in heat after all, and Mesprit has shown you how delirious a pokemon can get when in that state of mind.

You shake your head. You're not actually sure that Uxie would ever do something like that. But then, it is the only logical explanation right now.

And, if that isn't the reason, the problem remains: why did she erase your memories?

That must have been her motivation, you decide. Maybe she couldn't sleep because of her heat, she became uncontrollable and she used the first thing she found - you.

It really is something horrible to think about, but it was not her fault, you guess. So, if it really was her reason, if she really wasn't thinking lucidly, you guess that you could bring yourself to forgive her after all-

Your train of thought is interrupted. You're sure you heard a noise.

You listen carefully. Again, you hear the noise. It seems like leaves shaking.

Startled, you glance around, and spot a few bushes rustling.
"Who's there?" you call out, expecting the cry of some pokemon in response.

But instead...

"Hello again human," a voice says. Startled, you take a leap back and watch as a bipedal figure emerges from the rustling bushes.

You initially don't see it clearly due the darkness of the forest. But as the figure gets closer to you, you manage to make out the silhouette of a black and blue jackal, that you recognize as a Lucario.

"A Lucario...?" you mutter, calming down a bit. Only to fear again as you notice a second figure leaping out from behind the bushes. This one is quadruped, and has a long tail and two big ears.
