The pale moonlight allows you to recognize the second pokemon as a Vaporeon. You take notice of them staring at you with different expressions: the Lucario stares at you with slight annoyance. Probably he doesn't like humans too much, and you're a human... better not piss him off, you decide.

But the Vaporeon - she stares at you with an expression of... pity? Why does she look so pitiful?

"Er... Hi?" you say as the two walk closer to you, before remembering about something.
"Hey, could you please tell me who talked? I mean, I'm sure I heard a voice..." you explain.

"That's correct. It was me, human," the Lucario speaks up, surprising you.
"Oh... er..." you mutter not sure of how to react.

"Listen, human. Us and you need to talk about something," the blue and black pokemon says.

"...About?" is the only reply you can give him.
"We actually already tried to talk to your... friend Mesprit. But she ignored us and flew away. That's why we need you to listen to us." he continues.

You take a step back. These two wanted to talk with Mesprit? About what?

"I'm listening. What did you want to tell Mesprit? I'll make sure to tell her," you assure.
"There's no need for it, since you are personally involved in this," you look into the Lucario's crimson eyes, before blinking a few times, talking in clear body language: ‘What?’.

"Tell me, you just found out about what Uxie did to you, didn't you? Mesprit and Azelf told you, right?" he asks.

"... How do you know about it?" you ask, before answering yourself:
"Were you spying on me?" you hiss.
"No no, we were just keeping an eye on you. And, trust me, we had a good reason," he says.

It's the turn of the Vaporeon to speak up.
"Yeah, we saw Uxie wiping away your memories,we saw her lying to you..." she says, although you can't possibly understand her.

Fortunately, the Lucario picks up on this problem.
"She said that we saw her wiping your memories away. We saw how she lied to you," he speaks.

You self-convince that these two are speaking the truth.
"Alright, I believe you," you say, earning a smile from the Vaporeon.
"But now, I need to know, why did Uxie erase my memories?! You two, you are saying that you saw her so please, tell me!" you plead, this time earning a smirk from the Lucario.

"Of course, human. That's what we're here for. As I already told, you and us need to talk. Preferably in a more secluded place," he says, turning around while motioning for you to follow with a single movement of his paw.

The Vaporeon emulates him as she turns around as well as they start to walk deeper into the forest.

You stand there for a few moments. Can you really trust these two pokemon? Do they really know why Uxie has erased your memories?

Yes, you decide. They told you what you already knew, meaning that they were speaking the truth: they SAW Uxie lying to you.

"Come on!" the Lucario calls you, his voice calling you back to reality.
"Coming!" you reply as you hurry to follow them, your heart beating faster as you are about to find out the truth...
134331211111212121121211212122212122212.title: Suddenly, you notice two pokemon approaching you!

choices: "Find out about what?" you ask, acting oblivious
1343312111112121211212112121222121222122.content:
As you follow the two pokemon, a shadow - a huge shadow - suddenly obscures the moonlight.

You glance backwards, discovering a familiar giantess with a yellow head and eyes closed as usual.

Startled by the sudden apparition of Uxie, you turn back, only to discover that the Lucario and the Vaporeon disappeared. Your gaze shifts on Uxie again, and you find her hovering above her own Lake, a dejected look painted on her face.

Then, just as you're about to shy away, the giantess happens to rise her head up.

Right in your direction.

Having always her eyes closed, it's hard to tell is she saw you or not. But you find your answer as you notice her mouth opening.

Then, without any warning, the giantess floats towards you; before you even know it, you're snatched up and hugged against the giantess face.
"Hi Uxie..." you mutter as calmly as you can. She doesn't reply, but she starts nuzzling you.

This only serves you as a confirm: she's sorry for some reason. Or maybe, wherever she was for the whole day, she just really, really missed you. But, given the circumstances, the first option is more probable.

Pushed against her face, you notice her floating over the lake shore and sitting down.

"Uh... do you feel fine...?" you ask her. You still get no reply.
"Come on, did something happen to you? Why do you look so sad?" you ask again, still getting no response from the yellow headed giantess, who doesn't give any signs of wanting to break her hug anytime soon.

"Where were you? I... uh... missed you?" you say, trying to make her talk using sweet words. She still doesn't answer, but your words definitely had an effect on her as she suddenly pulls you backwards.

Uxie lets you sit on her cupped paws as you are brought in front of her face. You find her staring down at you intently, her closed eyes fixed on your comparatively puny form.

And then, she slowly moved you to her face again, though this time not to her cheek.

To her lips.

Uxie placed a small kiss on your forehead, before pulling back, leaving you feeling like you're on fire!

The giantess giggles softly. Then, for the first time since she returned, she finally decides herself to talk:
"Don't you worry my little one," she says.
"I am fine." shaking off your blush, you smile and nod your head.
"Why were you acting so weird then?" you ask her.

Again, the pixie drops her smile, but quickly shakes her head.
"Don't worry about it," she says.
"You instead, I didn't think I would have found you awake in the middle of the night. And I didn't think I would have found you out in the open. What are you doing out here?
All by yourself?" she asks concerned.

Right before remembering about why she had been away from home for the whole day. Was her little human trying to leave again? But... she did delete his memories! He couldn't have possibly regained them! When someone looked into her eyes, their memories were gone for good.

Uxie looks at you up close. You didn't have your bag with you this time. This was a good sign, but she doesn't discard the idea that whatever made her human want to leave the first time could have convinced him that he had to leave without losing anymore time.

So, he maybe waited for her sisters to be asleep before trying to escape...

"Hey, you aren't leaving, are you? Please, do tell me the truth..." Uxie asks you with worry.
‘Why does everyone keep asking me that...?’ you think.
"Uh, no? Why would I want to leave anyway?" you state with a hint of annoyance.

Uxie stares at you for a moment.
"Azelf and Mesprit. Are they asleep...?" she then asks.
"No? I told them that I needed some air, that's why I'm here," you lie, before an idea finds its way in your thoughts.
"Hey, I think we should go back. Maybe they're worried about me..." you try.

"They can wait for a bit more, dear," Uxie tells you, before assuming a serious expression. You find her face inching closer to you - or she's moving you closer to her.

"Uh... what is happening...?" you question, not quite sure of what the blue and yellow titaness has in mind. Uxie stares at you for a few moments. You have a feeling that she's looking into your eyes. You swallow, praying that she isn't planning to open hers again, making you forget what you had learned earlier.

Uxie stares right into the human's eyes, noticing that the yellow gleam that was usually present in the eyes of those who forgot things because of her has faded.

Maybe the human didn't find out about what she did? Mesprit and Azelf did for sure, but she'll confront them later on.

Still, the question remains: did the human discover about her actions...?

Uxie seems to be pondering something. She remains silent for a few minutes, just staring at you, before talking again:
"Listen, I need to know something now," the yellow headed pixie tells you.

"Uh, what?" you ask. Uxie takes a deep breath.
‘Here we are...’ you think as she talks:
" I need to know... did you find out...?" she asks with an anxious voice.
1343312111112121211212112121222121222122.title: The return of the being of knowledge

choices: Break free and go check on Azelf.
Ignore her and return to sleep.
13433121111121212112122.content:
"Uh... you know... I bet Azelf and Mesprit are worried about you- I mean, they still haven't heard you, right? Mesprit is, like, REALLY worried about you," your words seem to have an effect on the giantess.

"...Maybe you're right. Better go and reassure them." Uxie replies, starting to float into the depths of the thick forest.

It's not long before the titanic figures of the two pokemon come into view. They quickly take notice of their sister's presence.

Without even letting Uxie talk, Azelf floats forward, grabbing her in hug. Making you fall off the giantess' paw.

You go pale and scream as you fall to your very probable death.

Luckily, Mesprit notices you falling. Her two tails dart forward, right underneath you. You land onto them, and sigh in relief.

"And that makes two. Hehehe, looks like you really can't survive without me." Mesprit snickers, retreating her tails, snatching you up and closing your body in a hug.
"Apparently." you reply, giving a small, grateful smile.

Mesprit smiles sweetly, before turning her attention on Uxie.
"How are you feeling, Uxie?" she asks with concern.

Azelf breaks the hug, letting her sister breath.
"I'm fine, thank you." she replies, smiling.
"Mesprit told me what happened, Uxie. That's simply-"
"Rough, I know." Uxie ends the sentence.

A moment of silence follows. Then, a bright smile spreads on Mesprit's face.
‘So, we're here now," her smile shifts into a grin.
You find her mouth approaching your ear.
"What me and this little cutie here could be doing right now? Preferably in private?" the statement, said in a mere whisper, makes you freeze.

You're firmly held into Mesprit's hug, and the giantess has no intention of letting go of you. Not anytime soon. There's no way out.
‘Come on, you. You said you wanted to help, didn't you?’ she speaks with a small smile.
‘Not that kind of help, Mesprit!’ you mentally retort.
‘Too late~’ she giggles in response.

Before she can do anything, though, the sun settles down. Having spent the past few hours worrying for your own well being, you totally lost the track of time.

The moon slowly rises into the sky. You take your chances.
"Hey, is anyone hungry? Because I sure am!" you quickly say.

"Now that you say it, I'm pretty hungry too." Mesprit says. In confirmation of her words, her stomach growls loudly. You sigh in relief.

Azelf floats forward, snatching you from Mesprit.
"Hey-"
"Human, let's go find something to eat." she says you. You nod slowly.

And so, before Mesprit can further complain, Azelf quietly ventures into the forest.

The blue giantess stops after a few minutes, and stares down at you intently.
"What?" you ask.
"Listen. I actually wanted to talk to you," she says. You nod at her.

"Uxie and Mesprit trust you. They say you're a friend, but..." you already don't like where this is going.

You try to interrupt, but Azelf doesn't let you as she continues, staring right into your eyes.
"...But I know your kind." she speaks, keeping her voice low. Yet again today, you feel fear rising.

"If you ever hurt my sisters-" you interrupt her.
"If I hurt your sisters - and I can't nor do I have any intention to - you'll blow me up or something like that?" you say with a hint of indignation.

You see her smirk.

"Nope," she says, while leaning forward.

You're about to ask what's going on, but you suddenly find that you can't move or talk anymore. You just stare at the titaness for a minute, until she speaks again:
"Got that?" you discover that you're able to move again.
"...Okay, what the hell was that?!" you ask, somewhat startled.

"Simple, I took your will away. That's what happens if you ever hurt my sisters," she says threateningly.

Seeing the frightened look on your face, her smirk fades into a smile.
"... That said," she says reassuringly.
"Don't let my words get in the way of our friendship," suddenly, her smile drops as she continues:
"Please, forgive me. But my sisters are my only family. I already almost lost them once and-"
"It's alright. I understand." you reply.

The smile comes back on her face.
"Come on then. We're supposed to get food." she says, her fist opening as she lets you sit on her palm.

It's not long before Azelf gathers a large amount of berries.

You're cur holding to one her tails. In fact, Azelf has currently her arms occupied by the berries.
"I think these will be enough..." you hear her mutter as she floats out of the forest.

She finds Mesprit and Uxie chatting near the lake shore.

They abruptly stop, noticing Azelf's presence.
"Where's little one?" Mesprit instantly inquires.

As an answer, the tail holding you lowers. Your feet connect with the ground as the tail gently unwraps from your waist. .
You can't enjoy the ground beneath your feet for long, though, as you are soon snatched up by two paws which, you see, belong to Mesprit. And they bring you straight to her chest as she hugs you.
"Missed me?" she asks playfully. You look elsewhere as a blush spreads on your cheeks.

"Um. Mesprit, it seems that you like our little friend quite a lot." Uxie states with a small smile. Mesprit blinks innocently.
"Who? Me? We're just good friends, sister." she says.
‘Or maybe something more~’ her telepathic voice resounds in your head.
"Yes! Just good friends , Uxie." you state, making sure to empathize your phrase. Mesprit giggles.

The giantess lowers her paw back on the ground, gently letting you on it.
"Well then... let's eat." you suggest. You dumbly realize that you didn't even need to say that. The three already dug in their meal. Sighing, you take a few berries for yourself and start eating.

By the time you're done you and the three giantesses are done eating, the moon fully rose in the sky, enlightening it along with thousands of stars.

You're totally stuffed and, judging by the satisfied sighs of the three, they are as well.

"Well," Uxie says with a yawn.
"I guess it's time to sleep."
"You're right. Today was sure full of emotions!" she giggles at her own joke.

And then, her gaze travels on you. She stares at you for a few moments, that smirk of hers not leaving her face.
"Mine!" she suddenly chimes, startling you as two gigantic paws rush towards you.

You can't even think to move out of the way as they get a hold of you and retreat, bringing you to Mesprit's chest. The titaness giggles as she encloses you in yet another hug.

You glance quickly at Azelf and Uxie, mentally begging them to help you. You notice Uxie shaking her head with her paw on her forehead, while Azelf rolls her eyes.

Your world shakes Mesprit lays flat on the ground, making it quake softly. Soon, the other two giantesses follow her, laying down on the snowy floor on each of Mesprit's sides.
"Uxie, aren't you sleeping in your cave?" you hear Azelf asks.
"I'm fine sleeping outside." comes her reply.

Seeming satisfied with the answer, Azelf talks again:
"See you all in the morning." she says, before she goes silent.

‘Well, goodnight my little one,’ you hear Mesprit's telepathic voice in your head. Seriously, this day will end with your head aching as hell.
‘Sleep tight. Oh, and...’ her voice gets sweeter.
‘Welcome in the family." you don't know if to feel flattered or scared.

Ten minutes pass, in which point you notice all three sisters fast asleep. You have to admit, Mesprit actually makes a comfortable bed, her paws acting as a soft blanket, while the beats of her heart slowly soothe you to sleep...


You suddenly wake up. Looking up, you notice it's still nighttime, but you're unsure about what time it is. Mesprit is still asleep, snoring softly, maybe swimming in sweet dreams.

With your vision blurry from the drowsiness, you casually glance to your side. And notice that Azelf is no longer there.

Shutting your eyes open, you look around. And there, truly impossible to escape eyesight, you notice the blue mountain sitting at short distance from the sleeping form of Uxie, her tails and feet submerged in the water of the lake.

She looks like someone who's pondering something. You wonder what is going on in her mind. Maybe she's thinking about her sisters. True, you met her only earlier today, but you really couldn't not get that she cares deeply about her sisters... though you would have appreciated if she hadn't expressed it by menacing to take away your will.

Feeling curious, you consider to slip out of Mesprit's hug and go talk to her. But your lack of sleep soon reclaims you to dreamland, and the thought of sleeping is really tempting...

Giving a yawn, you decide to...
13433121111121212112122.title: The lake trio reunited.

134331211111212121121221.content:
Curiosity winning your sleepiness, you slowly start sliding out of Mesprit's tight hug. It takes you a full five minutes, as you work your way out careful to not wake the giantess.

Finally, you manage to slip out from under the giantess' paws. But, even if she is asleep, Mesprit seems to feel your absence. She starts moving her paws around, trying to find you, needing you back.

You wait for them to give up on finding you and slide down onto Mesprit's chest. You focus on the major problem: how to get down? Jumping is absolutely out of question, unless you have a death wish... Sliding down the giantess also sounds pretty... deadly.

Giving a sigh, you look around and notice one is Mesprit's arms laying on the snowy, cold ground. From there, you could easily walk on it and get down.

So, you walk towards the other side of the giantess' chest and hop onto her shoulder. You look back at her pink face, to see if she woke up.

She didn't. Her eyelids are still closed, hiding those golden, charming eyes of hers. For a 200ft pokemon, she looks rather adorable... Adorable?

You shake your head, returning to your senses.
"Okay, what was that?" you ask, before remembering what you're supposed to be doing.

So, giving a sigh, you turn around, starting to climb down Mesprit's titanic arm.

It takes you almost twenty minutes to accomplish the task, but you finally get past Mesprit's wrist, palm, fingers, and you finally hop on the ground, feeling your feet sinking into the snow. Luckily, Mesprit didn't wake up in the whole process, and Azelf is still in the same position as she was when you noticed her, still thinking about something unknown to you.

You decidedly make your way towards the giantess, walking past the sleeping bodies of Mesprit and Uxie, stopping at Azelf's side.
"Ahem." you clear your throat, succeeding in getting her attention.

You find her star shaped head slowly moving as her golden eyes fix down on you.
"Oh... you." she mutters distractedly.
"Why aren't you sleeping? Nightmares?" she then asks, giving a bit of a teasing smile.
"No," you reply.
"I could ask you the same thing, you know. Why are you awake?" the pale moonlight allows you to see a faint blush spreading across her cheeks.

It takes her a while before answering.
"Uh... you know, just thinking." she says.
"About what?" you inquire again.
"About things that happened in the past. Things that you couldn't-"
"Things like a pact and you three getting big?" you interrupt. You see her eyeing you with her mouth wide open.

"... Mesprit told you about this, didn't she?" you smirk, nodding your head. Apparently, you guessed right about her thoughts.

You notice her huffing, turning her head to her sleeping sister.
"‘Never trust humans’, uh Mesprit?" she asks in a noticeable annoyed whisper.
"Hey, I'm human. And you're talking to me." you stick up for Mesprit.

Azelf's gaze travels back on you. She smirks.
"Well, you're an exception, I believe. Otherwise, Uxie would have wiped your memories about us away." she says. The last remark makes sends shivers down your back. You find nothing to say afterwards.

Suddenly, you hear Azelf groan.
"Hey, what's happening? Are you alright?" you ask, concerned.
"I'm fine." she replies with a broken voice.
"No, you're not," you say firmly.
"What's going on?" she looks at you for a moment. You see an expression of pain on her face.

She gives a sigh.
"You know what period is for us pokemon, don't you?" she asks you. You nod.

And how could you not know? Mesprit spent the whole day plucking out pokemon of her sister's... love tunnel because of that. And then, the same Mesprit had you 'play' with her. You wonder if part of her issue is gone, at least for now...

Azelf goes on.
"Yeah, that is tormenting me. And no pokemon to help me. They're either too scared, horny, or... I-I don't even know!" she stammers, her voice rising, risking to wake Uxie and Mesprit.

You briefly wonder what would happen if Mesprit suddenly wakes up and notices you talking about sex with her sister.

"Ehm... maybe I could help... ehm... somehow?" you ask, keeping your voice low.
"You can't help me. Humans and pokemon aren't compatible. And-"
"Not that kind of help, Azelf." you state bluntly.

She offers a sympathetic smile.
"Well, there is no other way," she pauses, seeming to be thinking.
"Of course, if you're willing, we could... Maybe there's some private place into the forest" you take a step back.

You can't believe it. It's the third time you hear a pokemon - and huge one as well - asking to have sex.

The silence follows Azelf's question, interrupted just by the snoring of Mesprit and Uxie.

Time seems to stop. The giantess stares at you intently, waiting for your answer.

You don't know what to do. If to agree - and risk your own life - or refuse - and you're pretty sure Azelf won't take 'no' as an answer.

Why did she even ask? She mistrusted you just earlier!... Why did you even bothered to check on her? She threatened to take your will away! These seem pretty good reasons to refuse. However, you're pretty sure that you would regret it the moment you say it.

But, her sisters trust you, right? She wouldn't harm someone close to them, right? Maybe you can convince her that you're tired and you want to go back to sleep? Mesprit would make a good protection for the night. But, are you really willing to sleep with her? You quickly decide that it's better than the alternative...


It feels like an eternity since she asked the question, but it is only a few minutes. The silent giantess stares down at you with hope. You rise your head, gazing up at her.

It takes a few more moments, but you finally make a choice...
134331211111212121121221.title: An Elf's night talk.

choices: You are awakened again by one of the sisters.
1343312111112121211212211.content:
You look up at giantess.
"Look, c-can't we just go back to sleep? I m-mean-"
"I can't sleep like this!" she exclaims, waving her arms. You notice Uxie moaning out in her sleep. You repeatedly press your index finger on your mouth, silently telling her to keep her voice low.

Azelf quietly lowers her head.
"Please... I beg you..." she says, a suffering look taking place on her face. Her expression successfully melts your heart. Damn it...

"... Are you really suffering?" she nods her head almost frenetically, keeping her eyes fixed on you.

Your palm connects with your face as you shake your head, praying that this is only a nightmare, that you're still asleep on Mesprit's chest. But you know this is hard reality.

You hardly find the words to reply:
"A-Alright. I-I will help you. Just... let's be quick, alright?" you reply.

Azelf's face almost immediately brightens up.
"Of course. I understand that you're scared of it, but I tell you, take it as bonding." you rise your head at the last remark.
"Mesprit is going to kill me." you say, sighing. She smiles softly.
"It appears that you developed a close relationship with her already, uh? Don't worry, I'll handle everything problem that this may cause," she says sympathetically, before holding out a paw.
"Now... shall we?" you take a few more moments to finally decided yourself.

Reluctantly, you hop on her paw. Azelf gives you another, grateful smile, before silently floating past her sisters and into the thick forest.

The moonlight enlightens the way as Azelf floats into the depths of the dark, snowy woods, searching for an... appropriate spot. You can't help but feel scared. Scared of what will happen.

Finally, after a few minutes, she stops in small, secluded clearing, hidden by tall trees, thick vegetation and darkness.

The titaness lowers her paw, gently letting you on the snow-covered grass. You see her paws closing together, a blush spreading on her cheeks.
"So... er... Ready?" she asks, her gaze fixed on the ground.

You take a deep breath.
"I-I guess..." you stammer. She nods.
"I know how are you feeling right now... so, I hope this will enjoyable for... as it will be for me..." she says softly.

That said, she places her paws down and slowly lays on her back, spreading her legs in front of you, revealing her slit.

You hesitate at the sight of it.
‘Let's get over with it.’ you mentally prepare yourself. There's no going back now, and you know it.

So, you step forward, getting closer to her vertical lips.
"H-How am I supposed to do it?" you stammer, rubbing the back of your head. Seriously, is all this really happening?
"Well... rub it, I guess..." comes Azelf's reply.

Nodding to yourself, you slowly extend your arm, until your arm lightly touches her slit.
"Oh!" she exclaims, feeling your touch on her sensible nether regions.

"Azelf! Quiet!" you suffocate your voice, so that only Azelf hears you. The giantess rises her head, nods briefly and places her paws on her mouth, before laying back down.

So, giving a sigh, you start rubbing slowly, feeling her crotch pulsating against your hand.

You aren't sure you're doing it good, until you feel the area getting wet.
"Mh!" the titaness confirms that you're doing well.

In order to speed up the process, you bring your other hand to her crotch, starting to rub faster. Suffocated moans start to escape the giantess' mouth more often. You notice her legs moving frenetically, her tails swinging wildly.

Her mouth drools beneath her paws, small rivers of saliva pouring down her cheeks; her eyes are closed from the intense pleasure she is feeling.

And finally, she can't hold it in anymore.

" Mhh!" understanding what is about to happen, you quickly pull yourself back. Just as a wave of white liquid flows out of her sex.

You notice her removing her paws from her mouth, letting herself pant.
"G-Great... T-thanks..." she stammers, never having recovered from her orgasm, that left her unable to talk properly.

It takes her a full twenty minutes to recover. Twenty minutes in which your blush gradually fades.

She slowly sits upright.
"D-Did I do good?" you ask.
"You were wonderful," comes her reply. You notice her scanning the ground, trying to spot you. She seems to notice you as you feel yourself being lifted off the ground and onto her paw.

She doesn't let you say anything more though, as she pushes you into her cheek.
"I can't find a way to express how grateful I am. Just know that you have my sincere thanks. My heat won't bother me for days!" she silently exclaims.
"You're welcome." you reply, smiling a bit.

She smiles brightly.
"Come on, we're supposed to be asleep. And remember, we did nothing~" she brings out a cheerful tone for the first time since you met her.

It takes a few minutes for her to get back to the lake shore where her sisters are currently sleeping.

She floats over Mesprit, placing you down on her chest. Instantly her paws enclose your whole being in a hug.
"Goodnight then." Azelf says, blowing you a kiss.

You blush.

Azelf takes her original place beside Mesprit. Within minutes, you hear her snoring.

You sigh, and close your eyes, ready to drift off as well.

When...

"Did anything fun?" Mesprit's voice snaps you back to reality.
"M-Mesprit?" you say. Did she hear what you just did?!
"Yup. And I dare you to sneak away from me while I'm asleep again." she calmly says, leaving out the part where her spirit left her body to see what the two of you were doing. She will tell you about that later on, she decides.

You look back at her face, expecting to see an irritated expression. But you don't. You notice her staring down at you, one eye closed, and a teasing smile on her face.
"... You wouldn't hurt me, would you?" you ask, fearing the worst.

"Nope. I couldn't do that, you're just too... precious to me. But I can assure that you'll feel incredibly sorry for a week," she whispers.

You pale at the perspective.
"What if I say that I'm sorry now?" you ask.
"Apology accepted. You did it to help my sister. But," here she lets out a low giggle.
"You aren't forgiven yet." she states.

You get where this is going.
"Alright, what do you want?" you ask.
"I'll tell you later. Now sleep, you'll need it." she says, leaning to place a peck on your forehead, which immediately burns hot.
"Goodnight again, cutie." she says.
"Er... goodnight..." you reply.

Her eyes disappear behind her eyelids, and her paws push you deeper into her chest.

You close your eyes as well. Whatever she has in store, you're sure you're going to hate it.

Soon, you feel her chest rising up and falling down along her breath, meaning that the giantess is asleep. You let the movements cradle you, while the beats of her heart slowly soothe you to sleep as well.
1343312111112121211212211.title: The human and the Elf.

choices: "Uh, alright. I'll come with you." you say, deciding to help her.
"Uhm... I'd rather sticking around..." you say, not wanting to take risks.
13433121111121212112122111.content:
The moon slowly fades from the sky as daylight slowly takes its place, replacing it.

The events of last night left you completely drained from all your energy, and you keep sleeping on top of Mesprit. One paw was removed from you, and is currently resting on the ground, but the other still has a firm grasp on you.

The lake guardian is still asleep herself, like her sisters, who are still floating in their own dreams.

At least, until dawn fully rises up in the sky.

After another hour of sound sleeping, Mesprit's eyelids slowly open up, revealing her golden eyes to the world.

She absentmindedly sits upright. But, as she is about to stir, she notices she is holding something.

She slowly releases you from her hug and brings you to her gigantic face as she inspects you.

It takes a few seconds for her mind to process who the tiny human she is holding is. A smile appears on her face.
"Why hello there, my little cutie. Silly me, I was about to think you were a dream. But you weren't,"she whispers, placing a small kiss on your forehead.

She snickers.
"You're still here. Still all mine." she says, proceeding to lightly shake you in order to wake you from your slumber.
"Wake up, my little one. There will be time to nap later,"

You moan out in your sleep.
"Wake up sleepyhead~" she repeats, placing a paw on your head, starting to stroke it softly.

You still don't wake up. Mesprit grins.
"And I thought it was hard to wake Uxie up. But I have one more trick in my fur~" she sings lowly.

And then, she pushes your unconscious body into her lips.

It seems to work, as you slowly open your eyes. And the first thing you see is a gigantic pair of pink lips being pressed on your face.

A fiery blush takes place on your cheeks as memories of yesterday come to your mind. You recognize the lips as Mesprit's.

And your thought is confirmed when she pulls off, smiling down at you.
"Good morning, sleepy!" she cheers.
"Eh... good morning, Mesprit..." you reply.

The giantess lowers her paws. You hop onto the ground and glance around, spotting Azelf and Uxie still fast asleep. Their snoring can easily be heard from miles of distance.

Memories of last night come to you as you look at Azelf, and you flush bright red.

"Hey, I'll get something to eat. Wait for me here." You hear Mesprit saying behind you. You turn around just in time to see her leaving.

Only to return after ten minutes with her paws full of all kinds of berries. She lowers herself, and sets the literal hill of fruit down in front of you.

"Let's dig in. I've got something to tell you." Mesprit says, sitting down in front of you, crossing her legs.


"Hey, remember when I told you about something you had to do for me?" Mesprit asks while chewing on the berries she provided for both of you.
"I was hoping you'd forget about that." you reply bluntly.

"I don't forget things easily," she giggles, while playfully wagging one paw.
"But it's not what you think. Listen, I've been away from home for two days now. I just want to make sure that Lake Verity is alright before coming back here. But I needed someone - you - to do a few chores around, like you did here with Uxie." she explains.

"Uhm..."
"Aw, please! I just need some help, nothing more!" she insists.

You don't what to do. Going with Mesprit would mean remaining alone with her. And, knowing her, you're not quite sure if you're going to like whatever she means with 'chores'.

On the other hand, you don't want to upset her by refusing. And plus, you're quite curious about her own home, the Lake Verity she mentioned.

"So? Will you come with me? It'll be just a few hours, then we'll come back." she says again.


A few minutes of silence follow her last question. She just stares down at you with an expectant look, her head crafting a huge shadow that engulfs you completely.

You take your time deciding what to do. You quickly glance at the other two giantesses, but they're still dead asleep.

So, ultimately, you rise your head and reply...
13433121111121212112122111.title: The dawn of emotions.

choices: You sneak your way past Mesprit and get to the cave unnoticed...
Mesprit notices you, and quickly snatches you from the water!
1343312111112121212.content:
Without second thinking, you quickly turn around and dash away from the lustful giantess.
"W-wait! D-don't go!" you hear her stammer with a pleading voice.

But you aren't going to stop. The only thing that counts now is getting as far as you can from the Emotion pokemon. At least for a while, until she calms down.

But, sadly, you don't get too far before having to stop right in front of Acuity Lake.

Far away from you is the cave where the guardian of this place currently is. But you know that there's no chance you can reach it. Mesprit would simply use her psychic to get you in no time.


"Please... come back... I need you..." you hear Mesprit's voice. And it's definitively not too far from you.

You know that you can only do one thing to escape the delirious giantess. Even though it seems impossible, it's worth a try.

And so, taking a deep breath, you leap into the water.


The water of the lake is still freezing cold, having been unfrozen just a short while ago. The cold quickly assaults your body as you start rethinking about your choice. Many pokemon swim past you, paying you no attention.

Remembering that you have limited oxygen, you start swimming forward, in direction of Acuity Cave. Sure, Uxie is probably not in the mood to fight her own sister, but she could at least keep you away from her for a while.


In the meantime, Mesprit makes her way towards the lake as well.

Once she gets there, she glances around, trying to spot you anywhere on the snowy land.

After all, her little one couldn't have been so inconsiderate to dive into the lake. Right?

Her gaze darts around frenetically, but she can't find you anywhere. Her fear starts to rise. You couldn't possibly have done it... the water is too cold for any human to survive... you would freeze to death...

One last look around finally confirms her fears.
"Darn..." she mutters to herself as she closes her eyes, staying perfectly still as her own spirit floats its way out of her body.

Then, without losing anymore time, Mesprit 'dives' into the lake as well. She's not going to let you die of frostbite, she has to rescue, no matter what!


Back at you, you swim as fast as you can, as your breath is running short. You're pretty sure that Mesprit had arrived to the lake as well; if you emerge, she would see you.

But the situation is becoming unbearable. Your lungs, already deprived of air from the running you had been doing in order to get away from Mesprit, are now starting to freeze along with the rest of you.

Soon, you come to the point where you have to necessarily surface. You rise your nose from the water, greedily inhaling as much air as you can. Not daring to look back to see if Mesprit is there, you instead take a look forward; the cave where Uxie resides is nearer than it was before... Still a bit, you can make it!... At least, you hope. Even though your lungs are finally getting filled with oxygen again, the cold certainly getting any better. If you don't reach the cave soon, you're afraid of what is going to happen...

Unfortunately for you, Mesprit's spirit, which is still floating underwater trying to find you, comes to a halt as she spots your body afloat.

Quickly, she makes her way back to the land and enters her body again. In the same moment, you dive into the water once again.
"Hold on, my little one, Mesprit is coming!" she thinks out loud as she starts floating on the surface of the lake at supersonic speed.

And it's not long before the Emotion pokemon catches up with you. But she ends up surpassing you, stopping at short distance from the cave where her sister is. Still fearing the worst, she starts looking around once again, trying to find you in the immense mirror that is the water.


Once again, you have to surface. But, before you can take the first breath, you notice Mesprit floating right in front of you, her back turned to you.

You keep yourself from gasping, and gaze underneath her in the meantime. You notice that you're almost there... if you manage to reach the cave, you'll be safe! Of course, you have to go through one major problem first...

So, taking a deep breath, you dive once again, strongly hoping to make it...
1343312111112121212.title: Great time for a swim.

choices: ... Mesprit... this won't end well for you...
13433121111121212121.content:
You swim slowly, careful to not make any noise that could catch the giantess' attention. Her huge body, which is currently floating on the surface of the lake, casts a huge shadow even underwater.

After a minute or so, you rise your head out of the water. Much to your relief, you notice Acuity Cavern right in front of you.

You quickly glance backwards. And your heart seems to melt as you notice the same pokemon you're trying to get away from with her back and to you.

Silently but quickly, you get out of the water and rush inside the cavern completely unnoticed. Only when you're safe from the emotion pokemon's gaze, you dare to sigh in relief. Granted, diving into the lake might have been an irresponsible move, but, at least, you made it.

Shivering a bit because of your wet clothes and the cold atmosphere, you look upwards, discovering Uxie laying down on the floor of the cave, sleeping. Or not. It's really hard to tell, since her eyes are constantly closed.

But all your doubts are dissipated as she turns her head in your direction.
"Oh... you..." she says, not moving from her position. After all, as Mesprit said, it's practically impossible for her to fit completely inside the cavern, but you guess that that it's spacious enough for her to at least lay down.

You hear Uxie talking again:
"Why are you all wet?... Did you take a bath into the lake?... With your clothes on?" she asks.
"Kind of..." you mutter, before remembering your current situation.
"Uxie! Mesprit has gone crazy!" you exclaim in a scared whisper, fearing that the pink and blue giantess might hear you from the outside.

Uxie rises her head.
"Why? What ha-" she roughly stops, reality hitting her.
"Oh no! She didn't try anything weird with you, did she?" she asks, a noticeable hint of worry in her voice.

You timidly nod. In response Uxie slams her paw against her face.
"Damn..." you hear her mutter, before she turns to you again.
"Listen. Go outside, I'll join you in a second." she instructs you.

Panic starts to rise in you.
"Do... Do I have to? I mean-"
"Running from problems won't solve them." Uxie interrupts you. She quickly adds:
"But don't worry. I'll talk to Mesprit. I won't let her do anything to you, promise." she speaks with a softer voice, a small smile adorning her face.

Gulping, you nod. Almost mechanically, you turn around, starting to walk towards the entrance of the cavern.

You get hit by the warm sunlight as you get out of Acuity Cavern. And, right a few meters from you, you spot the looming figure of Mesprit, who still seems to be looking for you, although a worried look had taken place on her face. After all, she did search for you for a while. Can you really blame her for being worried?

You shake your head. Guilt is the last thing you need right now.

Just when you're about to forget what Uxie said and head back into the cave, Mesprit turns to look straight in your direction.

Her worried expression instantly fades, leaving a smile in its place.
"There you are!" she says, while starting to lean down, her paw extending, eager to get a hold of you.
"You had me worried for a moment. But-" she is interrupted as Uxie suddenly appears in between you and her, causing her to retract her paw.

Mesprit frowns.
"What are you doing, Uxie?" she asks. Then, remembering about her current state, she puts you aside for a moment.
"How are you feeling, sister?" she speaks with soft words.
"Better, thank you." the yellow headed giantess replies.

The two go silent for a couple of moments, before Uxie speaks again.
" Say Mesprit," she says, cocking her head.
"Have you been trying anything weird while I wasn't there?" Mesprit seems taken aback by the sudden question. But she quickly recomposes herself.
"Who? Me? Nope. Just some emotions games. Right, little one?" she asks, peeking over her sister's shoulder to catch a glimpse of your form.

You don't reply.
"Do not lie to me Mesprit," Uxie says.
"You can't fool me." the pink headed giantess huffs loudly in response.
"Do you necessarily have to spoil all my fun sister? I haven't tried anything... yet" she retorts.

Before Uxie can reply, Mesprit continues.
"Now, if you'll excuse me, we were in the middle of something nice and-"
"I won't let you, Mesprit." Uxie says bluntly.

As an answer, Mesprit cups her paws together, a blackish sphere starting to form in between them.
"I don't want to hurt you, sister. Let me get the little one, and I'll leave." she speaks slowly.

In response, Uxie spreads her arms in front of you.
"I don't want to hurt you either, Mesprit. Stop this foolishness, or you'll regret it." the knowledge pokemon calmly says.
"Foolishness? I just want to have some fun!" Mesprit retorts.
"And then, you're the one to talk! I've had to pull, like, twenty pokemon out of you! Wasn't that 'fun'?" Uxie blushes furiously at the memory.
"I didn't want any of that!" she shouts.

Sensing the imminent fight between the two, you, who had been watching the two arguing the whole time, decide to try and stop them.
"Can I say so-"
"No!" both giantesses shout, menacing to break both your eardrums. You can literally feel the irritation flowing like electricity between the two.

The sphere dies in Mesprit's paws. You sigh. At least, she wants to avoid the conflict. You notice her looking at you.
"Come on, I didn't try to hurt you in any way, did I?" she asks. You catch the hint of sadness in her voice.

Again, you don't find reasons to blame her. It's not her fault if she can't hold back her urges.
"Well... no..." you admit.

The giantess lowers her head for a second, before looking at you again.
"Come on... let's leave..." she says you.

In an instant, you feel your body getting surrounded by psychic energy as the giantess lifts you off ground, and moves you towards her.
"W-wait...!" you shout, fear once again rising inside you.

You float right in between the two, before you feel yourself stopping. More psychic energy surrounds you.
"Won't let you do that, Mesprit. If you want to leave, that's fine with me. But if he doesn't want to leave with you, he won't." Uxie says resolutely, pulling you closer to her with her own psychic.

You don't know what to think. A big part of you doesn't want to spend another moment with the pink and blue giantess; The other pities her. After all, she delirious right now, she can't control herself.

Mesprit keeps pulling with all of her powers. The fire inside her burns with great intensity. She's determined to get what she wants. And, should she tear her little human from her sister's paws and force him to do as she wishes, she will do so.

Mesprit tries to pull you to her, while Uxie tries to pull you in the opposite direction. But you don't move of an inch.

You can definitely a sharp pain starting to manifest itself. You go pale as you realize that the giantesses might just tear you in two if they don't stop this soon.

The pain soon becomes unbearable.
"Stop! Stop!... Please!" you shout, hoping that the two would realize you're in pain and stop this stupid, pointless fight of theirs...

Suddenly, you feel yourself rocketing into a wall of fur. In the same moment, a loud thud is heard.

It takes you a moment to realize the fight is over. One of the two has beaten the other, and is currently holding you. With your heart galloping within your chest, you shift your gaze upwards. Only to notice that the winner of the fight is...
13433121111121212121.title: Brains over emotions.

choices: "Alright! I'll play with you!" you shout, deciding to let her have her fun.
"I'm sorry, Mesprit. I... can't..." you reply, not wanting to take risks.
134331211111212121211.content:
You look upwards to discover the pokemon who is currently holding you, and who obviously is the winner of the fight.

Your very soul seems to sigh in immense relief as you notice a yellow face with two closed eyes turned down to you, a small smile present on Uxie's face.
"Are you alright?" she asks with concern.

You nod slowly, replying to her question. Then, still enclosed in her hug, you do your best to turn around in her paws and look at Mesprit.

You notice her floating on her back on the surface of the lake. Suddenly you know what the loud splash you heard earlier was.

Mesprit stays completely silent, not moving a single muscle; those golden eyes of hers, which are easily five times your size, look completely void, while her whole face remains emotionless. Which is completely weird for the being of emotions.

" Mesprit..." you hear Uxie whisper as she gets closer to her sister.

Noticing the approaching giantess, Mesprit briefly turns her head, before finally rising herself out of the water and turns around, her dripping back turned to both you and Uxie.
"Good fight, Uxie." you hear her say with an indecipherable voice.

She takes a deep breath before talking again.
"... I'll be leaving now." at this point, she glances backwards, and looks right at you. You notice two damp spots right under her eyes.
"So... see you later, I guess" finally you figure out the hint in her voice... sadness? Suddenly, you feel very sorrowful.

Is she playing with your emotions again? No, you decide, you didn't feel them coming from nowhere. You're genuinely sorry for her.

" Wait... Mesprit..." Uxie says, one of her paws leaving you, extending forward in a attempt to stop Mesprit, who seems determined to leave.

But, before the giantess can fly or teleport away, you decide to act up.
"Mesprit! Don't go!" you shout, surprising both giantesses.

The pink headed, fairy-like pokemon slowly turns her head to look at you once more. The damp spot under her eyes became wet. You figure out that in a matter of moments, she could burst into tears. Just imagining it is a heart-shattering experience.

"What?" she asks.

You ponder about your answer, not really knowing what to say.
"... Can I... can we talk for a moment? In private?" you ask. Seemingly curious about your question, Mesprit stares at you for a good amount of time, before slowly moving her head up and down.

You feel Uxie moving slightly behind you.
"But-"
"Don't worry. I'll be fine." you say her, as Mesprit's twin tails wrap around you and snatch you from the yellow headed giantess.

You find yourself being carried back into the thick, snowy forest you were in before everything happened.

The two tails holding you release you on the snowy ground, while the giantess turns around.

Then, you can feel the ground shake beneath your feet as Mesprit lays down in front of you, her bodily warmth quickly melting the snow.

"So, here we are," she says, not pulling her gaze from you as she speaks.
"What did you want to talk about?" deciding to go straight to the point, you quickly speak up:
"Look, Mesprit, I don't want you to leave. You've been nice to me so far," you say.

She cocks her head. You interpret it as a ‘go on’.
"But why... what was the reason of all this?" you ask.

Mesprit blinks a few times, looking perplexed.
"Weren't you listening?" she asks after a few moments of awkward silence.
"I..." one of her paws move behind you, pushing you closer.
"...Want..." her tone of voice suddenly gets darker. You get pushed into one of her cheeks.
"...You." she breathes in a lustful whisper, all of her desires returning in a mere moment.

Managing to pull yourself backwards, though not freeing yourself from her paw, look up at her.
"... And that's the exact reason of why I ran," you say bluntly.

Mesprit goes silent, another moment of awkward silence following.
"When I talked about that kind of playing earlier, you knew what I was talking about. Why don't you want to play with me now?" she asks.

She hasn't to wait long for your answer.
"... Because you're a pokemon? And a 200ft tall as well?" you ask back, thinking it is an obvious reason.
"Do I look like I care? I shouldn't even let you see me - and yet, I want you!" she repeats, once again lust controlling her mind.

At this point, you consider running again. But you decide against it.
‘Running from problems won't solve them.’ you remember Uxie's words.

Mesprit continues:
"Please... let me play with you for a while. I promise you're not going to regret it..." she breathes heavily, clearly unable to control herself for much longer.
She once again goes silent, awaiting for your decision.

You give a deep sigh. Mesprit doesn't want to give up on you. Sure, you could help her, but then? What would Uxie say? And, most of all, whatever Mesprit has planned, it could be deadly...

Suddenly, you feel like you're on fire, thousands of thoughts burning inside your mind. You soon find the pressure unbearable, and you do the only thing that can make it stop...
134331211111212121211.title: ... Uxie. You're safe!

13433121111121212122.content:
You keep swimming, doing your best to not make any splashing noise that could get the giantess' attention, as she is currently floating right upon you.

Unfortunately, just when you're about to reach your destination, you run out of air again. And, as a result, you have to emerge from the cold water of the lake.

Much to your luck, Mesprit seems to not have noticed the movement.

Quickly glancing backwards, you notice that her huge form is standing at mere inches from you. You can almost feel the warmth emanated from her fur; Apparently, with her gigantic size, she didn't notice you surfacing. You can finally reach the cave!

But, before you can dive again, you happen to sneeze.

And, unluckily, the noise did not escape Mesprit's hearing.

Slowly, the giantess' gaze shifts on you; you can literally feel all the weight of that golden stare of hers, a weight that keeps you in place, leaving you unable to move a single muscle.

And, before you can even turn to face her, you feel something tightly gripping you and pulling you out of the water.

You stay perfectly silent as Mesprit manipulates you so that you're staring right into the twin golden mirrors of her eyes.

Then, without pronouncing a single word, she shoves you forward, right into her chest. Her other paw soon joins the one holding you in a bone-crushing hug.

A good while passes before the titaness decides to speak up:
"May I know what in the world were you thinking?!" she practically yells the last words, finally giving you air as she releases you from her hug, letting you sit on her cupped palms as she stares right down at you.

You don't find the courage to say anything, so she continues.
"Why did you do that? You could have drowned! You could have froze to death!... You could have left me..." the last part is pronounced in an incomprehensible whisper.

After that, the giantess goes silent, and looks at you once more. Her gaze is much more soft than the one she had not even a moment ago.

Getting that she's expecting an answer, you hastily decide that your best shot now is apologize.
"Sorry..." you say, lowering your head, doing your best to look as ashamed as possible.
"And I can bet you are! But now... it doesn't matter," you dare to look upwards as she says that. To your surprise, the smile came back on her face, although it isn't the grin you saw earlier. It's a sincere smile, full of happiness for your being fine.

"The important is that you're safe." she continues. The Emotion pokemon spends another small amount of time contemplating you, before finally talking again.

"Come on," she says, starting to float away, gently holding you in her palms.
"Let's get you warm before you catch something bad." you sigh in relief. You expected her to want to start off with her... 'games', but, apparently, she put those aside for the moment.

At least, for now, you are sa-

"After all, we still have to play~" you heart skips a beat at the new declaration. Damn it...


Mesprit carries you deep into the thick, snowy forest, stopping after a few minutes. And your world shakes as she sits down on the ground.

Before you can ask her whatever she has in store for you, she pulls you into yet another hug. The warm and soft fur cushions you, effectively succeeding in drying up a little your dripping clothes.

You almost feel... safe. Like nothing could hurt you in this exact moment. Like-

"Mesprit, stop playing with my emotions!" you shout.
"Quiet you. Just enjoy it." comes her reply, followed by her signature giggle. You let out a deep sigh, which causes the giantess to giggle more.


Mesprit keeps you 'entrapped' in between her chest and her paws for about an hour, doing a great job in warming you up. Much like Uxie has done earlier, when she found you unconscious in the middle of a blizzard.

"Feel better?" Mesprit asks after a few more minutes as she releases you from her hug. You look upwards, right into her eyes.
"Actually... yes. That was kinda nice." you admit with a small smile. Mesprit giggles.

And then, the sweet smile on her face fades, leaving the same grin you saw earlier in its place.

"Now then," she says. Is it you, or her voice got darker?
"I helped you. So, now, will you help me? Will you play with me?" she asks, a mischievous sparkle in her eyes.

You're in cage. Still held in her paws, you can't run away again. Mesprit must have thought about it. There is no way out.

Instead of screaming her to let you go, you ponder an answer.
"Do I have a choice?" you ask, pretty much expecting the answer.
"Nope." she replies flatly, before continuing:
"Now, to start off..." she mutters to herself, pondering what to do.

You find one of the fingers of her free paw finding its way on your head, stroking it as she thinks what 'game' should she start with.

"I know!" she chimes after a while, the excitement in her voice making your heart freeze.
"Let's start with...
13433121111121212122.title: Mesprit notices you, and quickly snatches you f...

choices: ... I guess I can tell you a little more." she replies with a smile.
... maybe later. I want to play, now!" she replies impatiently.
134331211111212121222.content:
You feel the blood leave your face as the words escape the giantess' mouth, which, apparently, is the place you're going to.

You start shivering at the realization of what you are reduced to - a toy. A mere toy for this titaness to use as she wishes; a toy she would wildly use to pleasure herself. She can do whatever she wants with you, and you can't do anything about it!

But, sensing your fear, Mesprit gives a small and somewhat reassuring smile.
"Why are you scared? You know I'm not going to hurt you." she pauses to let a giggle escape her mouth, before continuing:
"And how could I? You're just too cute. I could never bring myself to hurt. In fact..." she stops in mid sentence to bring your helpless body upwards, lifting you like a doll.

And, before you can even think to talk, she does it for you.
"...I think that our little game can wait for a bit, after all," she says, seeming to be thinking.

You're about to let a out a relieved sigh, but her next phrase throws it right back in your lungs:
"I just thought of something else we can do." contradictory to what she just said, she inches you dangerously close to her mouth, which is curled in a sickeningly sweet smile. She's deliberately creating an unnerving atmosphere.

You can feel her warm breath gently blowing into your face, which only serves to scare you more. Where the hell is Uxie?!

Mesprit moves you an inch closer to her titanic mouth. You watch her lips move as she says one last sentence:
"Pucker up." with that, she pushes your whole being forward.

Your struggles to break free from her grasp are pretty much useless as the Emotion pokemon starts to repeatedly pressing her lips on different parts of your face; she smooches your forehead, pecks your cheeks, all while you feel a burning sensation taking over your body.

She keeps doing this for a few minutes, when your breath is cut short, in which point you start struggling in between her paws and her lips.

Luckily for you, the titaness soon pulls off, leaving your with a massive blush on your cheeks.

For the second time today, you find yourself greedily filling your lungs with fresh air.
"That was some good start~" Mesprit cheers in a seductive manner. If the red shade on your cheeks could grow wider, it would be probably doing so now.


The pink and blue giantess lets you regain your breath for a few minutes, before talking again.
"So... Ready?" she asks, opening her mouth nice and wide.

Your heart stops as you see where she intends to put you - a massive, slippery cave, full of pearly teeth; a red, slimy 'floor' already moving, looking eager to dart out at any moment to taste you. And, shortly distant from it, a dark abyss, a portal that leads to an assured, painful and slow death.

You don't know what to do to avoid such fate. You open your mouth to scream, but no sound comes out. You already know that trying to slip out of her grasp is useless.

You notice Mesprit moving the paw holding you near the cavernous mouth.
"W-wait!!" you shout out of fear, finally regaining the ability to talk.

Your heart resumes its beat as you see Mesprit closing her mouth, an inquisitive - and bothered - look on her pink face.
"What now?" she asks, not hiding her annoyed tone.
"Come on, I promise you won't be hurt. Just trust me." she says.

Before she can open up again, though, your brain hastily comes up with an idea.
"Wait! I-I k-kinda wanted to hear the rest of your story!" you try.

The two parting lips stop.
"Come again?" Mesprit inquires.
"Yeah, I want to hear the rest of the story. You know, what happened after you and your sisters grew?" you ask, feigning a curious tone.

The psychic type smirks.
"So you did like my emotion games!" she exclaims with a triumphant expression.
"A little," you lie.
"But I was REALLY interested in the story. Could you tell me the rest?" you ask, expecting her to feel your hope. She's the one who created emotions after all, and she already proved herself able to sense them in you.

It seems to be working. Mesprit closes her eyes, seeming to be thinking about your request.
"Want to know more, uh?" you nod in almost frenetic manner.
"Do you want me to play with your emotions again?" she asks.
‘No!No!No!’ your mind screams.
"Uh, if you want?" your mouth says instead.

The giantess smiles. You hope that you managed to convince her to talk for a while. At least, until Uxie comes out and rescues you or Mesprit grows bored, whichever comes first.


The legendary talks again.
"Well...
134331211111212121222.title: ... mouth exploring!"

134331212.title: Uxie or Mesprit for others to use

134332.content: What about the cute 'little' Shaymin?
134332.title: more

choices: "Why don't we go to sleep for the night?"
13433212.content: You are walking through the well known Seabreak Path in the Sinnoh region; people would usually come here to relax, between the fresh air and the beautiful flowers covering the whole path. And you are just like the others, trying to get relax from a stressing day. You reach the end of the path, a beautiful sunset dyes the sea red, a small breeze through your hair. Everything's perfect right now, nothing could ruin this moment. You breath in the fresh air and sigh, relaxed like you were never before "Oh?!" comes a surprised squeal from beneath you. Instantly, the ground begins to lift. You fight to keep your balance as two huge flowers enter your view "W-who is there?" a female voice speaks, seeming scared "It's me. I'm up here" you reply "U-up here? What are you doing on my back?" the voice asks "Y-your back?" you ask, confused "Yeah, you're on my back". You look over the edge of the 'ground' and notice a large white object that seems a paw "Wait, let me get down there so we can talk" you say. Hopping down, you land softly on the flowers. Next to you stands a tall white surface, with a green back. Whatever it is, it was camouflaging "Are you still there?" the voice asks again. You walk around the surface and find yourself staring into two green eyes that are about the size of your head "W-what?" taking a few steps back, you notice that the thing you'd been staring at is an about 200 ft tall Shaymin "H-hi?" she says, embarrassed by the situation "Uh hi" you reply, as well embarrassed "W-why were you on my back?" she asks "And why were you camouflaging in the flowers?" you ask back. The Shaymin turns her head shyly "I-I didn't want people to be scared of me" she says "What?" "Y-you see, people that would come here run away as soon they see me. So I decided to hide, so people wouldn't be scared" she explains. This explanation calms you down as Shaymin goes on "Do you think of me as a monster as well?" she asks with a mix of shyness and sadness in her voice. You are saddened by this. Why do people believe, even if it's huge, that such an adorable and docile thing is bad? So you move closer to her and hesitantly put a hand on her white cheek and start rubbing it. Shaymin looks surprised at first, but she doesn't stop you "Why aren't you afraid of me?" she asks instead "Because I don't see anything bad in you. You're not so scary after all" you reply, smiling a little. The Shaymin seems slightly pleased by your words, showing you a shy smile "Thanks... you know, I never got your name" she says "I'm Matt" you say "Thanks Matt. And nice to meet you" she says, nuzzling you. You then notice that the sun settled down and was replaced by the moon, meaning that it's now evening "Well" you say "I think it's time to go home. Well, it's been a pleasure to meet you. Maybe I'll come back someday" you say, petting Shaymin's cheek on last time, before starting to walk away. But something, you notice, holds you in place. You turn around and notice Shaymin holding your shirt with her mouth. She releases you "Wait, don't go please. I'm very lonely here and I want some company" she says "What do you mean?" you ask "I mean..." she pauses to let a blush spread all over her face "Would you like to... to be my trainer?" she asks. You are taken aback by the question, but you then smile kindly "Sure, why not?" you reply. Hearing a big cheer that almost breaks your eardrums, your smile grows larger as you pick a pokeball "I'm not sure if this'll work, but trying won't hurt" you say, holding the ball out at her. Shaymin seems hesitant, but it's just a moment as she taps the ball with her nose. Luckily, it works, and she is engulfed in red light. She smiles down at you before getting pulled in the ball. It doesn't even shake, it just clicks in your hand as she wasn't struggling to get out. You stare at the pokeball with a smile, when Shaymin suddenly pops out "Man, it's cramped in there. Can I stay out?" she asks "Sure" you reply as she nuzzles you happily, a bit of a blush on her face. After a but she pulls off and speaks "Matt...
13433212.title: A meeting between the flowers

134332121.content:
As the sunset reaches its end, shaymin sets her body down on the ground. "Matt. You can climb on my body. Let's sleep together." upon reaching the place where her 2 flowers bloom close together, shaymin starts to sleep. Taking the opportunity to see the night stars, you climb through the stem of one of her flowers and reach the top thanks to the ease of the leaves holding a pattern for a small being like you to climb up.

"I never knew that I get to be friends and have such a big and cute pokemon alongside me." sliding on the flower until you land on the center of one of her flowers, you enjoy the coziness of it until her sweet scent lulls you to a sweet slumber. You get to have dreams where you and shaymin have a kiss on each other's lips in the middle of a gardening season where berries starts to grow and produce fruit on her leafy back as of her body is like soil for plants to grow.

Just as it is about to end, Matt hears one more sentence from his shaymin gazing at him with anticipating eyes paired with shyness and willingness. "Pollinate me Matt. Pollinate me as much as you want."
134332121.title: "Why don't we go to sleep for the night...

choices: Could you help me with something?
1343321211.content: Sun slowly takes its place up in the sky, replacing the moon. Its first, warm rays shine trough the Seabreak Path, lightening your sleeping form. You were sleeping so good on Shaymin's flowers, when the light gets in your eyes, waking you up. Annoyed, you move to a sitting position and stare down at the two flowers that had been your 'bed' for the night. Reclutantly, you get up. You really don't want to leave your comfy bed, but you'd have to sooner or later. You then notice that Shaymin is still asleep, judging by the soft snoring and the movements of her back. Smiling, you start to pet her grassy fur "Come on Shaymin, wake up" you say; Shaymin gives a small moan "Aww, five more minutes" she says "And some more petting". You chuckle as you keep scratching her fur until her white face pops out of the flowers "Why good m-" you attempt to say, but Shaymin pushes you off her back and on the ground. You don't have time to do anything that she pins your arms to the sides and starts nuzzling you happily "S-shaymin, what does this mean?" you ask "Just happy you're no mere dream" she giggles, completely covering your face with her gigantic nose. She holds you down for a few minutes before releasing you. You rub your sore arms while Shaymin stares at you with a shy smile. You notice something different. In fact, her back is now full of Gracidea flowers "What the...?" "That happens when I'm happy" she explains, nuzzling you once again. The sweet scent of the flowers is now pretty strong, and it fills your nose, giving you a pleasing sensation and making you smile. Shaymin's smile just grows as she speaks again "Matt, may I ask you something?" "Sure, what is it?" "Well..."
1343321211.title: The next day

13433212111.content:
"Could you help me with something?" Shaymin asks "Sure! What can I help you with?" you ask "Well you see, there's a rare flower around here, it is called Gracidea flower. It has the effect of making me change my form. Now, could you help me find one?" she asks "Why'd you want to change your form?" you ask "You'll see" Shaymin replies winking, a small blush on her cheeks "Fine, can you tell me how does this flower look like?" you ask "That's easy. Do you see the flowers on my back? They're pretty similar" she replies. Nodding, you knee and start start searching for the Gracidea flower. It's not easy, as this path is covered inch by inch by flowers, especially pink colored ones.

Eventually, you spot a flower that is almost identical to Shaymin's ones "Is this the Gracidea flower Shaymin?" you ask, showing her the flower. Shaymin does not answer, she just touches the flower with her nose. Immediately, she starts to glow. You have to cover your eyes because of the bright light blinding you. When it dies down, you open your eyes, and the first thing you notice is that Shaymin is no longer there. Instead a majestic, tall, reindeer-like creature is standing there. It has two ling antlers on each side of its head and a red flower is behind its neck. A little bush of fur standing under its neck "S-Shaymin?" you ask. The creature looks at you "Yes Matt, that's me! Am I prettier now?" she asks, flashing you with a smile. You have to admit, she looks gorgeous. But you can't even respond that your now more-than-huge pokemon FLIES to you and pushes you to the ground and pins you to it with her nose, nuzzling you "So? Do you like me more now cutie?" she asks. You can't believe it. Your shy and calm pokemon has turned into a wild and much less shy pokemon. But you can't deny that she is as well adorable in this form, if nit more "Yes, you're beautiful" you admit. Giving a light giggle in response, Shaymin pecks your cheek. Ignoring the blush that has just appeared on your face, you smile "But are you going to stay like this all the time?" you ask "Nah, I'll return normal once sun settles down. And I suggest that we use our limited time to...
13433212111.title: Could you help me with something?

choices: "Have some more fun" she says seductively.
"We could find something to eat?" she asks.
134332121111.content:
"I suggest we use our limited time to have some fun!" Shaymin beams.
"What kind of fun?" you ask.

In reply, Shaymin lets out a cute giggle and sits down.
"Climb on my muzzle." she says.
"Why?"
"Trust me master. I promise you'll be fine." she replies sweetly.

Deciding that Shaymin hasn't any bad intentions - despite her sudden change of personality from shy to cheerful - you make your way to her muzzle.

Shaymin patiently waits for you to climb on her now elongated muzzle, before throwing you up in the air.

After a short flight, you land on Shaymin's head, right in between her 'antlers'.
"Shaymin, what are you doing?" you ask upon recovering from the startling experience.

"Shaymin doesn't reply; instead, she suddenly starts flying!
"Shaymin! You can fly!" you shout, in a mix of fear and excitement, while holding on tightly.
"Yeah master, now enjoy!".

With that last sentence, the air suddenly smells sweet. It takes you a while to realize Shaymin just used sweet scent. Your grip weakens as the scent threatens to make you fall off.

Tightening your grip on her white fur, you watch in amazement as Shaymin uses magical leaf, creating a magnificent spectacle of colors in the sky.

"Shaymin this is..."
"Amazing, isn't it master~?" she asks. Smiling, you lie on your belly, hugging her white fur, enjoying its warmth and the sweet scent around you.

You are taking a walking in the forest near your house, stressed after the horrible day you went through. You try to shake off the thoughts about this day, just trying to forget it. The sunset is making a quite good job in helping you with it. Suddenly, as you walk, a sound catches your attention. It's somewhat soothing and sweet, it's so... hypnotic. It seems like a song. You follow the sound until you discover its source. Your jaw drops.

Sitting there, in a small valley, is the gigantic white face of a pokemon. This pokemon has a black dress, adorned with a green 'belt' around her waist, white and slim legs, fingerless, black and round hands. A greenish blue gem on her forehead and long, green hair. It must be around 200 ft tall. Totally female, you assume from both the looks and the voice of the pokemon.

Suddenly she opens her eyes, that are baby blue colored, and starts crying. You snap out of your trance and look at her crying. Saddened by the sight, you make your descent into the valley.

The pokemon must be feeling you, because she suddenly looks in your direction and sees you.
"W-who are you?" she asks between sobs.
"I'm Matt. Who are you? And why are you crying?" you ask her.
"My name is Meloetta. And I'm crying because I'm all alone here in this forest. Pokemon and humans avoid me because of my size, and I can't help but... but..." she bursts back into tears without ending her sentence.
"But you were singing so sweetly," you state.
"That was a sad song, I'm sad," she says.

Feeling sad for this unlucky pokemon, you go sit next to her.

Wondering what she wants to do, you feel yourself being pressed into her chest, pulled in a tight hug.
"Thank you Matt. You made me happy," she says. Smiling, you notice the sun settled, the moon taking place.
"Oh, I think it's time I go. I'll come back someday," you say, trying to free yourself from her hug. Unluckily, Meloetta has no intention of letting you go.
"Wait! Don't go, please! Please don't leave me alone again!" she says, determined to not stay alone anymore.

"Then, why don't you bring me along?" she asks.

She hands you some and takes the rest for herself.

13532221.content:
Rain hit your already soaked body as you ran into the depths of the forest in search of a shelter.

It all had begun with a pleasant stroll when it suddenly started raining.

Great...

You were soaked to the bone when you finally managed to spot a small cave, partially hidden by the thick vegetation but still noticeable.

You didn't think twice as you sprinted inside.

You glanced around the cavern. From the inside, it looked quite big, and it was apparently deserted, so you could freely sit down and wait for the rain to stop before getting out again.

Exhausted from the strenuous run, you sat down on the hard, stone floor of the cave, leaning back against a wall. You inhaled deeply and exhaled heavily as you tried to regain your breath, small drops of water falling from your soaked air and clothes and splashing onto the floor.

Outside, the rain started raging, a strong wind starting to shake the trees of the forest violently. You gulped, glad that you found a shelter just in time.

Once you managed to regain some air in your lungs, you finally raised your head, slowly shaking it to rid it from the water. A thunder roared outside, but you paid it no mind. A thunder didn't scare you, the thought that you might be trapped in here for hours to an end did.

You sighed.

To take your mind off things, you started looking around the cave. There was nothing interesting aside from a weirdly shaped rock in a corner.

You were completely alone in a forest, in the middle of a thunderstorm and trapped in a deserted cave.

What a great day, you sarcastically thought as you grabbed your head in your hands.

And then, you heard something.

You looked around... you were sure you had heard a noise somewhere inside the cave.

"... Hello?" you called, your voice echoing around inside the cavern that served you as a shelter from the raging rain.

You shook your head - was your mind pulling pranks on you too now? - and tried to relax, cursing yourself for leaving your phone at home. Now, there was no way you could call for help if you needed to...

Again.

You turned around again, this time sure you heard a noise. But... there was no one aside from you...

You narrowed your eyes - why did that corner seem darker than the rest of the cave?

Curious, you got up and approached the darker side of the cavern. A low sound started assaulting your ears... it barely audible, and yet you could hear it even though the rain outside.

It was like a ghostly whisper.

You took a step back, rubbing your eyes. You were sure you saw a pair of red eyes staring straight at you from the shadows.

But it was only your brain, no?... Right?

You took a deep breath as you attempted to calm yourself, before finally removing your hand from your eyes and looking forward...

Your heart skipped a beat - they were still there.

A pair of big, red eyes staring straight at you.

"Wha...?" you muttered startled as a figure started to emerge from the shadows, apparently having noticed that you noticed it.

What looked like a pokemon came out... but it couldn't be.

It was enormous - at least 200 ft tall, tall enough for the tip of its head to touch the stone ceiling without issue.

As for the pokemon itself, you've never seen it before.

It had relatively short arms and legs and an oddly shaped head. It was completely dark grey, with fiery red eyes that stared straight at you.

You took a few steps back - this... thing had been with you inside the cave for the whole time? Or was it there before you even came inside?

It didn't matter, it sure frightened you...

The pokemon kept staring at you for a while more, before closing its eyes and starting to giggle.

A low, ghostly giggle assaulted your ears as you took a few more steps back, trying to figure out whether this giant was harmless or dangerous.

Also, you noted, you could hear a slight, feminine tone in that giggle, making you assume that this giant is actually a giantess.

And then, the pokemon looked back at you, a small smile on her face.

"Hi..." she spoke in a low, spectral voice. If she really was a pokemon, she undoubtedly was a ghost-type.

You needed to hear nothing more.
